title: Owning a Vineyard: The Days of Wine Are Not All Rosy
description: BILL PRICE was a founder of TPG, one of the worlds largest private equity firms, and was involved in large deals, including buying Continental Airlines and J. Crew. He also invested in Beringer Vineyards and Chateau St. Jean, two California wineries.

title: The Depression Radically Changed the Way Americans Ate
description: A SQUARE MEALA Culinary History of the Great DepressionBy Jane Ziegelman and Andrew CoeIllustrated. 314 pp. Harper/HarperCollins Publishers. $26.99.

title: Jon Ronson Reviews a New Book About Bad Digital Behavior
description: THE CYBER EFFECTA Pioneering Cyberpsychologist Explains How Human Behavior Changes OnlineBy Mary Aiken387 pp. Spiegel & Grau. $28.

title: Hepatitis A Outbreak Linked to Strawberries at Smoothie Chain
description: An outbreak of hepatitis A linked to strawberries at a smoothie chain has sickened 89 people from seven states, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention said on Thursday.

title: With Wearable Tech Deals, New Player Data Is Up for Grabs
description: The University of Michigan football team took the field for its season opener on Sept. 3 accompanied by Michael Jordan, the teams honorary captain for the game, in uniforms bearing his signature Jumpman logo. Such pageantry is the fruit of a new apparel contract, worth about $170 million, between the university and Nike.

title: Arm Wrestlings Popularity Goes Over the Top
description: The arm regarded by many as the strongest in New York measures 39 inches from neck to wrist, with biceps the circumference of a football and skin spray-tanned to a similar leathery brown. Even in repose, its snaky veins swell to the surface, masked only by a tangle of tattoos. Six days a week, the arm spends two hours in the gym, sculpting itself to perfection. It can curl 100-pound dumbbells with ease. It requires specialized tailoring. It has saved lives.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Mamaleh Knows Best

title: Paperback Row
description: Seven new paperbacks to check out this week.

title: A Little Nagging Can Help Reduce Credit Card Debt
description: While no one likes to be nagged, a bit of prodding  with periodic emails or online messages  can help consumers reduce their credit card debt, a new study has found.

title: Norbert Schemansky, Who Won Weight-Lifting Gold but Little Applause Back Home, Dies at 92
description: Norbert Schemansky, one of the worlds greatest weight lifters and the first to win medals in four Olympic Games, all while scraping to make a living in a hometown, Dearborn, Mich., that more than 60 years ago greeted his achievements with a shrug, died on Tuesday at his home there. He was 92.

title: 2 New Faces for Staatsballett Berlin, When Nacho Duato Leaves in 2019
description: The choreographer Sasha Waltz and the Royal Swedish Ballet director, Johannes Ohman, will become the joint artistic directors of the Staatsballett Berlin when its current director, Nacho Duato, comes to the end of his contract in 2019. The announcement, made on Wednesday by Michael Mller, the mayor of Berlin, comes just two years after Mr. Duato took over from Vladimir Malakhov.

title: News Quiz
description: Ten questions about the news of Sept. 6-12, 2016

title: Bookshelf: Pirates Booty
description: New picture books include Captain Jack and the Pirates and The Pirate Jamboree.

title: Mike Pence Has G.O.P. Candidates Respect. Just to Be Safe, They Keep Him at a Distance.
description: Gov. Mike Pence of Indiana has so far played the role of Donald J. Trumps translator to conservatives, character witness to evangelical Christians, and clarifier in chief, issuing explanatory statements after Mr. Trump has committed a variety of unforced political errors.

title: The Lure of the Fish Cake
description: There are myriad types of fish cakes, and its hard not to love them all.

title: Reliably Red Ohio County Finds Both Trump and Clinton Hard to Stomach
description: DELAWARE, Ohio  Donald J. Trump is not popular in this prospering county north of Columbus. The Republican nominees dystopian language does not resonate here. Signs that read Now Hiring outnumber Trump campaign placards.

title: Downside of Bitcoin: A Ledger That Cant Be Corrected
description: There has been much discussion about the potential of blockchain, the technology underlying virtual currencies like Bitcoin, to change the world. We have heard waves of inspired commentary on how the technology, with its ability to share information and record transactions, will be as revolutionary as the internet itself. At Accenture, we agree about these huge possibilities, but there is an elephant in the room that will need to be confronted.

title: Privatizing Drones
description: To the Editor:

title: Show Jumping and Celebrity Spotting in the Hamptons; Wall Streeters Host 9/11 Memorial Dinner
description: Michael R. Bloomberg hosted his annual 9/11 Memorial Dinner, a benefit for the National September 11 Memorial and Museum, on Sept. 7 at Cipriani Wall Street. The event honored Ronald O. Perelman and Michael L. Corbat of Citigroup, and raised $3 million. The Hampton Classic Grand Prix on Sept. 4 capped off the summer social calendar, featuring world-class show jumping and celebrity spotting on a gorgeous Sunday afternoon.

title: Donald Trumps Lack of Good Deeds
description: To the Editor:

title: Norman Vincent Peales Influence on Donald Trump
description: To the Editor:

title: The Playlist: Lady Gaga Returns Lovelorn, and Zack de la Rocha Returns Furious
description: Every Friday, pop critics for The New York Times weigh in on the weeks most notable new songs and videos  and anything else that strikes them as intriguing  in the Playlist. You can listen to this playlist on Spotify here. Like this format? Let us know at theplaylist@nytimes.com.

title: Molly Shannon Loves You, but Will Not Give You Her Number
description: When Molly Shannon visits New York, one of the few places she goes to is Chelsea Market. She lived across the street from it in the early aughts and in the 90s while she was a cast member of Saturday Night Live, turning out characters like Mary Katherine Gallagher, the awkward Catholic-school girl who wants to be a superstar.

title: Donald Trumps Admiration for Vladimir Putin
description: To the Editor:

title: U.S. Suspends Construction on Part of North Dakota Pipeline
description: BISMARCK, N.D.  The federal government on Friday temporarily blocked construction on part of a North Dakota oil pipeline, an unusual intervention in a prairie battle that has drawn thousands of Native Americans and activists to camp and demonstrate.

title: Monsanto Whistle-Blower: $22 Million Richer, but Not Satisfied
description: Winning isnt everything.

title: Diversity Training for Students
description: To the Editor:

title: N.F.L. Says Officials Missed Head Hit on Panthers Cam Newton
description: The N.F.L. has determined that a penalty should have been called against a Denver Broncos linebacker after his helmet-to-helmet hit against Carolina Panthers quarterback Cam Newton in the third quarter of Thursday nights game, which opened the football season.

title: Conviction Thrown Out for Ex-Rutgers Student in Tyler Clementi Case
description: An appeals court in New Jersey on Friday threw out the conviction of the former roommate of Tyler Clementi, the Rutgers University freshman who killed himself six years ago after he was spied on while having sex with another man.

title: Hopes Dimming for a Woman to Lead the United Nations
description: UNITED NATIONS  Britain has Theresa May. Chile has Michelle Bachelet. In the United States, Hillary Clinton this year became the first woman to clinch a major party nomination for president.

title: What Should You Choose: Time or Money?
description: Given the choice between more time or more money, which would you pick? For a beach vacation, you might pay more for a direct flight to gain a couple of extra hours getting sand between your toes. On the other hand, you might take a better-paying job that requires late nights at the office.

title: 3 Questions: Designing the Magazines High School, U.S.A. Issue
description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how news, features and opinion come together at The New York Times. Below, Chloe Scheffe, the lead designer for Sundays special issue of The Times Magazine, reveals what she meant to convey by manipulating the sections print typefaces: High schoolers are all about ownership.

title: How the Novelist Megan Abbott Spends Her Sundays
description: Megan Abbotts thrillers are explorations, she says, of women, power and aggression. Her latest, You Will Know Me, is set in the cutthroat world of girls gymnastics and was published this summer, just before the Olympics. A Times review in July said Ms. Abbott had resumed her customary role of black cat, opaque and unblinking, filling her readers with queasy suspicion at every turn. She recently completed a cross-country promotional tour for the book, and now Ms. Abbott is back in Forest Hills, Queens, where she lives. During her Sunday writing stints, the author, 45, takes a break from the shadowy side of human nature to step into the light of a neighborhood she loves.

title: Seriously Committed, and Not Just to Each Other
description: Allie Stickney and Dr. Jack Beecham, whose first marriages ended in divorce and whose second spouses died from cancer, connected when they needed each other most.

title: A Widow and a Widower Embrace Love After Loss
description: Readers of this column have no doubt lost count of the many ways people meet and later marry, but few couples can claim the hard-fought battle over womens reproductive issues as their backdrop.

title: Jason Wu: Spring 2017
description: Mr. Wu, who also designs Hugo Boss womens wear, presents a show focused on merino wool.

title: Shopping Guide: Dining Chairs
description: For Benjamin Vandiver, choosing a dining chair is about more than finding a comfortable place to sit during meals. I approach it as an opportunity for a sculptural moment  probably before comfort, he said. Heres a beautiful opportunity to add an art piece that you might sit in for 45 minutes.

title: Manchester Renowned, and Redrawn, by Its Soccer
description: MANCHESTER, England  It is what Gary Neville sees from the roof terrace of his hotel that gives him a sense that something is happening. Not the immediate view to his right of the Sir Alex Ferguson Stand at Old Trafford, with the words Manchester United  the club Neville supported, represented and captained  emblazoned in neon red. Neville points, instead, to the view on his distant left.

title: My 10 Favorite Books: Ev Williams
description: For his bookshop and website One Grand Books, the editor Aaron Hicklin asked people to name the 10 books theyd take with them if they were marooned on a desert island. The next in the series is Ev Williams, the co-founder of Twitter and the founder of Medium.com, who shares his list exclusively with T.

title: Minority Youths Mistrust Police. A Brooklyn High School Has a Plan.
description: On a chilly morning in November, Lt. Donzel Cleare of the New York Police Department stood in front of a classroom at Liberation Diploma Plus High School in Coney Island and asked a simple question: How many of you guys feel that I work for you?

title: In East Williamsburg, an Architect Updates the Streets of His Youth
description: Unlike the brownstones of Park Slope and Cobble Hill, the vinyl-sided rowhouses of North Brooklyn have never quite garnered the admiration of borough tastemakers. If anything, most new developments in North Brooklyn seem to make a point of distinguishing themselves from these structures.

title: Prosecutors Appeal Overturned Conviction of Making a Murderer Subject Brendan Dassey
description: Brendan Dassey, the Wisconsin man whose murder conviction was questioned on the popular Making a Murderer documentary series on Netflix, will have to spend at least a little more time in prison.

title: Review: Signs of Rebirth at New York City Opera
description: Is New York City Opera, which went under in 2013, finally back in business? Last January, the reorganized company, under its general director, Michael Capasso, made a tentative comeback with an uneven production of Puccinis Tosca. June brought a colorful production of Daniel Catns maudlin Florencia en el Amazonas.

title: What Were Reading
description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week. Sign up

title: What I Love | Sara Bareilles
description: Sara Bareilles, the Grammy and Tony-nominated singer-songwriter, lives in a two-bedroom rental in Lower Manhattan.

title: Sara Bareilles, of Waitress, on Her Sanctuary in the City
description: When the singer-songwriter Sara Bareilles came to New York from her native California in 2013 and rented what she described as a really sweet one-bedroom in the West Village, who knew  certainly not Ms. Bareilles  that shed soon be crooning a love song to the city?

title: Review of the San Bernardino Terrorist Attack
description: The Police Foundation, with help from the Justice Department, examined the law enforcement and emergency response to the mass shooting in San Bernardino, Calif., on Dec. 2, 2015. The report shows how officers handled the crisis.

title: The Curious Case of Susan Estrich
description: Susan Estrich is known for being first.

title: At Jason Wu, Bright Red Lips Fit for a Rave
description: The Olympics might be over, but a certain athletic, body-in-motion mentality ruled backstage at Jason Wus spring/summer 2017 show this afternoon. The makeup artist Yadim, dressed in high-tops and a baseball cap, created an energized, high-performance red-orange lip color that channeled the graceful sportswear vibe of Wus collection. In the past, weve done a blood red, but because of the sportiness and youth of the clothes this season, I wanted to make a rave red, he said. Its a bit brighter, its a bit more shocking, almost like a neon red.

title: Kevin Amato Casts New York Fashion Week
description: The photographer documents his time casting several shows  and shares his images exclusively with T.

title: What Its Like to Cast a Fashion Week Show
description: Kevin Amato is something of a multihyphenate: He casts several fashion week shows  including, this season, VFiles, Band of Outsiders and Kith  and this week has released a new book of photography, The Importants, featuring over 200 images culled from his years spent taking pictures. Amato focuses on street casting, picking models he finds on the street  or, increasingly, on Instagram  who typically dont conform to the traditional look of models in the industry. Amato also runs his own Instagram talent agency. This season, he held an open casting call for the VFiles show, which attracted hundreds of young hopefuls (including one who made the trip up from Florida). Amato captured his process of scouting for the show, as well as late-night pizza, exclusively for T.

title: Giulio Regeni, Italian Student, Was Under Investigation in Egypt Before His Death
description: CAIRO, Egypt  Egyptian security officers investigated an Italian graduate student for several days just two weeks before his brutalized body was discovered on the outskirts of Cairo in February, Egypts top prosecutor said on Friday, altering the official timeline of events leading up to the mans disappearance.

title: A Ballerina Steps Out  as a Choreographer
description: On a recent Saturday afternoon, Lauren Lovette surveyed her dancers before sliding into a split  one of her go-to positions when shes contemplating a step  and rose suddenly to move through a dynamic passage in her new ballet. She calls this part soft serve. In it, dancers line up along a diagonal and pirouette away as their arms swirl above their heads like curlicues topping a dip of Dairy Queen. She made some tweaks; her dancers peeled away from the line with more refinement but no less verve.

title: 9/11 Memorial Concerts, Mostly Low-Key
description: In classical music, birthday celebrations and other anniversary observances sometimes seem strained, even ludicrous, marketing ploys. It is hard to argue with recognitions of round numbers in, say, multiples of 50. But something like Carnegie Halls 125th anniversary, which came in May? Borderline. And how does a 15th anniversary stack up against a 10th?

title: Kerry James Marshall, Boldly Repainting Art History
description: CHICAGO  Kerry James Marshall, whose highly anticipated retrospective, Mastry, opens Oct. 25 at the Met Breuer, is steeped in classical training more thoroughly than almost any painter of his generation. Hes spent hundreds of hours in figure-drawing classes and anatomical studies, honing techniques developed over centuries by idols like Veronese and Rembrandt, to get up alongside them on the wall, as he says.

title: Turkey Uses Post-Coup Emergency Decree to Purge Mayors and Teachers
description: ISTANBUL  The Turkish government said on Friday that it was preparing to take over at least 28 municipal administrations nationwide, ousting elected mayors as part of an intensified crackdown against Kurdish insurgents.

title: Jason Wu Brings it Home
description: Its gotten so crazy out there, I just really wanted to bring it home.

title: Kelly Osbourne, Suffering for Fashion
description: The temperature in New York reached an uncomfortable 90 degrees on Friday afternoon as guests arrived at Michelle Smiths Milly show in Chelsea. With her Pomeranian, Polly, in tow, Kelly Osbourne took her seat among a front row that included Candace Cameron Bure, best known for her role as D.J. Tanner on Full House, and Johanna Braddy, who stars alongside Priyanka Chopra in the television show Quantico.

title: Critics Are Lining Up to Oppose Changes to Dodd-Frank Law
description: Buyout firms are at the forefront of Capitol Hill. They have successfully promoted legislation to roll back regulatory disclosures required under the postcrisis Dodd-Frank legislation, even as they settle cases over misleading investors. If the bill is enacted, however, there is a risk of repercussions.

title: Review: In Son of Zorn, the Dads Dense, and Drawn That Way
description: There are plenty of jokes in Son of Zorn. Theres the one when Zorns ex-wife asks if he owns a shirt, and he says, Does a Gryffian herdsman have nine anuses? Theres the one when his son tries to convince a predictably chauvinistic Zorn that his new boss is, in fact, a woman, and Zorn replies: No, son, youre not listening to me. Hes my superior.

title: U.S. Presidential Race, North Dakota, NASA: Your Friday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: An American Opera Company Adapts Chinas War and Peace
description: SAN FRANCISCO  It was a week before the premiere, and Bright Sheng, the composer and co-librettist of the new opera Dream of the Red Chamber, was already bracing for the backlash.

title: Friday Night Music: The Red Army Choir Sings Its A Long Way To Tipperary
Identity Crisis: Theater Productions That Refuse to Be Theater
description: We had landed on Pandora, a moon 4.4 light-years from Earth. Strange beasts roamed here; curious plants flourished. The air smelled of ketchup, and a mysterious, fluting voice encouraged us to visit the merchandise kiosk.

title: Review: When the Bough Breaks, Blame a Scary Pregnancy Surrogate
description: Perhaps you were wondering if it were still possible to wring any suspense out of an unbalanced-third-wheel plot. When the Bough Breaks, about a surrogate pregnancy gone horribly wrong, has a definitive answer: No, it isnt.

title: Galaxy Note 7 Owners Are Urged to Stop Using Their Phones
description: WASHINGTON  The fallout over the potential for Samsung Galaxy Note 7 smartphones to catch fire is intensifying.

title: Canada Today: A Surge in Interest, and Prices, for Torontos Film Scene
description: Were trying something new: Canada Today, a weekly roundup for Canadian readers and anyone else interested in the True North. Tell us what you think and what youd like to see, at CanadaToday@nytimes.com.

title: Off the Runway: Day 2
description: Scenes from the second day of New York Fashion Week.

title: On the Market in the New York Region
description: This weeks properties are five-bedroom homes in Lloyd Neck, N.Y., and Little Silver, N.J.

title: Novak Djokovic Survives Gal Monfils and the Humidity
description: Novak Djokovic has had more fluid days on the tennis court. But on a suffocating day when his body became desperate for fluids, he was grateful to take a victory any way he could get it.

title: Mary J. Blige Performs at Jimmy Choos 20th Birthday Party
description: Amber Valletta, Diane Kruger and others celebrate the shoe brands 20th year. Fashions finest toasted the opening of Saks Fifth Avenue Downtown.

title: Jonathan Rinehart, Founder of Public Relations Firm, Dies at 86
description: Jonathan Rinehart, who is credited with helping to pioneer the field of deal-making communications, died on Aug. 30. He was 86 and lived in New York.

title: On This Runway, Non-Models and Cool Kids
description: Over Labor Day weekend, a steady stream of hopefuls arrived at Eckhaus Lattas basement studio in Chinatown for the chance to take an audition strut down a makeshift runway.

title: Hillary Clinton Takes Aim at North Korea, Then at Donald Trump
description: Hillary Clinton called Friday for rethinking President Obamas strategy to combat North Koreas nuclear program, saying the countrys latest nuclear test gave the White House an opening to expand sanctions and broaden a missile-defense program in neighboring countries.

title: Mike Pence Releases 10 Years of Tax Returns
description: While Donald J. Trump resists making his tax returns public, his running mate, Gov. Mike Pence of Indiana, released a decade of his own filings on Friday.

title: Russia and the United States Reach New Agreement on Syria Conflict
description: GENEVA  Russia and the United States agreed early Saturday on a new plan to reduce violence in the Syrian conflict that, if successful, could lead for the first time to joint military targeting by the two powers against Islamic jihadists in Syria.

title: North Carolina Elections Board Settles Fight Over Voting Guidelines
description: North Carolinas state elections board settled a deeply partisan battle over this falls election rules on Thursday, largely rejecting a Republican-led effort to write local voting guidelines that would limit Democratic turnout in a political battleground state.

title: Akris: Spring 2017
description: Albert Kriemler shows his spring 2017 womens collection in New York for the first time.

title: 7 Police Officers to Be Charged in Bay Area Sex Scandal
description: A prosecutor in California said on Friday that criminal charges would be filed against seven current or former police officers in the San Francisco Bay Area, capping a monthslong investigation into allegations of officers having sex with a teenage prostitute.

title: Apple Is Said to Be Rethinking Strategy on Self-Driving Cars
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Apple is rethinking what it plans to do about self-driving cars, just as other big tech companies appear ready to plow ahead with competing efforts.

title: Gov. Mike Pences Personal Financial Disclosure
description: Mr. Pence, the governor of Indiana and the Republican vice-presidential nominee, released his own personal financial disclosure, which showed his state pension, a few investments and a series of loans totaling more than $80,000 for his childrens education.

title: The 2015 Income Tax Return for Gov. Mike Pence and Karen Pence
description: In 2015, Mr. Pence, the governor of Indiana and the Republican vice-presidential nominee, and his wife, Karen, reported an adjusted gross income of $113,026, paid $8,956 in federal taxes and contributed $8,923 to charities.

title: Dustin Moskovitz, Facebook Co-Founder, Pledges $20 Million to Aid Democrats
description: A billionaire co-founder of Facebook is committing $20 million to help elect Democrats this fall, saying the campaign of Donald J. Trump has raised such fundamental questions that he and his wife felt compelled to intervene.

title: Judge in 9/11 Suits Feels No Regret That None Ever Went to Trial
description: After the terrorist attacks of Sept. 11, 2001, scores of victims family members decided to pursue lawsuits in federal court, bypassing a dedicated compensation fund in order to seek not only millions of dollars in damages, but also answers and accountability.

title: Wells Fargo Offers Regrets, but Doesnt Admit Misconduct
description: Wells Fargo was flowing with regrets on Friday, taking out ads in nearly a dozen newspapers saying the bank took full responsibility for creating sham bank accounts without its customers permission.

title: G.M. Spots an Airbag Problem and Moves Quickly to Respond
description: Concerns about automobile airbags lately have focused on ones that deploy too explosively or even spontaneously.

title: Fact Check: Trump and Clinton on Security
description: The New York Times checks statements by Donald J. Trump and Hillary Clinton about national security and foreign affairs.

title: Keeping Ahead in Arms Race for the Perfect Wheelchair
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  The Paralympic wheelchair basketball competition had not even begun, and Mike Frogley was already thinking about the next one. And the one after that.

title: Rapper Bobby Shmurda Takes 7-Year Plea Deal in Gang Case
description: After spending over a year and a half in jail awaiting trial, the Brooklyn rapper Bobby Shmurda pleaded guilty on Friday to conspiracy and weapons possession in a deal with prosecutors three days before jury selection was to start.

title: Health Care Providers Scramble to Meet New Disaster Readiness Rule
description: An estimated 72,315 American health care providers and suppliers  from hospitals and nursing homes to dialysis facilities and care homes for those with intellectual disabilities  will have a little over a year to meet federal disaster preparedness requirements  completed this week by the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services.

title: Call It a Growing Family: High Maintenance Moves to HBO
description: Ben Sinclair and Katja Blichfeld were wedged into the bedroom belonging to their friend Russell Gregory on a cold and rainy February day, shooting a scene for the television series High Maintenance. Mr. Gregorys railroad apartment was crawling with people  sound guys, assistant directors, camera operators  and the atmosphere was as tense as the working conditions (and schedule) were tight.

title: Sexism: Lets Deconstruct Donald
description: Are Donald Trumps attacks on Hillary Clinton sexist? To be fair, Trump is a guy who makes insulting personal remarks about everyone he disagrees with, regardless of gender. Lets not jump to conclusions. This deserves a serious breakdown.

title: Monse: Spring 2017
description: Laura Kim and Fernando Garcia, recently appointed creative directors of Oscar de la Renta, present their spring collection.

title: For Rudy Giuliani, Embrace of Donald Trump Puts Legacy at Risk
description: Weeks after the Sept. 11, 2001, attacks, with bodies still being pulled from the smoldering rubble, New Yorks mayor, Rudolph W. Giuliani, delivered an emotional address before a hushed United Nations.

title: North Korea Will Have the Skills to Make a Nuclear Warhead by 2020, Experts Say
description: North Koreas fifth nuclear test is ominous not only because the country is slowly mastering atomic weaponry, but because it is making headway in developing missiles that could hurl nuclear warheads halfway around the globe, threatening Washington and New York City.

title: Young, Digitally Savvy and Just Fine With a Little Grime in Their Subway Cars
description: When 23-year-old Patrick J. Stewart reviews a subway car for his subway-centric YouTube channel, he sometimes brings a white glove to stroke the poles, checking how besmirched his fingertips get. It is a good way to gauge how well a car is maintained, he says, and, by extension, how caring its overseers back at the rail depot are: The finger-swab is a health check on the entire system.

title: Women in Terror Cell Were Guided by ISIS, Paris Prosecutor Says
description: PARIS  A terrorist cell made up mainly of radicalized young Frenchwomen has been dismantled by security forces, the Paris prosecutor said on Friday, after a car filled with gas canisters was found last week in the heart of Paris.

title: North Koreas Nuclear Enabler
description: No country has more influence over the rogue state of North Korea than China, which provides it with food, fuel and access to vital trade routes. Yet when North Korea conducted its fifth and most powerful nuclear weapons test on Friday  underscoring once again the failure of international efforts to halt the nuclear program  Beijings response amounted to pap.

title: Virginias Republicans Turn Back the Clock
description: In the last couple of decades, states have begun to recognize the particular viciousness of laws that prevent people with felony convictions from voting. Virginia Republicans, on the other hand, appear eager to return to the 19th century, when most of these laws were drafted explicitly to keep African-Americans away from the ballot box.

title: A Way to Protect Planned Parenthood Services
description: Opponents of Planned Parenthood in recent years have cut funding to the organization that goes through the Title X Family Planning Program, which provides federal money for services like contraception, testing for sexually transmitted infections and cancer screenings. (Like all federal programs, it is largely barred from paying for abortions.) State and local governments distribute that money to health care providers, and at least 14 states took actions to cut the share they direct to Planned Parenthood.

title: Youre Soaking in It
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  As a devotee of film and television pop culture, it did not surprise me in the least that my first two entries in Peter Wentzs crunchy and challenging puzzle were ALEX ROCCO and PALMOLIVE.

title: Bob Graham: Release More 9/11 Records
description: In July, after approval from the Obama administration, Congress released a 28-page chapter of previously classified material from the final report of a joint congressional inquiry into the Sept. 11 attacks. Saudi Arabias foreign minister, Adel al-Jubeir, said that the document had ruled out any Saudi involvement in the attack. The matter is now finished, he declared.

title: The Selling of Donald J. Trump
description: In their struggle to understand the Trump phenomenon, establishment pundits, political scientists and millions of flabbergasted American voters have settled on a long list of sober-sounding socioeconomic explanations: Deindustrialization. Anomie. Racial animosity. The rising up of a dislocated America.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Sully is worried about his reputation, but this movie isnt helping mine.

title: Matching Sully to Real Life
description: They sat, like others will this weekend, in the darkness watching Sully. But for those who survived the landing of US Airways Flight 1549 in the Hudson River in 2009, this was not just a night at the movies.

title: Tommy Hilfiger: Fall 2016
description: The label presents its fall 2016 TommyXGigi collection via a carnival at South Street Seaport.

title: After a Rocky Start, Stan Wawrinka Storms Into His First U.S. Open Final
description: The United States Open took a hit in July when Roger Federer announced that his season was over because of a knee injury. Fans were disappointed that the veteran Swiss master with the graceful one-handed backhand would be unable to make another run to a final.

title: De Blasio Faces Mounting Pressure on Matters of Transparency
description: Mayor Bill de Blasios weekly radio appearance ought to have been a sleepy affair on a grindingly humid Friday morning at the tail end of summer.

title: Protesters Respond to Pipeline Ruling
description: The U.S. government temporarily halted construction on the Dakota Access pipeline after a federal court denied a Native American tribes request for an injunction.

title: Donald Trump Says Hillary Clinton Wouldnt Be Prosecuted Even if She Shot Someone
description: PENSACOLA, Fla.  Donald J. Trump, in escalating attacks against Hillary Clinton, suggested on Friday that his opponent was so immune to prosecution that she could shoot someone in front of thousands of witnesses and not be prosecuted.

title: Rally to Beat the Braves, and a Favorable Schedule, Buoy the Mets Hopes
description: ATLANTA  The nadir of the Mets season may have been Aug. 19. They were two games under .500, and five and a half games out of the second National League wild-card spot. Playoff projections had the Mets percentage chances of reaching the postseason in the single digits.

title: Nora Mendis and Samuel Ellison: From Platonic Buddies to an Unexpected Love
description: Nora Rose Mendis and Samuel Noah Lindsay Ellison were married Sept. 10 in Dummerston, Vt. Joshua Bauchner, a friend of the couple who received authorization from the State of Vermont, officiated at Full Plate Farm, a vegetable farm owned by Laura Hecht and Matthew Crowley, friends of the couple.

title: Emma Tessler and Benjamin Jacoff: The 116th Time Was the Charm
description: Emma Eiber Tessler and Benjamin Samuel Jacoff were married Sept. 10 in Madison, Conn. Rabbi Jessica Minnen officiated at Barberry Hill Farm, a vegetable, fruit and wildflower farm.

title: Kate Horowitz and Jake Klarberg: From Campers to Counselors to Spouses
description: Kate Margaret Horowitz, a daughter of Katherine C. Horowitz and the stepdaughter of Scott S. Glassman of Dix Hills, N.Y., was married Sept. 10 to Jake Tyler Klarberg, a son of Rindi N. Klarberg of Morristown, N.J., and Barry J. Klarberg of Greenwich, Conn. Rabbi Susie Moskowitz officiated at the summer home of the brides family in Kings Point, N.Y., with Cantor Sarene Applebaum taking part.

title: Amy Margolis and David Wilson: Atop Yosemites Half Dome, a Banana-Bread Wedding
description: Amy Beth Margolis and David John Wilson were married Sept. 6 in Yosemite National Park in California. Hannah M. McHugh, a friend who became a Universal Life minister to preside, officiated on the summit of Half Dome, a popular hiking destination.

title: 5-Year Prison Term in Iran Is Reported for Thomson Reuters Charity Official
description: A British-Iranian employee of the Thomson Reuters Foundation, who was arrested more than five months ago while she and her daughter, a toddler, were visiting family in Iran, has been sentenced to a five-year prison term for unexplained charges, the foundation said Friday.

title: Corrections: September 10, 2016
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: Dustin Johnson, With 2 Eagles, Sets Course Record
description: Dustin Johnson made two eagles in a seven-hole run, shot 31 on the back nine and set the course record at Crooked Stick in Carmel, Ind., on Friday with a nine-under-par 63 that gave him a share of the lead with Roberto Castro in the BMW Championship.

title: Yankees Ride Out Rain, With Their Future Suddenly Looking Bright
description: At 11:17 p.m., with Yankee Stadium emptying and one out in the ninth inning, the rain again became too much to bear. The Yankees and Tampa Bay Rays had already withstood two delays, each just 21 minutes long  more nagging intrusions than debilitating storms  and this was the worst one yet. A game that was dragging into its fifth hour came to another halt.

title: Whats on TV Saturday: Star Wars: The Force Awakens and Sisters
description: Star Wars: The Force Awakens blasts onto all Starz channels. Tina Fey and Amy Poehler let loose as siblings hosting the party of a lifetime in Sisters. And you can watch The Devil Wears Prada and The September Issue in honor of New York Fashion Week.

title: War Games Show Off Russias Tightening Grip on Crimea
description: MOSCOW  Large landing ships approached the shores of Crimea on Friday, simulating an invasion of the peninsula that was annexed by Moscow from Ukraine in 2014. Tanks and armored vehicles lumbered out of the ships, only to be met by the superior forces of the defenders, equipped with heavy artillery.

title: NYPD 9/11 Parade Honors Lost Officers
description: To mark the 15th anniversary of 9/11, the NYPD held its first memorial parade. The procession commemorated the 23 officers who died on 9/11 and the 99 who died as a result of related illnesses.

title: Wars Have Been Fought for Much Less
description: Here are the top 10 comments of the week on our digital platforms, as selected by our readers and the journalists who moderate nearly every comment.

title: In a Reverse Mentorship, Seeing Age Though a New Lens
description: A few months ago, Phyllis Korkki, an assignment editor at The New York Times who sits a few cubicles away, approached me with a question that gave me pause. Will you mentor me? she asked.

title: What Could I Possibly Learn From a Mentor Half My Age? Plenty
description: How on earth did I become an older worker?

title: In the Bonobo World, Female Camaraderie Prevails
description: The female bonobo apes of the Wamba forest in the Democratic Republic of Congo had just finished breakfast and were preparing for a brief nap in the treetops, bending and crisscrossing leafy branches into comfortable day beds.

title: The Stars Come Out for Opening Ceremonys Fashion Week Agitprop
description: If anything is likely to pierce the seemingly impenetrable fashion week bubble, surely it has to be this wacko election season. Not even the most frivolous catwalk devotee remains untouched by a presidential race as unprecedentedly weird as this one.

title: Gwyneth Paltrow and Goop Go Into the Fashion Business
description: SANTA MONICA, Calif.  Can you help me clear something up?

title: The Trauma of Violent News on the Internet
description: The world has always been messy, President Obama said in 2014 after a string of doom-and-gloom news events. In part, were just noticing now because of social media and our capacity to see in intimate detail the hardships that people are going through.

title: Jerry Lewis At 90: His Mouth Runneth Over
description: LAS VEGAS  It wasnt always easy to make out his words above the din of five Chihuahuas yipping at his feet. But when Jerry Lewis has something to say, damn if he isnt going to be heard.

title: New York Fashion Week, Day 4: Start Early, Party Late
description: Weekend? What weekend? New York Fashion Week knows no such thing. On Saturday, the shows soldier on  and so, in their thrall, do we.

title: Postcards From the Hajj: The Wildlife
description: When I was preparing for the hajj, the holy Muslim pilgrimage to Mecca, Saudi Arabia, my brother warned me of a peril in the skies: the birds.

title: Throwing Stones and Slaughtering Sheep at the Hajj
description: Usually, the post office is where you send mail or pay your bills. In Saudi Arabia during the hajj, its where you pay for your animal sacrifice.

title: A Little Variety
description: VARIETY PUZZLES  This weeks puzzles include:

title: Tobin Was Right (Implicitly Wonkish)
description: Right now, when not trying to do something about the political horror unfolding, Im revising macro chapters and also preparing for several European speeches, including this one on macroeconomic lessons from recent experience. And I found myself returning to a theme Ive touched on a few times over the years: it seems to me, all too often, that both economists and economic policymakers might actually have done a better job responding to the crisis if they has been using an old-fashioned theoretical toolkit, say what smart Keynesians believed circa 1970.

title: The Daily Bag: Jason Wu
description: The classic saddle bag got a modern update at Jason Wu: chalk-white leather, silver hardware and a sleek shape.

title: The Daily Jewel: Chris Gelinas
description: The sculptural, rose-gold earrings at Chris Gelinas were inspired by abstract florals.

title: Farhads and Mikes Week in Tech: The iPhones Super Mario Moment
description: Each Saturday, Farhad Manjoo and Mike Isaac, technology reporters at The New York Times, review the weeks news, offering analysis and maybe a joke or two about the most important developments in the tech industry.

title: The Daily Shoe: Tanya Taylor
description: Memories of summer lingered at Tanya Taylor, where the designer collaborated with Paul Andrew on playful, festive raffia slides.

title: Monse Draws Attention, and Not Just for the Clothes
description: Amid much excitement over Monses designers being appointed to lead Oscar de la Renta, the label showed its new collection.

title: Amid Much Buzz, Monse Shows Its Spring Collection
description: One week ago, the news broke that Laura Kim and Fernando Garcia, the designers of Monse, would be going back to Oscar de la Renta  where they had spent 12 and 6 years, respectively  as its next creative directors. The timing was not ideal. Ms. Kim and Mr. Garcias own label was barely a year old, and the preparations for its New York Fashion Week show, only its third, were well underway. But news will out.

title: When Birds Nest in Bad Places
description: I live in a condominium with beautiful landscaping, trees   and lots of birds. The air-conditioning and heating units in the apartments are vented outdoors through louvers built into the buildings brick facade. Birds nest in the spaces between the louvers and the cooling-and-heating units, leaving behind droppings and nesting material. It is messy and a health hazard, but does not damage the appliances. The board says condo owners are responsible for cleaning and removing the nests. But shouldnt this be the boards responsibility, since the nests are in the facade and not in the appliances?

title: The Secret History of Colombias Paramilitaries and the U.S. War on Drugs
description: CALABAZO, Colombia  Skinny but imposing with aviator glasses, a bushy mustache and a toothy smile, Julio Henrquez Santamara was leading a community meeting in this sylvan hamlet when he was abducted by paramilitary thugs, thrown into the back of a Toyota pickup and disappeared forever on Feb. 4, 2001.

title: Gawkers New Owner Deletes Six Posts Involved in Lawsuits
description: Executives at Univision, which bought Gawker Media last month for $135 million, voted on Friday to remove six posts previously published by Gawker Media sites. The posts, which were taken down on Saturday, are involved in continuing legal action.

title: Fashion Week Photo Diary: Jason Wu, Monse and Tommy Hilfiger
description: Scenes from the collections which were presented in New York on Friday.

title: Greek Life
description: Recent graduate captures greek life on an HBCU campus.

title: Boise State Mounts a Paper Defense of Its Home Turf
description: BOISE, Idaho  If anyone in the world  a high school in Texas, a college in New England, a university in Japan  wants to install an artificial turf field of any color besides green, it must first receive permission from the occupant of a corner office in a brick building at the center of the campus of Boise State University.

title: For Twins Dozier, One Big Swing Unlocks Another
description: It took a while for the most prolific power hitter of the summer to understand his potential. But doing so was essential to reaching the majors, said Brian Dozier, whose epiphany came on a golf course.

title: Boiler Explosion at Bangladesh Factory Kills at Least 23
description: TONGI, Bangladesh  A boiler explosion in a cigarette packaging factory outside Dhaka enveloped the five-story building in flames early Saturday, killing at least 23 people, fire officials said.

title: Rickie Fowlers Killer Instinct Comes With a Smile
description: CARMEL, Ind.  As honorary observers, the two men were close enough to get splattered by the muddy spinout that was Rickie Fowlers opening round at the BMW Championship at Crooked Stick Golf Club last week. Fowlers three-over-par 75, six strokes higher than the scores carded by his playing partners, gave Ted Azar and Mike Bova pause.

title: North Korea, Far From Crazy, Is All Too Rational
description: Is North Korea irrational? Or does it just pretend to be?

title: Real-Time Election Day Projections May Upend News Tradition
description: PALO ALTO, Calif.  For decades, news organizations have refrained from releasing early results in presidential battleground states on Election Day, adhering to a strict, time-honored embargo until a majority of polls there have closed.

title: On Ben McAdoos Journey to the Top, False Starts and Tenacity
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  In 2000, at 22 years old, Ben McAdoo had no plans to become a coach, not even in midget football, let alone in the N.F.L. His career game plan included law school. He had not been in a football uniform since high school.

title: Ryan Cladys Twisted Turns
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  Upon being traded to the Jets in April, Ryan Clady wondered whether his new teammates would accept him.

title: Variety: Urban Renewal
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  This puzzle by Puzzabilitys Mike Shenk is a lot of fun, particularly if you pay attention to the two-word combinations you have to make before you change the letters to get the United States or world cities.

title: Review: Fiorello!, the Mayor Who Fought for the Little Guy
description: Imagine, if you can, a musical comedy called La Guardia! Picture a chorus angrily lamenting their canceled flights. A frustrated plaint from an overtaxed ticketing agent trying to calm them. A frenetic hip-hop dance number as arriving passengers dodge traffic to find their Uber drivers.

title: An Overlooked Rivalry: Novak Djokovic and Stan Wawrinka
description: With his sweatshirt hood up and the midnight hour approaching, Stan Wawrinka stifled a laugh.

title: Yellow, Fuzzy and Flat: Where Do Recycled Tennis Balls Go?
description: Pop open a can of tennis balls before a match. Open a new can for the next match, and the next.

title: Why Arent They in Jail? Heres One Company Head Who Is
description: Consumers who write to the Haggler to describe particularly egregious behavior often end their letters with variations of this question: Why arent the people in charge behind bars?

title: Bobby Chacon, Boxing Champion Hounded by Misfortune, Dies at 64
description: Bobby Chacon, a scrappy two-time world boxing champion who was haunted by tragedy outside the arena and memorialized in song by Warren Zevon, died on Wednesday at a hospice in Hemet, Calif. He was 64.

title: No Driver? Bring It On. How Pittsburgh Became Ubers Testing Ground
description: PITTSBURGH  Any day now, Uber will introduce  a fleet of self-driving cars in Pittsburgh, making this former steel town the worlds first city to let any passenger hail an autonomous vehicle.

title: Lacoste: Spring 2017
description: Felipe Oliveira Baptista presents his spring 2017 collection.

title: Married Off by the Khmer Rouge, and Nobody Could Help Me
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia  In a vast courtroom on the outskirts of Phnom Penh, a middle-aged Cambodian woman soberly described a night nearly four decades ago that she said she had never talked about before.

title: The Bull Is Still Running. So Why Are Investors Tiptoeing?
description: Wall Street seems unable to make up its mind about risk-taking.

title: A Robot May Be Training to Do Your Job. Dont Panic.
description: In my speaking engagements, when I mention the terms the future of work and automation in the same sentence, I often see the audience squirm. Peoples worst fear is that their job will soon be taken over by the equivalent of Rosie the Robot from The Jetsons. But even though were only in the beginning stages of work force automation, Im optimistic about the effect it will have on human workers.

title: A Linguist Helping Apps Learn to Speak Millennial
description: Q. What is Yik Yak and what is your job there?

title: The Trump-Ailes Buddy Act
description: Trump TV.

title: Street Style: New York Fashion Week
description: Street style from the spring 2017 fashion season at New York Fashion Week.

title: Narcos Season 2 Finale: The Last Stand
description: The photograph of Colombian armed forces members standing over the body of Pablo Escobar on a Medelln rooftop shows the end of a costly mission captured in suitably unsavory fashion. Bloodied and splayed across the tile with no shoes, rolled-up jeans and a shirt hiked above his generous belly, Escobar became the subject of a ghoulish photo-op, with various operatives posing with wide smiles on their faces, like big-game hunters showing off a prize catch. They cannot be blamed for their exuberance, given the terror and violence Escobar perpetuated to his very last breath, but the photos are the punctuation mark at the end of an unsettling chapter for Colombian and United States law enforcement.

title: Liu Wen, the Happy-Go-Lucky Model
description: On Friday evening, the fashion world turned out for a glitzy carnival on Pier 16 in the Financial District  or to be more accurate, a carnival/fashion show/shopping extravaganza hosted by Tommy Hilfiger and Gigi Hadid, who collaborated on a collection with the designer.

title: Against a Backdrop of War, Ad Portrays Donald Trump as Reckless
description: Priorities USA, the primary super PAC supporting Hillary Clinton, takes viewers through a visual tour of the horrors of warfare, from Vietnam to the Islamic State, in a new ad that seeks to paint her opponent, Donald J. Trump, as reckless and flippant on the use of military force.

title: Dropout by Dartmouth Raises Questions on Health Law Cost-Savings Effort
description: WASHINGTON  In its quest to remake the nations health care system, the Obama administration has urged doctors and hospitals to band together to improve care and cut costs, using a model devised by researchers at Dartmouth College.

title: David Dukes Senate Run in Louisiana Draws Attention but Not Support
description: MANDEVILLE, La.  It has so far been a mostly humdrum race for Louisianas open United States Senate seat, likely to end in a victory for some veteran officeholder: the Republican state treasurer, one of the congressmen, maybe even, in a surprise, a Democratic public service commissioner.

title: Temperatures Rise, and Were Cooked
description: ONE of Donald Trumps 100 wackiest ideas is that climate change is a hoax fabricated by China to harm America.

title: The Strip
description: A weekly comic strip featured in the Sunday Review.

title: Seeking the Final Faces for a 9/11 Tapestry of Grief, Loss, Life and Joy
description: Albert Ogletree, a food handler with Forte Food Service, was working in the cafeteria at Cantor Fitzgerald in the north tower of the World Trade Center when a hijacked jetliner careered into the skyscraper. He is one of the 2,983 people killed in the terrorist attacks of Sept. 11, 2001, and Feb. 26, 1993, when the trade center was bombed.

title: How to Celebrate Eid al-Adha Like an American
description: The Muslim festival of Eid al-Adha, which commemorates the end of the annual hajj pilgrimage, begins Monday, Sept. 12. For a few weeks, it looked as if the holiday was going to fall the day before: Sept. 11.

title: Michigan Prosecutors Defy the Supreme Court
description: Why are Michigans prosecutors ignoring the Supreme Court?

title: Our Russia Problem
description: RUSSIAS place in American politics used to be (relatively) simple. The further right you stood, the more you feared Ivan and his Slavic wiles. The further left, the more you likely thought the Red Menace was mostly just a scare story.

title: Why We Should Stop Grading Students on a Curve
description: Ask people whats wrong in American higher education, and youll hear about grade inflation. At Harvard a few years ago, a professor complained that the most common grade was an A-. He was quickly corrected: The most common grade at Harvard was an A.

title: Donald Trumps Ideology of Applause
description: Americans are such sticklers. Such poops. Sure, some of Vladimir Putins political opponents wind up in jail, while some of the journalists he dislikes end up in the morgue. Yes, his government is apparently committing cybercrimes to meddle in our election. And there was that small matter of invading and annexing one of Russias neighbors.

title: A Walk Around the Void of 9/11
description: Walk onto the plaza in Lower Manhattan and you hear the memorial before you see it  a whooshing through the oak trees. You soon realize its not the wind, but water. At the footprint of each tower, north and south, a vast square emptiness is bound by four walls of falling water, the pool below pouring into a smaller central void that flows out of sight. The memorial is black upon black, but the water casts reflections. Sunlight and mist make fragmentary rainbows that flicker as clouds go by.

title: Before You Spend $26,000 on Weight-Loss Surgery, Do This
description: Earlier this year, the Food and Drug Administration approved a new weight-loss procedure in which a thin tube, implanted in the stomach, ejects food from the body before all the calories can be absorbed.

title: The Bitch America Needs
description: There are so many ways to be a bitch when youre Hillary Clinton. You can refuse to give up a thriving law career when your husband is elected governor of Arkansas. Later, when he becomes president of the United States, you can infuriate housewives across the nation with a dismissive reference to baking cookies.

title: Even Amid Cease-Fire Countdown, Syrias Conflicts Deepen
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  On the swirling battlefield in Syria in the past month alone, Turkey has sent in tanks, incendiary bombs have charred children and whole towns have been emptied in surrender deals that could change the countrys demographics.

title: Marathon Swimmer Falls Short in Bid for a Record Off San Francisco
description: SACRAMENTO  Just before noon on Friday, Kim Chambers, 39, stood on a floating dock at the Sacramento Yacht Club as Kala Sherman-Presser, a member of her support team, rubbed lanolin under Chamberss arms and the seams of her swimsuit.

title: Trigger Warnings, Safe Spaces and Free Speech, Too
description: I didnt get the University of Chicago welcome letter that made the rounds on the internet earlier this summer. Im a senior this year, and the message from Jay Ellison, the dean of undergraduate students, was for the incoming class: Dont expect trigger warnings or safe spaces here. The university, he said, was committed to free expression and would not shield students from ideas they disagreed with or found offensive.

title: Eckhaus Latta: Spring 2017
description: Mike Eckhaus and Zoe Latta show their latest designs.

title: Saving Our Coastlines
description: Rising sea levels caused by climate change are threatening coastal areas. What can we do?

title: With Pensions Like This ($315 a Month), Chileans Wonder How Theyll Ever Retire
description: SANTIAGO, Chile  Discontent has been brewing for years in Chile over pensions so low that most people must keep working past retirement age. All the while, privately run companies have reaped enormous profits by investing Chileans social security savings.

title: Megan Price
description: Megan Price is executive director of the Human Rights Data Analysis Group, or Hrdag, a nonprofit, nonpartisan organization that collects and analyzes data to investigate and document human rights violations around the world.

title: The Truth About False Balance
description: TO anyone who has avoided the debate over false balance, apologies for disturbing your bliss. But its necessary, because those who havent heard this phrase are missing out on one of the more consequential debates to engage the media in years.

title: Hillary Clinton Calls Many Trump Backers Deplorables, and G.O.P. Pounces
description: Republicans from the presidential ticket on down pounced Saturday on Hillary Clintons remarks that half of Donald J. Trumps supporters fit into a basket of deplorables, saying it showed she was out of touch with an economically hard-hit electorate.

title: Under a Maestro, Manchester City Strikes the Perfect Note
description: MANCHESTER, England  Pep Guardiola, still basking in the delight of a victory in his first Manchester derby, was walking past the gleaming hospitality boxes that line Old Traffords Sir Bobby Charlton Stand when a familiar face emerged from one of the suites to greet him.

title: Cast-Out Police Officers Are Often Hired in Other Cities
description: As a police officer in a small Oregon town in 2004, Sean Sullivan was caught kissing a 10-year-old girl on the mouth.

title: Ryan Roche: Spring 2017
description: Looks from the designers latest collection.

title: Potent Critiques of NBC Forum Raise Stakes for Moderators
description: As criticism rained down on Matt Lauer, the NBC anchor whose handling of a prime-time presidential forum on Wednesday received an onslaught of poor reviews, there was one select group of television journalists whose reaction ran along simpler lines:

title: On the Trail: Week of Sept. 4
description: Hillary Clinton and Donald J. Trump invited the news media aboard their planes and attended a candidate forum aboard the decommissioned aircraft carrier Intrepid.

title: Sack Time
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  Ive had a very busy workweek, so Im very tempted to take Ned White and George Barany up on their advice. The theme elements in their grid look so comfy.

title: Angelique Kerber, With a U.S. Open Win, Solidifies Her Claim on No. 1 Status
description: The line can be so fine, even with all the work Angelique Kerber has done on herself and her game.

title: Christian Siriano: Spring 2017
description: The latest looks from the Project Runway winner, who designed Michelle Obamas Democratic National Convention dress this year.

title: Subtraction of Several Stars Changes the Early N.F.L. Title Math
description: Tom Brady of the New England Patriots is suspended for the seasons first four games, and LeVeon Bell of the Pittsburgh Steelers is suspended for the first three. Tony Romo of the Dallas Cowboys will have an extended absence because of a back injury, and Teddy Bridgewater of the Minnesota Vikings is expected to miss the entire season with a severe knee injury.

title: The Lacoste Collection
description: Dreaming of a villa on Capri. (Who wouldnt?)

title: Putin, Admired by Donald Trump, Emphasizes Strength as Virtue
description: MOSCOW  Tiger shooter, bare-chested horseman and architect of Russias revival as a muscular global power, President Vladimir V. Putin, dressed in a somber suit and tie, sat for over an hour this past week sipping tea from a delicate porcelain cup and offering earnest advice on how to improve housing, medical care and other services in a provincial town south of here.

title: Greta Friedman, Who Claimed to Be Nurse in V-J Day Photo, Dies at 92
description: Greta Friedman, who said she was grabbed and kissed by a sailor in a euphoric moment that made for one of the most defining American photos of the 20th century, died on Thursday in Richmond, Va. She was 92.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Vladimir Putin is a strong leader in the same way that arsenic is a strong drink.

title: Donald Trump Praises Phyllis Schlafly as a Conservative Hero at Her Funeral
description: ST. LOUIS  Invoking the power of regular people to take on the rigged system, Donald J. Trump on Saturday paid his respects to the conservative activist Phyllis Schlafly, while suggesting they were kindred spirits in a shared fight.

title: Greek Leader, Amid Protests, Promises Light at the End of the Tunnel
description: ATHENS  Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras on Saturday pledged millions of euros in relief for those hit hardest by Greeces financial crisis and heralded a turning point for its battered economy, saying that relief was in sight as thousands of people protested against austerity.

title: Masahiro Tanaka and Gary Sanchez Keep Yankees Surging, to 7th Straight Win
description: When the Yankees Masahiro Tanaka and Gary Sanchez are in the clubhouse doing interviews, each has an interpreter, one for Japanese and the other for Spanish.

title: Open Belongs to U.S., and So Do Its Finalists (a German and a Czech)
description: They played a gripping United States Open womens final, even without whatshername  although, in truth, Serena Williams remained very much part of the tense and tangled tale.

title: Band of Outsiders: Spring 2017
description: Niklaus Hodel, Matthias Weber and Florian Feder present their first runway show for the label.

title: Stabbing Attack in Australia Is Linked to the Islamic State
description: SYDNEY, Australia  A man who stabbed and critically wounded another man in a park in a Sydney suburb on Saturday was inspired by Islamic State extremists, the police here said on Sunday.

title: Collision at Home Shakes Up Wilmer Flores and Leaves Mets Reeling
description: ATLANTA  After Saturdays 4-3 loss to the Atlanta Braves in 10 innings, Mets Manager Terry Collins sat in his office waiting to speak with reporters as he normally does. This time, though, he had a confession to make.

title: Kanye West Performs at the Harpers Bazaar Fashion Week Party
description: Kylie Jenner, Coco Rocha and other fashion elites celebrate the magazines Icons by Carine Roitfled at the Plaza Hotel; Julianne Moore and Keri Russell toast Gemfields at the Jane Hotel.

Schanen and Mitchell J. Schanen of North Brunswick, N.J. The ceremony, at Monteverde at Oldstone in Cortlandt Manor, N.Y., was led by Michael Trifiolis, a friend of the brides family who became a Universal Life minister so that he could officiate.

Wickham Boyle, a friend of the brides family, who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, officiated.

description: Morgan Julia Bisignano, a daughter of Nancy A. Bisignano of Green Brook, N.J., and Frank J. Bisignano of Watchung, N.J., was married Sept. 10 to Sam Albert Lituchy, a son of Barbara H. Lituchy and Richard B. Lituchy of Melville, N.Y. Rabbi Arthur L. Schwartz officiated on Ellis Island. Msgr. Jamie J. Gigantiello performed a Roman Catholic blessing before the ceremony.

Hughes and Leslie W. Abramson, both of Louisville, Ky. Judge M. Margaret McKeown of the United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit, with chambers in San Diego, officiated at LAuberge Del Mar, a hotel in Del Mar, Calif.

Gendler and Dr. James M. Salik of New York. The ceremony, at the Mount, the summer home of Edith Wharton in Lenox, Mass., was led by Marshall E. Nannes, a friend of the couple who received temporary permission from Massachusetts to officiate.

description: June Jiao Liang and Dr. Andrew Thomas Wong were married Sept. 10 in Manhattan. Dorothy Muson, a minister of the Church of Spiritual Humanism, officiated at the Penn Club of New York.

description: Amy Rice Wolf and Wayne Mark Winnick were married Sept. 9 at Wolffer Estate Vineyard in Sagaponack, N.Y. Rabbi Richard Berman officiated.

Booker of South Richmond Hill, Queens. The Rev. Michael Perry, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at Our Lady of Refuge Church in Brooklyn.

title: Michael Jarecki, Chirag Badlani
description: Michael Robert Jarecki and Chirag Gopal Badlani were married Sept. 10 in Chicago. Judge Ann Claire Williams of the United States Court of Appeals for the Seventh Circuit, for whom Mr. Badlani was a law clerk until 2012, officiated at the Chicago Cultural Center.

title: Alexander Wang: Spring 2017
description: The designer, who recently tapped Kylie Jenner for his fall 2016 campaign, presents his spring 2017 womens show.

title: Whats on TV Sunday: Churchills Secret and Son of Zorn
description: In Churchills Secret, Michael Gambon plays Britains aging prime minister in 1953, determined to hide his debilitating stroke from the world. Son of Zorn blends animated and real characters in the tale of a He-Man-style warrior trying to win back his ex-wife and son. And a new season of Masters of Sex plays musical chairs in and out of the bedroom.

title: Anti-Semitism and the British Left
description: LONDON  Opponents of Jeremy Corbyn, the left-wing leader of Britains Labour Party, usually claim one of two things about him: that his politics are extreme and will lead the party to electoral oblivion, or that his values are admirable but he is too incompetent to put them into effect.

title: Few Expect China to Punish North Korea for Latest Nuclear Test
description: BEIJING  North Koreas biggest nuclear test, conducted last week less than 50 miles from the Chinese border, sent tremors through homes and schools in Chinas northeast. But hours later, there was no mention of the test on Chinas state-run evening television news, watched by hundreds of millions of viewers.

title: New York Fashion Week, Day 5: Oh, the Pageantry
description: Day of rest? Nah. New York Fashion Week continues; so does sweaty weather. Dress accordingly. Heres what youll see today.

title: U.S. Presidential Race, North Dakota, Syria: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Here are the weeks top stories, and a look ahead.

title: Postcards From the Hajj: Pray Hard
description: On a hectic day at the hajj, the annual pilgrimage to Islams holiest sites, Diaa Hadid, a New York Times correspondent, felt a sudden call to prayer.

title: Gems from the Deep
description: BEAULIEU, England  When divers searched the wreckage of the S.S. Persia off the coast of Crete in 2003, they found some remarkable cargo: more than 200 gemstones, including rubies, amethysts, moonstones and what are believed to be some of the first mass-produced synthetic rubies.

title: Daniele Gatti, Creative Risk-Taker, Picks Up Baton at Royal Concertgebouw
description: AMSTERDAM  The first time Daniele Gatti stepped inside the Concertgebouw concert hall in Amsterdam, he was 30 years old and wearing jeans and a T-shirt. The young Italian conductor had just come off a 10-day cycling tour through the Netherlands, and when he arrived in Amsterdam he saw that tickets were still available for that evenings performance. He bought cheap seats and sat on the onstage podium behind the double basses.

title: Haute Glitter
description: A roundup of some of the most dazzling haute joaillerie collections shown during Couture Week in Paris.

title: Tianjin Mayor Caught Up in Xis Antigraft Campaign
description: BEIJING  President Xi Jinpings grinding campaign against graft and disloyalty in the Chinese government claimed another powerful victim over the weekend, when the Communist Partys disciplinary agency announced that the mayor of Tianjin, a northern port city, was under investigation.

title: N.F.L.: Heres What We Learned in Week 1
description: The Oakland Raiders defense may need some tightening up, but their offense can keep up with Drew Brees in the Superdome and their coachs Twitter game is decidedly elite.

title: Raised Hackles and Shears Over a Lottery Card Mix-Up
description: The old man shuffled along West 10th Street on Thursday toward the police station in Manhattan. He has lived next door for decades. He had a question.

title: Silence May Be Good News for Trump
description: There is talk among Republicans, and some trepidation among Democrats, that Donald J. Trump could benefit from a silent vote. Although these voters arent captured by polls, the privacy of a voting booth or a mail-in ballot will allow them to vent their anger and resentments.

title: Songs and Tears for Hidden Figures
description: TORONTO  With a free concert by Pharrell Williams and tearful appearances from the starry cast, the makers of Hidden Figures, the coming film about black female mathematicians working at NASA during Jim Crow, charmed public and private audiences at the Toronto International Film Festival here while laying the groundwork for an Oscar campaign.

title: Lacoste, Under the Capri Sun
description: While the United States Open was being played in Queens, Lacoste was staging a fashion show in Manhattan. It sounds like kismet, but the two were not to meet. Serendipity was sidestepped.

title: Fashion Week Photo Diary: Lacoste, Eckhaus Latta and Ryan Roche
description: Scenes from the spring/summer 2017 collections which were presented in New York on Saturday.

title: 1966: East Germans Bulldoze Way to Freedom
description: BERLIN  Two East German couples and a child crashed through Communist barbed wire in a steel-plated bulldozer today [Sept. 11] and escaped into West Berlin. East German border guards riddled the bulldozer with sub-machine-gun bullets but it got through a trench and three barbed-wire barriers into West Berlins Spandau district. Steel plates placed around the bulldozers cabin saved the five refugees  two pregnant women, their husbands and a four year-old boy. Two bullets grazed the heads of one man and woman. They were treated for flesh wounds at a West Berlin hospital and then released.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Tommy Hilfiger Brings the Circus to Town
description: This season, unsatisfied to merely hold a runway show with global reach, debut a capsule collection with the social media phenom Gigi Hadid, and adopt a see-now/buy-now business plan that made all items shown on the catwalk immediately available for purchase online, the designer Tommy Hilfiger also decided to host a party.

title: The Daily Jewel: Dion Lee
description: At Dion Lee, thin silver cuffs molded to the forearm  like subtle, wearable sculpture.

title: The Daily Bag: Simon Miller
description: Simon Miller scaled down the traditional tote shape, adding an arts-and-crafts touch: a leather cord wrapped around each handle.

title: Hillary Clintons Doctor Says Pneumonia Led to Abrupt Exit From 9/11 Event
description: Hillary Clinton is being treated for pneumonia and dehydration, her doctor said on Sunday, hours after she abruptly left a ceremony in New York honoring the 15th anniversary of the Sept. 11 attacks and had to be helped into a van by Secret Service agents.

title: The Daily Shoe: Alexander Wang
description: Glam meets surf in this hybrid shoe, which connects a thong sandal to a thick ankle strap, bedazzled with large crystals, by means of a clever leash hidden in back.

title: Victoria Beckham: Spring 2017
description: Ms. Beckham, who recently introduced her first makeup collection, unveils her spring 2017 womens looks.

title: A Vanderbilt Trades In Her Pop Star Strut for a Runway Glide
description: The question for a novice Fashion Week model was straightforward: Is the way you walk down the runway different from the way you walk down the street or, say, through Grand Central Terminal?

title: Fashion Week Photo Diary: Alexander Wang
description: Scenes from the spring/summer 2017 collection which was presented in New York on Saturday.

title: Beauty Q. & A.: Taylor Hill on Her Alexander Wang Debut
description: Alexander Wang always casts a band of cool, of-the-moment models to appear in his runway shows, and his spring/summer 2017 lineup was no different  the mix of faces was both fresh and familiar, and included the doe-eyed, Colorado-bred Taylor Hill. While the 20-year-old has already landed campaigns for Miu Miu, earned her Victorias Secret wings and recently become the face for Lancme, this marked her first time walking for Wang. As it turns out, last nights runway was full of surprises; the designer announced his collaboration with Adidas at the finale. Backstage, T caught up with Hill to talk about athletic workouts, the surfer-punk-inspired hair at the show and her splash-on-skincare routine.

title: Prince Buster, Trailblazer of Ska, Dies at 78
description: Prince Buster, a performer and producer who transformed Jamaican music in the 1960s as a trailblazer of the ska beat, died on Thursday in Miami. He was 78.

title: Jonathan Saunders Builds on Diane von Furstenbergs Archives
description: A look at his first collection as the labels creative director.

title: 1916: Lloyd George Visits Verdun
description: The eloquence of Mr. Lloyd George was framed in a dramatic setting when, while paying a visit to the French front, accompanied by M. Albert Thomas, French Under-Secretary for Artillery, he partook of a frugal meal last Friday with the officers in the underground defences of Verdun. In the casemates of the citadel of Verdun, under those vaulted roofs, fashioned in solid rock, at depths which render them impregnable, the officers of the defence were on September 8 filled with an intense emotion.

title: The New DVF and the Incredible Lightness of Legacy
description: There is a ritual that pretty much all designers who take on a legacy brand have to go through when they start their new jobs: a visit to the archives. There, surrounded by the past, they can be steeped in the history of the house, the better to channel its essence as they enter the atelier.

title: Spate of Deadly Attacks in Syria Ahead of Cease-Fire
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Bags of body parts. Three young siblings killed along with their mother. A pregnant woman lying dead under a fallen roof.

title: Sully Flies High and Lands Smoothly at the Box Office
description: Sully, the kind of adult-oriented, midbudget drama that isnt supposed to succeed in theaters anymore, at least if you listen to franchise-obsessed studio executives, soared at the box office over the weekend.

title: Venice Film Festival Announces Winners
description: The Venice Film Festival announced its winners on Sunday, with Lav Diazs The Woman Who Left winning the top prize for best film and Emma Stone winning for best actress for La La Land.

title: Tome: Spring 2017
description: Ryan Lobo and Ramon Martin show their latest collection.

title: Photos: Tommy Hilfiger, Alexander Wang, Victoria Beckham and More
description: Backstage and on runway at some of New York Fashion Weeks most Instagrammed shows, including Tommy Hilfiger, Alexander Wang and Monse.

title: Hashtag Fashion on the Rise
description: We live in a time of bifurcation and oppositions: Trump vs. Clinton, the one percent vs. the 99 percent, globalism vs. isolationism. So it shouldnt be a surprise to any of us, really, that fashion is right on trend. Theres a rift opening in New York Fashion Week, with big blowout extravaganzas facing off against quieter, more traditional collections; hashtag hoo-has against analogue outreach. Its an either-or moment.

title: Afghan Police Chief Is Killed as He Tries to Turn Tide Against Taliban
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  A hard-charging Afghan police chief with deep experience in Afghanistans long conflict with the Taliban was killed in a blast on Sunday in the countrys eastern Nangarhar Province, which has been under threat from the Taliban and affiliates of the Islamic State.

title: Alexander Wang, Naomi Campbell and Karlie Kloss Party on Saturday Night of Fashion Week
description: Doutzen Kroes hosts #KnotOnMyPlanet benefit for the Elephant Crisis Fund; Madonna and Nicki Minaj at Alexander Wang; Blood Orange performs for Re/Done jeans.

title: Christian Siriano, a Designer for all Body Types
description: On Saturday afternoon, seated in the front row of Christian Sirianos sartorial sojourn to Capri were Kelly Osbourne, Coco Rocha, Christina Hendricks, Pamela Anderson, Neve Campbell and Jaimie Alexander.

title: Ireland Doesnt Want Apples Back Taxes, but the Irish Arent So Sure
description: CORK, Ireland  When European officials ordered Ireland to collect a record $14.5 billion in back taxes from Apple, Kieran OConnell drew up a wish list for spending the money.

title: After Centuries of Loss, Seeds of Hope for Argentinas Indigenous People
description: VICTORICA, Argentina  Each year on the night of June 23, they gather at the sacred outpost on the brown flatlands to celebrate New Years on a pre-Columbian calendar. Wearing ponchos and a type of jewelry called tupu, they make offerings of food, feast on barbecued ribs and tell stories. In the morning, they march around a ceremonial wooden stake and a fire fueled through the night to honor the land.

title: Where to Stay for $39 a Night in New York City? In a Yellow Cab
description: It may have a great view of Manhattan, but this vacation rental sits in parking spaces in Long Island City, Queens, and has no bathroom. And it has a bit of that old car smell.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of Sept. 12
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: As More Devices Board Planes, Travelers Are Playing With Fire
description: The Federal Aviation Administration, citing fire hazards, has warned against using Samsung Galaxy Note 7 smartphones on aircraft. Three Australian airlines and the German carrier Lufthansa have outright banned their use onboard.

title: Why Business Class Poses a Unique Fire Hazard
description: In mid-May and again in late June, business-class passengers on Qantas flights from Australia to the United States dropped their smartphones into the mechanism below their seats.

title: Madonna, Zo Kravitz and More Come Out for Alexander Wang
description: Pamela Anderson may not be the first pulp icon to feature prominently in a designers ad campaign. (For that, thank Marc Jacobs, who once cast Victoria Beckham, better known in those days as Posh Spice, in a series of irreverent ads.) But Ms. Anderson was certainly among the first, alongside Kim Kardashian, to make a selling point of her famously pneumatic curves for a fancy, high-priced brand.

title: How Countries Like the Philippines Fall Into Vigilante Violence

In the conflict between Good and Evil during the Second World War, the infamous Nazi doctors played a crucial role. They preceded the torturers and assassins in the science of organized cruelty that we call the Holocaust.

title: Never Forget: Sept. 12

But the next day, Sept. 12, 2001, was also historic. That was the day Americas staunchest allies stood with us in solidarity, ready to respond in Americas time of need. It was the day when our then 18 NATO allies invoked, for the first and only time in history, Article 5 of the Washington Treaty, the clause that declares that an attack on one nation is an attack on all.
