title: At Altuzarra, a Party-Ready Touch of Glitter
description: Backstage at the Altuzarra spring/summer 2017 show this afternoon, the makeup artist Tom Pecheux was his usual chic, irreverent self. Smiling, he described the beautifully dewy look he created as sweaty, sexy, naughty, with a bit of a wink to reporters. The effect, he explained, picked up on the energetic, playful vibes of Joseph Altuzarras collection and channels the women who emerge from a pool or shower and throw on their clothes and they just go. For the high-shine look, he swept Butter Elixir botanical oil over the skin, patted on creamy foundation, and dusted MAC Mineralize SkinFinish in Perfectly Lit across the upper cheeks and nose in a wavelike formation for a natural glow. On the eyes, Pecheux applied black eyeliner smudged in with MAC Neon Studio Eye Gloss, a fleshy tone that warms up the black eyeliner so its not so aggressive and doesnt look too pristine (perfection is boring, he said, with Parisian insouciance). But the glamorous twist? Pecheux lightly dappled MAC Glitter in Reflects Bronze over the models faces  the fine particles floating through the air before they gently landed on the skin to produce a subtle shimmer.

title: In Connecticut, a Wealth Gap Divides Neighboring Schools

They prepare their pupils for the same statewide tests. Their teachers, like virtually all the teachers in the state, earn the same high marks on evaluations.

In a column on Beatlemania, he made John, Paul, George and Ringo look like the Four Horsemen of the Cultural Apocalypse. In his florid opinion, They are so unbelievably horrible, so appallingly unmusical, so dogmatically insensitive to the magic of the art, that they qualify as crowned heads of anti-music.

title: Colin Kaepernick and the Question of Who Gets to Be Called a Patriot
description: Citizenship is citizenship, until appearances get in the way. The world now knows, for instance, that Colin Kaepernick, a quarterback for the San Francisco 49ers, is protesting racial injustice  all because of a routine photo, taken during the singing of the national anthem before a preseason game. The photographer, Jennifer Lee Chan, tweeted the image last month, writing, This team formation for the national anthem is not Jeff Fisher-approved. Fisher is the head coach of the Los Angeles Rams, who, in an episode of the reality football show Hard Knocks, told his team that standing for the anthem was sacrosanct: Its an opportunity to realize how lucky you are. Yet here was Kaepernick, sitting down.

title: Ikea Forever
description: Not long ago, during an interview with the BBC, Kanye West announced, in his trademark third-person idiom, that he hoped to design for Ikea: Yo, Ikea, allow Kanye to create, allow him to make this thing because you know what? I want a bed that he makes, I want a chair that he makes. This seemed strange at first; what did West care about budget-friendly particleboard furniture? But if your goal is a kind of worldwide saturation, then collaborating with Ikea, with its 387 stores in 48 countries, is an ingenious tack. Ikea is one of the worlds largest consumers of lumber. It sells a set of its Billy bookcases every 10 seconds, and its said that one in 10 Europeans is conceived in an Ikea bed. Last year, approximately 884 million people  more than twice the population of the U.S.  visited Ikea stores. Theres even a web series called Hikea, in which people take psychedelics and attempt to assemble, from a wordless instruction manual, the pile of planks and screws in front of them. Ikea, not unlike West himself, is part of the zeitgeist.

title: 1966: Church May Elect Cardinals
description: TURIN, Italy  The Roman Catholic College of Cardinals may be turned into an election body, with the top bishop of each nation serving a limited term according to an authoritative report here today. The Turin archdiocesan weekly Ti Nostro Tempo (Our Times) hinted that a plan was under study at the Vatican. Such a change would throw out the centuries-old system in which popes alone choose cardinals and appoint them for life. Under the new system, the heads of the Churchs 53 national and regional bishops conferences would become cardinals.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Sept. 13, 1966

title: Can Beijing Stop Hong Kongs Separatists?
description: HONG KONG  Two years after Chinas leadership slammed the door on political reform for Hong Kong, six young candidates running on separatist platforms won seats in the Sept. 4 election for the territorys legislature. The rapid rise of a youthful political movement intent on gaining more independence for Hong Kong is a direct result of Beijings tightening grip on this former British colony.

title: California Today: School Bond Measure? Why You Should Care
description: Good morning.

title: South Koreas President Warns of More Provocations From North
description: SEOUL, South Korea  President Park Geun-hye of South Korea warned on Monday that there would be more provocations from North Korea after the Norths fifth nuclear test last week, adding that they could raise the danger of war on the Korean Peninsula.

title: How Yelp Reviews Can Help Improve Patient Care
description: Hospitals and many insurance carriers care about patient satisfaction. It especially matters to hospitals because insurance payments can be influenced by how patients rate the care they receive, as well as by the health of the patient, which hospitals usually report.

title: Oliver Mears Is Named to a Top Post at the Royal Opera House
description: LONDON  Oliver Mears, the artistic director of Northern Ireland Opera, will take over as the head of opera at the Royal Opera House in March 2017, the London theater announced on Monday.

title: E-Trade Names New C.E.O. in Management Shake-Up
description: E-Trade Financial, the online retail broker, has shuffled its top management and created a new role for a former executive who is returning to the firm and being tasked with bolstering growth in its main business.

title: How Mexico and the U.S. Can Fix Migration
description: WASHINGTON  The United States and Mexico have a rich, shared history. For more than a century, people have moved back and forth at the border to work. Their toil and industry could have taken place within a well-regulated and mutually beneficial labor market. But in recent years much of their labor has occurred in a vast black market  harming workers, families, security and public finances in both countries.

title: Guidepost Solutions, a Corporate Monitor, Hires State Regulator
description: They dont have badges or grand jury power, and yet corporate monitors are often entrusted to keep an eye on Wall Street.

title: Agrium and Potash Corp. to Merge, Creating Fertilizer Giant
description: As chemical and agricultural products producers face pressure to grow, two of the worlds largest crop fertilizer makers have agreed to combine in the latest farming industry deal.

title: Starboard Value, Taking Stake in Perrigo, Looks to Make Another Big Investment Pay
description: The hedge fund that helped prod Yahoo into selling its core business has found a new target for its brand of shareholder activism: the drug maker Perrigo.

title: Donald Trump Seizes Hillary Clintons Absence to Press His Case
description: Donald J. Trump hurled himself into a new effort to reshape the presidential race on Monday, scrambling to allay voters concerns about his temperament and put Hillary Clinton on the defensive over her critical comments about many of Mr. Trumps supporters.

title: Five Sexy, Shaggy Chairs
description: The fur rug gets elevated, literally.

title: HSBC Adds Former C.E.O. of Singapores DBS Bank to Board
description: LONDON  HSBC said on Monday that it was adding the former chief executive of the Singapore bank DBS to its board, while the vice chairman of its global banking and markets unit was leaving the company.

title: Super Cabins
description: A visit to Douglas Burnhams Northern California Modernist masterpiece, where power is in the impermanence.

title: A Constellation of One-Room Cabins, Embedded in the Forest
description: THE BACK ROADS THAT SNAKE through Mendocino County, a few hours from San Francisco, seem open to the sky and closed to outsiders. Here, where high-tech pot farms thrive amid the weekend homes and backyard wineries of Silicon Valley entrepreneurs, people like their privacy; no small talk or pancake breakfasts at the Elks lodge. Once in a while theres a path, wide as a pickup, spanned with a padlocked metal gate and a discount-store-bought No Trespassing sign.

title: Jimmy Garoppolo Rises From the Ashes of Deflategate
description: Passionate partisans on both sides of the Deflategate debate  and there are still many out there  will tell you that it was a battle between right and wrong, truth and lies, even good and evil.

title: Mexico Citys Fading Art: Organ Grinders
description: Organ grinders in Mexico City say they are losing popularity. They face more competition and a younger population that does not appreciate their music.

title: Mexico Citys Organ Grinders, Once Beloved, Feel Shunned
description: MEXICO CITY  Business was not going well for Moiss Rosas. A saxophonist was down the street, making decent money. A young woman was loudly hawking eyeglass repair services. And Super Mario, stationed at the entrance to the pedestrian path, was drawing a crowd.

title: Whats Daring Now? Hood by Air and Altuzarra Make a Statement
description: When it comes to fashion, whats shocking now? Or even (lets lower the bar a bit) discomfiting, challenging, daring? After a summer when the burkini became an international cause clbre, its not an irrelevant question. And in New York, an answer of sorts is starting to appear on the catwalks.

title: Arson Suspected at Mosque That Orlando Nightclub Gunman Attended
description: The members of the Islamic Center of Fort Pierce had broken their fasts and left the mosque near Floridas eastern shoreline. In the waning minutes of Sunday, less than an hour later, a surveillance camera recorded a man as he approached the mosque. Then came a flash as flames damaged the house of worship where the man who attacked an Orlando, Fla., nightclub often prayed.

title: Home and Work: Lia Chavez
description: The artist converted a 4,500-square-foot house on Long Island into a clean space to quiet her mind  and get to work.

title: One Artists Long Island Home: A Meditation in White
description: The moment I experienced the light here, I just knew that this was going to be a place  a really important place, said the artist Lia Chavez, as we stepped out onto the back deck of the Long Island home she shares with her husband  and has transformed into a minimalists nirvana.

title: Netanyahu Criticized for Ethnic Cleansing Remarks
description: In a video titled No Jews, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu accuses the Palestinian leadership of demanding a Jew-free Palestinian state by opposing Israeli settlements in the West Bank. He adds, Theres a phrase for that: Its called ethnic cleansing.

title: This Decanter Aerates Wine in a Flash
description: A well-designed decanter is the star of a new high-end line of brass-trimmed barware from the maker of the Rabbit wine opener called the RBT Collection. The secret is the stopper, which has a removable stainless-steel filtering screen and a series of tiny holes around the edge that send the wine down the sides of the wide glass vessel for better aeration. Its wrapped in rubber for a tight fit. The decanter is easy to handle and can hold a magnums worth of wine. It comes with a protective acacia wood coaster: $99.95 at Bloomingdales, bloomingdales.com.

title: An Olive Oil Revolution in Tunisia
description: Tunisia was the featured country at this summers Fancy Food Show in New York, and almost half of that countrys exhibits were promoting extra-virgin olive oil. The industry, which has existed since Roman times, has shifted to a higher-end product for export to Europe and America. Although Tunisias extra-virgin olive oil is still sent in bulk to Europe for anonymous blending, production rules and labeling certifications for extra virgin and organic have been tightened. Now 100 percent of whats in a bottle labeled Tunisian is indeed from Tunisia. Some oils tend to be lighter, sweeter and less peppery than their European counterparts. For example, Terra Delyssa Extra Virgin Olive Oil is typically mild and fruity with a hint of bitterness in the aftertaste (try it in a salad dressing), and Olivi Chemlali de Djerba Extra Virgin Olive Oil is lighter and even more delicate. Les Moulins de Mahjoub, an organic extra-virgin oil, is deeper in color, more viscous and herbal, with a nice green olive bite. It would add a sleek finish to grilled fish and vegetables: Terra Delyssa, $8.99 for 34 ounces, worldmarket.com; Olivi, $14.90 for 8.45 ounces, from amazon.com; Les Moulins de Mahjoub, $19.99 for 12.5 ounces, from amazon.com.

title: How the Sugar Industry Shifted Blame to Fat
description: The sugar industry paid scientists in the 1960s to play down the link between sugar and heart disease and promote saturated fat as the culprit instead, newly released historical documents show.

title: Apple Offers Free App to Teach Children Coding (iPads Sold Separately)
Opening Ceremony Tries Political Theater
description: Fred Armisen, Carrie Brownstein and a star-studded supporting cast send messages on numerous issues.

title: Game of Thrones, of Course, Rules as First Emmys Are Handed Out
description: Game of Thrones continued its TV award dominance over the weekend, leading the way with nine Creative Arts Emmys. The awards, which cover technical categories and others left out of the Primetime Emmy Awards, like guest acting and nonfiction honors, were handed out Saturday and Sunday in a two-night ceremony in Los Angeles.

title: Opening Ceremony Sends a Message (Plenty, in Fact)
description: As a concept, the opening ceremony is synonymous with pageantry. As a company, Opening Ceremony  the fashion retailer and label  is synonymous with pageantry. Was it only a matter of time before Humberto Leon and Carol Lim, Opening Ceremonys founders and stewards, made the connection literally?

title: The Daily Bag: Victoria Beckham
description: Victoria Beckhams floral shopper tote and matching printed dress are the perfect spring camouflage.  MALINA JOSEPH GILCHRIST

title: The Daily Jewel: Altuzarra
description: Twisted door-knocker earrings make an especially strong statement in cherry red lacquer.  MALINA JOSEPH GILCHRIST

title: Put Your Signature on the Digital Dotted Line
description: Q. Is it possible to sign a PDF using an iPad?

title: The Daily Shoe: Sies Marjan
description: Retro patent platform mules bring back the best of the 70s  by way of the 90s.  MALINA JOSEPH GILCHRIST

title: Italian Staples Straight From the Source
description: LaRina Pastificio & Vino, an inviting new Italian neighborhood restaurant in Fort Greene, Brooklyn, offers an extra perk: a retail counter well stocked with food made both in-house and imported from Italy. Silvia Barban is the chef and an owner. Her fresh pasta includes buckwheat shells, black bucatini and ruffled lemon-scented gigli that begs for a sauce of crab meat and cherry tomatoes. Calabrian chiles, fat jars of anchovies, taralli biscuits, fresh sausages, Corbara tomatoes from the Naples area, and tartly sweet pomegranate balsamic vinegar from Modena are some of the other items. The counter opens with the restaurant at 5 p.m. Monday to Friday, 11 a.m. Saturday and Sunday: LaRina Pastificio & Vino, 387 Myrtle Avenue (Vanderbilt Avenue), Fort Greene, Brooklyn, 718-852-0001, larinabk.com.

title: Airbnb, a Silicon Valley Titan, Breaks Ranks in Admitting Its Power
description: In recent years, the idea of privilege  for whites, for men, for straights, and for others  has moved to the fore of American discourse.

title: Brand to Know: A Curated Line of Very Special Things
description: In culling pieces for their new label, Permanent Collection, Fanny Singer and Mariah Nielson relied on principles of museum acquisition: They sought what is most elemental and classic, says Singer, and took care to avoid even short-term obsolescence. Inspired by their own possessions, the things wed had the longest, that felt most relevant no matter what, their first collection includes porcelain teacups cast from originals by Nielsons father, the sculptor J.B. Blunk (her mother is the organic textiles pioneer Christine Nielson), and a pair of Attal leather slides like the ones a family friend once gave Singer, whose mother is Alice Waters. Nielson and Singer, both Northern California natives, met in a London bakery while wearing matching navy blue jackets, both vintage of indeterminate origin, and hit on the idea for the project.

title: Dessert for Dinner and Other Recipes
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Homes That Sold for $700,000 to $899,000
description: 107 West 82nd Street, Upper West Side

title: Kate DiCamillo Among Candidates for Young Peoples Literature Award
description: The National Book Foundation announced the Longlist for the 2016 National Book Award for Young Peoples Literature on Monday. The 10 nominated books represent a stylistic and thematically diverse range, with fiction, a graphic memoir and nonfiction that address subjects like domestic violence, sexual identity, race, social activism and how children cope during war. The remaining longlists, for the poetry, nonfiction and fiction categories, will be announced over the next three days. Finalists will be revealed on Oct. 13, and the winners will be announced at a gala in New York City on Nov. 16.

title: A Taste of How Beer Is Made
description: Beer begins with plants, including grains and hops. To reinforce that connection, the New York Botanical Garden will have displays and demonstrations this weekend to explain the botany behind the brewing process. There will be tastings of beers and ciders, and, to liven things up, blues and bluegrass music: Blues, Brews and Botany, Saturday and Sunday, noon to 5 p.m., $30 for tasting for adults 21 and older ($5 for members), New York Botanical Garden, Bronx, nybg.org.

title: Eddie Redmaynes Guide to Fantastic Beasts
description: Anticipation for Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them has been so high that fans began dressing up as its main character, Newt Scamander, based solely on the trailer. That surprised its star, Eddie Redmayne, when he attended Comic-Con International in July and looked out into the audience only to see several Newts staring back at him.

title: Thoma Bravo Raises $7.6 Billion Fund to Pursue More Tech Deals
description: SAN FRANCISCO  At a busy time for technology takeovers, one of the main private equity specialists in the field is raising its biggest-ever fund to pursue more deals.

title: A Book to Distill Wine to Its Essence
description: Jancis Robinson, a British wine writer renowned for her many big, glossy tomes, has come up with a compact, breezy, one-shot wine seminar for novices. In 112 no-nonsense pages, she covers all the basics for understanding, selecting, appreciating, serving and storing wine. She dismisses pretension in favor of the practical. If carignan or claret are still vinous mysteries to you, look here for answers: The 24-Hour Wine Expert by Jancis Robinson (Abrams Image, $12.95).

title: Polishing Financial Results Looks Good, but Can Lead to Fraud
description: Like a child on a playground who wants everyone to watch a new maneuver, companies clamor for public attention by presenting their numbers in a way that makes them look as successful as possible. But when those measures involve manipulating the figures, then their efforts can end up as a fraud on investors.

title: Syria Is Calmer but Cautious as Cease-Fire Begins
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  A cease-fire in the Syrian civil war, negotiated by Russia and the United States, officially took effect at sundown on Monday after a weekend of intensified fighting and a vow by Syrias president to retake the entire country.

title: 1916: Fingerprints Prove Prisoners Guilt
description: LONDON  Science has proved beyond any reasonable doubt that you are guilty, said Judge Atherley Jones at the Old Bailey yesterday [Sept. 11], when sentencing Andrew Scarloli, aged 24, a newsvendor, to twelve months hard labor for breaking into Sadlers Wells Theatre and stealing Treasury notes and about 43.

title: A Chocolate Slipper Thats the Perfect Fit
description: If you have ever longed for those Christian Louboutin pumps with the signature red soles, they can now be had for a modest price  in chocolate. Annie Rupani, a chocolatier in Houston who specializes in unusual formats and seasonings like garam masala, fennel and cardamom, has introduced a version of her chocolate high heel with a red sole. Select dark, milk or white chocolate: Louboutin-Inspired Chocolate High Heel, $55; other styles $35 and $45, from cacaoandcardamom.com.

title: Edward Humes on How Transportation Overkill Is Killing Us
description: Edward Humes, 59, is a Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist whose latest book, Door to Door: The Magnificent, Maddening, Mysterious World of Transportation, is a wide-ranging look at the planes, trains and cars that Americans have chosen to rely on. We spoke recently in Manhattan and later by phone. Here is an edited and condensed version of those conversations.

title: Walk Signals
description: Our puzzle this week was suggested by Seth Cohen, who teaches astronomy and physics at St. Pauls School in New Hampshire. We last saw Seth a year ago, when he illuminated us with Bulbs and More Bulbs. Lets now join him for a race through town. Heres

title: De Blasios Nonprofit Must Comply With Ethics Panels Subpoena, Judge Says
description: A judge in Albany has ordered Mayor Bill de Blasios political nonprofit to comply with a subpoena from a state ethics panel, putting a damper on the mayors widening effort to prevent the disclosure of certain communications that he deems privileged.

title: Donald Trump Releases Deplorables, an Anti-Hillary Clinton Ad
description: Donald J. Trump released a new ad Monday seizing on comments made by Hillary Clinton late last week in which she called some of his supporters a basket of deplorables during a fund-raiser.

title: The New Ghost Snake in Madagascar
description: A new species of snake  pale gray, with white and black spots  was discovered on a rocky plateau in northern Madagascar. Researchers are calling it Madagoscarophis lolo, after the Malagasy word for ghost.

title: Travis Scott Debuts at No. 1 and Apple Notches Another Win
description: Ever since the strange release of Frank Oceans Blonde three weeks ago, the music business has been buzzing with the expectation that exclusive digital albums  in which the music is at first available only through one service  would disappear, a casualty of industry politics. But as this weeks Billboard chart shows, windowed releases are not gone quite yet.

title: Daily Report: A Light Local Hand on Tech
description: If you want to see the future, head to Pittsburgh is probably something unsaid for most of a century. That may be about to change, because of the way its local government is welcoming its robot overlords.

title: Carolina Herrera: Spring 2017
description: Looks from designers spring 2017 womens collection.

title: Trial to Begin in Standoff at Oregon Wildlife Refuge
description: PORTLAND, Ore.  The trial of Ammon Bundy, his brother Ryan and five of their followers, antigovernment protesters charged in the armed takeover of a national wildlife refuge this year, will begin here on Tuesday in a federal court.

title: What You Should Watch to Catch Up on This Summers Shows
description: Welcome to Watching, The New York Timess what-to-watch guide. We comb through releases big and small to email readers twice a week with our timely recommendations. You can browse previous guides here, and to receive recommendations straight to your inbox, sign up here. Stay tuned for our coming website.

title: Rosie Assoulin: Spring 2017
description: The 2015 Swarovski Award for Womens wear winner shows her latest collection.

title: With Dodgers, Dave Roberts Has Another Chance to Haunt the Yankees
description: LOS ANGELES  One day when they were working alone on a back field during spring training in Vero Beach, Fla., Maury Wills explained to his pupil, Dave Roberts, why they were spending so much time on the intricacies of base stealing.

title: Fed Official Says She Favors Prudence in Raising Interest Rates
description: WASHINGTON  Lael Brainard, a Federal Reserve governor and a leading proponent of the Feds efforts to stimulate the economy, said in a speech on Monday that she still favored prudence in raising interest rates despite recent signs of economic progress.

title: Oceans Are Absorbing Almost All of the Globes Excess Heat
description: This year is on track to be the third consecutive hottest year on record. Where does that heat go? The oceans, mostly.

title: Trial Over Potsdam Boys Killing Begins With Focus on Credibility
description: CANTON, N.Y.  An unexpected midnight visit. A series of small lies. And a left turn, instead of a right, following the trail of a 12-year-old boy.

title: Jeremy Scott: Spring 2017
description: The designer, who also holds the creative reigns at Moschino, shows his spring 2017 collection.

title: TPG Growth Plans to Start a Social Impact Fund
description: TPG Growth has established itself as a boldface name in investing, with stakes in companies that include Silicon Valley darlings like Uber and Airbnb and the guitar maker Fender.

title: Failure to Improve Is Still Being Used, Wrongly, to Deny Medicare Coverage
description: Edwina Kirby was having a hard time. She had tripped over a rug in her home in Livonia, Mich., and the fall broke a femur. After she had surgery and rehabilitation, an infection sent her back into the hospital. Her kidneys failed, requiring dialysis; she was also contending with diabetes and heart disease.

title: Did Degas Make This Plaster? An Expert Now Says Yes
description: In a twist to a longstanding debate that for years has riveted a corner of the art world, one of the leading experts on Degas has decided that a long-disputed plaster of that artists Little Dancer, which shows the ballerina in a slightly different pose, is indeed an earlier model of his famous 1881 sculpture Petite Danseuse de Quatorze Ans.

title: Violence Erupts in Southern India Over Order to Share Water
description: NEW DELHI  Violent protests broke out in the southern state of Karnataka on Monday after the Indian Supreme Court ordered the state to release water to the neighboring state of Tamil Nadu, the latest chapter in a longstanding dispute.

title: Sies Marjan Spring 2017
description: Looks from Sander Laks latest colorful collection.

title: Sies Marjan Still Swears Off Black
description: Last season, the new label Sies Marjan arrived on the New York Fashion Week schedule in a blaze of color. Sander Lak, its designer, declared  heretically, given that he had just taken up residence in New York  that very few women actually look good in black. He advocated fearlessly for neon yellow and orange, lilac and magenta.

title: Mothers Killing of Children in Rural China Spurs Debate About Inequality
description: BEIJING  The young mother lived in obscurity in a wobbly house at the end of a dusty road. She did not speak much with strangers, spending her days tending to rows of wheat, peas and potatoes.

title: Potash and Agrium Deal Is a Friendly, Balanced Merger
description: It is a rare corporate love-in. The Potash Corporation of Saskatchewan and Agrium, a fertilizer company, have agreed to a merger of equals worth $36 billion in enterprise value. Mondays straightforward, no-premium deal is a contrast to other recent attempts at industry mash-ups, which gave off a whiff of exuberance before collapsing.

title: Most Parents Give the Wrong Dose of Liquid Medication
description: Most parents unwittingly give their kids the wrong dose of liquid medication  in some cases more than twice as much as instructed, a new study shows.

title: Fashion Week Photo Diary: Victoria Beckham, Hood by Air, Sies Marjan and Opening Ceremony
description: Scenes from the collections that were presented in New York on Sunday.

title: David Cameron Steps Down From His Seat in British Parliament
description: LONDON  The post is ancient, and the duties are light (nonexistent, actually). But in order to step down from his seat in the House of Commons, David Cameron, the former prime minister of Britain, had to take on another position on Monday: Crown Steward and Bailiff of the Manor of Northstead.

title: Watching, and Wincing, as Clinton Stumbles
description: For all of her famed competence, Hillary Clinton has also been, from the beginning, something of a stumbler. While she was still a prospective first lady, she famously insulted all those cookie-baking mothers of the world; there was a gap between her and everywoman, and she walked right into it with a misstep that colored her public persona going forward. She has stumbled in traps of her own making  those emails  and traps set by others.

title: August Ties July for Hottest Month on Record
description: It just keeps getting hotter.

title: In The Studio: Stuart Vevers of Coach
description: Stuart Vevers, creative director of Coach, talks about his new digs in Hudson Yards.

title: Gold Medalist Aly Raisman Goes to Fashion Week
description: A typically colorful crowd showed up Monday morning for Jeremy Scotts runway show. Sisters Paris and Nicky Hilton arrived to great fanfare. Tinashe posed for a gaggle of photographers.

title: Louis C.K., Bruce Springsteen and More at Stand Up for Heroes
description: Louis C.K., Bruce Springsteen and Jon Stewart will share the stage in November for the 10th edition of Stand Up for Heroes, an annual performance to benefit wounded veterans.

title: In the Studio With the Creative Director of Coach
description: Welcome to Episode 1 of our fifth season of In the Studio, which goes behind the closed doors and shaded curtains of designers private work worlds. Here, Stuart Vevers, the executive creative director of Coach, reveals how the High Line changed his first collection, the virtues of radical transparency and where Felix the Cat fits in. (This conversation has been edited and condensed.)

title: Arson at Orlando Gunmans Mosque
description: The fire late Sunday night at a Florida mosque where Omar Mateen, the Orlando nightclub gunman, had worshiped is being investigated as arson. This is at least the third suspected arson at a Florida mosque this summer.

title: Can Teenage Defiance Be Manipulated for Good?
description: Since there have been teenagers, there have been adults trying to control them. The Massachusetts Bay Colony passed the Stubborn Child Law in 1646, allowing parents to have their defiant teenage sons put to death. The Bible suggests stoning them to death. But what if adolescent defiance is not a demon to be exorcised, but a power to be harnessed?

description: Looks from Hood By Air, Altuzarra, Pyer Moss and Prabal Gurung.

title: Is Space Junk Creating Earths Own Ring?
description: Q. Will Earth end up with a Saturnlike ring someday because of all of our space junk? Or is there one already?

title: Review: A Sublime Survey of Baroque Music
description: The execution was as delightful as the notion was preposterous: a comprehensive survey of Baroque music by a hardy band of four (or slightly more) in four hourlong concerts. Such was the annual 4x4 Baroque Music Festival, presented last week by its founder and director, the keyboardist Avi Stein, at Trinity Church on Lower Broadway.

title: Benefits of Private Prisons
description: To the Editor:

title: Browns Robert Griffin III Is Out With Injury; Enter Josh McCown
description: After an abysmal 3-13 season in 2015, the Cleveland Browns cut ties with their problem child quarterback, Johnny Manziel. To replace him, they turned to the once exciting, if sometimes inconsistent, Robert Griffin III. Fans were looking forward to more wins, or at least some offensive excitement.

title: Saturday Night Live Adds 3 Cast Members
description: Saturday Night Live is adding three cast members as it enters its 42nd season, NBC announced on Monday. The season begins Oct. 1.

title: Ysaunny Brito Transforms at Jeremy Scott
description: The photographer Greg Kessler captures behind-the-scenes beauty transformations during spring/summer 2017 fashion week in New York.

title: Opening Ceremony Parties at Penn Station Food Court
description: Teyana Taylor, Will.i.am and Eddie Huang at Opening Ceremony rager; Russell Westbrook and Ben Taverniti at Barneys dinner.

title: Review: A Truck Full of Money and a Thirst to Put It to Good Use
description: Before the sensibility of Tracy Kidders new book clearly emerges, and before its subject, Paul English, becomes endearingly familiar, you may be tempted to put it down. The first few chapters of A Truck Full of Money: One Mans Quest to Recover From Great Success have the sound of a glossy business-magazine hagiography  so much so that readers may wonder why the book isnt blushing.

title: Its Not the Bullets Forcing Yemeni Troops Off the Battlefield. Its the Pay.
description: AL MUKALLA, Yemen  Maj. Mortada al-Youssefi has more to worry about as commander of a government military unit in Yemen than the enemy. He has also had to figure out how to stop hundreds of his own men from walking off the battlefield over not being paid.

description: As the rest of America used Sunday night for mainlining Buffalo wings and watching football, fashion week parties raged throughout the city.

description: To the Editor:

title: What Pneumonia Experts Say About Clintons Case
description: If Hillary Clinton brushed aside medical advice to rest after getting a diagnosis of mild pneumonia, she was risking developing a more serious case, medical experts said Monday.

title: In Paralympic Goalball, Resourceful Listeners Face a Hard Thrower
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  In mens goalball, a sport for the visually impaired that, kind of, sort of, resembles a mix of handball and bowling, countries tend to have distinct playing styles.

title: The View From Syria as a Cease-Fire Takes Effect
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  The timing of the cease-fire in Syria, which took effect on Monday at sundown and was largely holding on Tuesday, is fraught with symbolism.

title: Benjamin Netanyahu Draws Fire After Saying Palestinians Support Ethnic Cleansing
description: JERUSALEM  In the absence of any prospect of peace with the Palestinians, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel has started a video war.

title: Toddlers Are at Highest Risk for Chemical Burns to the Eyes
description: Accidents involving chemicals splashed in the eyes were long regarded as a workplace risk.

title: Obama to Veto Bill Allowing 9/11 Lawsuits Against Saudi Arabia
description: WASHINGTON  The White House said on Monday that President Obama would veto legislation approved by Congress that would allow the families of victims of the Sept. 11, 2001, attacks to sue Saudi Arabia for any role in the plot, escalating a bipartisan dispute with lawmakers over the measure.

title: Times Insider Photo Challenge: Caption This!
description: Times Insider shares insights into how we work at The New York Times. Occasionally we have some fun.

title: Willy Vanderperres New Show in Brooklyn
description: The veteran photographer opens up an exhibition that includes a wide range of his works over the course of his 20-year career.

title: A Cult Photographers Expansive New Show  With Plenty to Buy
description: Willy Vanderperre moved to Antwerp in the early 90s to study fashion design at the Royal Academy of Fine Arts before switching to photography. Since then, hes distinguished himself as one of the most influential artists of his kind  shooting editorials and campaigns for renowned publications and fashion houses. This week, he opens a show, prints, film, posters, and more" at Red Hook Labs in Brooklyn, consisting of nearly 60 pieces that span his more than 20-year career.

title: Admit Veterans to Elite Colleges
description: To the Editor:

title: What Do You Know About Your Credit Card?
description: Travel hackers obsessively analyze the nuances of premium card deals. Take this quiz to find out how well you know your credit cards.

title: Value-Seekers Warm to a $450 Annual Credit Card Fee
description: Seldom does a new credit card go viral.

title: The Story Behind Our Most Requested Recipe Ever
description: When Marian Burros, a longtime food reporter for The New York Times, first wrote about the plum torte in September 1983, no one expected it to become the most requested recipe, and among the most beloved, in the history of the newspaper.

title: 5 Ways to Adapt Our Famous Plum Torte Recipe
description: Five ways to make Marian Burross legendary New York Times plum torte recipe even better.

title: Saudi Bid on a Houston Oil Refinery Is a Big Strategic Bet
description: HOUSTON  The Saudi national oil company is making a bid to significantly expand its operations in the United States at a critical moment in the always uneasy relations between the United States and Saudi Arabia.

title: Review: Sept. 11s Monumental Despair, Evoked by Solo Piano
description: Extremely Loud and Incredibly Close is Jonathan Safran Foers Sept. 11 novel, one of the best-known responses to those traumatic events. Its title works equally well as a description of Michael Herschs The Vanishing Pavilions, a monumental solo-piano work that he started the day after the attacks and composed over the next five years.

title: Visions of Life on Mars in Earths Depths
description: WITWATERSRAND BASIN, South Africa  A mile down in an unused mine tunnel, scientists guided by helmet lamps trudged through darkness and the muck of a flooded, uneven floor.

title: Big Success Story: Sri Lanka Is Declared Free of Malaria
description: After a long struggle, Sri Lanka, the large island nation southeast of India, was declared free of malaria last week by the World Health Organization. It has been more than three years since the last case.

title: Off the Runway: Day 5
description: Scenes from New York Fashion Week on Monday.

title: Highlights From the Food Worlds Most Game-Changing Festival
description: At the fifth MAD Symposium  Denmarks annual culinary twist on the Butterfly Effect, where small acts lead to large outcomes  a young cook from India, Ashwami Manjrekar, landed a gig with Rosio Sanchez, the Mexican-American chef from Chicago who opened a now-famous taqueria in Torvehallerne. That two women from disparate cultures on opposite sides of the earth found common ground over tacos under a circus tent is just one example of how MAD Symposium is arguably the most impactful food movement around.

title: El Salvadors Abortion Lawyer
description: The congested road to El Salvadors Ilopango Womens Prison is lined with rundown snack shops and pink dogwood trees. Dennis Muoz describes the concrete complex, which operates at 900 percent capacity, as living hell.

title: At 3.1 Phillip Lim, Eyeliner Meets Architecture
description: The designer Phillip Lim is a passionate collector of art (furniture made by cabinetmakers is a particular interest). So it made sense that the makeup look at his spring/summer 2017 show took an artist-driven approach. Backstage, the makeup artist Francelle Daly slicked on graphic eyeliner, then removed the edges for a conceptual play on negative space. Its about modernizing the way we wear eyeliner, she explained of her technique  which stood out for not only its impactful quality, but also for its ease of application. Daly simply outlined the eyes, saturating the upper and lower lash lines in Nars Eyeliner Stylo in Carpates, then traced Nars Kohliner Minorque along the inner waterline. Then, for the fun part: Daly dipped her Q-tip in a water cleanser and chopped off the inner and outer corners of her lines, customizing the shape to each models eyes. Maybe its a little smaller at the bottom, maybe its a little bigger on top, just to make sure you dont overpower the eye, or look like a raccoon, she noted. Daly also recommends stepping back and looking in the mirror to ensure your liner is somewhat symmetrical on both eyes. But dont agonize over it: Its all about what works best for you when doing your makeup, and being your own artist.

description: BRISBANE, Australia  Officials in charge of an Australian writers festival were so upset with the address by their keynote speaker, the American novelist Lionel Shriver, that they publicly disavowed her remarks.

description: Colin Kaepernick, the San Francisco 49ers quarterback who touched off a national debate when he chose not to stand during the playing of the national anthem before games, has emboldened a handful of other players to follow suit.

title: The Word a Headline Didnt Need
description: You can buy Trump That Bitch buttons and T-shirts on Amazon to show your disdain for Hillary Clinton. You can hear the word shouted at rallies for Donald J. Trump and spread across Twitter. At one event last month, a school-aged boy standing with his mother yelled out, Take the bitch down.

description: Dani Qappani described the quiet in his suburban Damascus neighborhood, Moadhamiyeh, on Monday night as a temporary cease-fire began.

title: Scrutiny of Hillary Clintons Health Puts New Focus on Tim Kaine
description: DAYTON, Ohio  When Hillary Clinton was searching for a running mate, she made clear her top criterion: Her selection needed to be ready to become president if something were to happen, as she put it.

title: N.C.A.A. Moves Championship Events From North Carolina, Citing Anti-Gay-Rights Law
description: The N.C.A.A., responding to a contentious North Carolina law that curbed anti-discrimination protections for lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender people, will relocate all championship tournament games scheduled to take place in the state over the coming academic year, the organization announced Monday night.

title: Giants Reinstate Kicker Josh Brown After a One-Game Suspension
description: The Giants reinstated kicker Josh Brown on Monday after his one-game suspension for a domestic violence arrest in 2015. Giants Coach Ben McAdoo said Brown would be the teams kicker in its home opener against the New Orleans Saints on Sunday.

title: Albert Kumin, Pastry Chef for Carter White House and Top New York Restaurants, Dies at 94
description: Albert Kumin, one of the most celebrated pastry chefs in the United States, who created desserts for the Four Seasons and Windows on the World in Manhattan as well as for Jimmy Carters White House, died on Friday at his home in Stowe, Vt. He was 94.

title: Fords Driverless Car Plan: Embrace Tech and Go Slow
description: DEARBORN, Mich.  Raj Nair, the development chief leading Ford Motors effort to build self-driving cars, concedes that he does not know what caused the fatal May accident in which the driver of a Tesla Model S sedan, operating in Autopilot mode, crashed into a tractor-trailer crossing a roadway in Florida.

title: With U.S. Election in Sight, Ban Ki-moon Seeks Quick Action on Climate Accord
description: WASHINGTON  As the United Nations General Assembly converges in New York on Tuesday, Secretary General Ban Ki-moon is using the gathering of world leaders to rush the 2015 Paris climate change accord into legal force this year, hoping to bind all countries to its strictures for at least the next four years  regardless of the outcome of the presidential election in the United States.

title: Funding Planned Parenthood, or Not, May Be Key to Keeping the Government Open
description: WASHINGTON  Republican leaders looking to avoid a government shutdown one month before Election Day will have to jump a familiar hurdle: demands from some of their members to cut off funding for Planned Parenthood.

title: Jutta Limbach, First Woman to Lead Germanys Highest Court, Dies at 82
description: BERLIN  Jutta Limbach, a lawyer who became the first woman to head Germanys highest court and later led a commission to mediate disputes about the restitution of art seized by the Nazis, died on Saturday at her home here. She was 82.

title: Robert Timberg, Who Chronicled the Scars of Vietnam, Dies at 76
description: Robert Timberg, a Marine combat veteran who became an author and journalist after his agonizing recovery from disfiguring scars inflicted by a land mine in Vietnam, died on Sept. 6 in Annapolis, Md. He was 76.

title: Pervasive Sham Deals at Wells Fargo, and No One Noticed?
description: I dont want anyone ever offering a product to someone when they dont know what the benefit is, or the customer doesnt understand it, or doesnt want it, or doesnt need it.

title: Period for Ground Zero Workers to Seek Compensation Is Extended
description: New York State is extending the period for workers and volunteers to seek medical benefits and lost wages resulting from their involvement in the rescue and recovery operations in Lower Manhattan after the attack on Sept. 11, 2001.

title: Full Disclosure on Candidates Health
description: As President Obamas graying hair suggests, the American presidency is perhaps the most grueling and stressful political job there is. This year, both major party candidates for that job are past the nations customary retirement age. And while submitting health records is not a requirement for the job, Hillary Clinton and Donald Trump would be doing American voters a great service by furnishing a much clearer picture of their physical health than the abbreviated and sunny reports provided so far.

title: Bar Cars May Return to Metro-North Trains Serving Connecticut
description: The last of the bar cars on commuter trains in the New York metropolitan area made their final runs more than two years ago. But rolling cocktail service may be returning to the rails in Connecticut.

title: Pregnant Women Anxious as Floridas Zika Test Results Take Weeks
description: MIAMI  So many pregnant women have taken advantage of Floridas offer of free Zika testing that state laboratories have been unable to keep pace, doctors and patients say, leading to long delays for women anxious to know whether the virus has passed to their fetuses.

title: Did You Hear the Latest About Hillary?
description: Hillary Clinton has pneumonia. Did you know she has a body double? She was that blond woman waving at reporters in front of Chelsea Clintons apartment a few hours after Mrs. Clinton felt unwell and left the Sept. 11 commemoration at ground zero.

title: G.O.P. Voters Urged to Select Dead Assemblyman in New York Race
description: Even in death, State Assemblyman Bill Nojay, a Republican from the Rochester area who fatally shot himself in a city cemetery last week, seems likely to win the primary election for his seat on Tuesday.

title: Matt Kuchar, J. B. Holmes and Rickie Fowler Named to U.S. Ryder Cup Team
description: INDIANAPOLIS  Phil Mickelson had already played his way on to the United States Ryder Cup team before the BMW Championship when he said that the eight automatic qualifiers know who is going to be playing with who, when theyre going to be playing, what matches. Mickelsons remarks suggested that the team captain Davis Love IIIs four discretionary picks were a foregone conclusion, and the three selections that Love announced on Monday did nothing to disabuse anyone of that notion.

title: There You Have It
description: TUESDAY PUZZLE  When last we saw Stan Newman, the editor of the Newsday crossword puzzles, in the New York Times crossword, he was capitalizing on a national holiday to say thank you. Today hes back to offer us a puzzle that happens to double up on a high-scoring Scrabble letter.

title: Review: Aubergine, a Stew of Regret and Impending Loss
description: In the monologue that begins Aubergine, a drama by Julia Cho about family, food and mortality that opened on Monday at Playwrights Horizons, a woman named Diane (Jessica Love) speaks at length about her and her husbands obsessive love of food.

title: Review: Nice Music, but in Maestro He Doesnt Look a Thing Like Lenny
description: The riskiest moments in Maestro, Hershey Felders tribute to the conductor-composer Leonard Bernstein, come as spectators settle in at 59E59 Theaters, waiting for the performance to start. Onstage, projected in black-and-white archival television footage, is the handsome, charismatic Mr. Bernstein.

title: Wally Backman Will Not Return as Mets Class AAA Manager
description: WASHINGTON  Wally Backman, who played second base for the 1986 World Series champion Mets, will not return as the manager of the teams Class AAA affiliate in Las Vegas, Mets General Manager Sandy Alderson said Monday. Some reports said Backman had been fired, and others said that Backman had resigned.

title: The Public Face of Crazy Eddie Recalls the Real One
description: There was the time that inspiration for a radio commercial struck as Jerry Carroll was walking down Third Avenue. He explained it to the advertising executive he was with, who said, Sounds like a good idea. They stopped for a moment, just long enough for Mr. Carroll to write out the commercial, using the top of a trash can as a desk.

description: WASHINGTON  With each pitch, Rafael Montero looked more out of place. Montero, a once-promising prospect who has fallen on hard times, could not find the strike zone. And just as in his past starts, the walks were piling up. But this time, the Mets could not survive them.

title: The Avalanche of Distrust

They have set the modern standards for withholding information  his not releasing tax and health records, her not holding regular news conferences or quickly disclosing her pneumonia diagnosis. Both have a problem with spontaneous, reciprocal communication with a hint of vulnerability.

Mr. Monty, an immigration lawyer in Houston, has been deeply involved in Republican politics in Texas and nationally for much of the past 20 years. He was a fund-raiser for both of George W. Bushs campaigns, and estimates that he has personally contributed more than $250,000 to Republican candidates.

That may be a tempting move, given recent efforts by Ms. Aung San Suu Kyi to end ethnic conflict and the persecution of the Rohingya, a Muslim minority group, but it would be a mistake to lift all remaining sanctions now.

title: Competition and Camaraderie: A Look Inside the Michigan Football Team

description: LONDON  Nets, the Danish payment processor, said on Tuesday that it expected to be valued at up to 32 billion Danish kroner, or $4.8 billion, in its initial public offering this month.

title: Margot Lee Shetterly Wants To Tell More Black Stories
description: Your new book, Hidden Figures, is the story of the black female mathematicians at NASA who helped put Americans on the moon. Why havent we heard about this before? Where I grew up, in Hampton, Va., we knew the story, and we thought it was pretty normal. They were people who were doing this exceptional job when you look back on it, but at the time, they were just ordinary people who loved their work. It was kind of nice to grow up in a place where that achieved such a degree of normalcy that people werent talking about it all the time.

title: What Playing Madden Teaches Us About Football  and What It Doesnt
description: Nearly everything I know about football I know from Madden. My first encounter with the game came in 1992 in David Rabinowitzs basement. I was 12, living in a cable-free household, in a town where the Sunday CBS or NBC broadcasts were very limited. My main exposure to the N.F.L. was through my trading-card collection  I had fortuitously invested in football cards in 1989 and therefore had the rookie cards for Troy Aikman, Barry Sanders, Deion Sanders and the great Andre Rison. But because I did not see a lot of football, even those stars were mostly just names to me.

title: For Every 10 U.S. Adults, Six Vote and Four Dont. What Separates Them?
description: People are motivated to vote by a combination of individual priorities, group culture, candidate outreach, and how easy or hard it is to cast a ballot.

title: How Two Producers of Transparent Made Their Own Trans Lives More Visible
description: On a hot night in July at Skylight Books in Los Angeles, Zackary Drucker and Rhys Ernst perched on stools to discuss their new book of photographs, Relationship. It is by far the most personal of the many projects they have worked on together. The photographs chronicle their six-year romance, which ended soon after many of these images were shown at the Whitney Biennial in 2014.

title: Sitcom Men, Grappling With a New Reality on TV
description: This fall, broadcast television will turn its attention to the battle of the straight white man to assert his masculinity in an increasingly alien world. And you wont need to wait until the first presidential debate to see it.

title: An Unplanned Absence for Hillary Clinton at an Inopportune Time
description: For much of the summer, Hillary Clinton deliberately kept a low public profile, fund-raising in private and pursuing a hands-off campaign strategy: If Donald J. Trump wanted to seize center stage by picking unpopular fights  with a Gold Star father, a federal judge, the leaders of his own party  she would not stand in his way.

description: The end is nigh, but were not there yet. Some of New York Fashion Weeks biggest names show their collections on Tuesday. Heres what to look for today.

title: The Medieval Monasteries of Kosovo
description: The main street in Gracanica, a village on the outskirts of Pristina, the capital of Kosovo, is lined with bakeries and markets strung together in a jumble until the shop fronts give way to a high stone wall. Step to the other side, and the hum of Volkswagens and Skodas falls away almost entirely. At the center of a wide lawn sits Gracanica Monastery, a masterpiece of late-Byzantine ecclesiastical architecture, its rosy domes like steppingstones that draw the eye and the spirit toward the sky.

title: IPhone 7 Review: Though Not Perfect, New iPhones Keep Apples Promises
description: Apples iPhone, just short of 10 years old, has hit puberty.

description: As just one of two million pilgrims, Diaa Hadid, a correspondent for The New York Times, battled huge crowds to perform the sacred rites of the hajj, even as a V.I.P. treated to helicopter rides and other perks.

title: Delaware, New Hampshire and Rhode Island Hold Congressional Primaries
description: The congressional primary season essentially draws to a close on Tuesday with contests in Delaware, New Hampshire and Rhode Island, ending a long slog of state races that produced few upsets despite the volatile electorate.

title: 1966: Tortured Pilot Escapes
description: SAN DIEGO  A young Navy pilot today [Sept. 13] calmly described his incredible escape from Laotian Communists and the barbaric tortures he experienced after being shot down early this year during a bombing raid over North Vietnam. Lt. Dieter Danglerss adventures began when his propeller-driven Skyraider was downed Feb. 2 and ended with his dramatic July 20 rescue by helicopter after U.S reconnaissance planes spotted signal fires he had set in the jungle. He also told how a fellow escapee Air Force Lt. Duane Martin, of Denver, died when a villager virtually beheaded him with a machete.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Sept. 14, 1966

title: Weekly News Quiz | Sept. 6-12, 2016
description: Have you been following the news? Our weekly 10-question quiz is back, but you can also catch up on the whole summer here.

title: Theaters Evolving Role in China and Taiwan
description: Over the past few decades, Stan Lai has established a reputation as one of the most celebrated Chinese-language playwrights and directors. His works include more than 30 original plays, two feature films and four operas. Mr. Lai, who was born in the United States and is based in Taiwan, has written classics like Secret Love in Peach Blossom Land (1986), now an iconic play in contemporary Chinese theater, while still continuing to experiment with new forms, as seen in his eight-hour epic A Dream Like a Dream (2000), which has audiences sitting on swivel chairs in the center of the stage.

title: Italys Fertility Day Call to Make Babies Arouses Anger, Not Ardor
description: ROME  One ad pictured a woman holding an hourglass next to the words: Beauty has no age limit. Fertility does. Another portrayed a pair of baby shoes wrapped in a ribbon of the Italian flag. Yet another showed a man holding a half-burned cigarette: Dont let your sperm go up in smoke, it read.

title: Germany Arrests 3 Syrians on Suspicion of ISIS Ties
description: BERLIN  Three Syrians who entered Germany as migrants have been arrested on suspicion of belonging to the Islamic State and may have links to those who carried out the Paris terrorist attacks last year, the authorities said on Tuesday.

title: Israel Denies Claims That Syria Shot Down Warplane and Drone

description: Good morning.

title: Stockholm as Strindbergs Muse
description: Rare is the writer who can still rile his countrymen more than a century after his death. But in Sweden, August Strindberg remains lodged under the countrys proverbial skin. The author and playwright, known as much for his gossip-column lifestyle and controversial political views as for his prodigious literary output, died in 1912.

title: Contemporary Design That Upsets Our Perception of the Home
description: Matylda Krzykowski, the Polish-born designer, curator and co-founder of the contemporary-design space Depot Basel, in Switzerland, will lend her knack for sniffing out talent to Chamber, the Chelsea gallery and boutique, next month. Inspired by the artist Richard Hamiltons iconic collage Just what is it that makes todays homes so different, so appealing?  a comment on postwar consumer culture  shes selected objects that are between sculpture and your living environment, including a surrealist lamp from the Austrian duo Mischertraxler and a pair of trompe loeil wooden boxes by the Swiss designers Trix and Robert Haussmann. Its about shifting our perception of things that we know, Krzykowski says.

title: Colin Kaepernick Finds His Voice
description: SANTA CLARA, Calif.  A postgame professional football locker room is a primal cave. Massive and bruised men dress and move slowly, their bodies lost to ache. I noticed a curiously ebullient man, San Francisco 49ers linebacker Eli Harold, and wandered over to hear what he had to say.

title: Time Inc. Shakes Up Management, Replacing Chief Executive
description: For the second time in two months, Time Inc., the publisher of Time, People and Sports Illustrated, has shuffled its top leadership as it tries to reinvent itself as a digital organization and turn its well-known magazine titles into successful online properties.

title: Wukan, a Chinese Village, Erupts in Unrest Over Activists Arrests
description: BEIJING  A riot broke out in the southern Chinese village of Wukan on Tuesday as dozens of people, many of them waving flags and hurling stones, protested early morning raids that led to the arrests of activists who had criticized the government.

title: Great British Bake Off Will Leave BBC, and Two Hosts Quit
description: The Great British Bake Off, a hit reality TV show that has been hailed as a cheery avatar of multicultural, biscuit-loving modern Britain, has been torn apart in recent days over a decision by producers to leave its longtime home at the BBC for a rival network, an announcement that surprised its hosts and prompted two of them to quit on Tuesday.

title: New York Fashion Week Comes to Life With Thom Browne and Proenza Schouler
description: On Monday in the late afternoon, as the breeze blew in off the Hudson, Thom Browne built a trompe loeil pool for Palm Beach ladies in the basement of a Chelsea art gallery and blew the dust off fashion week.

title: Turning Points: Rethinking a Campaign Clich
description: In presidential politics, everyone is on the lookout for them and an army of analysts is eager to declare them: turning points. Its the moment when a single image or phrase or blunder could change the trajectory of the campaign.

title: Four Puzzlingly Perfect Patchwork Bags
description: Designers new takes on the timeless carryall.

title: 1916: Circus Raided for Shirkers
description: LONDON  A raid for military absentees was made on a travelling circus on Monday [Sept. 11] night by the military authorities, assisted by the police and special constables and a large detachment from a volunteer training corps. The latter surrounded the circus tent while the military and police entered. The names and addresses of seventy men without necessary papers had been taken when all the lights went out, and the audience of between three and four thousand was left in darkness. The proceedings of the military and the remainder of the performance had to be abandoned.  The New York Herald, European Edition, Sept. 14, 1916

title: Pneumonia, Polyps and Gunshots: A Short History of Presidential Health
description: Hillary Clintons bout of pneumonia and the criticism of how little she and her opponent, Donald J. Trump, have made public about their medical histories thrust questions of transparency about health to the center of the presidential campaign this week, with both candidates promising to release more detailed records in the coming days.

title: Neighbors Say North Dakota Pipeline Protests Disrupt Lives and Livelihoods
description: ST. ANTHONY, N.D.  Jack Schaaf, 60, has been keeping away from the grassy camp where thousands of Native Americans have joined the Standing Rock Sioux tribes fight against an oil pipeline.

title: U.S. Household Income Grew 5.2 Percent in 2015, Breaking Pattern of Stagnation
description: WASHINGTON  Americans last year reaped the largest economic gains in nearly a generation as poverty fell, health insurance coverage spread and incomes rose sharply for households on every rung of the economic ladder, ending years of stagnation.

title: Back in Los Angeles, Rams Lose in a Rare N.F.L. Shutout
description: In football, the shutout is the ultimate failure: 60 minutes and not a point to show for it, not even a measly field goal.

title: ISIS and the New Route of Hashish

title: Scaling Up a Drug Trade, Straight Through ISIS Turf
description: PALERMO, Italy  The investigators for Italys antidrug unit were used to measuring the flow of hashish from Moroccan fields to European shores one speedboat or Jet Ski at a time.

title: The Best Pairing for Indian Food? Its Not Beer
description: A recent dinner at Indian Accent on West 56th Street began in a typical fashion. Papadum and other crisp wafers arrived with an assortment of sweet and spicy chutneys, though, in an elegant expression worthy of high-end aspirations, the wafers were presented vertically, their edges anchored in a bed of dry lentils.

title: Why Are The Media Objectively Pro-Trump?
description: Because they are, at this point. Its not even false equivalence: compare the amount of attention given to the Clinton Foundation despite absence of any evidence of wrongdoing, and attention given to Trump Foundation, which engaged in more or less open bribery  but barely made a dent in news coverage. Clinton was harassed endlessly over failure to give press conferences, even though she was doing lots of interviews; Trump violated decades of tradition by refusing to release his taxes, amid strong suspicion that he is hiding something; the press simply dropped the subject.

title: The Daily Jewel: Proenza Schouler
description: At Proenza Schouler, hammered silver earrings looked like giant mobiles  or the work of Alexander Calder.  MALINA JOSEPH GILCHRIST

title: Threes a Trend: Pinstriped Shirts, Reimagined
description: The classic pinstripe button-down shirt has been recast for spring/summer 2017. At Adam Selman, a pinstriped pleated halter top was paired with gaucho pants; for the relaunched Band of Outsiders collection, which was inspired by Los Angeles street culture, a pinstripe slip dress came over slouchy navy slacks and sneakers. And Alexander Wang, who was also inspired by West Coast vibes, interpreted the shirt dress with a deep V, side cut-outs and a thigh-high slit.

description: MANILA  Military cooperation between the Philippines and the United States appeared to be undisturbed on Tuesday, as the Southeast Asian country sought to temper comments by its president suggesting American troops should leave Mindanao, where they have been helping to fight an insurgency.

description: Ibrahim Abo Allith, a volunteer rescue worker, recounted continued violence and fear in Aleppo as a planned cease-fire took effect on Monday.

title: Maah Daah Hey Trail, N.D.
Songwriters Sue Justice Department Over Licensing Rules
description: When Michelle Lewis, a Los Angeles songwriter, gets her quarterly royalty statements from Ascap, she receives a stark reminder of how songs are valued in the digital age. The tunes she writes for TV shows like Disneys Doc McStuffins bring in thousands of dollars, but streaming outlets like Pandora and Spotify yield less than $100 combined.

title: Can You Guess the Models by Their Walk?
description: In times like the 1980s, when fashion itself was brash and theatrical, designers were unafraid of models who brought their outsized personalities to the catwalk. People like Vivienne Westwood or Gianni Versace encouraged the beauties they hired  exceptional types like Naomi Campbell, Christy Turlington, Carla Bruni  to translate on the catwalk not only their professional chops but their love of the moment, the cameras lens, the rapt attention of the claques they attracted and even, occasionally, the clothes.

description: Donald J. Trump has departed from Republican orthodoxy in multiple ways, but his consistently kind words for President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia stand as the most striking.

title: Umbria, Italys Best-Kept Culinary Secret, Is Budding
description: NORCIA, Italy  Norcia, a small town in Umbria, is little known outside Italy. Its not a celebrity hill town like Siena or a religious destination like Assisi, but in Italian food its name is even more resonant.

description: A hostile takeover attempt makes fertile turf for an activist investor.

title: The Economic Expansion Is Helping the Middle Class, Finally
description: For years, the standard knock on this economic expansion has been twofold: Growth has been slow, and big businesses and wealthy investors have been its major beneficiaries, rather than middle-class wage earners.

title: Rodarte Brings Back Youthful, D.I.Y. Headbands and Barettes
description: The Rodarte designers Kate and Laura Mulleavy often spin a dreamy, youthful quality into their ethereal collections. At todays spring/summer 2017 show, that vibe also came across in delicate floral hair accessories  headbands and barrettes the French hairstylist Odile Gilbert crafted from bits and pieces of silk, chiffon, crystals and sequins left over from making the garments in the collection. Its like being a kid in school, where youre given materials and you have to create something, she said, adding that the process took a full day: We started at nine oclock and finished at six. Each piece was a one-off, in that no two were exactly alike  and Gilbert placed them into the hair with a similarly spontaneous attitude: She rubbed Wella Enrich moisturizing conditioner between her palms, and worked it through strands to add softness and texture, and misted on  Stay Essential light crafting spray for grip and hold. Then she slipped headbands on the back of the models heads, like half-crowns, and attached barrettes in a cascading, organic pattern.

title: Britains New 5-Pound Note Is Chewable, Washable and Harder to Fake
description: LONDON  It can withstand a spin cycle in a washing machine filled with extremely hot water. It can be eaten by mischievous toddlers or pet hamsters without causing lethal indigestion. It can fend off wily criminals with tiny lettering visible only under a microscope.

description: Russian hackers  possibly the same group that compromised the Democratic National Committees computer servers  have made top American athletes their latest target.

title: When Dressing the Future Means Skipping the Present

title: Rooms with a View
description: Three new monographs celebrate interiors of uncommon originality.

title: Port Chester Wants to Grow, but Exactly How Is the Question
description: PORT CHESTER, N.Y.  The mayor of this compact, working-class village bordering Connecticut cant resist the comparison. Like so many boosters of their own towns, he invokes a New York City boroughs name as he describes changes to Port Chester over the last few years. Yes, he calls it the Brooklyn of Westchester County.

title: Shimon Peres, Former Prime Minister of Israel, Suffers a Stroke
description: JERUSALEM  Shimon Peres, the Israeli former prime minister and president who shared a Nobel Peace Prize for his efforts to resolve the long-running conflict with the Palestinians, remained hospitalized on Wednesday after suffering what his doctor called a massive stroke.

title: The Spicy Spoils of Chinas Boom, at Hao Noodle and Tea
description: In the hedonists view of American immigration patterns, bad times for chefs in China are good times for dumpling chasers and noodle hunters in New York. When experienced cooks couldnt make a living there for political or economic reasons, they came here. Conversely, over the last decade or so, the hypertrophic Chinese economy has left the kitchens of our Chinatowns somewhat flattened, with fewer high peaks of talent standing out in the landscape.

title: Hao Noodle and Tea by Madam Zhus Kitchen
description: Spicy and inventive, Hao Noodle and Tea impresses in Greenwich Village.

title: A Paralympian Goes for Another Gold, in a Third Sport
description: Two years had passed since Alana Nichols broke her back in a snowboarding accident, leaving her paralyzed and wheelchair-bound, when one day she took a shortcut through a gym at the University of New Mexico, where she was a student.

title: Robert E. Allen, 81, Dies; Led an AT&T in Transition
description: Robert E. Allen, who as chief executive and chairman of AT&T for almost a decade presided over major reorganizations of the company as the telecommunications industry remade itself in the late 1980s and 90s, died on Saturday in Chatham, N.J. He was 81.

title: Command and Control Warns of Decline of Nations Nuclear Complex
description: An understated warning comes toward the end of a new documentary on a Titan 2 missile accident that shook the small town of Damascus, Ark., in mid-September 1980.

description: Monday nights parties included photography with W magazine, dinner with Purple magazine and clubbing with Jeremy Scott.

description: A cooler Monday brought relief from last weeks swampy despair, but did not chill the nights partying.

title: In Avid Reader, a Celebrated Editor as Shepherd and Alchemist
description: Robert Gottlieb, the celebrated editor at Simon & Schuster, Alfred A. Knopf and The New Yorker, was a pale, bookish, sensitive, rumpled and vaguely mousy young man. His first father-in-law, a roofing contractor, took a look at him and said, If I had a son like that, Id take him out and drown him like a sick kitten.

title: New York Gets a New Ratings Service for Restaurants
description: A new service for rating restaurants has released its first results for New York City, and the winners are: Eleven Madison Park, Atera and a host of similar restaurants that often end up on such lists.

description: Move over, all you basketball wives. Three animated high school basketball players have arrived, and theyre more outrageous in any given five minutes than you are in an entire episode.

title: How a Dutch Businessman Fulfilled His Dream to Open a World-Class Museum
description: WASSENAAR, the Netherlands  The Dutch chemical company executive and art collector Joop van Caldenborgh was attending a dinner in London in the 1990s when the American abstract artist Ellsworth Kelly approached him.

title: U.S. Finalizes Deal to Give Israel $38 Billion in Military Aid
description: JERUSALEM  The United States has finalized a $38 billion package of military aid for Israel over the next 10 years, the largest of its kind ever, and the two allies plan to sign the agreement on Wednesday, American and Israeli officials said.

title: Harvey Weinstein Gets Oscar Boost After Lion Screening
description: TORONTO  A week ago, most Oscar prognosticators and strategists had effectively written off Harvey Weinstein as a player in this years awards race.

title: Donald Trump Unveils Plan for Families in Bid for Womens Votes
description: ASTON, Pa.  Donald J. Trump unveiled a menu of proposals on Tuesday to help working parents, calling for six weeks of mandatory paid maternity leave and expanded tax credits for child care.

title: Im Not From Here
description: Day after day, an elderly woman recalls the Spanish Basque country of her youth  while forgetting she is consigned to a retirement home in Chile.

title: Im Not From Here
description: As so much of our worlds population ages and faces the attendant burden of Alzheimers and other forms of dementia, the rest of us are left to consider the collective mysteries of memory. When just about all is forgotten, how do we process what remains?

title: Broadway-Bound Groundhog Day Will Cast Shadow on Tonys
description: Make way for Groundhog Day. A musical version of the hit film is coming to Broadway, and it immediately assumes front-runner status in this seasons Tony derby.

title: Emily Blunt Rides the Unnerving Rails of Addiction in The Girl on the Train
description: Emily Blunts metamorphosis into Rachel Watson, the physically ravaged, emotionally shattered alcoholic in The Girl on the Train (out Oct. 7) burrowed deeper than a mere Hollywood make-under.

title: Thai Seafood Finds a Downtown Home at Fish Cheeks
description: FISH CHEEKS Ohm Suansilphong, a chef who worked at the highly rated Nahm in Bangkok, has joined his brother, Chat Suansilphong, a chef who worked for Tom Colicchio, to help bolster New Yorks somewhat scant offering of reasonably authentic Thai food. The room, decorated with Thai motifs, is a glowing, golden affair. And their concise, creative menu of mostly family-style dishes is heavy on seafood (coconut crab curry with betel leaves, crispy garlic branzino) and frequently fueled by tiny, potent birds-eye chiles. Were not dumbing down the dishes or the spice levels, said Chat, adding that they are grinding their spice mixtures: 55 Bond Street (Bowery), 212-677-2223, fishcheeksnyc.com.

title: Review: Documentary Now! Skewers Politicians and Food Fetishists
description: In an age of niche television, few shows are more niche than Documentary Now! How much of an audience could there be for half-hour parodies of famous documentaries (including Grey Gardens and The Thin Blue Line in Season 1) contained in a loving re-creation of a weekly public television showcase?

title: Ibrahim Maalouf Gives His Trumpet a Human Voice
description: Bridging musical cultures comes naturally to the trumpeter and composer Ibrahim Maalouf. Born in Beirut and reared in Paris, he has earned wide acclaim for his work in the Western classical tradition, as well as in Arabic music, film music, jazz and rock. Throughout the Francophone world, and in parts of the Middle East, he operates on the scale of a global pop star.

title: Review: Command and Control: Common Errors, Nuclear Arms and Consequences
description: American military history is full of misguided wars, botched battles and scandals of all sorts, so its no secret that there is fallibility all through the ranks. But the events chronicled in Command and Control, a documentary by Robert Kenner based on the book by Eric Schlosser, are terrifying nonetheless. Our most destructive weapons are somehow immune to our own clumsiness and inexactitude, arent they? No, theyre not.

description: The designer, recent winner of the U.S. Woolmark Prize for womenswear, shows her latest collection.

description: In their recent single Drop, the R&B sister duo Chloe x Halle are all attitude, telling a boy: Baby, I get sick of you. Youre that same old tune I dont ever want to hear again.

description: The morning after Britain voted to leave the European Union, Matt Kelly ducked into a coffee shop on a graffiti-lined street in the trendy East London neighborhood of Shoreditch.

title: One Designers Fashion Week Fittings, Illustrated
description: Since the opening of her Lower East Side boutique in 2008, and the launch of her namesake line in 2013, Maryam Nassirzadeh has (in one way or another) infiltrated countless New Yorkers closets. But she hasnt held a fashion week presentation  until now. (I always felt fulfilled doing my own thing, she says.) Tonight, a cast consisting of Nassirzadehs nearest and dearest friends will model the designers spring/summer 2017 collection. Theyre part of the reason why I wanted to do a show, she says. Its organic to ask the people who Im comfortable seeing in the clothes to participate, and its truly a collaborative process. Its not that I want to impose my vision, its that Im inspired by them.

title: Young Women Get Buzzed, on Their Own Terms
description: A generation of young women is discovering a new way to get buzzed  no illicit substances required. Instead, all thats needed is a good pair of clippers and some nerve.

title: In Expanding Russian Influence, Faith Combines With Firepower
description: PARIS  The golden main dome of a new Russian Orthodox cathedral now under construction on the banks of the Seine shimmers in the sun, towering over a Paris neighborhood studded with government buildings and foreign embassies. Most sensitive of all, it is being built beside a 19th-century palace that has been used to conceal some of the French presidencys most closely guarded secrets.

title: Fed Proposes Ban on Merchant Banking, a Practice With Little Risk
description: The Federal Reserve has taken dead aim on merchant banking, proposing to ban the practice as part of a take no risk regulation strategy.

title: Lucerne Festival Theater Project Killed by Vote
description: An unusual episode in classical music philanthropy  the effort to build a theater for the Lucerne Festival in Switzerland to produce operatic and experimental works  came to an apparent end on Monday when Swiss officials voted it down.

title: U.S. Agency Faults Pilot of Delta Jet That Slid Off La Guardia Runway
description: A Delta Air Lines jet skidded off a snowy runway at La Guardia Airport and nearly plunged into Flushing Bay last year because its pilot used excessive force to slow the plane as it landed, federal transportation safety officials said on Tuesday.

title: Vice Media Delays Start of HBO Newscast Until Oct. 10
description: Vice Media said on Tuesday that it was delaying the start of its daily HBO half-hour newscast by two weeks. The program, Vice News Tonight, will now begin on Oct. 10 instead of Sept. 26, as Vice had announced.
