title: Arsenal Earns a Champions League Draw, but P.S.G. Is the One Moving Forward
description: PARIS  As the overblown strains of Handels Zadok the Priest blasted out over Parc des Princes, and as the players from Paris St.-Germain and Arsenal emerged into the bright lights of the Champions League once more, a vast red banner was unfurled on one side of the stadium.

title: Black Health Experts Renew Fight Against Menthol Cigarettes
description: WASHINGTON  Menthol cigarettes account for about a third of all cigarettes sold in the United States, and they are particularly popular among black smokers  about four out of five report smoking them, according to federal surveys.

title: Bridgewater Manager Ray Dalio Defends His Firms Radical Transparency
description: The billionaire hedge fund manager Ray Dalio on Tuesday defended the unusual culture at his $150 billion firm, Bridgewater Associates.

title: Details of Syria Pact Widen Rift Between John Kerry and Pentagon
description: WASHINGTON  The agreement that Secretary of State John Kerry announced with Russia to reduce the killing in Syria has widened an increasingly public divide between Mr. Kerry and Defense Secretary Ashton B. Carter, who has deep reservations about the plan for American and Russian forces to jointly target terrorist groups.

title: U.S. Wins Gold at Chess Olympiad With Help of Imported Talent
description: It has been nearly 80 years since the United States could boast that it had the best chess team in the world, but the group it put together this year  with the help of a wealthy benefactor and a bit of international intrigue  can now make that claim.

title: Obama Condemns Trump in Full-Throated Pitch for Clinton
description: PHILADELPHIA  President Obama vigorously defended Hillary Clinton on Tuesday as a relentless leader who had been held to unfair standards during an uncommonly wild presidential campaign, pleading with the voters who were the core of his own support to tune out the reality show noise of the race and vote for his chosen successor.

title: Metro-North Getting Bar Cars Again, but Dont Expect a Seat
description: To the list of famous things that have been discontinued only to be resurrected later  Marvel Comics, the Muppets and Twinkies, to name but three  add bar cars on the Metro-North Railroad.

title: Cate Blanchett and Chekhov, Together on Broadway
description: An old friend writes: I am far from cheating myself, my dear man, about the true condition of affairs; not only am I bored and dissatisfied, but as a doctor I am cynical enough to be convinced that from this life we can expect only evil  errors, losses, illnesses, weakness, and all kinds of dirty tricks.

title: Black Female Playwrights Want You to Face Facts. The Harsh Ones.
description: Its not unusual for theater, like many of the arts, to address a pressing social or political issue. But what strikes me as unusual this fall is that most of such work comes from notable black female playwrights: Sarah Jones, Anna Deavere Smith and Lynn Nottage all have new (or new to New York) works that grapple with problems preoccupying contemporary culture.

title: Allow Me to Introduce Whats His Name
description: Editors Note: September 21, 2006

title: Trial Begins for Maurice Greenberg, Ex-A.I.G. Chief Accused of Fraud
description: The 11-year-old accounting fraud case against the former American International Group chief executive Maurice R. Greenberg finally came to trial on Tuesday in a state courthouse in Lower Manhattan.

title: N.C.A.A. Leaves North Carolina in a New Spot: Sapped of Sports Pride
description: For months, North Carolina has weathered the umbrage of corporate America and the anger of the federal government over a law that curbed the rights of gay and transgender people.

title: Prosecution in Potsdam Murder Case Admits a Lapse
description: CANTON, N.Y.  It took nearly five years from the time of the savage strangling of a 12-year-old boy for Oral Nicholas Hillary, long the prime suspect, to be brought to trial.

title: Oregon Refuge Occupiers Were Protesting, Lawyer Says
description: PORTLAND, Ore.  The armed demonstrators who took over a federal wildlife refuge in Oregon this year were attempting to reclaim land that they believed was improperly seized by the federal government, a lawyer for one of the groups leaders told a packed courtroom on Tuesday.

title: Chelsea Manning Told She Can Have Gender Reassignment Surgery, Lawyer Says
description: Chelsea Manning, who announced that she was female the day after being sentenced to prison in 2013 for leaking government files, has been told that the United States military will allow her to proceed with gender reassignment surgery, her lawyer said on Tuesday.

title: The Failure to Talk Frankly About Poverty
description: Poverty in the United States is deeper than in all other wealthy nations. Yet neither Hillary Clinton nor Donald Trump has a specific anti-poverty agenda.

title: Southern California Gas Reaches $4 Million Settlement Over Natural Gas Leak
description: A California company that operated a natural gas storage system that leaked last year, spewing thousands of tons of methane and other chemicals into the air and forcing the evacuation of more than 8,300 households, reached a $4 million settlement with state prosecutors, officials announced on Tuesday.

title: Sexual Abuse Charges Put Shadow on U.S. Gymnastics Federation
description: Considering how many medals U.S.A. Gymnastics brought home from the Rio Games  an amazing 12, including Simone Biless three individual golds and the womens team gold  the federations post-Olympics glow should be brighter than ever.

title: Whats Deplorable About Presidential Campaigns
description: Its hard to believe now, but there was a time in American politics, not so long ago, when a presidential candidate might hold only a few fund-raisers, when a serving president  Ronald Reagan, for example  might refuse to appear at any fund-raisers at all for his own re-election campaign. That was back before wily political operatives, and then the Supreme Court, opened the floodgates to cash, and candidates began holding fund-raisers by the score.

title: House Republicans Dread a Possible Election Result: Bipartisanship
description: WASHINGTON  A big conspiracy theory in Washington these days, perhaps second only to the one concerning Hillary Clintons supposed body double, is the fear among some House Republicans of what President Obama and their party leaders might cook up during a lame-duck session of Congress after Election Day.

title: Tip Leads to Vanished Arctic Exploration Ship After 168 Years
description: OTTAWA  To solve a 168-year-old Arctic mystery, the Canadian government had spared no expense. Officials over the last several years used satellite and underwater imaging and deployed crews from the navy and coast guard along with scientists and researchers to search for the Terror, a British ship that vanished along with 129 crew members while trying to map the Northwest Passage.

title: Mike Pence Is Rebuffed as He Tries to Rally G.O.P. Leaders Over Deplorables
description: WASHINGTON  Gov. Mike Pence came to Capitol Hill on Tuesday on a mission to promote Republican unity, attacking Hillary Clinton for describing many supporters of the G.O.P. ticket as bigoted deplorables and urging Republicans to rally behind their nominee, Donald J. Trump.

title: Brandon Maxwell: Spring 2017
description: Having only launched his brand in September 2015, Lady Gagas fashion director presents his latest collection.

title: Mohammad Javad Zarif: Let Us Rid the World of Wahhabism
description: Tehran  Public relations firms with no qualms about taking tainted petrodollars are experiencing a bonanza. Their latest project has been to persuade us that the Nusra Front, Al Qaedas affiliate in Syria, is no more. As a Nusra spokesman told CNN, the rebranded rebel group, supposedly separated from its parent terrorist organization, has become moderate.

title: Ethiopian Marathoner Planned His Defiant Gesture
description: WASHINGTON  The Ethiopian marathoner who won a silver medal at the Rio Olympics and then crossed his arms over his head in an X at the finish line as an act of political defiance, said Tuesday that he planned the action months before the Games in response to the government killing, imprisoning, repressing its own people.

title: Ask Me Anything
description: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE  I would bet that the majority of people who dont solve regularly probably see crossword puzzles as very stodgy, two-dimensional, nonhumorous intellectual ventures. But once you become a regular solver, you learn that this is far from the truth.

title: Yuh-Line Niou Defeats Sheldon Silver Ally in Primary for His Old Assembly Seat
description: Yuh-Line Niou won a six-way race on Tuesday for the Democratic nomination to inherit the State Assembly seat once held by Sheldon Silver, in a repudiation of the stubborn grip Mr. Silver held on his Lower Manhattan district for four decades  held, that is, until his conviction late last year on federal corruption charges.

title: Computer Breach Could Have Exposed Trauma Victims to Further Anguish
description: Havoc sneaks in so often, we shrug. Data breaches, for instance. Hackers break into bank computers or Home Depot terminals to steal credit card numbers, dates of birth, addresses, Social Security numbers.

title: Mets Kelly Johnson Remakes His Swing in Daniel Murphys Image
description: WASHINGTON  Kelly Johnson does not remember the exact date, but sometime in early August, nearly two months into his second tenure with the Mets, he approached the teams hitting coach, Kevin Long, and his assistant, Pat Roessler, with an idea that he hoped would make him a more consistent power hitter in his 11th season in the majors.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: We lifted three and a half million people out of poverty, the largest one-year drop in poverty since 1968. The uninsured rate is the lowest since they began keeping records. The pay gap between men and women shrank to the lowest level on record. Thanks, Obama.

title: Stars Off the Bench Help the Yankees Shut Out the Dodgers
description: The grind of a long season leaves its mark in many ways, some visible and some unseen. So, with the Yankees nearing mid-September, and with each game precious as they hunt for a playoff berth, Manager Joe Girardi faced a difficult decision.

title: Mets Blow Lead Against Nationals, but a Hunch Pays Off
description: WASHINGTON  Based on the matchup, there seemed little chance a home run was possible. Mark Melancon, the Washington Nationals standout closer, was pitching the top of the 10th inning of a tie game and had an 0-2 count against the Mets rookie infielder T.J. Rivera, who had hit few home runs even in the minor leagues.

title: Narciso Rodriguez: Spring 2017
description: Mr. Rodriguez shows his spring 2017 collection.

title: New Documents Released From Hack of Democratic Party
description: A hacker who American intelligence officials believe has ties to the Russian government made public on Tuesday a second batch of documents suspected of having been stolen from the Democratic National Committees computer system, leaving the organization rushing to contain damage or embarrassment less than two months before the presidential election.

title: Stanley K. Sheinbaum, Economist and Liberal Crusader, Dies at 96
description: Stanley K. Sheinbaum, a former economics professor who worked for liberal candidates and causes and dauntlessly injected himself into political controversies abroad, died on Monday at his home in Los Angeles. He was 96.

title: Lionel Messi Leads Barcelona in Its Champions League Opener
description: Lionel Messis first goal of the Champions League season took three minutes. Manchester City never got the chance to start.

title: Care.com Creates a $500 Limited Benefit for Gig-Economy Workers
description: In one of the earliest moves to bring employee benefits to workers in the so-called gig economy, an online marketplace that connects millions of families with babysitters, nannies and caregivers announced on Wednesday that it would provide up to $500 a year for workers to use for health care, transportation or education expenses.

title: Corrections: September 14, 2016
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Whats on TV Wednesday: Archie Panjabi on Blindspot and South Park Hits 20
description: Archie Panjabi joins the cast of Blindspot  and yes, shes wearing boots. The lawyers of Suits fight for the lives of their client and their firm. And South Park begins its 20th season on a hot topic: the national anthem.

title: Word of the Day + Quiz | carcinogenic
description: carcinogenic  \kr-s-no-je-nik\  adjective

title: Looking at White Privilege Under Apartheid
description: The South African photographer David Goldblatt revisits white, middle-class life under apartheid in a new edition of his 1982 book, In Boksburg.

title: Why Not a College Degree in Sports?
description: Boulder, Colo.  A new influx of money into big-time college sports is likely to reinvigorate debate over whether student athletes should be paid as if they were professionals, with colleges running semipro teams as side projects to their research and teaching missions.

title: Donald Trumps Putin Crush
description: When it comes to rebutting Donald Trumps idiotic observation that Vladimir Putin is a strong leader  far more than our president has been a leader  it is hard to top the assessment of Russian-born Garry Kasparov, the former world chess champion, which The Timess Andrew Higgins quoted in his story from Moscow: Vladimir Putin is a strong leader in the same way that arsenic is a strong drink. Praising a brutal K.G.B. dictator, especially as preferable to a democratically elected U.S. president, whether you like Obama or hate him, is despicable and dangerous.

title: How Trump Might Win
description: Like a star-crossed baseball team trying to close out a pennant, Hillary Clinton holds an advantage in the race for president that feels real yet not at all reassuring  for her partisans or for Trump fearers worldwide. She just has to hang on seems like the dominant emotion among her backers, and for that matter among her staff, who handled her ground zero meltdown like a front office desperately trying to minimize the seriousness of a star pitchers injury. Just a bruise  O.K., a muscle pull  we just took him out as a precautionary measure  hell make his next start  O.K., fine, hes on the disabled list.

title: How Bolivia Fights the Drug Scourge
description: This week, the White House issued its yearly report on the nations on the front lines of the war on drugs. Predictably, it listed Bolivia as one of three countries that failed demonstrably to do enough to combat the drug trade. President Evo Morales of Bolivia responded, as he does each year, with defiance.

title: Hillary Clintons Sick Days
description: Before we delve any further into the coughs heard round the world and the swoon that changed history, some perspective:

title: Space Travel: A Vision
description: PHILADELPHIA  One night, I had a dream (or half-dream) about swinging on my own for the first time. It started out as a kind of interview, as though I were getting help coming up with an idea for a poem. Someone asked me what I was wearing. I said shorts. Then, after thinking a few seconds, I remembered the short-sleeved seersucker shirts we used to wear, my twin brother, Dave, and I. I may have been about 4, about the age of the boy I can hear crying in the street as I write this  all those partials in his voice, all that open-mouthed speech, full of longing, you cant quite understand.

title: Is School Reform Hopeless?
After North Korea Flooding, Relief Agencies Help Tens of Thousands
description: SEOUL, South Korea  International relief agencies said on Wednesday that they had begun delivering food and other assistance to tens of thousands of North Koreans who lost homes in some of the worst flooding to hit the country in years.

title: Looking at White Privilege Under Apartheid
description: When we imagine South Africa of the 1970s and 1980s, the most indelible images depicted the violent struggle against apartheid. They are epitomized by Sam Nzimas iconic photograph of Umbiswa Makhubo carrying Hector Pietersons limp body during the Soweto Uprising on June 16, 1976, when police opened fire on schoolchildren protesting forced instruction in Afrikaans. The photo sparked international outrage and more protests, helping to galvanize a resistance movement that eventually vanquished apartheid.

title: Picture Prompt | Colin Kaepernicks Protest
description: The Times writes:

title: Article of the Day | Visions of Life on Mars in Earths Depths
description: Article: Visions of Life on Mars in Earths Depths

title: Should I Tell My Friend I Had a Fling With Her Ex?
description: After attending a house party that my friend S. hosted, I made a rather rash decision to text her the next day and hopefully strike up a fling. Surprisingly, she took the bait. Soon enough we picked up momentum and enjoyed a monthlong, unofficial relationship. I did take some things into consideration before I decided to text her. For instance, I made sure that she was not in a relationship; she said she was only casually seeing other people.

title: Immortalized on the Streets of St. Petersburg: Kim Jong-il and Mannerheim
description: Wait a minute  were honoring him?

title: A Victory for Press Freedom in 1735 Set an Important Precedent
description: INDELIBLE INKThe Trials of John Peter Zenger and the Birth of Americas Free PressBy Richard KlugerIllustrated. 346 pp. W.W. Norton & Company. $27.95.

title: Lauren Collinss Memoir on Falling in Love in French
description: WHEN IN FRENCHLove in a Second LanguageBy Lauren Collins243 pp. Penguin Press. $27.

title: Could Ancient Remedies Hold the Answer to the Looming Antibiotics Crisis?
description: On a warm, clear evening in March, with the sun still hanging above the horizon, Cassandra Quave climbed aboard a jalapeo-green 4-by-4 and started to drive across her fathers ranch in Arcadia, Fla. Surveying the landscape, most people would have seen a homogenous mat of pasture and weeds punctuated by the occasional tree. Quave saw something quite different: a vast botanical tapestry, rich as a Persian rug. On a wire fence, a Smilax vine dangled menacingly pointed leaves, like a necklace of sharks teeth. Beneath it, tiny wild daisies and mint ornamented the grass with pink tassels and purple cornets. Up above, on the sloping branches of oak trees, whiskery bromeliads, Spanish moss and the gray fronds of resurrection fern tangled in a miniature jungle all their own.

title: Letter of Recommendation: Ear Candling
description: Ear candles are widely and emphatically denounced by doctors as quackery. When burned, the little tubes of waxed gauze are supposed to create a vacuum effect just outside your ear, with the pressure differential pulling wax out and up into the tube itself. Sounds scientific enough, but its basically impossible to find evidence that they actually work. WebMD includes them on their list of 5 Home Remedy No-Nos, alongside rubbing whiskey on a teething babys gums and at-home colon cleansing. Putting a flaming tube in your ear and lying down for 10 minutes  a lot can go wrong, apparently.

title: Justin Trudeau, Nearing a Year in Office, Tries to Recast Himself
description: OTTAWA  The crowd was enthusiastic, and Justin Trudeau was working it. He seemed to leave no hand unshaken in the crush of the convention hall as light perspiration gathered on his forehead. Even on what could have been hostile turf, the ebullience was palpable.

title: Donald Trump Checkup Said to Reveal He Is Overweight
description: After a whiplash-inducing morning of mixed messages, Donald J. Trump on Wednesday opened a small window into some of the results from his most recent physical examination, revealing that he is overweight and takes a statin, a type of drug that lowers cholesterol.

title: 27 Million Potential Hispanic Votes. But What Will They Really Add Up To?
description: Two weeks after Hillary Clinton accepted the Democratic presidential nomination in Philadelphia, beaming through a hail of gigantic balloons, her campaigns Latinos con Hillary program began in five cities in Virginia. One of the kickoff parties took place at Todos Supermarket in Prince William County, in a modest white room where about 40 people gathered around three tables draped in cheap blue cloth to hear a speech by Clintons national Latino-vote director, Lorella Praeli. When she was 2, Praeli, now 28, lost one of her legs in a car accident, but with her crutches, she commanded the room more adroitly than any of the speakers who preceded her, moving among the tables as she rallied her troops. Though the party was advertised on Facebook, most of the men and women in attendance were seasoned Democratic politicians, staff members and volunteers.

title: The Gaudy, Glittery, Gorgeously Subversive World of Taylor Mac
description: BREWSTER, N.Y.  A baby was crying in a makeshift concert hall here, a wooden barn that felt like a Swedish sauna in the August heat. Already ringed in purple glitter, the eyes of the entertainer Taylor Mac lit up further, with opportunity.

title: Should Parents Make Their Children Clean Their Room?
description: Is your bedroom an archaeological site of dirty socks, sports-drink bottles, ripped papers and empty boxes of Cheez-Its like that of one of the teenagers described in this article? If so, does it make your parents crazy? How often do you clean it up? Does the mess bother you?

title: Living in Times Square
description: About 5,800 people make their home in the Times Square neighborhood, with its bright lights and crowds of tourists.

title: Among the Bright Lights of Times Square
description: It is not novel for a child from a Minneapolis suburb to feel giddy in Times Square, to think, I want to live here, as Michael Wolk did when his parents took him to his first Broadway show decades ago. It is unusual, however, for an adult to see the hectic crossroads with its razzle-dazzle LED screens in the same way.

title: Why Fidgeting Is Good Medicine
description: Are you a fidgeter?

title: How to Be Mindful With a Cup of Coffee
description: It would seem that meditating by coffee is an oxymoron, says Gloria Chadwick, the author of Zen Coffee: A Guide to Mindful Meditation. Coffee jazzes you up and meditation calms you down.

title: Australias Leader Calls for National Gay Marriage Vote
description: SYDNEY, Australia  Australias divisive debate over same-sex marriage returned to Parliament on Wednesday when Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull implored lawmakers to support a bill that would ask Australians to vote on the issue.

title: Donald Trump, Syria, iPhone: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Morning Agenda: Dodd-Frank Rollback, Bridgewater Culture, Household Gains
description: The rollback of Dodd-Frank has begun.

title: New York Today: Cross This Way
description: Updated, 10:58 a.m.

title: New York Fashion Week, Day 8: Theyll Be Prancing in the Street
description: Already the talk at the shows is shifting to London; New York Fashion Week is drawing to a close, but fashion month is just beginning. Gird yourself, wont you? (Well be following it all.)

title: 5 Ways Total Strangers Can Make Your Trip Better
description: How striking up conversations, asking for advice and listening closely can transform your trip.

title: Trips That Encourage You to Lose Your Phone
description: Digital devices have given travelers instant access to online guidebooks, restaurant reviews and the social media means to disseminate photos. Now in a backlash against digital dependency, a number of tour operators, cruise lines and resorts are championing unplugged vacations.

title: How Did G.M. Create Teslas Dream Car First?
description: ORION TOWNSHIP, Mich.  Ten years ago, a little-known tech entrepreneur named Elon Musk published a secret master plan for Tesla Motors, an ambitious electric car start-up he had funded.

title: Refugees Pour Out of Turkey Once More as Deal With Europe Falters
description: BODRUM, Turkey  The number of Syrians and others fleeing Turkey for Greece is growing rapidly once again as an agreement reached months ago to curb the flood of refugees into Europe seems to be on the verge of collapse.

title: What It Feels Like to Ride in a Self-Driving Uber
description: PITTSBURGH  Im parked on a patch of gravel outside the old Heinz ketchup bottling factory here early on a Monday morning, and Im frustrated. My Uber self-driving car will not start driving itself.

title: Postcards From the Hajj: Pray on Wheels
description: Wheelchair pushers are common in Mecca, Saudi Arabia. They take pilgrims on laps around the Kaaba and to religious sites where pilgrimage rites are completed.

title: When Teenagers Bristle at How Was School?
description: How was school today?

title: Hillary Clinton Is Getting Surprisingly Little Extra Lift From Blacks and Hispanics
description: The conventional wisdom holds that sweeping demographic shifts propelled Barack Obama to the presidency.

title: In East Jerusalem, a Trip Into the Unknown
description: JERUSALEM  Mahmoud Muna, a Palestinian bookseller in East Jerusalem, does not mince words when it comes to his views on Israeli control over his part of the city, and his opinions can be difficult for Israelis to hear.

title: Turkeys Intelligentsia Kneels to Erdogan
description: BRUSSELS  On July 27, just minutes before my flight from Brussels to Newark was due to take off, a United Airlines staff member approached and asked me to leave the plane. I felt humiliated by the unspoken assumptions of nearby passengers, but I was not shocked: I knew that Turkey was canceling peoples passports to punish those it regarded as critics of its increasingly authoritarian government.

title: Drone Racing Becomes ESPNs Newest Televised Sport
description: First there was poker. Then there was the spelling bee, Scrabble and the recent emergence of e-sports.

title: Guatemalas Fragile Progress
description: HAVERFORD, Pa.  At first glance, Guatemalas recent steps to root out organized crime look impressive: Working with the United Nations, the countrys attorney general has dismantled a major criminal network tied to the political party led by the former president Otto Prez Molina, who now sits in jail  along with his vice president and some 200 other disgraced cabinet ministers, congressmen, civil servants, businessmen, bankers, lawyers and judges.

title: Oscar Wilde Honored by the Prison That Once Detained Him
description: READING, England  The Victorian prison compound at Reading near London would be just another penal facility if it werent for one star inmate: Oscar Wilde, who spent two excruciating years here from 1895 to 1897, after he was convicted of committing homosexual acts.

title: Trigger Warnings, Safe Spaces and Microaggressions: Discussing Questions of Freedom of Speech on Campus
description: This August, as a new school year was about to begin, the University of Chicago captured media attention with the letter it addressed to incoming first-years.

title: N.F.L. to Spend $100 Million to Address Head Trauma
description: Under continued pressure from fans, parents and lawmakers to address the growing problem of head trauma in football, the N.F.L. will spend another $100 million on the development of new technology and more research on the effects of head injuries.

title: An Unlikely Crime in One-Party China: Election Fraud
description: HONG KONG  Chinas legislature has expelled 45 of its members in a vote-buying scandal that has snared a prominent businessman who is active in donating to American universities, foundations and political campaigns.

title: Opposition Figures Rise Could Pave Way for Female Leaders in Japan
description: TOKYO  Among democracies in the developed world, Japan has one of the worst records of putting women in positions of political power.

title: The Winners and Losers as Europe Tries to Erase Borders for TV and Films
description: Siim Teller is a big fan of the British Broadcasting Corporation. A 37-year-old Estonian, he got hooked on the documentaries, period dramas and other programs after living in London for four years.

title: Musings on the Toilet
description: As bathroom trends come and go, our design editor keeps returning to the Edwardian ideal.

title: Bayer Deal for Monsanto Follows Agribusiness Trend, Raising Worries for Farmers
description: Don Halcomb, a 63-year-old farmer in Adairville, Ky., is expecting his profit to vanish this year, largely because of the confluence of falling crop prices and rising costs for seeds and other materials.

title: The Daily Jewel: Tory Burch
description: The prep set goes glam: oversize pearls and crystals come together in Tory Burchs memorable statement necklace.  MALINA JOSEPH GILCHRIST

title: Giants Try to Hang On in an Inelegant Playoff Race
description: SAN FRANCISCO  By the ninth inning Tuesday, as San Diego players scampered around the bases and batted balls took black cat bounces, it began to dawn on the San Francisco Giants and their fans that nothing good was going to happen this evening.

title: California Today: A Leaning Tower in San Francisco
description: Good morning.

title: New Twitter App Streams N.F.L. Games and Other Sports
description: Twitter is making a play for peoples living rooms, unveiling an app on Wednesday for Apple TV, Amazon Fire TV and Microsofts Xbox One that will showcase its bet on live content.

title: What You Get for ... $900,000
description: A house in Tennessee, a condomium in Chicago and a contemporary in New Mexico

title: $900,000 Homes in Tennessee, Chicago and New Mexico
description: ATHENS, TENN.

title: Acting Out at Coach, Rodarte and Tory Burch
description: Maybe its the influence of the Toronto Film Festival, which began the same day as the womens ready-to-wear shows, and the reports drifting south of narratives new and Oscar candidates to come. Maybe its anticipation of the Emmys, which are awarded just after the New York collections end, and for which, presumably, some celebrities are in the city to shop the shows.

title: Panthers, the Guardians of Prospect Park, Didnt See Citi Bike Coming
description: In 1898, Alexander Phimister Proctor, one of Americas foremost animaliers  artists who use canvas and clay to conjure the animal kingdom  created a pair of sleek bronze panthers to guard an entrance to Prospect Park, the verdant heart of Brooklyn.

title: Theresa May, Britains Prime Minister, Plays the Brexit Waiting Game
description: LONDON  She is known in the British civil service as Theresa May, or Maybe Not. But after months in which she has provided little clue as to how she intends to negotiate Britains exit from the European Union, Mrs. May could soon have a harder time dodging the question.

title: A Restored Period Home With Seven Bedrooms in Edinburgh
description: The six-bedroom house and a separate one-bedroom annex, on Calton Hill in the citys New Town, are on the market for $2.39 million.

title: House Hunting in ... Scotland
description: A RESTORED PERIOD HOME WITH SEVEN BEDROOMS IN EDINBURGH

title: If Youre Thinking About Your Underwear, Youre Wearing the Wrong Underwear
description: During fashion week, hair and makeup help make the outfit, but dont overlook the underwear. Without the right underpinnings, even the best dress can go so wrong. Little wonder that just as there are go-to beauty experts (Pat McGrath and Orlando Pita, for example), there is a go-to brand for lingerie. Commando, which not coincidentally also dominates the red carpet, is working with more than 30 brands during New York Fashion Week, including Rodarte, Rag & Bone and Zac Posen.

title: A Steel Watch Inspired by the Skies
description: Rather than assume the mantle of the famed French watch company his family founded in the 18th century, early aviator Louis Charles Breguet decided instead to fly. While the company (now based in Switzerland) was pioneering chronographs for cockpits in the late 1920s, Louis Charles perfected the gyroplane (a helicopter precursor) and developed a reconnaissance aircraft. The watch manufacturers relationship to the dynamics of flight is now evoked in the new Type XXI 3817 chronograph, based on a Breguet model worn for decades by the French air force. Its steel case features a retro dove-gray dial with luminous Arabic numerals, and a slew of complications including a fly-back function and a 12-hour counter.

title: Sportswear That Feels Nostalgic Yet New
description: The right mix of athletic wear and crisp basics hits just the right mark.

title: Conquering TV With Mad Men. Now Matthew Weiner Publishes a Novel.
description: Last fall, Matthew Weiner was walking on the Upper East Side of Manhattan when he saw a teenage girl having a tense conversation with a companion near a building under construction.

title: British Lawmakers Condemn 2011 Intervention in Libya
description: LONDON  A committee of British lawmakers issued a damning assessment on Wednesday of the 2011 intervention in Libya led by Britain and France, concluding that the military action had lacked a coherent strategy, had been based on poor intelligence and had led to a political collapse that aided the rise of the Islamic State in North Africa.

title: 1966: A Trip Deep Into Space
description: CAPE KENNEDY  Astronauts Charles (Pete) Conrad and Richard F. Gordon today [Sept. 14] streaked 850 miles deep into space  nearly twice as high as man has ever travelled before. I tell you, you cant believe it, Comdr. Conrad radioed to earth as the Gemini-11 spacecraft attained the record height over Australia. Just out of my window you can see the top of the world, all the way around we have the whole southern part of the world out of one window. To reach the record altitude, Comdr. Conrad and Lt. Comdr. Gordon fired the 16,000-poundthrust engine of an Agena target rocket linked to their spacecraft for 25 seconds. As they sped back into the lower orbit, the spacecraft set a new manned speed record of 17,931 miles an hour.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Sept. 15, 1966

title: Colin Powell, in Hacked Emails, Shows Scorn for Trump and Irritation at Clinton
description: WASHINGTON  Former Secretary of State Colin L. Powell has long been one of the high priests of the Washington establishment, staying quiet in this years raucous presidential campaign while tending to his reputation as a thoughtful officer and diplomat.

title: Angelica Garcia: An Unexpected Conspiracy of One
description: Angelica Garcias songs take unexpected swoops. Sometimes its the music, which is steeped in country-rock and blues, with flickers of indie-rock desolation; sometimes its her voice, which is sure and conspiratorial, bendy and grounded. Most often, though, its her words, which come together in surprising patterns, a blend of old-timey formalism and magical storytelling.

title: Danny Brown Shows Respect for His Elders With Atrocity Exhibition
description: The rapper Danny Brown is well aware of his reputation as a freak show: a drug-scarfing, cartoon-haired hedonist with an unsettling yelp of a voice.

title: A $150 Million Stairway to Nowhere on the Far West Side
description: By the look of the renderings officially unveiled on Wednesday morning, New Yorks next significant landmark may be the citys biggest Rorschach test, too.

title: Workers Pay More for Health Care as Companies Shift Burden, Survey Finds
description: State health insurance exchanges created under the new health care law are in turmoil. By contrast, the employer market  where the majority of Americans still get their coverage  seems like a bastion of stability.

title: Baseballs Grand Old Men, Like the Rangers, Still Seek First Ring
description: HOUSTON  The memories stalk Adrian Beltre, haunting and driving him. He has lived for nearly five years with the exquisite agony of that night in St. Louis when the Texas Rangers came so close to winning the World Series.

title: Rice and Beans, Plum Torte and Other Midweek Winners
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Michiko Kakutani on Twitter: A World of Splendid Dishevelment
description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights into The New York Times and how news, feature and opinion pieces come together at the paper. In this article, The Timess chief book critic, Michiko Kakutani, shares her appreciation for Twitter and its many charms.

title: Your Next Pair of Shoes Could Come From a 3-D Printer
description: The assembly line at Feetz has 100 humming 3-D printers. Their sole purpose is to make shoes.

title: Syrian Nurse Explains Protests in Aleppo
description: Modar Shekho, a nurse in Aleppo, Syria, took part in a protest against international aid entering the city on Tuesday evening.

title: Tom Krell of How to Dress Well, on Caring
description: Theres been a deficit of joy in music, said Tom Krell, the 32-year-old songwriter who records as How to Dress Well. Its often the case that art is able to produce affects of joy, which energize people against the forces of domination, energize people against cynicism and depression.

title: To Take Up a Musical Instrument, First Pick Up Your Phone
description: WHEN given the opportunity, some inexperienced musicians cant resist strumming a few chords on a guitar or plunking out a few bars of Chopsticks on a piano. But with the right app, its easy to start learning an instrument right on your smartphone.

title: Real Estate Executive to Take the Helm at Governors Island
description: With its food festivals and artist-inspired miniature golf, hammocks and bike rentals, Governors Island has become a summertime playground for New Yorkers  a weekend getaway that happens to be within the city limits.

title: Guggenheims Helsinki Outpost Wont Get Government Funding
description: Plans for a Guggenheim museum in Helsinki have been thrown into doubt, now that one of Finlands three ruling parties has vetoed government funding for the project.

title: Stop Carping at Hillary Clinton
description: To the Editor:

title: Sapphire Raises $1 Billion for Investment in Start-Ups
description: Sapphire Ventures has closed on a $1 billion fund to invest in privately held start-ups, easing fears about a downturn in the venture capital industry.

title: A New Wave of Miami Cocktail Lounges Refines the Quaffs
description: On a sultry Tuesday night in Miami, plaid-clad and boho-chic hipsters gathered around the pool at Broken Shaker bar, sipping herb-filled cocktails under strings of soft light bulbs. There was nary a bouncer or bikini in sight, replaced by a neighborly mix of artists, professionals and off-season tourists drawn to this denlike bar in a candlelit alcove by the pool.

title: Obama Pledges to Lift All Sanctions Against Myanmar
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama pledged on Wednesday to lift all remaining sanctions against Myanmar, seeking to reward the countrys recent moves toward democracy after decades of brutal military rule.

title: Daily Report: Test-Driving (or Not Driving) the Cars of the Future
description: The automobile is known as the machine that changed the world. Now the world is changing automobiles  in a big way.

title: Mansur Gavriel Turned Its Presentation Into a Museum  and Gift Shop
description: From the beginning of the brand, weve approached our bags as kinds of sculptures, says Rachel Mansur, the co-founder of the New York City-based accessories brand Mansur Gavriel. Each season, she and Floriana Gavriel put an incredible amount of thought into the set design for their presentations; see last Februarys domestic scene. For spring/summer 2017, a collection that includes more bag and shoe silhouettes than before (and three new materials), but a more edited color palette, they sought a minimal background, transforming the performance space Cedar Lake into a museum and coordinating gift shop. Scroll over the images to go inside last nights presentation.

title: 1891: Disastrous Floods in Spain
description: MADRID  Terrible floods have been caused in the South of Spain by the overflow of the Amarguillo River. It is estimated that 1,300 persons have been drowned. The towns of Valencia, Casellon and Almeria are inundated. There is at least 3ft. of water in the streets. It is not likely that there will be any railroad service south of Madrid for a week at least. The Queen Regent has sent her intendant with ten thousand douros, and has given him carte blanche in the matter of expense for the assistance of the sufferers in the Province of Toledo.  The New York Herald, European Edition, Sept. 15, 1891

title: The Daily Bag: Coach 1941
description: This suede fringe bag with grommets and a chain handle had a tough Western touch.  MALINA JOSEPH GILCHRIST

title: The Daily Shoe: Mansur Gavriel
description: These icy blue slides at Mansur Gavriel are like house slippers extraordinaire.  MALINA JOSEPH GILCHRIST

title: Re-enacting a Childhood Trauma on Video. For Art.
description: When she was 15, Antonia Wright was walking across the frozen surface of a reservoir near Boston with a friend when the ice gave way, and they both plunged into the freezing water.

title: Five Places to Shop in Florence
description: Florence may be known for its current designer offerings  from the likes of Ferragamo, Gucci and Marni  but savvy shoppers have also discovered that the city is full of exceptional vintage finds, from antiques, furniture and clothing to retro treasures. In fact, in the last few years the city has welcomed a number of new secondhand shops that have only added to the richness of an already considerable vintage shopping scene.

title: Off the Cuff, but on the Record
description: Suppose youre at a conference. The panels and keynotes and forums have broken up, and you head off to get a drink with a handful of attendees. Are you on the record?

title: Chiles Pension Problem
description: To the Editor:

title: The Refugee Experience
description: To the Editor:

title: Nick Kroll and John Mulaney Kvetch Their Way to Broadway
description: A walk through Times Square typically requires a high tolerance for exasperation, and even more so when it is spent in the company of Gil Faizon and George St. Geegland.

title: Why Plutos Moon Charon Wears a Red Cap
description: It turns out that Pluto may be responsible for maintaining the highlights on the red head of its biggest moon.

title: Fashion Week Photo Diary: Tory Burch, Rodarte, Coach 1941 and Brandon Maxwell
description: Scenes from the spring/summer 2017 collections which were presented in New York on Tuesday.

title: Ivana Trump Supports Dennis Basso, and Her Ex-Husband
description: Ivana Trump, best known as the first spouse of the 2016 Republican candidate for president and the woman who coined the term The Donald, made her New York Fashion Week spring 2017 debut at Dennis Basso on Tuesday, sitting front row at Moynihan Station on the West Side of Manhattan.

title: Michael Kors: Spring 2017
description: Mr. Kors, who just introduced a smartwatch, presents his latest collection.

title: After Years of War, Celebrities Find a Syrian Group to Back
description: The complex and brutal conflict in Syria has defied the best efforts of peace negotiators and humanitarian officials for more than five years, but a new group of luminaries is weighing in on a war that has cost hundreds of thousands of lives: celebrities.

title: Donald Trump and Kentuckys Downtrodden
description: To the Editor:

title: How to View a Richer Year for the Poor and Middle Class
description: The income and poverty report released on Tuesday by the Census Bureau was such a blockbuster that youd think the bureau had just issued Beyoncs next secret album the night before.

title: Review: Feminist Fight Club Takes On Workplace Sexism
description: The last 20 years has seen a reduction in many of the most blatant forms of workplace discrimination against women. A recent Harvard Business Review article reported, however, that subtle bias is often worse than the more overt variety. The very ambiguity of the behavior heightens stress and diminishes the chances of successfully seeking recourse, legal or otherwise. This could explain, in part, the stubborn persistence of the wage gap and continued underrepresentation of women in top corporate and professional roles  despite decades of women outnumbering and outperforming men through college.

title: Alicia Keys and the Tyranny of Makeup
description: It was the Friday before Labor Day, and Alicia Keys, the 35-year-old pop star, was on the Today show performing for the programs summer concert series  shes about to release a new album, and she wrote the theme song for Queen of Katwe, out next week. There was a lot to talk about. But instead, Ms. Keys spent most of her time talking about makeup (and not wearing it) with the anchors Tamron Hall, Billy Bush and Al Roker, who were doggedly wiping the pancake off their faces.

title: Big Bayer-Monsanto Deal Lags in Value
description: The German pharmaceutical group Bayer has finally agreed to buy the American seed-maker Monsanto for $66 billion. Shareholders in Bayer do not get the chance to vote on the takeover, but they have already made their views plain. Compared with the wider market, Bayer shares have probably lost $7 billion in value already.

title: Everythings Coming Up Daisies for Michael Kors
description: Of all the antidotes to Hillary Clintons recent stumble (literal and metaphorical) that could have appeared, the Michael Kors show is not the one that immediately leaps to mind.

title: Free Wi-Fi Kiosks Were to Aid New Yorkers. An Unsavory Side Has Spurred a Retreat.
description: The Wi-Fi kiosks in New York were designed to replace phone booths and allow users to consult maps, maybe check the weather or charge their phones. But they have also attracted people who linger for hours, sometimes drinking and doing drugs and, at times, boldly watching pornography on the sidewalks.

title: A.C.C. Pulls League Championships Out of North Carolina
description: The Atlantic Coast Conference announced Wednesday that it would move neutral-site championships for this academic year, including its football title game in December and its womens basketball tournament in March, out of North Carolina in reaction to a state law that curbed anti-discrimination protections for lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender people.

title: In a Besieged Town, No Food and No Escape
description: Hala Abdulwahab, 24, is a teacher in Madaya, Syria, near the Lebanese border. Civilians in the town struggle to get food on a daily basis.

title: Obama to Ring In Opening of African American Museum
description: Listen for the bells on Sept. 24 when churches in Washington and around the country are scheduled to herald the opening of the National Museum of African American History and Culture in Washington.

title: A Trip to Matty Bovans York Studio
description: The designer, who will present his first collection during London Fashion Week, has already worked with Marc Jacobs.

title: Inside an Emerging British Designers Candy-Colored World
description: Come take a look at this  this is a good color because its a bit gross, says the 26-year old British designer Matty Bovan as he pulls a swatch of neon green velour from underneath a sewing machine. How can it not be a bit revolting? he continues. I love taking these taboo fabrics like Aertex or velour that other designers would discredit  I like taking something wrong and making it desirable.

title: Jerry Browns Disappointing Tampon Tax Decision
description: On Tuesday, Gov. Jerry Brown of California unwisely vetoed a bill that would have exempted tampons, pads and other menstrual products from the states 7.5 percent sales tax. The measure passed the state Legislature unanimously in August. But Governor Brown vetoed it along with six other tax bills, arguing that tax breaks are the same as new spending and should be considered during budget deliberations. The seven bills would have cut state revenue by around $300 million over the next two years, he said.

title: Jessica Alba Parties at Tory Burchs Home for Fashion Week
description: Tuesday nights festivities included cocktails at the Pierre Hotel for Ms. Burchs new collection, and a party for Interview magazine.

title: Hillary and Me: A Tale of Two Pneumonias
description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how news, features and opinion come together at The New York Times. In this piece, Donald G. McNeil Jr., a Times science writer, shares what its like when your own hacking cough collides with the Democratic presidential nominees.

title: Jessica Alba Parties at Tory Burchs Home for Fashion Week
description: On Tuesday, Tory Burch hosted a party in her home at the Pierre Hotel to celebrate her Gemini Link collection. Later that night, Interview magazine hosted a party to celebrate its September issue.

title: A Debate Moderators Role
description: To the Editor:

title: Model Beauty Secrets, From a New York Fashion Week Newcomer
description: Backstage at Michael Kors spring/summer 2017 show, the mix of models represented exactly what the designer had in mind: I really wanted diversity as far as the look of the girls, and diversity as far as body types, he said. And in between supernovas from Kendall Jenner to Carolyn Murphy, stood the striking 5 11 Mayowa Nicholas, a newcomer who only began modeling two years ago but has already made quite a mark. Since winning an Elite modeling competition in her native Nigeria in 2014, Nicholas has walked for a number of top-tier European fashion houses including Christian Dior, Prada, Miu Miu, Herms and Loewe. (After closing Loewe, Nicholas posted on Instagram: Dreams do come true.) Last fall, Nicholas became the first Nigerian model to star in a Dolce & Gabbana ad campaign  a milestone moment not only for the Lagos-born beauty, but the industry as a whole. T caught up with Nicholas to talk about her debut at New York Fashion Week this season, her beauty secrets and why Kors is a true fashion king.

title: The Characters of New York Fashion Week
description: Collections from Coach, Tory Burch, Brandon Maxwell, Vera Wang, Rodarte and Narciso Rodriguez.

title: Are Subpoenas on Exxon Mobil Inquiries Valid? Experts Say Yes, and No
description: A House committee heard conflicting testimony on Wednesday over exceptional subpoenas arising from investigations of Exxon Mobil by state attorneys general.

title: Uniform Dressing Has Its Big Moment
description: How to achieve the look but still stand out.

title: How to Keep the Great Comet Party Going on Broadway: Dish Out the Pierogies (and Add Josh Groban)
description: In the beginning, there was the book. Famously long, and a bit of a slog. But Volume 2 Part 5 caught the cruise ship pianists eye.

title: A New Theater Season of Hitting the Boards Hard, From Broadway to Oregon
description: Dates are subject to change.

title: SUNY to Stop Asking Applicants About Felony Convictions
description: For years, the State University of New York included this query on its undergraduate application: Have you ever been convicted of a felony?

title: Autopilot Cited in Death of Chinese Tesla Driver
description: Tesla Motors came under renewed questioning about the safety of its Autopilot technology after news emerged on Wednesday of a fatal crash in China that may have occurred while the automated driver-assist system was operating.

title: Human Glitter. The Beckerman Twins Are Fashion Week Stars
description: Sam and Cailli Beckerman go through every waking moment as if they have just won the big prize on the fun wheel. They radiate optimism to an almost absurd degree. They dress bravely and outrageously.

title: Denzel Washington, Ethan Hawke and Antoine Fuqua on The Magnificent Seven
description: TORONTO  At the heart of The Magnificent Seven, John Sturgess classic 1960 western, is a group of flawed men (including Yul Brynner, Steve McQueen, Charles Bronson and James Coburn) who have never worked as a team, but who come together to defeat a nefarious bandit (Eli Wallach). That dynamic, adapted from Akira Kurosawas Seven Samurai, endures in the director Antoine Fuquas update of The Magnificent Seven, in which Denzel Washington, Ethan Hawke, Chris Pratt and others are the mismatched gunslingers; Peter Sarsgaard is the ruthless industrialist they are set against.

title: Michael Kors Spring 2017
description: The optimistic show included a live performance by Rufus Wainwright.

title: Scottish Nurse Who Had Ebola Is Cleared of Misconduct
description: LONDON  A Scottish nurse who contracted Ebola in Sierra Leone in 2014 and had been accused of concealing her high temperature from health officials after her return to Britain was cleared of professional misconduct charges at an administrative hearing on Wednesday.

title: Sales of Hillary Clintons New Book Are Off to a Slow Start
description: Hillary Clintons newest book, Stronger Together, which provides a policy blueprint for where she hopes to take the country if she is elected president, sold just 2,912 copies in its first week on sale, according to Nielsen BookScan.

title: Gabriela Hearst Spring 2017
description: Looks from the designers spring 2017 collection.

title: Threes a Trend: Luxe Silk Bra Tops
description: While some designers this season took the concept of the classic pinstriped shirt and turned it on its head  others eschewed shirts altogether. Alexander Wang sent a lace-trimmed bra down the runway, poking out from under a tuxedo jacket, Victoria Beckham showed a crushed-silk version with matching trousers  and Phillip Lim paired a silk bra with a Western-inspired embroidered jacket.

title: Gabriela Hearst, Now a Horsewoman of a Different Color
description: Gabriela Hearst is a natural ambassador for wool. She grew up, as has been lavishly documented in the press, on a ranch in Uruguay with thousands of sheep, though she has since relocated to an expensive ZIP code in Manhattan. She requires little prodding to celebrate wools versatility and its strength.

title: Lula, Brazils Ex-President, Is Charged With Corruption
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Federal prosecutors in Brazil filed corruption charges Wednesday against Luiz Incio Lula da Silva, the former president who has wielded influence across Latin America for decades, portraying him as the mastermind of a sprawling graft scheme intended to maintain his partys grip on the presidency.

title: How Long Is an Actress Onscreen? A New Tool Finds the Answer Faster.
description: The effort to catalog the inequity in onscreen roles for women and minorities has a new weapon. The Geena Davis Institute on Gender in Media, at Mount Saint Marys University, with financial backing from Google.org, the companys philanthropic division, will announce on Wednesday a tool that employs video- and audio-recognition technology, along with algorithms, to identify gender, speaking time and additional details about characters presented in films, television shows and other media.

title: Rufus Wainwright Gets Happy at Michael Kors
description: Fashion shows are not always uplifting affairs. Yet there was Rufus Wainwright at the Michael Kors show Wednesday morning, singing Judy Garlands Get Happy with a six-piece band as models marched out in white twin sets and floral print dresses.

title: The Modern Love Podcast: Kristin Chenoweth Reads Revenge of the Friend
description: In this episode of Modern Love: The Podcast, the actress Kristin Chenoweth (Wicked, Glee) reads the essay Revenge of the Friend, about a spinning instructor whose usually pleasant Saturday-morning class is upset by a couple of new cyclists.

title: Boss Women: Spring 2017
description: Designer Jason Wu shows his spring 2017 womens collection.

title: See How Popular Your Flickr Photos Are
description: Q. Is there a way to see a chart of how many people have looked at my Flickr photos?

title: Muslim Teenager Proposes Emoji of Woman Wearing a Head Scarf
description: BERLIN  The choice of princess, bride or dancer did not really allow Rayouf Alhumedhi to express herself in a chat room she was creating. As a Muslim teenager in Germany who wears a head scarf, she was disappointed by the standard emoji options on her smartphone keyboard.

title: Hillary Clinton and Donald Trump Give More Details on Their Health
description: With less than eight weeks until Election Day and pressure mounting for the candidates to give details about their health and medical histories, Donald J. Trump acknowledged on Wednesday that he was overweight and taking a cholesterol-fighting drug, and Hillary Clinton elaborated on the circumstances that led to her contracting pneumonia and the medicine she was taking to recover.

title: U.N. Chief Says North Korea Has Spawned Unprecedented Tension
description: UNITED NATIONS  Secretary General Ban Ki-moon warned on Wednesday that North Koreas repeated tests of nuclear bombs and ballistic missiles had created unprecedented tension in the region.

title: Considering Cremation? What You Need to Know
description: Cremation is becoming more popular than burial, but getting clear information about options and prices can be a challenge, a new report finds.

title: Prostate Cancer Study Details Value of Treatments
description: A new study offers important information to men who are facing difficult decisions about how to treat prostate cancer in its early stages, or whether to treat it at all.

title: Fox Co-Presidents Sign Multiyear Contracts
description: Fox News already doubled down on its leadership team last month when it announced that Roger Ailess major deputies were being elevated into top positions at the network.

title: Home to High-Security Lab and Source of Rumors, Plum Island Faces Uncertain Future
description: PLUM ISLAND, N.Y.  There have been comparisons to the H.G. Wells novel, The Island of Dr. Moreau, a nod from Hannibal Lecter in The Silence of the Lambs, and a murder mystery called Plum Island, by Nelson DeMille, in 1997. When the carcass of an unidentified animal was found on a Long Island beach a few years ago, it became popularly known as the Montauk Monster, and local residents said it had come from  where else?  Plum Island.

title: Shop the Newest See-Now, Buy-Now Collections
description: Shop the see-now/buy-now collections just shown at New York Fashion Week. Youll find items like an oversize cashmere Love intarsia pullover ($995) at the new Michael Kors serialized pop-up shop titled the Kors Edit, where Septembers theme is Ready-to-Wear, Ready to Go. At 384 Bleecker Street.

title: Review: Blood at the Root, a Tale of Racial Cleansing Close to Home
description: Early one morning in September 1912, an 18-year-old white girl named Mae Crow was discovered in the Georgia woods, badly beaten and barely alive. It took only a day for the Forsyth County sheriff to arrest three young black male suspects. Two were hanged by the state within two months; the other was hanged by a mob within 48 hours.

title: The Exciting New Directions of a Few Top Designers
description: Three creative forces are developing surprising products with unexpected partners.

title: Review: A Zany Rene Zellweger and Mystery Daddy in Bridget Joness Baby
description: Who could dislike Bridget Jones, the zany screwball heroine whose latest and probably last screen incarnation, in Bridget Joness Baby, finds the character back where she started: alone and single?

title: Review: Ushers Hard II Love Uses Regret as a Selling Point
description: No one converts an apology into a come-on more suavely than Usher, who releases his eighth solo studio album, Hard II Love, this week. Its a stratagem he perfected as far back as 2004 with Confessions, which became his best-selling album. Some sincere contrition, a request for mercy, an appeal to a longtime bond, a reminder of physical chemistry and voil  hes sweet-talked his way to another chance.

title: That Cute Whale You Clicked On? Its Doomed
description: I was scrolling through Instagram when I saw it: a white fuzz ball of a baby seal, snuggling in a snowdrift. I stared dopily into its clear black eyes, squealed at the screen and tapped the cartoon heart beneath the photo. You better believe I liked it.

title: $100 Million Awarded in Contest to Rethink U.S. High Schools
description: An organization announced on Wednesday that it had chosen the winners of $10 million grants in a competition to rethink the American high school.

title: MoMA Will Make Thousands of Exhibition Images Available Online
description: The Museum of Modern Art, which has defined Modernism more powerfully than perhaps any other institution, can often seem monolithic in the minds eye, essentially unchanged since its doors opened in 1929: a procession of solemn white-box galleries, an ice palace of formalism, the Kremlin (as the artist Martha Rosler once called it) of 20th-century art.

title: Congress Considers Plan to Curb Ticket Bots
description: WASHINGTON  Senator Bill Nelson sounded exasperated. I did not get to go see Hamilton, this Florida Democrat told the musicals lead producer on Tuesday. The reason I didnt go: I did not want to pay $800 a ticket.

title: Trump Talks About His Health on Dr. Oz
description: Donald J. Trump taped an episode of The Dr. Oz Show on Wednesday and handed over a one-page summary of his recent physical examination.

title: Hillsong Casts a Secular Lens on an Evangelical Band
description: Michael John Warren, the director of MTV documentaries about Drake and Nicki Minaj, perked up a few years ago when he heard about a big music film that was kicking around Hollywood.

title: U.S. Presidential Race, Colin Powell, Carla Hayden: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Review: Blossom, a Puppets Tale of Alzheimers
description: With his tufted white eyebrows and kindly old face, James Blossom is instantly endearing  even more so in his patterned sweater vest and jaunty bow tie. But when he first appears at the start of Spencer Lotts puppet play, Blossom, at Dixon Place, James is outfitted for underwater adventure.

title: Off the Runway: Day 7
description: Scenes from New York Fashion Week on Wednesday.

title: Off the Runway: Day 7
description: Moments from the shows of Naeem Khan, Bibhu Mohapatra and Delpozo.

title: All Syrians Are Tired of This Absurd War: Voices From the Cease-Fire
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  In rebel-held areas of Syria, Day 2 of a shaky cease-fire offered a rare chance to go outside. For some, that meant enjoying the simple pleasure of playing on a swing. For others, it meant protesting.

title: Jack Hofsiss, Stage Director of The Elephant Man, Dies at 65
description: Jack Hofsiss, who became the youngest director to win a Tony Award when, at 28, he was honored for his work on The Elephant Man in 1979, and who resumed his career after being paralyzed in a diving accident, died on Tuesday at his home in Manhattan. He was 65.

title: New Librarian of Congress Offers a History Lesson in Her Own Right
description: WASHINGTON  On the night in April 2015 that Baltimore went up in flames, Carla D. Hayden, the citys chief librarian, was under pressure to board up a neighborhood library branch and wait out the violence triggered by the death of Freddie Gray after being injured in police custody.

title: Four Actresses Everyone Will Be Talking About This Fall
description: These four actresses, featured in films scheduled for release this fall, are newcomers to film or new to American audiences. They wont be unfamiliar names for long.

title: Wells Fargo Subpoenaed in Sham Account Case
description: Wells Fargo has received subpoenas from three different United States attorneys offices in the last week, escalating an investigation into how thousands of bank employees came to secretly issue more than a million sham accounts without customers consent.

title: Marchesa: Spring 2017
description: Georgina Chapman and Keren Craig present their latest looks.

title: Clinton Foundation Initiative to Become Independent if Hillary Wins
description: The largest arm of the Bill, Hillary & Chelsea Clinton Foundation will spin off into an independent organization if Hillary Clinton is elected president, the charity said Wednesday in the latest effort by the foundation and the campaign to alleviate concerns about potential conflicts of interest.

title: Jurors Picked for Bridge Scandal Trial as Opinions About Chris Christie Are Aired
description: NEWARK  The jury of seven women and five men that will decide whether a political scandal involving the closing of approach lanes at the George Washington Bridge rose to the level of a federal crime includes a certified paralegal who lives in the same town as Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey and says she does not like him.

title: Rights Groups, Riding Film Publicity, Urge Pardon for Edward Snowden
description: WASHINGTON  Three human rights groups on Wednesday urged President Obama to pardon Edward J. Snowden, the former intelligence contractor who leaked secret documents about National Security Agency surveillance in 2013 and is living in Russia as a fugitive from criminal charges.

title: A Healthy Snack on the M66
description: Dear Diary:

title: Union Leader of New Hampshire Endorses Gary Johnson Over Donald Trump
description: When Donald J. Trump returns to campaign in New Hampshire on Thursday, he will be greeted by a familiar, if unwelcome, sight  a blistering attack on the front page of The Union Leader.

title: Disney Cuts 250 Jobs in Consumer Products and Digital Unit
description: LOS ANGELES  Disney cut 5 percent of its consumer products and digital media staff on Wednesday, or about 250 jobs, a spokesman said, the latest in a series of belt-tightening moves by the worlds largest entertainment conglomerate.

title: You Dont Know What Arte Povera Is? They Can Change That
description: ROME  If you dont know much about Arte Povera, the 1960s Italian avant-garde movement whose proponents created minimalist works using humble or organic materials, two New York collectors are hoping to change that.

title: Myanmars Leader Has a Longtime Champion in Mitch McConnell
description: WASHINGTON  As Myanmars pro-democracy figure and government leader, Daw Aung San Suu Kyi, makes her way through Washingtons power centers this week, one face is particularly familiar: Senator Mitch McConnell, who has been watching her for decades, usually at great remove.

title: Myanmar Leaders Unexpected Supporter
description: Of all the relationships Daw Aung San Suu Kyi has made with American officials, the most longstanding is with Senator Mitch McConnell, the lead sponsor of U.S. sanctions on Myanmar.

title: Julio Gonzalez, Arsonist Who Killed 87 at New York Club in 90, Dies at 61
description: Julio Gonzalez, a jilted lover whose arson revenge at the unlicensed Happy Land nightclub in the Bronx in 1990 claimed 87 lives, making him the nations worst single mass murderer at the time, died on Tuesday at a hospital in Plattsburgh, N.Y., where he had been taken from prison. He was 61.

title: A Rebounding Economy Remains Fragile for Many
description: WASHINGTON  The eye-popping improvement in economic fortunes last year raises the question: If incomes are up and poverty is down, why is Donald J. Trumps message of economic decay resonating so broadly?

title: Obama Prods Netanyahu After Signing of U.S.-Israel Aid Deal
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama on Wednesday renewed his call for a two-state solution to the Israeli-Palestinian conflict and argued that it was crucial to Israels security, using the completion of a new agreement to provide $38 billion in American military aid as an occasion to prod Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on a long-running dispute.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Im just doing small electrical jobs to dog-paddle my way through till Mr. Trump gets elected.

title: Arrest Made in Arson at Mosque That Orlando Nightclub Gunman Attended
description: A Florida man who espoused anti-Islamic views on social media was charged with arson on Wednesday in connection with a fire on Sunday that damaged a mosque in Fort Pierce, Fla., the authorities said.

title: Marines Scrutinize a Culture of Toughness After a Muslim Recruits Death
description: At Parris Island in South Carolina, the Marine Corpss oldest and most famous training center, the Third Recruit Training Battalion was called the Thumping Third  a nickname it earned through drill instructors reputation for dishing out physical abuse.

title: Americas Mr. Diplomacy
description: Since becoming secretary of state more than three years ago, John Kerry has been a man on a mission  multiple missions, in fact  relentlessly traveling the globe in search of diplomatic solutions to the worlds toughest problems.

title: Russian Hackers Draw Attention to Drug-Use Exemptions for Athletes
description: After Major League Baseball added amphetamines to its list of banned substances in 2007, many players appeared to exploit a loophole. They applied for what is known as a therapeutic use exemption, a waiver to use a prohibited drug for a legitimate medical reason.

title: Neighbor Recalls Potsdam Killing: A Scream, a Crash, and Then It Was Silent
description: CANTON, N.Y.  The scream was high-pitched, the witness said, almost feminine, and undeniably scared.

title: Check From Trump Foundation Sent to Committee Supporting the Florida Attorney General
description: On Sept. 9, 2013, Donald J. Trump signed a check from his foundation to And Justice for All, a political committee supporting Pam Bondi, the Florida attorney general. The date of the check, which was included in documents released on Tuesday by the New York attorney general, highlights that the contribution appeared to be on its way before Ms. Bondi's office said publicly that it was reviewing complaints about Mr. Trump's for-profit education company, Trump University.

title: New Records Shed Light on Donald Trumps $25,000 Gift to Florida Official
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla.  It was Aug. 29, 2013, an unremarkable day inside Floridas whitewashed Capitol, and a typically sweltering one outside among the moss-bearded oaks and sabal palms. Around 3:45 p.m., Jennifer Meale, the communications director for Attorney General Pam Bondi, fielded a seemingly routine call from a financial reporter for The Orlando Sentinel. The attorney general of New York had recently filed a lawsuit against Donald J. Trump alleging fraud in the marketing of Trump Universitys real estate and wealth-building seminars. Had Florida ever conducted its own investigation, the reporter asked.

title: Mets Lose Game but Not Any Ground
description: WASHINGTON  The out-of-town results at Nationals Park are displayed on an electronic scoreboard along the wall in right-center field, and from the visitors dugout along the third-base line, the Mets had a clear view of what their competitors were doing. So even though they fell to the Washington Nationals, 1-0, on Wednesday afternoon on one pitch from Fernando Salas to Wilson Ramos, the Mets knew exactly where they stood.

title: Pandemonium Ensues After Fight on J Train
description: When Josh Fjelstad boarded the J train in Bushwick, Brooklyn, on Wednesday morning, he thought he might be early for his job in Manhattan.

title: Yankees Match a Dominant Kershaw, Then Fumble the Game Away
description: After the torrent of rain had subsided and the ominous clouds had passed by, replaced by the encroaching darkness of the early evening, Clayton Kershaw occupied the mound at Yankee Stadium, undisturbed by nature or precaution. The Yankees and the Los Angeles Dodgers had waited through 48 minutes of a rain delay  their second of the day  and it stood to reason that Kershaw would not still be standing when it dissipated.

title: Sowing Doubt Is Seen as Prime Danger in Hacking Voting System
description: WASHINGTON  Russian hackers would not be able to change the outcome of the United States presidential election, the nations most senior intelligence and law enforcement officials have assured Congress and the White House in recent weeks.

title: A Twin Threat Rises in Buffalo
description: ORCHARD PARK, N.Y  The coaches are fraternal twins. One wears a beard and long gray hair, and the other a fresh haircut and shave.

title: Parents Renew a Personal Push to Compel CPR Training for Police in New York
description: In summer 2010, 11-year-old Briana Ojeda had an asthma attack on a playground in the Carroll Gardens section of Brooklyn. Unwilling to wait for an ambulance, her mother, Carmen Ojeda, rushed Briana into the familys car and sped toward Long Island College Hospital.

title: Florida Gets Help to Deal With Backlog of Zika Tests
description: MIAMI  Gov. Rick Scott of Florida announced on Wednesday that the state was getting help to speed up the results of Zika tests, a move that should reduce the inordinately long waits  sometimes up to five weeks  experienced by hundreds of pregnant women who took the state-offered tests at no cost.

title: A Dream Start as Leicester Citys Fairy Tale Arrives in Europe
description: BRUGES, Belgium  Leicester Citys fans gathered in the shadows of dreaming spires and sang. They thronged the cobbled streets by the thousands. They hung their flags from the gingerbread facades of delicate redbrick buildings, the storybook backdrop to the next chapter of their fairy tale.

title: Trapped
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  Ian Livengood, by all accounts, is a very nice person. Hes well-liked in the puzzle community, his wife still allows him to live with her and his dog thinks hes just swell.

title: Ralph Lauren: Fall 2016
description: The designer shuts down a city block to show a shoppable fall collection.

title: Review: Marie and Rosetta Ruminates on Gospel, R&B and Life
description: Theres an upright piano on the stage of the Atlantic Theater Company, where Marie and Rosetta, a new play by George Brant, supplemented by some mighty music-making, opened on Wednesday night. But it may take awhile for you to notice, since the more striking aspect of Riccardo Hernndezs set is the array of coffins surrounding that piano, some of them draped with dresses.

title: Donald Trump Gets Cool Reception at Black Church in Flint, Mich.
description: FLINT, Mich.  Donald J. Trump traveled Wednesday to Michigan, a state that has not voted Republican in more than two decades, as he reached out to African-Americans with remarks at a local church and toured a water-treatment plant in a city that has battled dangerously high levels of lead and contaminated water.

title: Faculty Lockout at L.I.U.-Brooklyn Ends With Contract Agreement
description: A faculty lockout at Long Island University-Brooklyn ended on Wednesday after 12 days, with the administration and the faculty agreeing to extend a contract that had expired at the end of August.

title: How the Trump and Clinton Child Care Plans Stack Up
description: Donald J. Trump on Tuesday proposed universal paid maternity leave and new subsidies for child care, departing in some ways from Republican orthodoxy. In most respects, his plan is significantly less generous than what Hillary Clinton has called for, and both are far less expansive than the benefits offered by most developed nations.

title: Nious Victory Spotlights the Diverse Communities Living in Lower Manhattan
description: For nearly 40 years, one name had been synonymous with Lower Manhattan politics: Sheldon Silver.

title: Top Investigator in Case of Missing Students in Mexico Resigns
description: MEXICO CITY  The chief of criminal investigations for Mexicos attorney general resigned late Wednesday amid an internal affairs inquiry into his offices handling of the case of 43 college students who vanished nearly two years ago.

title: Drivers Take Off for Muslim Holiday, and New York Is in Short Supply of Yellow
description: When Nilay Patel left his office Monday evening, he looked around for a cab.

title: Mr. Robot Season 2, Episode 11: The Dark Room
description: Nearly every scene in Wednesdays Mr. Robot consists simply of two characters talking. But these scenes, as with the conversations these characters have, involve two distinct and indispensable sides. There are the pairs doing the talking, yes: a prisoner and a child, an executive and a government official, an F.B.I. agent and her electronic home companion, a prisoner and her captor, a prisoner (now liberated) and her lawyer, and a madman and a dead man, to name a few. But this is no parade of talky two-handers. In addition to the actors and their dialogue, each of these tightly constructed exchanges involves set design, sound design, cinematography and editing so distinctive, so breathlessly bold, they might as well be from different shows.

title: Frank J. Barbaro, Liberal New York Lawmaker, Dies at 88
description: Frank J. Barbaro, a former longshoreman and liberal state assemblyman from Brooklyn who was Edward I. Kochs chief challenger for re-election to a second term as mayor of New York, died on Sept. 4 at his home in Watervliet, N.Y. He was 88.

title: Corrections: September 15, 2016
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: Obama Creates Atlantic Oceans First Marine Monument
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama on Thursday created the Atlantic Oceans first United States marine monument, preserving an expanse of sea canyons and underwater mountains off the New England coast as he races to use his executive power to protect vast stretches of land and water before he leaves office.

title: As Britain Confronts Brexit, a Canadian Takes Center Stage: Mark Carney
description: LONDON  On a soggy morning in late June, as Britain absorbed the staggering news that it had voted to abandon the European Union, a stone-faced Canadian took to national television to offer assurances that the world was not ending.

title: Whats on TV Thursday: Rene Zellweger in Bridget Joness Diary and Donald J. Trump
description: Treat yourself to a refresher course on Bridget Joness Diary before the arrival of Bridget Joness Baby in theaters. Julie Delpy returns to Paris, and love, in Lolo. And Donald J. Trump chats with Dr. Mehmet Oz and Jimmy Fallon.

title: Nearly Two-Thirds of Refugee Children Attend No School, U.N. Says
description: Nearly two-thirds of the six million school-age children classified as refugees have no school to attend, the United Nations said Thursday in a report highlighting education as an overlooked casualty of the global refugee crisis.

title: Fantasy Football: Players to Start in Week 2
description: The Sablich brothers have provided award-winning fantasy football advice for The New York Times since 2010. See their weekly player rankings and visit 5thDownFantasy.com for more fantasy analysis. You can also ask them questions through their Twitter account, @5thdownfantasy.

description: silt  \silt\  noun and verb
