Sandra Y. Hong, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated at the home of the grooms parents in Southampton, N.Y.

title: Whats on TV Sunday: The 68th Emmy Awards and Bruce Springsteen
description: For snippets of some of the years best television and its stars, watch the 68th Emmy Awards. Bruce Springsteen talks about his new autobiography, Born to Run, on CBS Sunday Morning. And Royal Wives at War dramatizes the friction between the Queen Mother and the Duchess of Windsor.

title: Corrections: September 18, 2016
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Explosion Causes Extensive Disruptions to Travel in Manhattan
description: The explosion in Manhattan  and the investigation that followed  caused extensive disruptions on Saturday night into Sunday for car traffic in a large area of the city and for mass transit.

title: Chelsea Bombing: What We Know and Dont Know
description: Prosecutors on Tuesday charged Ahmad Khan Rahami, 28, in federal court in New York in connection with bombings in the Chelsea neighborhood of Manhattan and in New Jersey on Saturday.

title: 17 Indian Soldiers Killed by Militants in Kashmir
description: NEW DELHI  In one of the deadliest attacks in the disputed region of Kashmir, heavily armed militants stormed an Indian Army base near the border with Pakistan early Sunday, killing 17 soldiers.

title: Donald Trump, Hillary Clinton, Buffalo Bills: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Here are the weeks top stories, and a look ahead.

title: Anya Hindmarch: Spring 2017
description: The designer will show her collection while simultaneously guest curating a contemporary art auction at Sothebys.

title: Here Is Your Emmy Awards Cheat Sheet
description: [ Our full report on the 2016 Emmy Awards | the list of Emmy winners | red carpet looks | our critics review of the show ]

title: Preen by Thornton Bregazzi: Spring 2017
description: Justin Thornton & Thea Bregazzi present their latest collection.

title: Mary Katrantzou: Spring 2017
description: Ms. Katrantzou, who recently designed costumes for a ballet at Pariss Opera Bastille, shows her spring 2017 collection.

title: Berlin Election Deals Angela Merkels Party Another Blow
description: BERLIN  Chancellor Angela Merkels party suffered the latest in a string of defeats in German state elections on Sunday, when her Christian Democratic Union was ousted from power in Berlin after its worst showing in the capital since World War II, according to preliminary results.

title: 1941: Britain Gets American Aid
description: AT A BRITISH PORT  Cargoes of lease-lend goods, and other materials ordered from America in cash-and-carry days, are pouring into England at an average rate of 850.000 tons a week and are being handled promptly, a visit to this large port revealed today [Sept. 18].

title: We Built an App: Keeping Track of Louisianas Flood-Tossed Tombs
description: DENHAM SPRINGS, La.  On a steamy hot afternoon, Arbie Goings was out looking for the itinerant dead.

title: Americas Infrastructure Is Getting Worse
description: In one of the few things they agree on, both Donald J. Trump and Hillary Clinton have said they would spend billions more on Americas aging roads, bridges, hospitals, schools and public transportation systems.

title: Coming Soon, Economists Hope: Big Spending on Roads, Bridges and Ports
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  The docks at the Port of Oakland are a tangle of cranes, shipping containers, railroad tracks and snaking lines of trucks waiting to load and unload cargo.

title: Manhattan Bombs Provide Trove of Clues; F.B.I. Questions 5 People
description: A bomb that injured 29 people on Saturday in the Chelsea neighborhood of Manhattan, and another that failed to detonate, were filled with shrapnel and made with pressure cookers, flip phones and Christmas lights to set off a powerful explosive compound, law enforcement officials said on Sunday.

title: F.B.I. Treats Minnesota Mall Stabbing Attack as Potential Act of Terrorism
description: A report by a news agency linked to the Islamic State claimed on Sunday that a soldier of the Islamic State was behind a stabbing attack on Saturday night at a Minnesota shopping mall, an episode that the F.B.I. said it was investigating as a potential act of terrorism. Nine people were injured in the attack before an off-duty police officer fatally shot the knife-wielding man, the authorities in St. Cloud said.

title: A Weekend Whirlwind: Simone Rochas Nostalgia and Henry Hollands Cheeky Tees
description: LONDON  Fashion may be an industry based on change, but in the wake of Britains vote to leave the European Union and the rise of the see-now, buy-now collections, few in the industry said they could recall a London season that felt more in a state of transition. Some familiar faces also stayed away from the opening weekend, doubtless taking a breather before the show marathon moves onto Milan and then to Paris.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Speech by Eric Rosengren of Federal Reserve Bank of Boston
description: A speech given Sept. 9 in which Mr. Rosengren, president of the Boston Fed, argues that it's time to begin gradually raising interest rates.

title: Explosion Rocks Manhattan
description: The authorities believe a homemade bomb caused the explosion in the Chelsea neighborhood about 8:30 p.m. Saturday, injuring 29. A second device was later found four blocks away.

title: Contests in New Hampshire May Alter Political Map
description: New Hampshire is in the bottom quarter of states in terms of its electoral and popular votes in the United States presidential race. But no other place has more competitive races with national implications.

title: A Routine Night, Until an Explosion Lifted Her Off Her Feet
description: In the shadow of Bellevue Hospital Center, cast by a luminescent moon early Sunday, the only hint of the chaos that had erupted on the other side of Manhattan hours earlier was a trim woman in gray sweatpants and a royal-blue button-down shirt who limped out onto First Avenue.

title: N.F.L.: Heres What We Learned in Week 2
description: Optimism is easy to come by in the offseason, but maintaining it in the regular season for even two games can be far more difficult. Just ask the Jaguars (0-2), the Raiders (1-1, with 69 points allowed through two games) and the Buccaneers (1-1 after being crushed 40-7 by the Cardinals).

title: At Topshop Unique, an 80s Supermodel Curl
description: The ravishing beauty of 1980s supermodels was the powerful starting point for the saturated Rapunzel curls backstage at Topshop Unique for spring/summer 2017. We were going to go quite extreme with a ponytail, explained the hairstylist Duffy. But it felt too young, so weve gone for a more mature style. Overloading the hair with LOreal Professionals PHI to create a matte finish, Duffy blasted it with the dryer (no brushing required), pulling it into a topknot tied together with any old elastic, before piling on lashings of Volume Life Mousse. After allowing the hair to set, he carefully twisted and twirled small sections around a curling iron with the dimensions of a chopstick. The real power move was to stop short of what Duffy termed instant noodle hair, by literally clapping the curls between the palms of the hands to break them up, for a more modern, lived-in look. Once complete, the elastic was snipped out and the hair swept over either to the left or the right of models heads, in what amounted to a hair homage to a young Cindy Crawford.

title: Peter Pilotto: Spring 2017
description: Peter Pilotto and Christopher De Vos show their spring designs.

title: An Explosion in Manhattan
description: A blast ripped through Chelsea around 8:30 p.m. on Saturday, injuring 29 people.

title: 1966: New Met Opera Opens
description: NEW YORK  The new Metropolitan Opera House opened in a blaze of glory Friday night, [Sept. 18] settling a dispute with its orchestra and thrilling one of its most glittering audiences ever gathered in New York. Mrs. Lyndon B. Johnson headed personalities at the Lincoln Center first night  which had threatened to be the last for some time. But as the curtain was about to rise for the last act of Antony and Cleopatra, Met general manager Rudolf Bing took the stage of the $47 million Opera House to announce that a strike by the musicians was over.

title: Emmy Awards 2016: Emmys Welcome Surprises Along With the Favorites
description: [ The list of Emmy winners | red carpet looks | our critics review of the show ]

title: Obama, Keen to Push Israeli-Palestinian Peace, Will Meet With Netanyahu
description: President Obama arrived in New York City on Sunday evening for three days that will mix election-year politics with a farewell to the world stage at the United Nations. But the visit comes against a suddenly tense backdrop, after a powerful explosion rocked a Manhattan street and a man claiming fealty to the Islamic State stabbed several people in a Minnesota shopping mall.

title: Straightforward Answers to Basic Questions About Syrias War
description: You could be forgiven, after five years of Syrias war dominating front pages, for feeling lost.

title: Mulberry: Spring 2017
description: Johnny Coca presents his second collection for the house.

title: Ultra Runner Karl Meltzer Sets Appalachian Trail Record, Fueled by Beer and Candy
description: At a time when endurance running no longer means mere marathons  and even 100-mile races are attracting the masses  Karl Meltzer, a former ski-resort bartender, has proved he can suffer longer and faster than almost anyone else.

title: Fashion Week Photo Diary: JW Anderson, Simone Rocha and Molly Goddard
description: Scenes from the spring/summer 2017 collections which were presented in London on Saturday.

title: Improving the U.N.
The United Nations Explained: Its Purpose, Power and Problems
description: Almost everybody has heard of the United Nations. But how many people know what it actually does? Or how it works? Or why, as world leaders gather to kick off the 71st session of the United Nations General Assembly, the institution has struggled to live up to the promise of its founders: making the world a better, more peaceful place?

title: La La Land Wins Top Prize at Toronto International Film Festival
description: Adding to its early status as an Oscar front-runner, the moody musical La La Land, directed by Damien Chazelle and starring Emma Stone and Ryan Gosling, on Sunday received the Toronto International Film Festivals top prize, the audience award for best feature film.

title: Blair Witch and Bridget Jones Sequels Lag; Sully Again No. 1
description: LOS ANGELES  Add two more sequels to the flop heap.

title: After Blast, New Yorkers Examine Themselves for Psychological Shrapnel
description: As detectives scoured every inch of the bomb scene in Chelsea on Sunday, New Yorkers were conducting their own investigations. But theirs were turned inward, as they felt around for the psychological shrapnel that an explosion on a busy city street is designed to release, as damaging in its way as the kind that tears into flesh.

title: Temperley London: Spring 2017
description: One of the Duchess of Cambridges go-to designers, Alice Temperley shows her latest looks.

title: Lil Buck and Jon Boogz, Wearing Paint as They Tell a Tale
description: It might seem all too obvious. Two young black men sit on a sofa watching the awful news of recent events  police shootings, the Orlando massacre  before venturing outside, where they are ignored, shunned and eventually shot. But in the lushly hypnotic video Color of Reality, a quick tale told through movement and visual art, these men are dancers and their message is not just about social justice. Its also about their art.

title: Philharmonic Shines in Live Unison With Films as It Kicks Off 175th Season
description: Of all the projects Alan Gilbert has introduced as music director of the New York Philharmonic, the series that screens classic films synced to the live playing of the scores may be the most popular. There is something magical about having the great Philharmonic serve as, in effect, a live studio orchestra for beloved films. Still, to ready these movies for screenings in concert requires considerable technical tinkering, and the results can be imperfect.

title: Review: In Kevin Can Wait, a Certain Domestic Dja Vu
description: Either Kevin waited too long, or he didnt wait long enough.

title: Jacoby Brissett Gets Job Done for Patriots After Jimmy Garoppolo Injury
description: The clicking sound heard throughout the Northeast on Sunday, was fans of the New England Patriots frantically searching the internet for anything they could find on Jacoby Brissett, a rookie quarterback unexpectedly forced into action after a shoulder injury knocked Jimmy Garoppolo out of the game.

title: Review: Welcome Home, a 1970s Flashback on Governors Island
description: Technically, it wasnt her childhood home. But in the case of Colleen Thomass new site-specific work, Welcome Home, inspired by her years growing up on Governors Island  her father was a photographer for the Coast Guard  it was close enough. She wanted to set the piece in her familys former residence, where she lived from age 6 to 12, but it suffered severe water damage during Hurricane Sandy. She compromised with another home nearby.

title: Review: Setting a Squadron of Joyless Worker Drones to Music
description: Early in monumental, a choreographic denunciation of corporate culture by the Canadian troupe the Holy Body Tattoo, a bit of life advice is projected upstage.

title: Giants Beat Saints With a Field Goal That Ends a Lackluster Game
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  The Giants receivers had dropped multiple potential touchdown passes. The team had lost three fumbles, and the offense had not scored a touchdown. Penalties had mired certain drives while sacks had stalled others.

title: What Happened at the 2016 Emmy Awards
Review: Three Days of Terror Relives the Charlie Hebdo Attacks
description: The British television director Dan Reed has a grisly specialty: documentary reconstructions of major terrorist attacks. Hes made Terror in Mumbai, Terror at the Mall (about the 2013 attack at a shopping mall in Nairobi, Kenya) and now Three Days of Terror: The Charlie Hebdo Attacks, all shown on HBO. Theyre elegant, understated chapters in a dreadful volume.

title: Review: In What Did You Expect?, a Potluck of Election-Year Anxiety
description: The Gabriels are as worried as you are. As one of them says, with a matter-of-factness that suggests long and weary acquaintance with a troublesome state of being, People are scared. Everyone I know is scared.

title: Introducing the New York Times Upshot/Siena College Poll
description: On Monday, The Upshot and Siena College will release their first  survey of likely voters in Florida.

title: Whos the New Guy Pitching for the Mets? Doesnt Matter. They Keep Winning.
description: Shortly after the Mets said Saturday that Jacob deGrom would in all probability miss the remainder of the season, Manager Terry Collins had to announce a replacement starter for Sundays game.

title: Reason and Vigilance After the Blast
description: A blast on a warm Saturday night in Manhattan sent people running through the streets. More than two dozen were hurt. New York City, accustomed to living with the echo and shadow of terrorism, handled the shock with composure.

title: Review: In The Good Place, Kristen Bell Is Dead and Crabby
description: Michael Schur is not the first writer to create a comedy about the afterlife. Dante Alighieri, for one, beat him by about 700 years. But Dantes The Divine Comedy had the advantage of drawing on theology widely accepted by his audience and not having to deal with network notes. (Beatrice: Relatable enough?)

title: Paul Smith: Spring 2017
description: The designer shows his spring 2017 collection.

title: Anthrax Is Still Here and Still Rocking
description: Just before 4 oclock on Friday afternoon, the bassist Frank Bello and the guitarist Scott Ian, both three-decade-plus veterans of the band Anthrax, arrived at the tiny Greenpoint, Brooklyn club Saint Vitus and took in the scene: Their tour crew was still working out how to fit a festival-size setup onto a stage barely big enough for Charlie Benantes nine-drum, 16-cymbal kit. Nearly a quarter of the floor was cluttered with crates and guitars, and the top half of an Anthrax banner was draped over the entire back wall.

title: Review: In The Wonder, the Morality of Letting a Child Fast
description: Two men sit across from each other in a Northern Ireland prison, locked in an argument so intense it feels like hand-to-hand combat. One is the Irish Republican Army prisoner Bobby Sands, who is preparing to starve himself to death. The other is Father Moran, a Catholic priest, who is trying to talk him out of it.

title: Emmys 2016 Liveblog
description: Dispatches from the red carpet and backstage  and thoughts from our reporters, editors and critics watching the show.

title: A Force on the Court, Tamika Catchings Was a Dynamo Off It
description: Tamika Catchings is planning to retire after this W.N.B.A. season, and she will leave an immeasurable void on the Indiana Fever roster.

title: Suspect Killed in Minnesota Attack
description: Patrons at a St. Cloud, Minn., mall were forced to stay inside until the police completed a security sweep and checked IDs. Nine people were injured before a knife-wielding man was shot by an off-duty police officer.

title: A Big Payout for a Big Loss
description: Guarantee games assure the winner of an easy victory and the loser of a hefty paycheck for taking a beating. Whether the games are good for either team is the subject of debate.

title: Historically Black Schools Pay the Price for a Football Paycheck
description: CLEMSON, S.C.  Clemson played South Carolina State in college football on Saturday. Both universities field Division I teams, and that is pretty much where the similarities end in terms of athletics.

title: Senate Committee to Discuss Wells Fargo Scandal as Federal Reserve Meets
description: Heres what to expect in the week ahead:

title: Classic TV Game Show
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  How about some math to start your solving week? Zhouqin Burnikel is back, and she is asking you to do some simple calculations in your head (we wont judge if you want to use scrap paper) in order to get the theme set.

title: How Tech Companies Disrupted Silicon Valleys Restaurant Scene
description: PALO ALTO, Calif.  It wasnt so long ago that the aroma of Moroccan spiced prawns and wood-oven pizzas wafted out to a downtown street here from the open-air patio of a once popular eatery called Zibibbo.

title: Emmy Red Carpet Fashion 2016
description: See what celebrities like Regina King, Rami Malek and Tatiana Maslany wore to televisions biggest night.

title: Red Carpet Review: Tuxes Are Easy. Its the Emmy Gowns That Demand Effort.
description: [ Our full report on the 2016 Emmy Awards | the list of Emmy winners | red carpet looks | our critics review of the show ]

title: Holocaust Survivors Needs Grow, and Aid Is Slow to Catch Up
description: BUDAPEST  Agnes Galgoczi, 84, can no longer make it to the toilet on her own. It sits in the kitchen of her apartment in Budapest, just three feet from the bed, where she sings to herself to fight loneliness. Several blocks away, Vera Varga, 78, slides decades-old movies into her videocassette player. The images remind her of the outside world.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of Sept. 19
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: Artificial Intelligence Software Is Booming. But Why Now?
description: SAN FRANCISCO  This is the year artificial intelligence came into its own for mainstream businesses, at least as a marketing feature.

title: 2 Former Albuquerque Officers on Trial in Killing of Homeless Man
description: ALBUQUERQUE  The 911 call to the Albuquerque police on March 16, 2014, sounded routine: A man had been illegally camping in the foothills of the Sandia Mountains, just 100 yards from the callers backyard. Could an officer come by and take him away? But the man refused to comply.

title: Why the Fed Is About to Raise Interest Rates
description: Federal Reserve officials have delayed raising rates this year as they wrestle with three critical questions. But they may soon be about to act.

title: James Stacy, Actor Who Kept Working After a Disabling Crash, Dies at 79
description: James Stacy, who played a gunslinging drifter on the television western Lancer and, after losing an arm and a leg in a 1973 motorcycle accident, turned in memorable performances in specialized roles, died on Sept. 9 in Ventura, Calif. He was 79.

title: Following Its Country Music, Nashville May Loosen Up on Marijuana
description: NASHVILLE  Willie Nelsons famous habit of smoking marijuana is not seen as a badge of outlaw courage here anymore, so much as the frivolous foible of an eccentric uncle. A popular FM station disgorging the Boomer rock hits of yesteryear calls itself Hippie Radio 94.5; one of its sponsors is a smoke shop that incessantly hawks glass pipes and detox kits. Even mainstream country acts mention smoking marijuana now and again among the litany of acceptable American pastimes.

title: After Quake, an Italian Crisis Unit Races to Rescue a Regions Heritage
description: AMATRICE, Italy  The rescuers worked tirelessly under a scorching sun. Wearing white masks to fight off the dust, they formed a human chain, passing from hand to hand all they could salvage from the gravelly destruction of the earthquake that struck this region in August. They had to work quickly, fearing the precariousness of an adjacent building splintered by wide fissures.

title: Emmy Awards 2016: The Winners List
description: [ Our full report on the 2016 Emmy Awards | red carpet looks | our critics review of the show ]

title: Mondays Matchup: Eagles (1-0) at Bears (0-1)
description: 8:30 p.m. Eastern, ESPN Line: Bears by 1

title: Adblock Plus, Created to Protect Users From Ads, Instead Opens the Door
description: Adblock Plus, an ad blocker now used on more than 100 million devices, started out as an almost utopian idea a decade ago. Wladimir Palant, a 20-something developer who was annoyed with intrusive ads online, created it as an open-source project and quickly built it up with the help of volunteers who also wanted to make the internet faster, less cluttered and safer from malware.

title: Chauffeur Service for a Second-String QB
description: Dear Diary:

title: Obama to Push Refugee Aid at U.N., but Critics Say Effort Is Overdue
description: UNITED NATIONS  President Obama is planning to use his last appearance before the United Nations General Assembly this week to corral world leaders to uplift the lives of refugees crossing borders in droves. But critics say the United States faces a credibility test of its own.

title: How a U.S. Airstrike Missed ISIS, but Damaged U.S. Policy in Syria
description: WASHINGTON  The United States accidental bombing of Syrian troops over the weekend has put it on the defensive, undercutting American efforts to reduce violence in the civil war and open paths for humanitarian relief.

title: The Silver Lining in Pinstripes: Gary Sanchez
description: BOSTON  In recent weeks at Yankee Stadium, sprouting up through the thicket of pinstriped No. 2 jerseys and other remnants of the Derek Jeter era, there have been signs that Yankees fans are wrapping themselves in something other than nostalgia.

title: Mayor de Blasio Avoids Terrorism Label in Manhattan Explosion
description: It was on the minds of New Yorkers, who immediately drew comparisons to Sept. 11, 2001. It could be felt in the police response, which included teams of heavily armed officers stationed at key targets and the Joint Terrorism Task Force of the Federal Bureau of Investigation and the Police Department.

title: Obama Asks for Reality Check as Frivolous Issues Dominate Election
description: WASHINGTON  The sun was shining, thousands of supporters were chanting his name, and President Obama was basking again in the electricity of a campaign rally. But for a moment last week, he could not hide his exasperation at the circuslike atmosphere of this years presidential race.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: This is one of the nightmare scenarios. We really were very lucky that there were no fatalities.

title: Larry King, the Russian Media and a Partisan Landscape
description: Last week, I caught Larry King on his post-CNN media perch, the RT America television network. His guest, the actress and activist Kamala Lopez, was powerfully emotional as she called for the ratification of the Equal Rights Amendment.

title: Pro-Putin Parties Show Strength in Russian Parliament Elections
description: MOSCOW  The Kremlins United Russia party and its three main allies maintained their lock on Parliament in national elections on Sunday, according to early results, with particularly low turnout in the largest cities.

title: How Police Found Second Bomb, and a Total Containment Vessel Hauled It Away
description: After the explosion on West 23rd Street on Saturday night, the police did what they typically do when they suspect a bomb has gone off. They spread out and began looking for unexploded bombs  what those on the New York Police Departments bomb squad call secondaries. Officers began searching block by block, going as far south as 14th Street and as far north as 34th Street.

title: A Doctors Assessment of Whether Donald Trumps Health Is Excellent
description: WASHINGTON  In releasing a far more sober account of Donald J. Trumps health on Thursday, his physician provided details to support his view that the Republican nominee for president is overweight but otherwise is in excellent physical health.

title: The Chaos of the Manhattan Explosion, Captured by Cameras

And then a bomb blast jolted a street in Chelsea with enough force to lift a Dumpster into the air, shattering windows and injuring 29 people. The violence was accentuated by the uncertainty: What had happened, and why, and who had carried it out?

title: Vote as if It Matters
description: Does it make sense to vote for Gary Johnson, the Libertarian candidate for president? Sure, as long as you believe two things. First, you have to believe that it makes no difference at all whether Hillary Clinton or Donald Trump moves into the White House  because one of them will. Second, you have to believe that America will be better off in the long run if we eliminate environmental regulation, abolish the income tax, do away with public schools, and dismantle Social Security and Medicare  which is what the Libertarian platform calls for.

title: Its Not Too Late to Fix Fox News

title: The TV Cure
description: Los Angeles  This is how TV used to show mental illness: Men imbued with magical crime-solving or disease-curing powers that hindered their personal lives. Criminals who were psychotic and therefore could not be understood, only feared. Girls with eating disorders that appeared in one episode of a sitcom and then were cured after a heart-to-heart. Soap operas that reveled in the split personality  not actually a real disorder  as a plot point.

title: 1916: Tanks Deployed at the Somme

The Tank may be roughly described as a dry-land submarine, says one who has seen them in an interview with the Star. title: 1941: No More Antipasto for Italians
description: ROME  The people of Italy were notified today that they will have to tighten their belts more to win the war. Restaurants were informed of five new restrictions, beginning on Monday, and on the same day a prohibition on the sale of confectionery will go into effect. The five-point program forbids the serving of antipasto or double portions of any dishes. No soups made with eggs may be served, which bans the popular zuppa pavese, made by poaching an egg or two in meat broth. No butter, olive oil or other fats may be served separately from the dishes of which they may be an element.  New York Herald Tribune, Sept. 20, 1941

title: Two Cookbooks Offer Fresh Approaches for Rosh Hashana
description: Sometimes all it takes is one recipe to justify a new cookbook. The chicken soup in The Gefilte Manifesto uses chicken parts that you brown before making the soup, something I have never done. But it works, enhancing depth and color in the broth. The whole point of the book, by the founders of the Gefilteria, the inventive online Jewish food company and caterer, is reworking traditional kosher Ashkenazi cooking and preparing dishes from scratch, with recipes like an inspired kimchi-stuffed cabbage. Theres even a recipe for kosher kimchi. But the so-called apple strudel, while easy and tasty, is a deep-dish pie, not a strudel at all. Another new approach to your Rosh Hashana dinner (the observance starts the evening of Oct. 2) may come from the kosher New York steakhouse Le Marais. Consider recipes for duck cassoulet, coq au vin, slow-roasted lamb shoulder or veal braciole from this new book instead of the usual brisket or roast chicken. The chef, Mark Hennessey, explains various steak cuts and how he adapts French recipes so they conform to the kashrut: The Gefilte Manifesto: New Recipes for Old World Jewish Foods, by Jeffrey Yoskowitz and Liz Alpern (Flatiron Books, $35), and Le Marais: A Rare Steakhouse  Well Done, by Mark Hennessey and Jose Meirelles (Gefen Publishing, $29.95).

title: Soup Dumplings With an Experts Touch
description: When it comes to xiao long bao, better known as soup dumplings, few practitioners of the craft have the expertise of Qihui Guan, a diminutive, grandmotherly chef who put in plenty of time at Joes Shanghai in Chinatown. Now this former math professor is running the tiny kitchen of this new East Village dumpling house for her son, Yuan Lee, with three other cooks. Its a constant traffic jam as they turn out baskets of handmade dumplings for the restaurants 26 seats and fill takeout orders. The soup dumplings include a pillow-size monster served with a straw for sucking the broth. Pot stickers, notable for their delicate wrappers, have fillings like chicken with cashews, beef with cilantro and mixed organic vegetables that rely on local farms for ingredients, making this yet another farm-to-table Chinese restaurant: Drunken Dumpling, 137 First Avenue (Ninth Street), 212-982-8882, drunkendumplingny.com.
