title: Bagels Get a Schmear, Salmon and a Stand for Serving
description: Theres always a place for bagels with smoked salmon and cream cheese during the High Holy Days. Eli Zabar sells stacks of filled mini-bagels on a stand that makes serving them easy: A dozen mini-bagels with smoked salmon and cream cheese, and the stand, $120 from Elis Market, 1411 Third Avenue (80th Street), 212-717-8100 extension 9, for pickup or delivery in Manhattan.

title: Keira Knightley and Victoria Beckham Celebrate the Green Carpet Challenge
Guatemalan Cotton for the Kitchen, and the Benefit of Others
description: Creamy natural cotton, with soft blue denim stripes and patterns, has been turned into a line of table and kitchen goods, including place mats, generous napkins, table runners, coasters, towels, potholders, oven mitts and aprons. All go on sale Tuesday online and in October at West Elm and Whole Foods stores. Theyre made in Guatemala from recycled denim, and benefit communities there. Also, $1 from the sale of each item will be donated to Whole Foods Markets Whole Planet Foundation to help alleviate poverty worldwide: The New Denim Project, table linens and kitchen goods, $14 to $39 from westelm.com, starting Tuesday; starting in October at West Elm and Whole Foods stores.

title: The Changing Clock of Australias Little Penguins
description: ST. KILDA, Australia  On any given night, as the sun sets at the bottom of the world, dozens to hundreds of people gather along the pier at St. Kilda Beach, just off the coast of Melbourne, Australia. Their black silhouettes punctuate the sherbet sky. But theyre not there for the sunset. Theyre there for the penguins.

title: Theresa May Makes Her Debut as the Voice of Britain
description: Theresa May, Britains new prime minister, in her first speech before the United Nations General Assembly on Tuesday, vowed that Britain would remain an important and responsible international player despite its vote to leave the European Union.

title: After a Long Wait, Mah-Ze-Dahr Bakery Gets a Shop
description: Umber Ahmad was an investment banker whose specialty was the global expansion of food brands. Tom Colicchio was a client, and they talked food. After Ms. Ahmad treated him to samples of her cakes and cookies she grew up baking with members of her Pakistani family in northern Michigan, he encouraged her to go into the business. Since founding Mah-Ze-Dahr Bakery in 2013, she has been baking in a commercial kitchen with Shelly Barbera, her executive pastry chef and partner, and selling her finely wrought pastries online to consumers as well as to wholesale clients like Jet Blue. And finally, a long year later than expected, she has a spacious West Village shop, opening Thursday, thats done in pearl gray with a tufted banquette and marble displays for her lush tarts, cookies, cream puffs, bars, cakes, brioche doughnuts and other sweet and savory items. Theres a back room with a communal table that she plans to use for classes, and a big kitchen downstairs. The name of the company is based on the Urdu word mazedar, meaning the essence: Mah-Ze-Dahr Bakery, 28 Greenwich Avenue (10th Street), 212-498-9810, mahzedahrbakery.com.

title: Friends Say Minnesota Attacker Was Normal American Kid
description: ST. CLOUD, Minn.  The man who the police say stabbed 10 people at a mall here on Saturday seemed like a model of assimilation, not a violent jihadist, people who knew him and his family said. The son of Somali refugees, he lived in the United States most of his life, did well in school, played sports, worked as a security guard and took classes at a local college.

title: Another Slip for the Libertarian Nominee, Gary Johnson: Nobody Got Hurt
description: Gary Johnson, the Libertarian Party presidential candidate, who has struggled in recent weeks to recover from a gaffe in which he was unable to identify Aleppo, in war-torn Syria, appeared to fumble once more on Sunday when he said no one had been injured in two violent events in New York City and Minnesota over the weekend.

title: Review: In Empathitrax, the Side Effects of Knowing Too Much
description: Wouldnt it be great to know what people really think about you? Then again, maybe not. Ana Nogueiras new play, Empathitrax, considers a fearsome weapon  a little pill that acts as a sort of truth serum, allowing you to reach out, touch someone and instantly feel what they feel.

title: Wells Fargo Settlement Raises Questions on Disclosure
description: Wells Fargo is facing a perfect storm of bad publicity and demands for changing its corporate culture after employees opened millions of fake customer accounts to hit their sales targets. The Justice Department has begun a preliminary inquiry into the banks conduct while its chief executive, John Stumpf, will be grilled this week by the Senate Banking Committee, including Senator Elizabeth Warren  the scourge of the big banks.

title: Erdems Costume Drama
description: Looks from Erdems spring 2017 collection

title: Gas Prices Surge in South After Pipeline Leak
description: ATLANTA  Gasoline prices increased again across the Deep South on Monday, 10 days after the discovery in Alabama of a pipeline rupture that threatened fuel supplies and prompted worries about environmental contamination.

title: Richard Plepler: By the Book
description: The chief executive of HBO treasures his volume of John Cheevers collected stories: Theres a lot in there about what Kant called the crooked timber of humanity. Its a masterpiece.

title: Monochromatic Home Materials, Made Interesting
description: A little texture  nubby wools, stippled paints, ribbed rugs  adds intrigue and depth to neutrals. Yes, even beige.

title: Huishan Zhang: Spring 2017
description: Presenting for the first time in London, Mr. Zhang shows his spring 2017 collection.

title: Charlotte Le Bons Street Art
description: Running through Paris tagging buildings with the rising actress and street artist.

title: Tagging Buildings With a Rising Actress
description: For Charlotte Le Bon, the only thing better than a good role is an empty alley on a quiet night.

title: Emmy Awards 2016: 13 Best and Worst Moments
description: Here's a look at some of the most memorable moments from the 68th Primetime Emmy Awards.

title: Jason Aldean Debuts at No. 1 Following the Adele Model
description: Streaming music is everywhere these days. But this week, for the second time in a year, the No. 1 album is nowhere to be found on streaming services.

title: What You Should Watch Now That Fall TV Has Arrived
description: Welcome to Watching, The New York Timess what-to-watch guide. We comb through releases big and small to email readers twice a week with our timely recommendations. You can browse previous guides here, and to receive recommendations straight to your inbox, sign up here. Stay tuned for our coming website.

title: Effortless Hair? Its Complicated.
description: Maybe theres someone in your life with hair like this, hair like a secret: piled or pinned up in a Gordian tangle, or refuting the laws of gravity in a hazy, floating pouf. Its not a pixie or a mullet or a bowl cut, not a bob or a lob or a Kwan cut or a Klute cut or a Farrah or a Rachel or anything with something so pedestrian as a name. This is a signature look, off-trend, timeless  arranged rather than done. Whether its a moptop tousled like the artist and writer Leanne Shaptons or tresses long and pinned back like the artist Taryn Simons or the writer Rivka Galchens, the effect is romantic, and just-so messy. Songstress Corinne Bailey Rae sometimes wears her curls stacked up on one side. Illustrator-author Juman Malouf architects a half-beehive into a soft crown. The hair seems to be hiding something. It is like a very elegant nest.

title: Stubborn Grudges Yield Little. Time to Change Your Investing.
description: Over the last few weeks, I have been humbled by the hundreds of emails I received in response to The Cost of Holding On, my essay encouraging people to let go of grudges, slights, and yes, underperforming investments.

title: Christopher Kane: Spring 2017
description: The Scottish designer presents his spring 2017 collection.

title: Abbotts Sale of Eye Surgery Unit Should Ease Its Merger Woes
description: Abbott Laboratories may have eased the flow of its merger pipeline. The $62 billion health firm is selling its eye surgery unit to Johnson & Johnson for $4.3 billion. With two looming acquisitions worth over $30 billion  and the purchase of Alere, in particular, not going smoothly  it is a sensible way for Abbott to gain some breathing room.

title: Obama, in Farewell to U.N., Paints Stark Choices for Unsettled World
description: UNITED NATIONS  It was President Obamas last appearance on the marble dais of the United Nations General Assembly hall, and his farewell speech on Tuesday revealed a man whose eye was fixed as much on the next seven weeks of the American political campaign as on his place in history.

title: Flaws in Fingerprint Records Allowed Hundreds to Become U.S. Citizens
description: WASHINGTON  The Department of Homeland Security granted citizenship to hundreds of people who had previously been ordered deported or removed under different names because of flaws in keeping fingerprint records, according to a report released Monday.

title: Shake. Stir. Sip. Takes the Math Out of Mixing Cocktails
description: A funny thing happened on the way to the cocktail-book boom. Or not so funny: It became very hard to make a cocktail at home.

title: Rome Mayors Troubled First 3 Months Raise Doubts on Her Five Star Movement
description: ROME  When Virginia Raggi, Romes first female mayor, was elected in June, she represented the anti-establishment Five Star Movements highest aspiration  to show Italy how nonprofessional politicians could turn things around.

title: A Facebook First for New York Philharmonic: Streaming Its 175th Anniversary Opener
description: The New York Philharmonic will open its 175th anniversary season on Wednesday a little differently than its forebears in 1842: For the first time it will stream the concert on Facebook Live.

title: Arts Import From New York to Lead ICA London
description: The Institute of Contemporary Arts in London, a leading contemporary arts exhibition space on the Mall, has a new director from New Yorks alternative arts scene.

title: Real Risks in Big Banks Merchant Banking Activities
description: In a recent Deal Professor column, Steven Davidoff Solomon gives the Federal Reserve a symbolic F for failing to justify its recommendation that Congress repeal existing statutory provisions allowing big Wall Street banks to run in-house private equity funds.

title: For a U.S. Role in Afghan Peace
description: To the Editor:

title: Tim Tebow, Wearing No. 15, Participates in First Mets Workout
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  A helicopter circled overhead. Below, about 400 fans and more than 70 members of the news media gathered at the Mets year-round training complex. They were all there  on the ground, in the air  to watch Tim Tebow play catch.

title: Me and Prof. Edward Albee
description: We were sitting in his loft in TriBeCa, Edward Albee and I, talking about families. Edward and his partner, the artist Jonathan Thomas, had never had children (It never occurred to us, never for a second). They did raise Irish wolfhounds, though. I once asked Edward how many Irish wolfhounds could fit in a king-size bed with two grown men in it, and without hesitation, he provided the answer: seven.

title: What We Are Hearing About Clinton and Trump
description: This election season, most Americans are paying attention to the presidential candidates on a daily basis. Thats good news, but what Americans report reading and hearing about Donald J. Trump and Hillary Clinton has to make us wonder about the value of the hyper-prolonged, exhausting modern-day campaign process.

title: Justin Trudeaus Message to U.N.: Were Canada and Were Here to Help
description: As Prime Minister Justin Trudeau of Canada made his first address to the United Nations General Assembly on Tuesday, he spoke before not only an enthusiastic audience, but one whose agenda largely mirrored his own.

title: Ahmad Rahami: Fixture in Familys Business and, Lately, a Completely Different Person
description: He presided behind the counter of a storefront New Jersey fried chicken restaurant, making his home with his family in an apartment above it. To some of his friends, Ahmad Khan Rahami was known as Mad, an abridgment of his name rather than a suggestion of his manner, and they liked that he gave them free food when they were short on money.

title: Invitation to a Dialogue: Twilight of Democracy?
description: To the Editor:

title: Emmys 2016: Ratings Hit a New Low
description: The Emmys once again hit a new low in viewership Sunday night, with 11.3 million people tuning into the ceremony on ABC, according to Nielsen.

title: Vladimir Putin Tightens Grip on Russias Parliament With Election Rout
description: MOSCOW  President Vladimir V. Putin leveraged his popularity to assert even greater control over Russias already malleable Parliament in national elections, with nearly complete results released on Monday showing the ruling United Russia party gaining an absolute majority of seats.

title: Fashion Week Photo Diary: Mary Katrantzou, Topshop Unique and Mulberry
description: Scenes from the spring/summer 2017 collections that were presented in London on Sunday.

title: Word + Quiz: pore
Review: This Is Us Is Skillful, Shameless Tear-Jerking
description: Watching This Is Us is like getting beaten up with a pillow soaked in tears.

title: Review: Michael Weatherly, Recast as a Jury-Puppeteer on Bull
description: To take the lead role in Bull, a drama that begins Tuesday on CBS, Michael Weatherly left N.C.I.S., which after more than 300 episodes is still among televisions most popular shows. Im going to go out on a limb here and predict that Bull is not going to enjoy that kind of longevity.

title: No Ordinary Love: Martino Gamper With Friends
description: For a new group show at Seeds gallery in West London, the designer invited 13 friends to craft one-of-a-kind ceramics.

title: When 13 Celebrated Designers (and Friends) Come Together to Make Ceramics
description: With its pristine rows of untouched Victorian villas, Launceston Place is one of the most picturesque corners of the West London district of Kensington. Its also home to the enterprising art and design upstart Seeds, which is dotted with reminders of the buildings former incarnations as a butcher shop and cheese factory: The intimate gallery and selling space, which opened in January, has meat hooks suspended from the ceiling and ornate ceramic tiling on the walls. I didnt want to make it a blank white box, explains the founder Nathalie Assi, pointing to an antiquated wrought-iron stove where cheese was once made in the redbrick basement kitchen. We really wanted to preserve its previous life.

title: Common Blood-Pressure Drug May Work on Malaria, Too
description: Giving malaria victims a common blood-pressure drug along with regular treatment may save lives by preventing lethal brain hemorrhages, scientists reported on Monday.

title: Times Insider Photo Challenge: Caption This!
description: Times Insider shares insights into how we work at The New York Times. Occasionally we have some fun.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Predict Zikas Spread? Its Hard Enough to Count the Cases
description: How far will the Zika outbreak spread, and for how long?

title: Review: Becoming Kazuo Ohno, a Bold Copycat Tribute to a Butoh Master
description: As audience members arrived at Japan Society on Friday night, the performer Takao Kawaguchi was already in motion, sliding down banisters, wrestling with a garden hose and otherwise making mischief in the theater lobby. Looking on from one wall was a portrait of his muse: Kazuo Ohno, the great Butoh dancer and a founder of that postwar Japanese dance-theater form, who died in 2010 at 103.

title: Tim Tebow Takes a Swing at Baseball
description: Tebow, the former Heisman Trophy Award winner and N.F.L. quarterback, was in Florida on Monday for his first day of practice for the Mets Florida Instructional League team.

title: Donald Trump Charity Failed to Heed States Rules With Veterans Event
description: Donald J. Trump boycotted a televised debate in January, instead holding a high-profile charity event for veterans in Iowa that helped raise millions of dollars from donors around the country.

title: Review: With a Tribute to an Esteemed Organist, Simon Rattle Settles Into New York
description: The English conductor Simon Rattle will cut a monumental profile in New York this fall. He opens the Metropolitan Operas season with Wagners Tristan und Isolde (Monday through Oct. 17), leads the Philadelphia Orchestra at Carnegie Hall (Oct. 10), accompanies the tenor Mark Padmore with Ensemble Connect in Hans Zenders orchestration of Schuberts Winterreise at Zankel Hall (Oct. 16) and conducts the Berlin Philharmonic at Carnegie (Nov. 9 and 10).

title: Do You Like Your Friends?
description: Do you actually like your friends?

title: Hawaiian Crows Join Tool-Users Club
description: The Hawaiian crow has just been inducted into an exclusive club: animals that know how to use tools.

title: Shopping for Sneakers
description: A look at Buscemi, Concepts NYC and Aglit Italy.

title: Review: A Happy Ending in LoftOperas Cos Fan Tutte, With an Edge
description: Cruel love games among the upper crust. Relationships nurtured by shared deceptions. Illusions shattered like cold water tossed in your face. Mozarts Cos Fan Tutte is the only opera I know that could do double duty as an Edward Albee play, and LoftOperas production of that work on Saturday, the day after Albees death, was an unexpectedly proper memorial.

title: Review: Bathing in Moonlight Tests a Priest and Boundaries
description: PRINCETON, N.J.  A Roman Catholic priest faces what might be called a crisis of humanity, rather than a crisis of faith, in Bathing in Moonlight, the gauzy new play from Nilo Cruz, which is having its premiere here at the McCarter Theater Center, where Mr. Cruzs Pulitzer Prize-winning Anna in the Tropics was also presented before moving to Broadway.

title: Memories Distilled by 2 Radically Different Poets
description: W. S. Merwin and Adam Fitzgerald are such dramatically different poets that reading their latest books in tandem can induce a feeling of vertigo. Imagine a playlist that squeezed together the music of Nick Drake and Lady Gaga, or think of a loaf of wild-yeast sourdough bread all rainbow-spangled with Pop Rocks. But both books have essential things to say about the movements of memory and loss  about what our minds try to hold on to, and why.

title: Sophie Turner, Emilia Clarke and Kerry Washington Party After the Emmys
description: With a clutch of golden statues, HBO hosts a lavish party for the winners (and losers).

title: Burberrys Painterly Beauty Look  Inspired by Literature
description: Virginia Woolfs 1928 historical fantasy Orlando  which tells the tale of a young Elizabethan nobleman  gave rise to what the makeup artist Wendy Rowe called beautiful statuesque skin backstage at Burberry today. The collection was renamed September 2016 (as opposed to spring/summer 2017), because everything, including the makeup used for the look, is shoppable straight after the show. The matte finish of the skin mirrored the many antique statues that filled Burberrys labyrinth Makers House venue on the edges of Londons Soho.

title: Sophie Turner, Emilia Clarke and Kerry Washington Party After the Emmys
description: WEST HOLLYWOOD, Calif.  If parties reflect the hosts self-esteem, HBO displayed no shortage of confidence.

title: Deaths, Fraud Allegations and an Inquiry Into a Long Island V.A. Hospital
description: Along the winding drive through the 300-acre compound of Long Islands only veterans medical center, banners line the road stating the presumed values of the institution: integrity, commitment, advocacy, respect and excellence.

title: What Rembrandt Did as a Teenager: 4 of His Sense Works Are Reunited
description: AMSTERDAM  For the first time, the four paintings still known to exist from Rembrandts series depicting the five senses are being displayed together. The works, completed when he was still in his teens, are presented in the exhibition Sensation: Rembrandts First Paintings, on view at the Ashmolean Museum in Oxford, England, until Nov. 27.

title: Pariss New Concept Shop for Men
description: Four years since the Made in France movement first emerged, the sentiment around preserving homegrown craftsmanship has reached a fever pitch. But until today, no shop has truly limited its offering to a collection of goods that reflects this wave. Mayaros abiding mission is precisely that  to showcase the artisans and crafters behind luxury products that demonstrate a distinctly French savoir-faire  and the focus is predominantly on items for men.

title: The Trump Campaign: Birther Lie, Bodyguards and Tax Breaks
description: To the Editor:

title: F.D.A. Approves Muscular Dystrophy Drug That Patients Lobbied For
description: WASHINGTON  The Food and Drug Administration approved the first drug to treat patients with the most common childhood form of muscular dystrophy, a vivid example of the growing power that patients and their advocates wield over the federal governments evaluation of drugs.

title: Bibi Ferreira, Brazils Grande Dame of the Stage, Cant Stop Singing Even at 94
description: Bibi Ferreira speaks in the cultivated, theatrical voice of an English dowager, the result of British schooling as a child. Its not the sound one would expect to come out of the mouth of an actress, singer and director whom Brazilians have called their greatest living woman of the stage. But in performance, Ms. Ferreira is a chameleon known for her probing, psychologically layered portrayals and the sweeping grandeur of her singing, not to mention her energy. Having worked nonstop since the age of 3, she has earned a rest, but even at 94, the ambition rages on.

title: Investigating the Blasts in New York and New Jersey
description: To the Editor:

title: Laser Scans Unveil a Network of Ancient Cities in Cambodia
description: SIEM REAP, CAMBODIA  For decades, archaeologists here kept their eyes on the ground as they tramped through thick jungle, rice paddies and buffalo grazing fields, emerald green and soft with mud during the monsoon season.

title: Marcia Clark Finally Has a Moment to Savor at the Emmys
description: LOS ANGELES  From the stars to the producers to the executives, no one involved with The People v. O.J. Simpson: American Crime Story seemed to realize the significance of where they were celebrating their triumphant Emmy night after the awards ceremony Sunday.

title: The Mad Professor Who Makes Sure the Tutus Swirl
description: On one side of the fitting room at New York City Ballets costume shop, the clothing designer Narciso Rodriguez was studying the neckline of a pink-and-black dress on the ballerina Indiana Woodward.

title: Colombias Leader Says Peace Deal Rests on Peoples Ability to Forgive
description: A half-century of civil war has deeply injured the psyche of Colombians, the countrys president said on Monday, weeks before a nationwide referendum on a peace deal that would end Latin Americas last major guerrilla conflict.

title: Burberry: Spring 2017
description: Christopher Bailey presents see-now/buy-now collections for both men and women.

title: In Statement to Senate, Wells Fargo Chief Is Deeply Sorry
description: The chief executive of Wells Fargo, John G. Stumpf, will say in testimony Tuesday morning that he is deeply sorry for selling customers unauthorized bank accounts and credit cards and that he takes full responsibility for the unethical activity, according to a copy of the remarks prepared for a Senate Banking Committee hearing.

title: John Stumpfs Prepared Testimony to Senate
description: In prepared testimony to be delivered before a Senate Committee on Tuesday, John Stumpf, chief executive of Wells Fargo, strikes a decidedly contrite tone on the scandal over fake accounts created by employees at the bank.

title: Kinshasa, Congo, Is Locked Down as Protests Erupt Against Joseph Kabila
description: KINSHASA, Democratic Republic of Congo  Busted glass. Smoldering fires. Torched cars. Empty streets. Hundreds of police officers clumped on the corners, glancing up at the smoke uncurling in the sky.

title: New York City, U.S. Presidential Race, Syria: Your Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Recent Commercial Real Estate Transactions
description: $19.7 MILLION

title: Eisenhower Family Drops Objections to Memorial
description: The long-stalled, $150 million memorial to Dwight D. Eisenhower was given new impetus on Monday after Eisenhower family members lifted their objection to the Frank Gehry design, the Dwight D. Eisenhower Memorial Commission announced.

title: Questions for: Ahmad Khan Rahami Is Arrested in Manhattan and New Jersey Bombings
description: Article: Ahmad Khan Rahami Is Arrested in Manhattan and New Jersey Bombings

title: Mapping Site Shows Shift in Mayor de Blasios Fund-Raising
description: In politics, geography is money. Political candidates in New York typically trek to Manhattans wealthiest neighborhoods to rake in big contributions, often neglecting more far-flung parts of the city.

title: Three Rolls for a Nickel
description: Dear Diary:

title: Self-Driving Cars Gain Powerful Ally: The Government
description: WASHINGTON  Federal auto safety regulators on Monday made it official: They are betting the nations highways will be safer with more cars driven by machines and not people.

title: Why So Many Business Leaders Are Tiptoeing Around Donald Trump
description: In conversations over the last several months with chief executives and other business leaders, the discussion invariably turns to the presidential election. And with few exceptions, at some point, most of the executives say something critical, even derogatory, about Donald Trump  but it is quickly followed by, I could never say that on the record.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Its like he was a completely different person. He got serious and completely closed off.

title: Wells Fargos John Stumpf Has His Wall St. Comeuppance
description: Long before he ran Wells Fargo, one of the nations largest banks, John Stumpf grew up on a dairy and poultry farm, one of 11 children. He started his career as a community banker in Minnesota and married the local bankers daughter.

title: One Year Later, a Tip About a Border Crossing Pays Off
description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights from The New York Times. In this piece, Ben Hubbard, a Times Middle East correspondent, and Karam Shoumali, a news assistant, reveal the promising outcome of a story they first reported in May 2015.

title: Having Won Re-election, a Black Mayor Is Out to Win Every Voters Heart
description: PHENIX CITY, Ala.  Eddie Lowe, this citys first-ever black mayor, could feel the white anxiety here.

title: Dorothy Cann Hamilton, Founder of French Culinary Institute, Dies in Crash at 67
description: Dorothy Cann Hamilton, a food aficionado who started a vocational course that evolved into one of the worlds leading culinary schools, died on Friday on Cape Breton Island in Nova Scotia. She was 67.

title: Mets Reliever Addison Reed Finds Dominance in the Heart of the Plate
description: On June 3, the Mets called on Addison Reed to protect a two-run lead in the eighth inning against the Miami Marlins. He allowed a single to Christian Yelich but struck out three formidable hitters: Martin Prado, Marcell Ozuna and Giancarlo Stanton.

title: Trial of Ex-Officers Opens With 2 Views of Fatal Albuquerque Shooting
description: ALBUQUERQUE  Lawyers in the trial of two former police officers charged in the fatal 2014 shooting of a homeless man on Monday painted starkly different views of how the encounter unfolded. A special prosecutor said the officers could have backed away from a confrontation. Defense lawyers said the officers were simply doing their jobs.

title: After Bombing on Jersey Shore, Residents Try to Make Sense of Chaos
description: SEASIDE PARK, N.J.  It was a deserted Monday at the end of the summer season; a determined rain and the news were keeping people inside, watching their flat-screen televisions. Live on Fox and CNN, local and federal authorities were announcing the arrest  of Ahmad Khan Rahami, a 28-year-old of Afghan descent from Elizabeth, N.J., who is suspected of planting bombs in New Jersey and New York.

title: Obama, at the U.N., Cites Iraq Gains and Urges Steady Nerves at Home
description: UNITED NATIONS  President Obama came face to face on Monday with the conundrum of his war against the Islamic State: Even as he claimed gains in retaking territory from the militants in Iraq, he had to steady nerves after a stabbing rampage inspired by them in the United States.

title: Private Coaches Proliferate in Hockeys Elite Ranks
description: TORONTO  Adam Oates was an unemployed N.H.L. coach in the spring of 2015 when he tuned in to watch the N.B.A. finals.

title: Video Released in Terence Crutchers Killing by Tulsa Police
description: The Police Department in Tulsa, Okla., released video on Monday of an encounter during which, the authorities said, a white police officer fatally shot an unarmed black man who could be seen raising his hands above his head.

title: How Pop Culture Wore Out Leonard Cohens Hallelujah
description: Leonard Cohens ballad Hallelujah has become so inescapable that the songwriter once asked for a break from his own track. I think its a good song, but too many people sing it, he told The Guardian in 2009, agreeing with a critic for The New York Times who asked for a moratorium on Hallelujah in movies.

title: The Success of the Voter Fraud Myth
description: How does a lie come to be widely taken as the truth?

title: The 75-Year-Old Arm Wrestler
description: WEST BRIDGEWATER, Mass.  In a musty, dungeonlike basement here, more than a dozen sweaty men and women descend the steep steps every Thursday night to grunt and groan while they work on their arm-wrestling techniques.

title: Who Is Ahmad Khan Rahami?
description: Ahmad Khan Rahami, 28, was arrested in connection with explosions in New York and New Jersey over the weekend. Neighbors described him as a friendly car enthusiast and were surprised by the arrest.

title: Whats for Dessert?
description: TUESDAY PUZZLE  Tracy Bennett is a fabulous crossword puzzle constructor, but I worry about her cooking skills.

title: Chelsea Residents Grapple With a Close Call in Their Neighborhood
description: When the barricades were removed, the law enforcement officers had cleared out and the news cameras had mostly dispersed, life on West 27th Street in the Chelsea neighborhood of Manhattan appeared to return to normal. But on Monday morning, nearly 36 hours after an explosive device was discovered across the street from her home, Lisa Bergofin was still shaking, thinking about what could have been.

title: Noah Syndergaard Stumbles en Route to a Potential Wild-Card Start
description: When the Mets debated how to align their starting rotation this week, they weighed short-term goals against long-term planning. It is a careful balance to strike because, although the Mets have a clear path to a playoff berth, none has yet been secured.

title: News Quiz | Sept. 13-19, 2016
description: Have you been following the news? Take our quiz to see what you know and to learn more.

title: D. Keith Mano, Novelist Who Tackled Christianity, Sex and More, Dies at 74
description: D. Keith Mano, whose teeming, rollicking novels explored the problems and passions of Christianity in the modern world, to remarkable effect in the capacious, Rabelaisian black comedy Take Five, died on Wednesday in Manhattan. He was 74.

title: Corrections: September 20, 2016
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: Whats on TV Tuesday: This Is Us and Bull
description: Mandy Moore, Milo Ventimiglia and Sterling K. Brown star in This Is Us, about a group of interconnected people born on the same day. After leaving NCIS, Michael Weatherly has landed a leading role as a trial consultant in Bull. And if you havent watched the Emmy-winning The People v. O. J. Simpson: American Crime Story, now is the time.

title: Elder Bush Plans to Vote for Hillary Clinton, a Kennedy Says
description: Kathleen Kennedy Townsend, the eldest child of Robert F. Kennedy, said in a Facebook post on Monday that the elder President George Bush told her that he planned to vote for Hillary Clinton. The former president, however, is not talking.

title: London Fashion Week, Day 5: MarquesAlmeida and NewGen
description: LONDON  After a busy four days, London Fashion Week comes to a close on Tuesday, with just a few shows on the calendar before the fashion tribe heads to Heathrow for flights to Milan (perhaps making a detour to Bradley Smith, Terminal 5s first blow dry bar, which officially opened Sept. 15 and promises that you will be on your way, stylishly coiffed, in 15 minutes).

title: G.M. and Union Avoid Strike by Canadian Workers
description: OTTAWA  General Motors and a union narrowly averted a strike by Canadian workers on Tuesday with a deal that could serve as a model for preserving the countrys dwindling auto jobs.

title: Regular M.R.I. Is Safe During Pregnancy
description: Having an M.R.I. during pregnancy presents no danger to the fetus or the offspring, researchers have found, but the risks appear to change when a contrast agent is used.

title: Burberry Turns the Page
description: LONDON  The first show in the next stage of Burberrys life as a brand took place on Monday in the former environs of a once-famous bookstore at the top of Charing Cross Road, just past the theater where Harry Potter and the Cursed Child was playing to standing-room only crowds.

title: Bringing @EverydayAfrica to the Printed Page
description: The founders of the Everyday Africa Instagram Feed are hoping to publish a book that will educate people on the reality of life in Africas many nations.

title: How Bad Off Is Oil-Rich Venezuela? Its Buying U.S. Oil
description: EL FURRIAL, Venezuela  One oil rig was idle for weeks because a single piece of equipment was missing. Another was attacked by armed gangs who made off with all they could carry. Many oil workers say they are paid so little that they barely eat and have to keep watch over one another in case they faint while high up on the rigs.

title: Bringing @EverydayAfrica to the Printed Page
description: When one thinks of Africa  and it is always Africa, never a specific country  what comes to mind are wartime scenes of starving children, kids toting machine guns and diseases like AIDS and Ebola devastating the continent. If you doubt this, check the Daily Show segment called Spot the Africa, where the former and current hosts Jon Stewart and Trevor Noah discuss the stereotypes that dominate coverage. It seems an insurmountable task to see a more nuanced view of the continents many nations.

title: SUNYs Wise Move on Admissions
description: Colleges that ask about criminal convictions on their applications frighten away untold numbers of students who could succeed academically and who present no risk to campus safety. Fortunately, the trustees of the 64-campus State University of New York did the right thing last week when they voted to remove the felony question from admissions applications. Colleges elsewhere in the country would do well to follow this example.

title: Dignity and Sadness in the Working Class
description: A few weeks ago I met a guy in Kentucky whod lived through every trend of deindustrializing America.

title: Modern Housing With Village Virtues
description: Working families in the United States have many struggles today: expensive child care, not enough time to cook healthy meals, disconnection from nature, a sense of social isolation  what the sociologist Robert Putnam famously called bowling alone  and more. Older Americans, a booming population, often end up segregated generationally and in dire need of care and companionship.

title: Our Immigrants, Our Strength
description: World leaders are gathering in New York this week for the United Nations General Assembly, and at the top of their agenda sits a refugee crisis that has reached a level of urgency not seen since World War II. The United Nations Summit for Refugees and Migrants and President Obamas Leaders Summit on Refugees represent a watershed moment that is putting a global spotlight on the need for an effective response to a growing humanitarian crisis.

title: The Bernie Bump
description: NEW PALTZ, N.Y.  This crunchy college town, between the Hudson River and the Catskill Mountains, feels like an ideal place for a Woodstock attendee to retire. Amble down Main Street, and youll see a yoga studio, a gluten-free bakery and a clothing store called the Groovy Blueberry. Im already against the NEXT war, a passing bumper sticker reads.

title: How to Raise Trillions for Green Investments
description: SAVING our planet from the worst effects of climate change wont be cheap. A new report from the United Nations says that the world will need to mobilize $90 trillion in public and private capital over the next 15 years.

title: Reversion to the Angry
description: Arthur Brooks: Hi, Gail. Another week slouching toward Gomorrah  I mean, heading toward the election. But at the top of todays basket of deplorables, before politics, is the sad fact that terrorism is back in the news. This time, it was bombs in New York and New Jersey and a knife attack in Minnesota. Thank God no one was killed by the attackers, but this seems to be becoming the new normal.

title: The Cost of Corporate-Funded Research
A Brand-New Learning Network
description: Good morning!

title: Once a Voice of Young China, Han Han Stakes Out a Different Path
description: Once celebrated as the voice of Chinas rebellious youth and the countrys most-read blogger, Han Han, who turns 34 on Friday, has shifted more of his energies in recent years into his career as a racecar driver, filmmaking and family life. Since 2013, he has rarely updated his blog, preferring short messages on his Weibo account, and often addressing personal issues rather than the scathing social and political criticism that made his early reputation. He writes movie scripts, song lyrics and, in 2014, he directed his first movie, the road trip comedy The Continent. He is working on two more films, adapted from his own novels.

title: Did F.D.R. Know He Was Dying? Did Anyone?
description: HIS FINAL BATTLE The Last Months of Franklin RooseveltBy Joseph LelyveldIllustrated. 399 pp. Alfred A. Knopf. $30.

title: What We Can Learn From Women Who Break the Rules
description: TRAINWRECKThe Women We Love to Hate, Mock, and Fear ... and WhyBy Sady Doyle297 pp. Melville House. $25.99.

title: A Site to Help Get Wedding Bells Ringing and Ringing and Ringing
description: Add this twist to the panoply of websites that promise to fill the holes in your love life: Sites that are aimed at married men who want to add wives, and single women whod be happy sharing a spouse.

title: Donald Trump, the Unsinkable Candidate
description: This American presidential election is a dizzying wonder: a torrent of outrages, gaffes and prime-time dramas, where one story blurs into the next, most of it driven by the Republican contender, Donald J. Trump.

title: Donald Trump Stands by Chris Christie Despite Revelations in Bridge Closing Trial
description: When Donald J. Trump campaigned in South Carolina in December, in a crowded and tightening Republican primary, he made a pointed declaration about one of his opponents, Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey.

title: Racial Segregation in New York Schools Starts With Pre-K, Report Finds
description: From elementary through high school, New York City children tend to go to school with others similar to themselves, in one of the countrys most racially segregated systems.

title: 15 Years Into Afghan War, Americans Would Rather Not Talk About It
description: The United States will soon mark 15 full years of war in Afghanistan, but you wouldnt know it from the political discourse.

title: Resolution of Jacob Wetterling Case Also Closes Chapter for a Reporter
description: ST. JOSEPH, Minn.  White ribbons flutter along a grade schools fence here in memory of Jacob E. Wetterling, whose remains were found this month nearly 27 years after he was abducted on a country road. A fresh vase of flowers sits at the spot on the road, silent but for crickets and the whoosh of wind through rows of corn, where Jacob was grabbed so many years ago. And though it is the middle of the day, at the house where Jacob lived, the porch light still is on, just as it has been over a matter of decades  here and at homes across Minnesota  to guide him home.

title: Ahmad Khan Rahami, U.S. Elections, Tulsa: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Morning Agenda: Wells Fargos Comeuppance, Tiptoeing Around Trump, Self-Driving Cars
description: Remember the days when a congressional grilling was pretty much a rite of passage for bank chief executives?

title: At Value-Focused Hotels, the Free Breakfast Gets Bigger
description: At some affordably priced hotels in the United States, a free breakfast is increasingly a perk of a stay.

title: When Should Children Take Part in Medical Decisions?
description: Pediatricians sometimes find ourselves holding small children down and treating them against their will. When cleaning the wax out of a toddlers ear, for example, to see if theres an infection, we dont ask the childs opinion.

title: The Season of the Skulls
description: When I was 11 and my sister 6, my parents pulled us out of our new Australian school for a six-week-long research trip across the belly of the continent. A year earlier, we had moved from the United States to Canberra, where my dad was doing post-doctorate work in geochemistry at the Australian National University, and now we were setting out to explore this vast new country.

title: New York Today: Bail Is Set for a Suspect
description: Updated, 11:38 a.m.

title: Harvesting Grapes in France, With Champagne as Reward
description: As a wine lover with an active imagination, Id always pictured the French wine harvest as a cross between Sideways and I Love Lucy, a sun-drenched bacchanal featuring boozy lunches en plein air, rosy-cheeked peasants crushing fruit with their bare feet, and a bit of insouciant grape picking.

title: Japans Negative Interest Rates Explained
description: TOKYO  Japans central bank is reviewing its economic policies, asking why they have failed to kick-start growth, as intended. Its much-anticipated report is due on Wednesday. One target is negative interest rates  an unconventional tactic adopted in Japan and Europe that turns the usual rules of borrowing and lending upside down.

title: Trump Campaign Vows to Fund Florida Push, Official Says, but Cash Is in Limbo
description: The campaign of Donald J. Trump, whose grass-roots organizing in Florida is far behind that of conventional presidential nominees, promised $1.9 million for a ground game in the state but has yet to come through with the money, less than five weeks before early voting begins.

title: Senate Is Set to Vote on Zika and Government Funding
description: WASHINGTON  After an unexpected delay, the Senate is scheduled to vote on Tuesday to advance a bill to keep the governments lights on and to help fund the fight against Zika, while paving the way for Planned Parenthoods partner in Puerto Rico to have access to some of the roughly $1.1 billion in planned federal money in its efforts against the virus.

title: U.N. Suspends Convoys to Syria After Attack on Aid Trucks
description: GENEVA  The United Nations suspended all aid convoys in Syria on Tuesday, the day after a deadly airstrike on trucks loaded with crucial supplies of food and medicine. The airstrike came after the Syrian military had declared an end to a seven-day partial cease-fire.

title: Thai Court Finds British Labor Activist Guilty of Defamation
description: HONG KONG  A Thai court on Tuesday found a British labor activist guilty of defamation and computer crimes, a verdict that some experts and rights advocates predicted would harm efforts to protect migrant workers in Southeast Asia.

title: California Today: Clearing the Air, Without Fossil Fuels
description: Good morning.

title: A National Parks Plea: Enjoy the Animals; Dont Act Like One
description: Does a bear poop in the woods? Of course it does, and so, apparently, do a whole lot of humans.

title: When to Call a Lie a Lie
description: Suppose that Donald Trump stops insisting President Obama was born outside the United States, and then saddles Hillary Clinton with starting the rumor in the first place. Is that stretching the truth? An unfounded assertion? An error? A falsehood?

title: How a Russian Fascist Is Meddling in Americas Election
description: NEW HAVEN  The president of Russia, Vladimir V. Putin, once described the collapse of the Soviet Union as a geopolitical catastrophe. But the political thinker who today has the most influence on Mr. Putins Russia is not Vladimir Lenin, the founder of the Communist system, but rather Ivan Ilyin, a prophet of Russian fascism.

title: 1916: Antiwar Riots in Germany
description: LONDON  Despatches from The Hague and Amsterdam announce that grave disorders have again occurred at Chemnitz and Hamburg. The population of Chemnitz, having learned that a large number of the local workingmen had been killed in the Somme, gathered in the streets on Saturday afternoon. The manifestants remained deaf to the orders to disperse and were charged by the cavalry. Revolvers were fired, five Hussars being killed and fourteen wounded. A general fight ensued, and detachments of infantry had to be brought up. Altogether about 40 persons were killed, and 300 who were carrying revolvers were arrested.  The New York Herald, European Edition, Sept. 21, 1916

title: What Hugo Chvez Tells Us About Donald Trump
description: MEXICO CITY  Long before becoming president, when he was a soldier, Hugo Chvez organized cultural activities, most notably beauty pageants. On a stage, microphone in hand, Mr. Chvez served as host, pumping up the audience and announcing the winner. The showman in him already struggled to emerge from under the uniform. Mr. Chvez said he imitated the proceedings he had seen on television in these improvised contests. This is how he learned to play to an audience.

title: London Fashion Week Partygoers Tear Up Dance Floor (and Tear Down a Wall)
description: LONDON  Where is your passport? I want your documentation now, demanded a thickset uniformed soldier with a heavy German accent, sitting on a velvet pouf in a shadowy subterranean nightclub. On the left, a pack of scowling punks in leathers leaned against a graffitied concrete wall. To the right, hordes of beautiful women in glitter and shoulder pads lounged, sipping cups of Champagne.

title: China Announces Inquiry Into Company Trading With North Korea
description: The police in northeastern China have announced a criminal investigation into a Chinese conglomerate that does extensive trade with North Korea, which researchers in South Korea and the United States say included materials that can be used in the production of nuclear weapons.

title: Greeks Appeal for Aid After Fire Damages Refugee Camp
description: ATHENS  Thousands of people were left homeless after a fire tore through a refugee camp Monday night on the Aegean island of Lesbos, and the Greek authorities appealed on Tuesday to the European Union for more support in managing the migration crisis.

title: Eight Beautiful Bucket Bags
description: Sturdy silhouettes in soft leather, suede and python.

title: Reviving the Double-Breasted Suit
description: The classic mens style, once a straightforward emblem of corporate power, is now a witty tribute to tailoring.

title: JPMorgan Picks Todd Combs, a Warren Buffett Protg, to Join Board
description: Todd A. Combs, a protg of the billionaire investor Warren Buffett, has been named a new board member at JPMorgan Chase.

title: When Kim Gordon Met Michael Smith
description: A raw noise-rock pioneer and a fancy interior designer meet somewhere in the middle.

title: Rights Groups Criticize Israeli Inquiry Into 2014 Gaza War
description: JERUSALEM  Israeli and Palestinian rights organizations have challenged the credibility of Israels inquiries into possible military misconduct during the 2014 war in Gaza, with one group describing the internal legal process as a facade intended to try to stave off a war crimes investigation by the International Criminal Court.

title: Chappatte on New York, After the Chelsea Blast
description: Trying to return to normal life.

title: 5 Cuban Volleyball Players Convicted of Rape in Finland
description: A Finnish court convicted on Tuesday five players from Cubas national volleyball team of raping a woman while they were in Finland for a Volleyball World League tournament in July, before the Summer Olympics in Rio de Janeiro, according to news reports.

title: On Istiklal, Istanbuls Champs-lyses, Symbols of a Citys Malaise
description: ISTANBUL  Istiklal Avenue is Istanbuls Champs-lyses, or its Times Square, far from loved by the citys sophisticates but a place everyone goes to, if only to get to somewhere better.

title: Airstrikes Hit Aid Trucks in Aleppo as Cease-Fire Ends
description: Just after the Syrian military declared the end of a cease-fire in September, aerial attacks destroyed a convoy carrying supplies and aid to neighborhoods of Aleppo, a rescue worker reported.

title: 1916: Lincolns Log Cabin Now Nations Property
description: HODGENSVILLE, Ky.  Standing before the marble memorial building which now houses the log cabin birthplace of Abraham Lincoln, President Wilson to-day, on behalf of the United States, accepted the Lincoln homestead, purchased by popular subscription through the Lincoln Farm Association. Forty thousand persons assembled for the ceremonies.

title: Fashioning a Post-Brexit World
description: LONDON  Uncertainty and insecurity, rents in the social fabric  such atmospheric currents have a creeping, potent influence on the creative mind.

title: MarquesAlmeida: Spring 2017
description: Marta Marques and Paulo Almeida, who are experimenting with sending ads as personalized emails to fans, show their spring collection.

title: 1966: King Leads Pupils in March
description: GRENADA  The Rev. Martin Luther King Jr. today [Sept. 20] led nearly 200 Negro children to schools where integration last week set off a mob frenzy by whites. Dr. King told a gathering of Negro pupils and parents at the Bellflower Baptist Church before leading them on the demonstration that he could not agree with the black power slogan of Burn baby, burn that came out of the 1965 riots in Watts. I am forced to disagree with that slogan, Dr. King said. I say, Learn, baby, learn and Build, baby, build.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Sept. 21, 1966

title: Sheldon Adelson Focuses on Congressional Races, Despite Donald Trumps Pleas
description: The Las Vegas billionaire Sheldon G. Adelson and his wife are giving more than $40 million to groups backing Republican congressional candidates, according to campaign filings and interviews with Republican strategists, disregarding repeated entreaties for support from allies of Donald J. Trump and dealing a major setback to Mr. Trumps efforts to rally the deepest-pocketed Republican givers.

title: We Gave Four Good Pollsters the Same Raw Data. They Had Four Different Results.
description: The error the polling world rarely talks about in public.

title: Approve or Reject: Can You Moderate Five New York Times Comments?
description: Were partnering with Google to change the way we review the 11,000 comments posted each day to nytimes.com  and this is what were up against.

title: An English Soccer Club Turns Fantasy Sports Into Reality
description: At first glance, the sideline of a United London F.C. home game features exactly what one would expect from an amateur-level soccer match on a rented field in Englands capital. Water bottles. A collection of balls. Substitutes warming up. A crowd that United Londons chairman, Mark North, describes as one man and his dog.

title: Erdogan, at United Nations, Defends Turkeys Move Into Syria
description: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan of Turkey defended his decision to send ground troops into Syria on Tuesday, saying that his militarys incursion had helped establish peace, balance and stability in a region taken over by hopelessness.

title: U.S. Officials Say Russia Probably Attacked U.N. Humanitarian Convoy
description: Russia was probably responsible for the deadly bombing of a United Nations humanitarian aid convoy in Syria, American officials said Tuesday, further shredding what remained of a severely weakened agreement between the United States and Russia aimed at halting the war.

title: Retracing a Suspects Journey: From a Bomb Site to a Quiet Doorway
description: ELIZABETH, N.J.  A few minutes after 7 oclock, the evening sky over the train station, which was just the color of Tang, has settled to a deep purple. The rain that fell during the day on Monday has relented, finally. But the air is still sticky. Very, very sticky.

title: Liev Schreiber, the Reluctant Rake
description: On a recent evening, Liev Schreiber wandered through several rooms of 18th-century French portraiture in the Metropolitan Museum of Art. The museum had closed an hour before, allowing Mr. Schreiber private communion with the heaving bosoms and coy smiles, the swathes of silk and froths of lace. He wasnt impressed. He dismissed a Fragonard painting of a woman reading a love letter as chocolate box.

title: Ousted Critic of Rodrigo Duterte Decries New McCarthyism in Philippines
description: MANILA  For one outspoken critic of President Rodrigo Dutertes deadly antidrug campaign in the Philippines, the denouement came quickly.

title: A Very Old Castle, Full of Contemporary Art
description: Paintings and sculptures by Gerald Laing populate the 16th-century castle he left New York to buy and restore in the 1970s.

title: Inside a Pop Artists Castle  and His Inspiration  in the Scottish Highlands
description: Wearying of the social whirl and turmoil of New York life in the late 1960s, the artist Gerald Laing did the unthinkable: He abandoned his successful studio practice in the city for a derelict castle in northeast Scotland. Staying still and doing the same thing over and over would have been safe, says the artists son Farquhar Ogilvie-Laing, who was born in 1970, while renovation work on the castle was underway. It was considered absolute professional suicide for my father to move to the north of Scotland from New York when he was doing well. The Highlands in the 1970s were very remote.

title: 15 Questions for Clinton and Trump. You Choose.
description: Even after the first debate, many issues havent been adequately addressed. Which are most important to you?

title: Ahmad Khan Rahami Was Inspired by Bin Laden, Charges Say
description: The man who the authorities say set off powerful bombs in Manhattan and on the Jersey Shore over the weekend planned the attacks for months, conducted a dry run just days before unleashing his assault and took inspiration from Brother Osama bin Laden and other international terrorists, according to a criminal complaint filed in federal court on Tuesday.

title: Orlandos Latest Theme Park Is a City for Wellness
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  In this most-visited city in the country, tens of millions of tourists spend their dollars every year in a swarm of theme parks that have made this area famous around the world. Now, Orlando is trying to show itself as a place far different than a land of fantasy.

title: Daily Report: Regulators Catching Up With Driverless Cars
description: Technology is changing so quickly that it is regularly outstripping regulations, often forcing federal regulators to play catch-up.

title: Jimmy Carter: A First Step for Syria? Stop the Killing
description: The announcement this month of a new cease-fire agreement in Syria is good news. But a lack of trust among the Syrian belligerents and their foreign supporters means this agreement, like the one that came before it, is vulnerable to collapse.

title: Donald Trump Jr. Compares Syrian Refugees to Skittles That Would Kill You
description: Donald Trump Jr. is facing intense backlash on social media after he posted a message on Twitter Monday night that compared Syrian refugees to a bowl of Skittles sprinkled with a few that would kill you.

title: North Korea Says It Has Tested a New Long-Range Rocket Engine
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North Korea said Tuesday that it had conducted the ground test of a new long-range rocket engine used to put a satellite into orbit, an effort long considered by Washington and the United Nations Security Council to be a cover for developing an intercontinental ballistic missile.

title: Gnter Seeger NY
description: The lyrical cooking of a star chef finds a new home in the West Village.

title: At Gnter Seeger NY, a Star Chef Resurfaces, Confidence Intact
description: Its complicated to praise someone whose confidence already seems to be reinforced with steel and clad in granite. Its even more complicated in the case of Gnter Seeger, whose confidence is the source of both his success in the kitchen and his occasional capacity for sabotaging himself in the dining room.

title: Japans Newest Technology Innovation: Priest Delivery
description: SAKAI, Japan  The stubble-haired Buddhist priest lit incense at a small, cupboardlike altar just as members of his order have done for centuries. As the priest chanted sutras, Yutaka Kai closed his eyes and prayed for his wife, who died last year of complications from a knee replacement.

title: Minimum-Wage Rift May Lead to Competing Pay Scales at New York Areas Airports
description: The governors of New York and New Jersey have staked out such starkly different positions on the minimum wage that their discord could result in uneven pay scales for thousands of workers at the airports that serve New York City.

title: Get Sharper Text on Your Windows Screen
description: Q. Is there any way to make the overall text on screen in Windows 10 less fuzzy?

title: Is Lying Trumps Strategy?
description: The deception was so brazen, so demonstrably disprovable, that it felt like a milestone in campaign history: After relentlessly promoting the lie that Barack Obama was born outside the United States, Donald J. Trump looked into the cameras and declared that he had instead debunked that insidious myth.

title: Megu and Its Japanese Menu Return to New York
description: MEGU New York once again has a branch of this lavish Japanese-style global restaurant chain, which closed its two Manhattan locations two years ago. The group is now owned by Jon Bakhshi, who also owns Beautique restaurant, a celebrity magnet, on West 58th Street. The sumptuous new Megu has replaced Cherry in the basement of the Dream Downtown hotel. A dramatic mirrored staircase leads to a lounge, a sushi bar and a vast dining room. Some of the dcor, like a room decorated with antique kimonos, may be familiar to those who recall the original Megu in TriBeCa. Nothing is modest here, and that also goes for the menu, by the chef Frances Tariga-Weshnak, a native of the Philippines, who is serving spice-crusted duck, edamame lollipops with tahini sauce and Maine lobster with ginger emulsion. Theres an extensive selection of sushi. (Opens Thursday): 355 West 16th Street, 212-885-9400, meguworldwide.com.

title: Giant Bubbles and Urban Periscopes Among Winners of Play Contest
description: A nonprofit group devoted to creating play areas has awarded $1 million to spur 50 new projects that create opportunities for urban children to play at places like bus stops, barber shops and Laundromats.

title: Sneakers So Nice, You Cant See the Pants
description: What we talk about when we talk about athleisure is wrong. We celebrate the mainstreaming of casual comfort as a retort to the tyranny of tailoring. We blather on about the potent social-media salesmanship of superficially jobless celebrities forever photographed out in the wild, getting a pressed juice or a macchiato. Where are they coming from? Where are they going?

title: Elizabeth Warren Accuses Wells Fargo Chief of Gutless Leadership
description: WASHINGTON  The more the chief executive of Wells Fargo tried to explain, the more skeptical the senators became.

title: Obamas Final U.N. Address as President
description: A New York Times correspondent analyzes President Obama's last speech before the United Nations General Assembly, in which the president discussed the pros and cons of globalization.

title: Syrian Rescuer Recounts Aid Convoy Attack
description: Airstrikes destroyed a convoy headed to Aleppo province in Syria on Monday, killing aid workers and destroying tons of supplies destined for besieged civilians. A volunteer rescuer worker described the scene.

title: Activity Trackers May Undermine Weight Loss Efforts
description: Wearable activity monitors can count your steps and track your movements, but they dont, apparently, help you lose weight. In fact, you might lose more weight without them.

title: Seeking Plutos Frigid Heart
description: Set foot on an alien world, three billion miles from the warmth of the sun.

title: The Modern Games
description: Travel through time to some of the most unforgettable moments in Olympic history.

title: Immigration Reform: Disparate Ideas, Disparate Futures
description: If Donald Trump were to win the presidency and carry out his strident promise to build an impregnable wall along the border with Mexico, both advocates and foes agree, it would turn the United States into a nation quite different from the one they live in.

title: Fashion Week Photo Diary: Erdem, Christopher Kane and Burberry
description: Scenes from the spring/summer 2017 collections that were presented in London on Monday.

title: The Latest Example of Donald Trumps Double-Talk
description: Donald Trump had a private meeting in New York with President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi of Egypt on Monday, professing his high regard for peace-loving Muslims, the same day a Trump adviser was quoted as saying that if elected, Mr. Trump can ban anybody from Egypt from entering the United States.

title: In a Fictional Pub, a Tale of a Bombing. A Block Away, a Very Real Explosion.
description: The curtain had gone up on the play Quietly about 25 minutes earlier. On stage, two middle-aged men in a pub, Jimmy and Ian, spoke about the atrocities they had lived through.

title: Alvin Ailey Is Expanding Its Crowded Manhattan Home
description: The Alvin Ailey Dance Foundation is raising the roof: it held a ceremonial roof-breaking performance on Tuesday to mark the beginning of a $25 million construction project that will add three more stories of studios, classrooms and offices to its Manhattan home.

title: The Magnificent 10: Restaurants That Changed How We Eat
description: Paul Freedman was having lunch at Delmonicos  not the original, which opened in the early 19th century, but a relic of it in the financial district. Lobster Newburg was still on the menu, the meat napped with a brandy-spiked butter.

title: Fort Lee Officials Recall Chaos and Turmoil as Lanes to Bridge Were Closed
description: NEWARK  Almost as soon as Chris Christie was sworn in as governor of New Jersey in 2010, his administration began an elaborate courtship of Mayor Mark Sokolich of Fort Lee.

description: To the Editor:

description: Donald J. Trumps progress in national polls has done something in the 2016 presidential race that is unusual. It has made the Electoral College matter.

title: Comic Book Artists Create Publication to Honor Orlando Victims
description: The comic book community is coming together to help the victims of the Orlando shooting. In December, DC Comics and IDW Publishing will publish Love Is Love, a 144-page comic book whose proceeds will benefit Equality Florida and its fund for those affected by the June 12 attack at the Pulse nightclub in Florida.

title: In London, Cocktails for 500 Fashion Influencers
description: LONDON  After the curtain fell on the Burberry show here Monday night, the front-row crowd moved en masse to the annual Business of Fashion 500 party, held at the London Edition hotel just north of Oxford Street.

title: Angelina Jolie to Divorce Brad Pitt, Ending Brangelina
description: It was a grand Hollywood romance that made its presence felt far and wide, from the red carpet to refugee camps in the worlds trouble spots.

title: Notes on Donald Trump From a Gun Shop
description: In September Nicholas Kristof wrote a column about false equivalence, arguing that the media has helped create a perception that Donald Trump and Hillary Clinton are equalcandidates. He concluded, Ive never met a national politician as ill informed, asdeceptive, as evasive and as vacuous as Trump. Hes not normal. Mike Weisser is an N.R.A. lifetime member and the owner of a gun shop in western Massachusetts; here is his response to that column.

title: Classic Rosh Hashana Desserts Get a Professional Upgrade
description: When Alex Levin became a pastry chef, he decided he wanted to keep his grandmothers Rosh Hashana traditions  though with a few modifications.

description: To the Editor:

title: Hollande Pushes Efforts for Syrian Peace
description: In his address to the United Nations General Assembly, President Franois Hollande of France urged members to push for humanitarian aid and a cease-fire in Syria.

title: Samantha Bee Condemns NBC and Jimmy Fallons Trump Interview
description: Monday was in many ways typical for the late-night comedy shows, with network hosts like CBSs Stephen Colbert and NBCs Seth Meyers performing pointed satirical monologues about Donald J. Trump, the Republican presidential nominee, and his many years spent propagating lies about President Obamas birthplace.

title: Review: Between Disbelief and Despair, Lewis Blacks Black to the Future
description: During 20 years worth of guest appearances on The Daily Show, Lewis Black has gone through many moods: incensed, seething, irate, furious, aggrieved, annoyed. All right, not that many moods, then. At his quietest, he appears to be struggling to hold back another choleric eruption.

title: Rikers Officer Pleads Guilty to Helping Cover Up Fatal 12 Beating of Inmate
description: A correction officer at Rikers Island pleaded guilty on Tuesday to helping cover up the fatal 2012 beating of a 52-year-old inmate who had kidney problems and walked with a cane.

title: The End of Brangelina
description: Angelia Jolie Pitt and Brad Pitt are filing for divorce.

title: The Many Sad Fates of Mr. Toledano
description: Afraid of dying? Dont be. Over a period of three years, I stood by my friends side while he became homeless and obese, got disfiguring plastic surgery, had a stroke, became an alcoholic, and got busted for insider trading. Then I watched him die  seven different ways. And, truthfully, it may have been the best thing thats ever happened to us.

title: The Many Sad Fates of Mr. Toledano
description: Phillip Toledano was terrified of growing old. So he decided to do it as many times as possible.

title: Review: In Designated Survivor, Jack Bauer Gets a Promotion
description: Designated Survivor is about a man with no obvious qualifications who suddenly becomes president of the United States. That would be an alarming scenario in real life, but in fiction its not so bad, because the accidental president happens to be Jack Bauer.

title: U.N. Signals That Climate Deal Has Backing Needed to Enter Force
description: UNITED NATIONS  The United Nations secretary general, Ban Ki-moon, is expected to announce on Wednesday that he has secured enough commitments from world leaders to ensure that the 2015 Paris climate accord will enter into legal force this year, binding the next American president, whoever it is.

title: Fashioning a Post-Brexit World
description: Looks from London Fashion Week collections.

title: How Was a Serial Rapist Nominated to the Pro Football Hall of Fame?
description: On the list of nominees for the Pro Football Hall of Fame released last week, one name stands out: Darren Sharper. Should Sharper be elected, he is unlikely to turn up at the induction ceremony next summer. He is serving 20 years in prison for drugging and raping women.

title: How Tesla and Apple Could Be Good for Each Other
description: Great partnerships are often forged when each party enjoys a surplus of something the other needs, and theres little conflict in their ambitions. By that logic, two of Silicon Valleys best-known firms, Apple and Tesla Motors, really need each other right now. An investment in Tesla by Apple in return for some of the carmakers innovation dust might be just the ticket.

title: In Julias French Kitchen
description: Our reporter Julia Moskin spent a week cooking in Julia Childs kitchen in the South of France.

title: In Julia Childs Provenal Kitchen
description: PLASCASSIER, France  When I hefted the rolling pin in my hand, I finally felt it: a thread of energy, a thrill of recognition. I knew I was standing in Julia Childs kitchen, and I was about to put it to work.

title: Olderbrothers Spring/Summer 2017 Collection
description: Called Summer Camp, the range includes shorts and T-shirts, some in a custom, turmeric-based marigold hue.

title: Brand to Know: Basics That Champion an Eco-Friendly Agenda
description: To prepare their newest goods, the designers Bobby Bonaparte and Max Kingery bought turmeric in bulk  15 pounds, to be precise; their Los Angeles workshop continuously smelled of simmering curry in the weeks before they headed into production. They were perfecting the marigold hue that features prominently in the spring/summer 2017 collection for their brand, Olderbrother. Turmeric is a known natural dye, but making it stable, so that a garment can see sunlight or go in the washing machine, takes a while, Kingery says. He likens the process to cooking (although not all their ingredients are edible), another inexact science. For example, they created a black indigo because Kingery made a mathematical error. We really stumbled into that one, he says.

title: Shooting of Terence Crutcher by Tulsa Police
description: The Tulsa Police Department released video on Monday of a white police officer fatally shooting an unarmed black man in Tulsa, Okla.

title: In Wells Fargo Case, Watchdogs Didnt Play Team Ball
description: The Wells Fargo case has exposed something besides bad bank practices: gaps in United States regulatory teamwork.

title: Obama at the United Nations: Hope and Change
description: President Obama used his final appearance before the United Nations General Assembly on Tuesday to deliver the kind of speech a troubled world needed to hear. It was a sober yet encouraging assessment of the fast-moving trend toward an integrated world  coupled with a necessary call for reform.

title: Former House Speaker John Boehner Joins Washington Law Firm
description: John A. Boehner, the former speaker of the House who left Congress and his leadership post last year, is joining Squire Patton Boggs, a Washington-based law firm long known for its lobbying work.

title: What Were Reading
description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week. Sign up

title: Bombing Suspects Hometown Is a Magnet for Immigrants
description: ELIZABETH, N.J.  Along the commercial corridor of Elmora Avenue, Salvadoran pupusas are sold next to kosher California rolls and across the street from a salon where three Colombians, a Cuban and a Uruguayan cut hair. Past Las Amricas Bakery, the owner of another salon is the proud daughter of southern Italian immigrants.

title: Travel Diary: Block Shop
description: In Rajasthan, India, with the brands co-founders, Hopie and Lily Stockman.

title: Review: Lethal Weapon and MacGyver, 2 80s Reboots, 1 With Chemistry
description: Its chemistry versus cleverness in this weeks battle of the 1980s reboots. And the winner is  well, neither of them is mandatory viewing, but if you have to watch one, go with chemistry.

title: A Trip to India With the Sisters Behind a Cult-Favorite Textile Label
description: Twice a year for a month at a time, when the tourists melt away in the heat and the mangoes are really good, the sisters Lily and Hopie Stockman return to Rajasthan, India, where they have been traveling for the last five years to oversee the production of their textiles line, Block Shop. Beloved for its wood-printed scarves  which are conveyed along the international style route by such retailers as Playmountain in Tokyo and the Hammer Museum shop in Los Angeles  the label recently grew to include topstitched quilts and flat rugs known as dhurries that reflect, as Hopie explains, the subcontinents mashed-up confluence of overland influences: including pre-partition cotton weaving techniques, the dusky desert palette and the visual principles of jaali, stacked geometric forms found in Mughal and Islamic architecture.

title: John Jasperse Hopes Remains Lasts After the Dancing Stops
description: Its one thing, on an intellectual level, to grasp how ephemeral dance is. Coming to grips with it emotionally is something else. Theres plenty of excitement in fleetingness, but that can also lead to heartbreak. No, dance may not leave any tangible remains, but the choreographer John Jasperse sees another possibility.

title: Review: In Speechless, Balancing Family Needs With Special Needs
description: JJ DiMeo (Micah Fowler) is no angel. Hes sarcastic; hes a little devious; he can be rude. In other words, hes a teenager. The first time we see him, he flips somebody off, though we have to have it explained to us, because his version of the middle finger is a flat, extended hand.

title: Shawn Mendes, Pop Idol, Is Not Banking on a Gimmick
description: Shawn Mendes got his first guitar at the age of 14, a major-label record deal at 15 and his first No. 1 album  last years Handwritten  at 16, thanks largely to the democratizing power of the internet.

title: Review: A Hamlet That Wants to Get Closer
description: Sitting in the front row at the Public Theaters touring production of Hamlet on Friday evening, the woman had been a little restless. Now, with the title character perched a few feet away, weighing the pros and cons of being and not being, her head was down, as if she were looking at the floor.

title: Donald Trump Used Over $250,000 From Charity for Business Disputes, Report Says
description: Donald J. Trump, already under scrutiny for how he uses his foundation, directed more than a quarter of a million dollars from the charity to settle legal disputes stemming from his personal businesses, according to a report on Tuesday in The Washington Post.

title: Bruce Springsteens Memoir: Riding Shotgun With the Boss
description: Long dark highways and thin white lines; fire roads and Interstates; the skeleton frames of burned-out Chevrolets; barefoot girls sitting on the hoods of Dodges; pink Cadillacs; last-chance power drives; men who go out for a ride and never come back.

title: Syria, U.S. Presidential Race, Tulsa: Your Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Its Not Like Hollywood: Why U.S. Airstrikes Go Awry
description: WASHINGTON  If there is a single link between the wars fought by the United States in the Middle East and Afghanistan, it is the long list of errant airstrikes carried out by American warplanes. Weddings, funerals, hospitals and friendly forces have been mistakenly attacked, with each strike prompting fresh outrage.

title: Federal Charges Against Ahmad Rahami
description: In a complaint filed in federal court in Lower Manhattan, Ahmad Khan Rahami was charged with several crimes, including the use of weapons of mass destruction and bombing a place of public use, in the weekend bombings in New York and New Jersey.

title: The 15-Point Federal Checklist for Self-Driving Cars
description: Federal regulators announced their first safety checklist ever for semiautonomous and driverless cars this week. In the guidelines, the United States Department of Transportation urged automakers and tech companies to prove that their semiautonomous and autonomous vehicles could meet a 15-point list of safety expectations before the autos hit the road.

title: Public Companies See Gold in California
description: California is the capital of American business. One out of five companies on the New York Stock Exchange and the Nasdaq stock market hail from that state, according to my recent assessment of relevant data.

title: Burundi Killings Could Ignite Wider African Crisis, U.N. Report Warns
description: GENEVA  I could be your child; I beg you, save me, the 16-year-old pleaded to police officers in Burundi. Seconds later, an officer put two bullets in his head.

title: Varvara Lepchenko Is Cleared in Meldonium Inquiry
description: Months after reports of a doping violation first surfaced, the American tennis player Varvara Lepchenko was declared to bear no fault or negligence for her infringement by the International Tennis Federation on Tuesday after having tested positive for meldonium in January at a WTA tournament in Brisbane, Australia.

title: Allister Sparks, South African Journalist Who Challenged Apartheid, Dies at 83
description: Allister Sparks, a prominent South African journalist who challenged apartheid and exposed a covert propaganda campaign by his government, leading to the presidents downfall, died on Monday in Johannesburg. He was 83.

title: I Work at the Guggenheim
description: Dear Diary:

title: S.E.C. Is Latest to Look Into Exxon Mobils Workings
description: HOUSTON  The Securities and Exchange Commission has requested information from Exxon Mobil on the companys longstanding policy of not writing down the value of oil reserves, as other energy companies have done in the recent past, Exxon Mobil confirmed on Tuesday.

title: Mets Hope Steven Matz Can Make Imminent Return to Rotation
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  As the improvising Mets continue to piece together a pitching rotation for the final 10 days of the season, their hope of adding Steven Matz to the mix is becoming a little more realistic.

title: California Voters Face Choice: End Death Penalty, or Speed It Up
description: HUNTINGTON BEACH, Calif.  Beth Webb remembers talking with friends at her sisters Christmas party several years ago, wondering aloud if she would support the death penalty if someone she knew were murdered. Then, in 2011, her sister, Laura Webb Elody, was killed along with seven other people  as she worked at a hair salon in nearby Seal Beach.

title: Looming Transition Ignites Deadly Clashes in Congo
