description: KINSHASA, Democratic Republic of Congo  The bodies were still smoking Tuesday morning, hours after the sun had risen and the killers had driven off.

title: Minnesota Knife Attacker Had Only Infrequent, Minor Brushes With Police
description: ST. CLOUD, Minn.  Nearly eight years before Dahir Adan was shot dead by an off-duty police officer and accused of stabbing 10 people at a mall, the police stormed into his familys apartment here to break up a fight between two of his brothers.

title: When Lifes a Crazy Mess, Try Going Onstage
description: Last year, the actor and writer Brian Quijada proposed to his girlfriend. Diamond ring. Bended knee. White sand beach. The whole Instagram-worthy shebang.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Just when we think it cannot get any worse, the bar of depravity sinks lower.

title: G.M. Job Shift From Mexico Tests a Trump Premise
description: In the realm of international trade, it is a truism seemingly as consistent as gravity: Jobs and investment flow from north to south, while manufactured goods travel the other way around. Factories in the United States and Canada shutter as work shifts to Mexico and Central America, where human hands do it more cheaply.

title: In Backing Autonomous Cars, U.S. Tells Automakers to Figure It Out
description: The Obama administrations approach to hands-free driving is remarkably hands-off.

title: Lula, Brazils Ex-President, Will Be Tried on Corruption Charges
description: SO PAULO  The judge overseeing the investigation into the colossal scandal around Brazils national oil company accepted corruption charges on Tuesday against the nations former president, Luiz Incio Lula da Silva, setting the stage for a trial of one of Latin Americas most influential political figures.

title: Man Killed by Tulsa Police Posed No Threat, His Family Says
description: The family of Terence Crutcher, an unarmed black man whose fatal confrontation with the Tulsa, Okla., police was recorded on video, said Tuesday that Mr. Crutcher had posed no threat and that his hands were in the air when he was shot.

title: Behind Mr. Putins Easy Victory
description: In Russias parliamentary election on Sunday, Vladimir Putins party won three-quarters of the seats outright in the State Duma, the lower house of the Russian Parliament, and the rest indirectly, through parties loyal to him. It apparently did so without many voting irregularities, and despite a sluggish economy, sanctions imposed by the West and unrest in some quarters over the governments crackdown on civil liberties. What gives?

title: Rose Pak, a Brash Force for San Franciscos Chinatown, Dies at 68
description: Rose Pak, the brash, combative community organizer in San Francisco who never held political office but who transformed her citys Asian-American population into a substantial political power, died on Sunday at her home there in Chinatown. She was 68.

title: Pakistan Grows a Baseball Team From Its Home Soil
description: Straight off a bone-wearying 24-hour journey, the Pakistani national baseball team went about its inaugural workout in the United States on Tuesday before the Coney Island backdrop of Nathans Famous restaurant and the Cyclone roller coaster. The Pakistanis were at MCU Park in Brooklyn for the qualifiers of the World Baseball Classic, which begin Thursday, and they were hoping to find their equilibrium on unfamiliar ground.

title: Canada Agrees to Talks on Extradition Treaty With China
description: Canada has agreed to negotiate a bilateral extradition treaty with China, breaking with a longstanding opposition over concerns about Chinas lack of due process and other human rights violations, according to a joint communiqu quietly posted on the website of the Canadian prime ministers office.

title: Bombing Case Points to Gaps in Trumps and Clintons Antiterrorism Plans
description: WASHINGTON  There is nothing in Donald J. Trumps or Hillary Clintons antiterrorism plans that would have had much chance of stopping the bombings in New York and New Jersey that Ahmad Khan Rahami is accused of carrying out.

title: Chicago Is Planning to Add Hundreds of Police Officers
description: CHICAGO  This city, reeling from a rising toll of gun violence, may soon hire hundreds of additional police officers  more than 500 of them.

title: Under New Playoff Format, Liberty Have No Room for Error
description: At 21-13, the Liberty finished with the best record in the Eastern Conference for the second straight season, which this year is a feat as valuable as Monopoly money.

title: In Appeal to Voters, Muslim Brotherhood in Jordan Soft-Pedals Religion
description: AMMAN, Jordan  At the headquarters of the Muslim Brotherhood, Ali Abu al-Sukkars telephone would not stop ringing Tuesday. It was Election Day, the first time the Islamist organization had taken part after nearly a decade of boycotts, and Mr. Sukkar found himself in demand.

title: Spring Into Action
description: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE  When we met Matthew Sewell not long ago, he was making his New York Times crossword debut with a charming theme about fantasy sports.

title: Video Caps States Case in Trial Over Potsdam Boys Killing
description: CANTON, N.Y.  Banking their hopes on an array of circumstantial evidence, prosecutors in the murder trial of an upstate boy rested their case on Tuesday after showing a video of the suspects car in proximity to the boy as he was heading home, minutes before the fatal attack.

title: Ahmad Khan Rahamis YouTube Account Listed Jihad Videos, Complaint Says
description: The man who the police say planted bombs in New York and New Jersey had a YouTube account that listed his favorite videos, two of which related to jihad, according to a criminal complaint filed in Federal District Court in New York on Tuesday.

title: Donald Trump Jr.s Skittles Tweet Fits a Pattern
description: Donald Trump Jr.  a close political adviser to his father, Donald J. Trump, the Republican nominee for president  posted on Twitter on Monday night an image of a white bowl full of rainbow-colored Skittles. The image came with this text: If I had a bowl of skittles and I told you just three would kill you. Would you take a handful? Thats our Syrian refugee problem.

title: Gary Sanchezs Homer Gives Yankees a Win They Desperately Need
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla.  The Tampa Bay pitching coach Jim Hickey bounced out of the dugout in the seventh inning on Tuesday and hustled to the mound to have a quick word with reliever Brad Boxberger.

title: After Explosion, Chelseas 23rd Street Slowly Comes Back to Life
description: Steps away from the site where a Dumpster was blasted into the air, the owner of King David Gallery on West 23rd Street took his first look at the shattered glass covering his windowless store in Manhattan on Tuesday morning.

title: Mets Lose Second Straight to Braves as Jay Bruces Struggles Continue
description: In perhaps the biggest moment of Tuesdays 5-4 loss to the Atlanta Braves, Jay Bruce was not on the field or at the plate for the Mets. Yet most of the questions posed to Manager Terry Collins after the game centered on Bruce, the slumping right fielder who was brought to New York on the Aug. 1 trading deadline to spark a playoff push.

title: Protests Erupt in Charlotte After Police Kill a Black Man
description: About 16 police officers in Charlotte, N.C., were injured when a standoff between law enforcement and demonstrators turned ugly overnight after an officer fatally shot a black man on Tuesday afternoon.

title: Miamis Refurbished Stadium Will Be Decked Out in Street Art
description: A dozen giant street-art murals, some up to 150 feet wide, by 12 artists, will be on view at the Hard Rock Stadium in Miami Gardens, Fla., when the venue opens to the public for the first regular home game of the Miami Dolphins season on Sunday.

title: Allos Tryout: 5 Days With Googles Annoying Office Intern
description: You may now have more messaging apps than you have close friends.

title: Corrections: September 21, 2016
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Milan Fashion Week, Day 1: Will Gucci Be the Blockbuster Show of the Season?
description: Milan Fashion Week has arrived  and with it a whirlwind of shows, presentations, parties and prosecco pit stops. The next seven days will be intense, but we will be on hand to tell you what to look for on the hamster wheel that is the Italian womens wear show circuit.

title: I.P.O. for Postal Savings Bank of China Gets Help From Beijing
description: HONG KONG  Chinas biggest banks are struggling with a slowing economy, rising bad debts and shrinking profits.

title: Federal Complaint Traces Ahmad Khan Rahamis Steps Before Bombings
description: Federal authorities in Manhattan and New Jersey charged Ahmad Khan Rahami with several crimes late Tuesday, including the use of weapons of mass destruction and bombing a place of public use. A federal complaint roughly laid out the method the authorities believe Mr. Rahami used to compile the materials for bombs and then place them in New Jersey and New York.

title: Curtis Hanson, Director of Wicked Noir L.A. Confidential, Dies at 71
description: Curtis Hanson, the film director whose adaptation of the James Ellroy noir novel L.A. Confidential won him an Academy Award, died on Tuesday at his home in Los Angeles. He was 71.

title: Whats on TV Wednesday: Speechless and Designated Survivor
description: A mother fights for a better life for her son, who has cerebral palsy, in Speechless, starring Minnie Driver and Micah Fowler. Clayne Crawford and Damon Wayans play unlikely perfect partners in Lethal Weapon. And Kiefer Sutherland suddenly finds himself president of the United States in Designated Survivor.

title: Word + Quiz: simile
description: The word simile has appeared in 13 New York Times articles in the past year, including on Jan. 3 in the book review of James Hamiltons A Strange Business:

title: Under the Brooklyn Bridge, the New Photoville
description: This year is the fifth anniversary of Photoville, one of the countrys premier photo festivals, where an impressive range of images is exhibited inside shipping containers-turned-gallery spaces.

title: Bank of Japan Raises Target Despite Limited Progress
description: TOKYO  Despite sagging public confidence in its ability to encourage growth, Japans central bank on Wednesday raised a key economic target and said it would continue to pump money into the economy until it succeeded.

title: Under the Brooklyn Bridge, the New Photoville
description: Photoville, the unorthodox New York photography festival where images are presented in shipping containers, began in 2011 with a simple premise: to bring high-quality photography to the broadest audience possible.

title: How Companies Like Apple Dodge Taxes and Their Own Investors
description: As an investor, one who has been entrusted with helping to safeguard other peoples money over many years, I value the high degree of disclosure required from American public companies. Corporations and the world in which they operate change every day, so investors need to know the risks their money faces.

title: Two Ex-Spies and Donald Trump
description: When it comes to assessing the presidential race, I prefer to listen to the spies. They tend to be brutally unsentimental, see through the nonsense and cut to the cold, hard bottom line. And right now, two of the worlds foremost former spymasters are sending uncoded messages about what it will mean for America and the Western alliance if Donald Trump is elected president.

title: Clintons Samantha Bee Problem
description: When the histories of the Trump era are written from exile in Justin Trudeaus Canada, they will record that it was none other than Jimmy Fallon who brought down the republic.

title: Mr. Trumps Stupid Excuses on Taxes
description: All major party nominees for president going back nearly 40 years have released their tax returns except Donald Trump. That leads to a simple question: What is he hiding?

title: Hillary Clinton: My Plan for Helping Americas Poor
description: The true measure of any society is how we take care of our children. With all of our countrys resources, no child should ever have to grow up in poverty. Yet every single night, all across America, kids go to sleep hungry or without a place to call home.

title: North Carolina Pays a Price for Bigotry
description: Gov. Pat McCrory of North Carolina has some nerve. Alarmed by the rising financial fallout from the discriminatory law he and Republican lawmakers hastily passed in March to bar transgender people from using restrooms that match their gender identity, the governor seemed desperate for an off-ramp last week.

title: Longing for the Male Gaze
description: When I was in my early 30s, I practiced yoga at a studio in my neighborhood in Brooklyn. On most days, I walked there with two friends  one who was in her 20s and one about my age  but occasionally we each got to class on our own. There was a construction site across the street as part of the growing onslaught of gentrification in the neighborhood. My friends would often complain about being harassed and catcalled by the construction workers  even more so when they wore their yoga clothes. I passed the site day after day without incident.

title: Flavors of Home
Questions for: Japans Newest Technology Innovation: Priest Delivery
description: Article: Japans Newest Technology Innovation: Priest Delivery

title: Should Parents Bribe Their Children?
description: Sometimes children dont naturally do what their parents want them to do. They play video games instead of reading books. They dont clean up their toys after theyre finished playing. They make too much noise or dont eat their vegetables. As they get older, they might not do their homework, study for tests or clean their room. Whats a thoughtful parent to do?

title: Remainders of the Day
description: I assumed the humiliations had ended. They began even before my book was published, when network morning shows that regularly had me on now refused my pleas for some airtime to promote it. Once the book came out in 2012, it only got worse. I read at bookstores with audiences smaller than those you might find randomly browsing on any given day, and had an Amazon ranking higher than the number of books I thought existed in the world.

title: What in the World? 10 Questions on Global Quirks
description: If youve been a What in the World reader, we hope weve surprised you, made you smile and maybe even taught you something about another culture. To celebrate the posting of our 100th article, we offer this quiz, where you can test your new knowledge of quirky facts from around the globe.

title: Obama Administration Considers Arming Syrian Kurds Against ISIS
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration is weighing a military plan to directly arm Syrian Kurdish fighters combating the Islamic State, a major policy shift that could speed up the offensive against the terrorist group but also sharply escalate tensions between Turkey and the United States.

title: Chemical Accidents in China Have Killed Nearly 200 This Year, Report Finds
description: Nearly 200 people have died in accidents related to the production, storage and transportation of chemicals in China this year, according to a report by Greenpeace released on Wednesday.

title: How to Be Mindful While Brushing Your Teeth
description: Everyone should be brushing their teeth twice a day, bookending the day, says Dr. Fern White, a dentist in Australia who practices mindful dentistry. If you do so mindfully, you can also be brushing your brain.

title: The Deflategate Scientists Unlock Their Lab
description: PHOENIX  It was over 100 degrees in the scrubby sprawl on the citys northern frontier earlier this month, but inside the 40-foot-long thermal chamber, it was 48 degrees  same as it was for the playoff game on that January night in Foxborough, Mass. The floor was covered in green artificial turf, like a football field.

title: For the Debaters: What Shall We Do About the Tech Careening Our Way?
description: Heres a question Im hoping comes up at Mondays presidential debate: Secretary Clinton and Mr. Trump, what would you do about self-driving trucks?

title: Who Hates Free Trade Treaties? Surprisingly, Not Voters
description: WASHINGTON  Few issues in this campaign cycle seem as toxic as trade: Both major-party presidential candidates oppose President Obamas 12-nation Trans-Pacific Partnership, and congressional leaders, having refused all year to vote on the trade accord until after the election, say they will not do so even then  potentially killing the largest regional trade pact in history.

title: Mistaken for Pregnant? Readers Respond
description: Have you ever been mistaken for being pregnant? Or have you wrongly assumed someone else was pregnant?

title: Charlotte, Donald Trump Jr., Syria: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: New York Today: Welcome Back, 23rd Street
description: Updated, 10:51 a.m.

title: Morning Agenda: Deepening Divides, Gutless Leadership, Exxons Workings
description: The income gap doesnt just apply to people  it applies to states, as well.

title: Vasectomy Not Tied to Prostate Cancer Risk
description: A large new study has found no connection between vasectomy and prostate cancer.

title: Hillary Clinton Outlines Vision of More Job Opportunities for People With Disabilities
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  Of all the attacks that Hillary Clinton and her fellow Democrats have tried against Donald J. Trump since he captured the Republican presidential nomination, one has stood out for its emotional force and persuasive power: No one, it seems, can abide Mr. Trumps mockery last year of a reporters physical disability.

title: In Crete, Henry Miller Found His Muse Amid the Ruins
description: Traveling from Athens to Crete in 1939, Henry Miller, the author of bawdy novels, many of them banned in America, flew in an airplane for the first time  an experience he described in The Colossus of Maroussi, his exuberant travelogue of a nine-month journey through Greece.

title: Dostoyevsky vs. Tolstoy: One Familys Competitive Vacation in Russia
description: Some readers gravitate toward Tolstoy, others toward Dostoyevsky. It is fun to assign camps to your friends and even more fun to argue in favor of your own inclination. The choice takes on a special resonance in Russia, however, where the arts are a central part of the national identity.

title: South Park: After Two Decades, Its Still by the Seat of Their Pants
description: LOS ANGELES  Every day at South Park Studios is different, but Trey Parker said this particular afternoon, Monday, Sept. 12, was especially memorable.

title: Air Pollution Is Linked to a Diabetes Marker
description: Exposure to air pollution, a new study finds, may increase glucose intolerance, a precursor of diabetes.

title: Donald Trump Hits Familiar Chords Before First General Election Debate
description: With less than a week until the first general election debate, Donald J. Trump has used his recent rallies to sharpen the nationalist message he has embraced throughout the campaign.

title: Protests in Charlotte
description: Police in riot gear responded to protests in Charlotte, N.C., after the shooting death of Keith L. Scott on Tuesday. Kerr Putney, the Charlotte-Mecklenburg police chief, said Mr. Scott had a gun. His family said he was holding a book.

title: What Maria Bamford Cant Travel Without
description: Maria Bamford has built a career on turning her experience with bipolar disorder into hilarious, addictive comedy. Her latest project, in which she stars, is Lady Dynamite, a Netflix show inspired by her own life. The second season is due in 2017.

title: Cellphones, Not Banks, May Be Key to Finance in the Developing World
description: SAN FRANCISCO  The increasing digitization of finance, and the move away from cash, could add 6 percent to the annual economic output of the worlds developing nations over the next 10 years, according to a new report from the McKinsey consulting firms research arm.

title: How to Counter Chinas Global Propaganda Offensive
description: BERLIN  It has been a difficult year for many Western democracies  and China is rubbing it in. As Donald J. Trump rose in the Republican primaries, the state-run Xinhua news agency gleefully described the United States presidential election as an entertaining drama that illustrates the malfunction of the self-claimed world standard of democracy. Another Xinhua article exploited the leak of Democratic Party emails to reassert that money politics has become an incurable disease of the American electoral system.

title: Bank of Japan Tries the Long View
description: The Bank of Japans latest policy overhaul buys it some time and friends. The worlds most aggressive central bank concluded a review of its huge stimulus program on Thursday by switching focus to targeting longer-term interest rates.

title: Italian Brands Expect Some Brexit Benefits
description: As the fashion shows move from London to Milan so, too, does the debate around Britains departure from the European Union (and the rain). But among the Italian fashion folk, the reaction to Brexit has a somewhat more glittering lam lining.

title: California Today: Extra! Extra! How the Gossip Machine Chased the Brangelina Split
description: Good morning.

title: Isle of Man, Flourishing in Britains Shadow, Faces Pivotal Vote
description: DOUGLAS, Isle of Man  The Isle of Mans governing body, the Tynwald, was founded by Viking settlers and first gained notoriety in 1237 when a gathering degenerated into a pitched battle between two factions that left three men dead.

title: Every Days a Safety Drill as Chipotle Woos Customers Back
description: A large digital kitchen timer perches near a sink at a Chipotle Mexican Grill in the Meatpacking District of Manhattan. It is reset every 30 minutes, and 12 minutes have passed.

title: What You Get for  $1,100,000
description: A contemporary in Vermont, a 1916 house in Maryland and a Tudor in Atlanta

title: $1,100,000 Homes in Vermont, Maryland and Atlanta
description: DORSET, VT.

title: Five New York Prison Guards Charged in 13 Beating of Inmate
description: On the night three years ago when Kevin Moores dreadlocks were ripped out and his ribs and facial bones were broken, a group of New York State corrections officers involved in a confrontation with him said that they were the victims, that Mr. Moore, a 56-year-old inmate, had attacked them.

title: A Baseball Card Contest Pays Off, 6 Decades After the Fact
description: Over the years, Darwin Day, a 70-year-old resident of Grand Prairie, Tex., had given away so many baseball cards from his childhood that he didnt think he had any left. But one that he found recently paid off when he entered a contest from 1957: He won a new baseball glove.

title: A Cuff That Dazzles  and Changes as It Moves
description: In the modern annals of fine jewelry, the rubellite beguiles. Unrelated to the ruby despite its rosy tone and similar name, it is a rare form of tourmaline, a semiprecious crystalline stone, often a blackish-blue shade. Rubellite, however, glows scarlet purple, like a luminescent raspberry. The artisans at Tiffany & Co. have crafted this nearly two-and-a-half-inch-wide cuff with 480 of the baguette-cut gems, 60 carats in all. With alternating lines of diamonds in a bold platinum armature, the bracelet looks entirely different  ice cool or fiery red  depending on the angle.

title: Charges Against 3 Corrections Officers in Fishkill, N.Y.
description: George Santiago, Carson Morris and Kathy Scott were charged with conspiracy and fraud in connection with the beating of Kevin Moore on Nov. 12, 2013, at Downstate Correctional Facility in Fishkill, N.Y.

title: In a Parched Corner of Xinjiang, Ancient Water Tunnels Are Running Dry
description: TURPAN, China  It is an improbable journey that begins on the highest peaks of the Tianshan Mountains, where glacial snowmelt descends across one of the worlds most arid landscapes to reach the lush oasis communities of this ancient Silk Road outpost.

title: A Four-Bedroom Beachfront House in Belize
description: The house, on the Placencia peninsula in southern Belize, is on the market for $2.3 million.

title: House Hunting in ... Belize
description: A FOUR-BEDROOM BEACHFRONT HOUSE IN PLACENCIA

title: Music for Aliens: Campaign Aims to Reissue Carl Sagans Golden Record
description: Carl Sagans Voyager Golden Record  of sounds of Earth, recorded greetings and an eclectic mix of music that was sent into space  has long been out of print and pretty much unobtainable for decades.

title: 1966: Paris Plans Somali Plebiscite
description: PARIS  France will hold a plebiscite before next July 1 in strife-torn Somaliland to determine whether the colony wants independence, it was announced today. But, Gen. Pierre Billotte, minister for overseas territories, warned that an independence vote would mean that France will wash its hands of its last African colony and cut off most aid to it. Information Minister Yvon Bourges said after a cabinet meeting presided over by President Charles de Gaulle that a bill authorizing the referendum would be introduced in parliament.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Sept. 22, 1966

title: Corey Lewandowski Continues to Be Paid by Donald Trumps Campaign
description: Donald J. Trump paid his former campaign manager Corey Lewandowski $20,000 in August for strategy consulting, two months after Mr. Lewandowski left the team and was hired by CNN as a commentator.

title: Firestorms at 2 Colleges After Students Share Racially Charged Photos
description: In the span of a week, students at two colleges have found themselves at the center of widespread criticism for posting racially charged photos to social media.

title: Roster Criticized, U.S. Meekly Exits World Cup of Hockey
description: TORONTO  As Phil Kessel was preparing for the Stanley Cup finals with the Pittsburgh Penguins last spring, he offered measured words about his surprising omission from the United States roster for the World Cup of Hockey.

title: 1941: Ptain Decries Attacks on Nazis
description: VICHY  Marshal Henri Ptain, in an appeal fraught with deep emotion, besought the population in occupied France tonight to cease molesting the Nazis. The ultimate sufferers from such action, he warned, would be innocent Frenchmen.

title: Russia Denies Any Role in Deadly Convoy Attack in Syria
description: MOSCOW  Russia sought to distance itself on Wednesday from American accusations that it was responsible for the fiery destruction of a humanitarian convoy in Syria, with the foreign minister, Sergey V. Lavrov, also seeking to absolve Syria of responsibility for the attack.

title: A New Crop of International Designers to Know
description: Clustered around the gritty borough of Hackney, one close-knit group is shaping our future.

title: The Blessed, Cursed Life of Bon Iver
description: What is left when unhungry?, Justin Vernon sings midway through 22, a Million, his third album as Bon Iver. Its one of many questions this 35-year-old songwriter and multi-instrumentalist asks of himself in the course of the album. And its answered, in some ways, by the songs themselves on Bon Ivers most diverse, noisiest, shortest, knottiest and most experimental album so far.

title: Guccis Sequined, Studded, Spangled Saga
description: MILAN  So to Milan  or as it increasingly seems, Micheleville. The story of the Gucci resurgence under the creative director Alessandro Michele has become so ubiquitous, it is one of the defining narratives of not just the city, but the industry.

title: Whitestone: Suburban Feel on the Waterfront
description: Although it is bounded by the heavily trafficked Bronx-Whitestone and Throgs Neck Bridges, the Whitestone section of Queens is surprisingly quiet. Its a sleepy waterfront neighborhood of tree-lined streets, manicured lawns and salty breezes off the East River.

title: Volkswagen Shareholders Seek $9.2 Billion Over Diesel Scandal
description: A German court has been flooded with new lawsuits against Volkswagen from investors who say they lost billions as the value of the carmakers shares plunged after its diesel emissions scandal.

title: Living In Whitestone
description: Although bounded by heavily trafficked bridges, the Whitestone section of Queens is surprisingly quiet and suburb-like.

title: Recipes from Julia & Julia
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Donald Trump Embraces Wider Use of Stop-and-Frisk by Police
description: Donald J. Trump on Wednesday called for the broad use of the contentious stop-and-frisk policing strategy in Americas cities, embracing an aggressive tactic whose legality has been challenged and whose enforcement has been abandoned in New York.

title: Insider Trading Charges Against Cooperman
description: The S.E.C. charged hedge fund manager Leon G. Cooperman and his firm Omega Advisors with insider trading.

title: Man Is Shot in Charlotte as Unrest Stretches to Second Night
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  A second night of protests set off by the police killing of a black man spiraled into chaos and violence after nightfall here Wednesday when a demonstration was interrupted by gunfire that gravely wounded a man in the crowd. Law enforcement authorities fired tear gas in a desperate bid to restore order.

title: Leon Cooperman, a Billionaire Charged With Insider Trading, Prepares to Fight
description: Leon G. Cooperman, one of the early titans of the hedge fund industry, is gearing up for the biggest fight of his career: preserving his Wall Street legacy as regulators accuse him and his multibillion-dollar firm of insider trading.

title: Stop Your Children From Downloading Those Naughty Apps
description: Q. Where are the controls to limit what Android programs children can buy in the Google app store?

title: John Kerry Urges Grounding of Military Aircraft in Key Areas of Syria
description: UNITED NATIONS  Secretary of State John Kerry on Wednesday called for an immediate grounding of all military aircraft in what he described as key areas of Syria  including where aid is delivered  as a last-ditch effort to save an agreement with Russia to reduce violence and ultimately halt a war that shows no sign of slowing.

title: Daily Report: Will Googles Allo Make It in the Messaging App Field?
description: Add another new messaging app to the proliferation of chat apps.

title: Jane Fondas Fashion Auction
description: A look at some of the clothes being put up for auction by the actress.

title: Trumps Stance on the Paris Climate Agreement is Criticized by 375 Scientists
description: Yesterday, 375 members of the National Academy of Sciences, including 30 Nobel Prize winners, posted an open letterreviewing the basics of established climate science, decrying claims of hoax and hype spouted by Republicans during the presidential campaign and warning against the United States pulling out of the Paris Agreement on climate change.

title: Jane Fonda: The Reluctant Fashionista
description: When the model Grace Hartzel opened Tom Fords spring 2017 show in a striking shag haircut, the inspiration was unmistakable  at least to those over 40 who watched Mr. Fords extravaganza. The hairdo paid homage to the one Jane Fonda made supercool as the Times Square hooker Bree Daniels in the 1971 movie Klute.

title: Here Come the iPhone 7 and iOS 10 Apps: What to Try First
description: APPLE released the iPhone 7 last week along with iOS 10, a major upgrade for its popular mobile operating system. What better time to download some apps to take the new hardware and software for a spin?

title: Hand to God to Have 13 Productions This Season
description: Hand to God, the irreverent and raunchy puppet play that had a 10-month run on Broadway, will be the most produced show (other than plays by Shakespeare and holiday-themed works) in American nonprofit professional theaters this season, according to a survey by American Theatre magazine.

title: Keeping Food on the Plate, and Out of Landfills
Furnitures New Geometric Forms
description: Elemental building blocks  circles, squares and triangles  are at the root of very sophisticated pieces.

title: An Artist Who Calls the Sanitation Department Home
description: For an artist obsessed for nearly half a century with the concepts of maintenance and sanitation, Mierle Laderman Ukeles keeps an office in desperate need of a cleaning. Or maybe an intervention by a department of doctoral students.

title: Romes Mayor Wont Support 2024 Olympic Bid
description: Rome was effectively knocked out of the race to host the 2024 Summer Olympics on Wednesday when its mayor, Virginia Raggi, decided to oppose a bid by the city.

title: Gucci: Spring 2017
description: Alessandro Michele shows his latest in romantic whimsy.

title: Good Bat? Cannon Arm? Jewish? Sign Him Up!
description: Every few weeks during the baseball season, I receive an irrationally optimistic email from my buddy Peter Kurz, who is a lifelong and thoroughly demented Mets fan. Demented is the adjective that attaches like a lesion to those of us who belong to the Mets tribe.

title: Apple Is Said to Be Talking to Vehicle Technology Companies
description: Apple, which laid off dozens of employees from its secretive car project this month, is increasingly seeking help from outside companies with expertise in vehicles.

title: Fashion Week Photo Diary: MarquesAlmeida
description: Scenes from the spring/summer 2017 collection that was presented in London on Tuesday.

title: Flagged Two Times in 2014, Ahmad Rahami Passed Scrutiny
description: When Ahmad Khan Rahami returned in March 2014 from a nearly yearlong trip to Pakistan, he was flagged by customs officials, who pulled him out for a secondary screening. Still concerned about his travel, they notified the National Targeting Center, a federal agency that assesses potential threats, two law enforcement officials said.

title: Mylans Chief Is Chastised by Lawmakers Questioning EpiPen Pricing
description: Members of Congress on Wednesday pelted the chief executive of Mylan, the company behind the EpiPen, the treatment for severe allergy attacks, with questions about steep price increases on the product and accused her of turning her back on families that could no longer afford the lifesaving treatment.

title: A Single Migration From Africa Populated the World, Studies Find
description: Modern humans evolved in Africa roughly 200,000 years ago. But how did our species go on to populate the rest of the globe?

title: Museum Officials and Archaeologists Sign Petition Against N. Dakota Pipeline
description: Over a thousand archaeologists, anthropologists, curators, museum officials and academics have added their names and voices to the protest against an oil pipeline being built in North Dakota.

title: An Event That Is Truly Electric: Formula E to Race in Brooklyn
description: The New York area is home to the Yankees and the Knicks, the Belmont Stakes and the Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show. But the city that is the capital for so many sports has hardly been a center for auto racing.

title: How to Get Guccis Dreamlike Beauty Look
description: For Guccis spring/summer runway show, the designer Alessandro Michele created a rapturous fantasy world, where walls shimmered with mirrored tiles that distorted light in all directions. The collection itself featured full-length gowns in materials like stiff taffeta or pleated, soft lam, which made it look like the models were floating down the runway.

title: Think a 401(k) Is Not a Sexy Benefit? Competition May Change That
description: When a company starts up, a retirement plan is usually the last item on the laundry list.

title: Looks from the Gucci Spring Collection
description: There were flowing Titania organza gowns and gold disco trousers bristling with ruffles and more.

title: Fall Movies: Insider Preview With A.O. Scott
description: The Times co-chief movie critic A.O. Scott talks about the fall movies, the film festival scene and highlights from the new season. Susan Lehman is host.

title: Alberta Ferretti: Spring 2017
description: After debuting her demi-couture line in Paris in July, the designer returns to Milan for her spring 2017 collection.

title: Fed, With 3 Officials in Dissent, Stands Firm on Interest Rates While Noting Improving Economy
description: WASHINGTON  A divided Federal Reserve, struggling to decide how soon to prune its economic stimulus campaign, said on Wednesday that it would wait at least a little longer.

title: Pittsburgh Welcomes Uber
description: To the Editor:

title: USA Network to Televise Beverly Hills Dog Show
description: USA Network, which last year lost the rights to the Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show to FS1, will begin televising the Beverly Hills Dog Show next year.

title: A Candidate to Lead Viacom: Leslie Moonves of CBS
description: Viacom is back on the hunt for a new chief executive. The person for the job could be a member of the extended family: CBSs chief executive, Leslie Moonves.

title: Imaging Software Advancing Archaeology
description: A computer imaging program can virtually unwrap and read ancient scrolls.

title: Modern Technology Unlocks Secrets of a Damaged Biblical Scroll
description: Nearly half a century ago, archaeologists found a charred ancient scroll in the ark of a synagogue on the western shore of the Dead Sea.

title: Fall Movies: Insider Preview With A.O. Scott
description: Times Insider shares insights into the working and thinking at The New York Times. Today, The Timess co-chief movie critic talks about movies and the new fall season.

title: A 17th-Century Portrait Will Be the Earliest Painting by a Woman at the Tate
description: LONDON  A rare portrait by Joan Carlile, one of the first women known to be a professional painter in England, will become the earliest work by a female artist to enter the Tate collection here. The acquisition of Portrait of an Unknown Lady (circa 1650-1655), one of only 10 paintings by the artist known to be in existence, was announced at the Tates annual news conference on Wednesday, when Alex Farquharson, the director of Tate Britain, affirmed the Tates commitment to showing more work by female artists.

title: After Bombing, a Crucial Test for Mayor de Blasio, and a Calm Response
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio strode along West 23rd Street on Tuesday, amid a phalanx of suits and uniforms, past the buildings and shops with windows shattered by a terrorists bomb in Manhattan.

title: Former ITT Technical Students Can Get Counseling at New Website
description: Thousands of students affected by the abrupt closing of ITT Technical Institute campuses can seek free academic and financial counseling through an online tool introduced this week by two nonprofit groups and the federal government.

title: The Lies of Big Sugar
description: To the Editor:

title: Nicols Maduro, Venezuelas Leader, Opts Not to Deliver U.N. Speech
description: Flush with oil money and political bravado, Hugo Chvez of Venezuela used his United Nations platform a decade ago to call George W. Bush the devil.

title: Benjamin Netanyahu: Speaking to an Audience Outside the Hall
description: For Benjamin Netanyahu, the brash prime minister of Israel, there are few audiences more skeptical than the world leaders he will face at the United Nations General Assembly on Thursday. But if his international peers are not all that fond of him, it is fair to say the feeling is mutual.

title: Irans President Accuses U.S. of Lack of Compliance on Nuclear Deal
description: President Hassan Rouhani of Iran accused the United States on Thursday of not complying with the landmark nuclear agreement that took effect in January, and said American credibility would suffer if the accord were not honored.

title: Mahmoud Abbas: Out to Push Palestinian Cause Back to Top of Agenda
description: When Mahmoud Abbas, the president of the Palestinian Authority, attends sessions of the United Nations General Assembly, he enjoys many of the trappings of a head of state. He is invited to address other world leaders. Last year, the Palestinian flag was even raised over the United Nations for the first time.

title: The Three-Decade Wild Ride of Supermodel Naomi Campbell Isnt Slowing Down
description: Here she was at Madison Square Garden introducing Rihanna in late August at the Video Music Awards. There she was the next weekend at the Venice Film Festival for the premiere of Franca: Chaos and Creation, a documentary about Italian Vogues longtime editor, Franca Sozzani.

title: Jonathan Andersons Things
description: Jonathan Anderson, the creative director of Loewe and his namesake fashion line, curates his most personal possessions.

title: How to Use Google to Plan Your Trip
description: Google Maps revolutionized how you get from point A to point B. Google Trips aims to to do the same for how you vacation.

title: Marc Jacobs and the Appropriateness of Appropriation
description: Despite the fashion calendar shifting continents and an entire fashion week unfolding in the interim (Londons five-day schedule ended yesterday evening), attention is still being drawn back to New York; namely, to Marc Jacobs. Last Thursday afternoon, Jacobs unveiled his spring/summer 2017 show, to generally positive critical reviews  and a social media brouhaha. The focus was the models hair, braided into multicolored dreadlocks inspired by the transgender filmmaker Lana Wachowski and sourced online. The designer was subsequently accused of cultural appropriation, of lifting influences from black culture and showing them on a cast of predominantly white models. Jacobs was rapidly tried and sentenced by a public jury; a fusillade of comments rained down on Instagram and Twitter. Jacobs responded, first by justifying his actions and then, after that engendered further criticism, apologizing for the justification, and for any offense caused. The story had already leapt from the fashion pages: Time ran a piece, as did many other general-interest publications.

title: A Brief History of Designers Appropriating Culture
description: Marc Jacobs came under fire on social media last week for the dreadlocked beauty look in his spring/summer show. But hes hardly the first designer to borrow from other cultures.

title: Falls Voluminous (but Quiet) Silhouettes
description: Textured knits, loose shirts and roomy skirts that welcome the calmer side of the season.

title: A Pilgrims Progress: Checking Mecca Off My Bucket List
description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how news, features and opinion come together at The New York Times. In this article, Diaa Hadid, a correspondent in The Timess Jerusalem bureau, shares what delighted her (pilgrims eating ice cream, helicopter rides over holy sites) and disturbed her (ever-failing WiFi, official answers to tough questions) about her first trip to Mecca.

title: David Adjaye on Designing a Museum That Speaks a Different Language
description: The first really fine major public building of the century to rise in the nations capital, the National Museum of African American History and Culture, opening on Saturday, fills the last prime plot of land along the National Mall in Washington and, with it, a gaping hole in the American story. Its three-tier bronzed aluminum skin, burnished and intricate, rising as if from out of the earth, contrasts with the white marble, concrete and glass palaces telling other chapters in that story.

title: Fausto Puglisi: Spring 2017
description: The designer holds a theatrics-filled presentation at the Derby Theater in lieu of a traditional runway show.

title: Feud Over a Holiday Threatens Fragile Peace in Bosnia
description: Bosnia and Herzegovina, the poor and chronically divided Balkan country, is facing a new threat of disintegration.

title: The United Nations Good Works
description: To the Editor:

title: A Crisis in Syria, Not a Holocaust
description: To the Editor:

title: A Defense of College Rankings: U.S. News Fires Back
description: To the Editor:

title: Viacoms Interim Chief Will Step Down in November
description: The fight for control of Viacom is settled, but the drama over its future is far from over.

title: Smaller Stars Will Get a Chance to Shine at Latin Grammys
description: Its a wide-open field at the Latin Grammys this year as many of the award shows most reliable winners  Juanes, Shakira, Calle 13, Alejandro Sanz, Juan Luis Guerra  are without eligible major albums.

title: Even Balanchines Arithmetic Contains Drama
description: Five lead women, three lead men: this odd formula  as seen in this photograph  is the nucleus of George Balanchines Divertimento No. 15 (1956), a classic set to Mozart that returns to the New York City Ballet repertory on Thursday after more than five years. Three men to partner five women! This also gives a clue to one aspect of how Balanchine prepared a work: arithmetic as drama.

title: The Modern Love Podcast: 2016 Emmys Edition
description: In this episode of Modern Love: The Podcast, weve reprised readings from three actors who brought home Emmys on Sunday: Sarah Paulson (The People v. O.J. Simpson: American Crime Story), Tony Hale (Veep) and Sterling K. Brown (The People v. O.J. Simpson: American Crime Story).

title: MoMA Looks at Migrants and Efforts to Help Them
description: Worldwide, some 65 million people have been forced out of places they knew as home by drone attacks and ground warfare, by arson and engineered starvation, and by psychological violence in countless forms. Where can these wanderers rest? Thats the question asked by the exhibition Insecurities: Tracing Displacement and Shelter at the Museum of Modern Art (Oct. 1 to Jan. 22).

title: Review: Melissa Errico Laughs, but Cant Let Go, at 54 Below
description: Melissa Errico is lucky she has a sense of humor: Without it, the frenetic life she described in her amusing show Funny, Im a Woman With Children at Feinsteins/54 Below on Tuesday evening would be an exhausting roller-coaster ride. But as she put it in a declamatory rendition of the shows opening number, James Taylors Secret o Life, the key is enjoying the passage of time.

title: A Mysterious Boom Rattles New Yorkers
description: Already on edge days after two bombings in New York and New Jersey, residents were startled on Wednesday afternoon by an earthshaking boom that thundered across several neighborhoods in Queens and on Long Island.

title: Hoping to Work in China? If Youre a Class C Foreigner, It May Be Tough
description: BEIJING  If youve ever wondered what class of person you are, move to China and find out.

title: Snap Sketch: The Faces of London Fashion Week
description: The illustrator Damien Florbert Cuypers draws the models, designers, buyers, bloggers  and looks  at the spring/summer 2017 collections.

title: Marvels Luke Cage Sweeps From Barbershop to Neighborhood Battle
description: I wasnt alone in not being able to look away from Mike Colter in Marvels Jessica Jones on Netflix. As Luke Cage, the source of Jessicas bittersweet longing, Mr. Colter played his superhero brooding and tender, shackled by the memory of his dead wife and enraged when he discovered the truth of her demise. Just because he had unbreakable skin didnt mean that his heart couldnt split in two.

title: How to Flash for the Cameras Without Ending Up as Instabait
description: Theres a fine line between shameless Instabait and unassailable chic. These accessories are the latter.

title: Teaching and Learning With the 2016 Presidential Debates
description: Updated: Sept.26

title: Mark Zuckerberg and Priscilla Chan Pledge $3 Billion to Fighting Disease
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Mark Zuckerberg, Facebooks chief executive, and his wife, Dr. Priscilla Chan, last year said they would give 99 percent of their Facebook shares to charitable causes. Now they are putting a large chunk of that money to work.

title: See Now, Buy Now: Burberry, Fresh From London Fashion Week, Now at Barneys
description: Shopping immediacy continues from London Fashion Week. Burberry has designed an exclusive capsule including a bell-sleeve sweater ($1,995) and tulle gown ($3,295) for Barneys New York. At 660 Madison Avenue and 101 Seventh Avenue.

title: Roberto Cavalli: Spring 2017
description: Peter Dundas presents his latest collection for Cavalli.

title: Hip-Hop Dance at the Crossing the Line Festival
description: The French breakdancer Anne Nguyen combines years of dance-battle experience with an avid interest in geometry  fields not as unrelated as they may sound  in her works for par Terre Dance Company, the Paris-based troupe she founded in 2005.

title: In Cranes Shadow, Los Angeles Strains to See a Future With Less Sprawl
description: LOS ANGELES  The powerful economic resurgence that has swept Southern California is on display almost everywhere here, visible in the construction cranes towering on the skyline and the gush of applications to build luxury hotels, shopping centers, high-rise condominiums and acres of apartment complexes from Santa Monica to downtown Los Angeles.

title: Poverty, Taxes and the Candidates
description: To the Editor:

title: The Women of Atenco
description: These are the 11 plaintiffs  and their words.

title: The Roots Picnic Expands to New York City, Featuring DAngelo
description: Its about time the Roots Picnic expanded from the bands hometown, Philadelphia, to New York City, where the Roots have their daily gig on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon.

title: Maternal Mortality Rate in U.S. Rises, Defying Global Trend, Study Finds
description: WASHINGTON  One of the biggest worldwide public health triumphs in recent years has been maternal mortality. Global death rates fell by more than a third from 2000 to 2015. The United States, however, is one of the few countries in the world that have gone against the grain, new data show. Its maternal mortality rate has risen despite improvements in health care and an overwhelming global trend in the other direction.

title: Can Bots Fight Bullying?
description: If a teenager gets bullied on social media, its usually up to her to report the incident. But one day, an automated tool might spot the harassment, ask her if she needs help, tell a moderator to step in on her behalf or notify her parents.

title: Review: City Ballets Gala Evening of Misses ... and a Lot of Skin
description: At Tuesdays Ballet and Fashion gala, given by New York City Ballet, the best-dressed people onstage were the four who had choreographed the evenings world premieres (Annabelle Lopez Ochoa, Lauren Lovette, Justin Peck, Peter Walker), and the solo guest cellist (Sara SantAmbrogio) who accompanied one of them. The whole gala, a trivial event, had a back-to-front quality of misplaced priorities and unresolved ideas. None of the ballets were important. Three of them actually suffered from their unflattering designs.

title: Street Style: London
description: Some looks from the streets as fashion month moves on to its next phase.

title: The Top 10 Moments from London Fashion Week
description: See-Now, Buy-Now at Burberry, Donatella Versace in chainmail  and Crocs on the runway.

title: Street Style: London
description: Fashion month has moved on to Milan, but the street style from London lives on in photos.

title: Review: Notorious Offers Nice Cheekbones, but Not Much Else
description: Notorious is technically a television drama about the symbiotic relationship between a cable-news producer and a celebrity lawyer. But its really a show about cheekbones. When Piper Perabo and Daniel Sunjata face off onscreen, you may duck involuntarily, afraid of being cut by a dangerously sharp zygomatic arch.

title: Review: Pitch, a Gender Changeup, but With Clichs Intact
description: By default, the new Fox series Pitch is not your usual baseball drama. Beyond A League of Their Own and The Bad News Bears, there arent a lot of stories featuring women or girls actually playing the game, let alone a woman who gets called up to the major leagues.

title: Arson at Belgian Forensic Lab May Set Back Terrorism Cases
description: BRUSSELS  The whole operation took less than 10 minutes. Three people drove a van up to Belgiums main forensic storehouse at 2 a.m., cut through a perimeter fence, smashed the ground-floor windows, and placed bottles of accelerant inside.

title: Review: Easy Stars the Young and the Muddled, Connecting in Chicago
description: Among the axioms of the television renaissance is that the medium is becoming more cinematic, with single-story seasons that are essentially six- or 10-hour films. But one of the most movielike new shows of the fall doesnt fit that description.

title: Charlotte, U.S. Presidential Race, Syria: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Review: A Rough Cut of The Thief and the Cobbler Makes It to MoMA
description: The Thief and the Cobbler is to animated movies what The Magnificent Ambersons is to live-action ones: a staggering masterpiece that can never be seen in its ideal form. Ambersons, directed by Orson Welles, was completed but then mutilated by its studio, its original version lost; Cobbler, a dream project the animator Richard Williams had been working on since the 1960s, was wrested from him by financiers in 1993, incomplete by about 15 minutes.

title: Forget Twitter. Id Rather Binge Theater.
description: Its often said that we live in an era that prizes speed and brevity above all else. Theres long been fast food, but now theres fast fashion, too. Why take the time to phone someone when an email will take less of your time? Why send an email when a text message would be quicker?

title: Review: In Hero of the Empire, a Young Churchill Earns His Spurs
description: Candice Millards third book, Hero of the Empire: The Boer War, a Daring Escape and the Making of Winston Churchill, would make a fine movie, though Richard Attenborough did, in a sense, get there first. In 1972, he made Young Winston, drawn from Churchills own account of his early life, and it includes the same material Ms. Millard recounts so thrillingly: the future prime ministers brash heroics in the South African Republic in 1899, which culminated in a prison break and nine days on the lam.

title: Review: Its a Wild, but Peaceful, World for the Former Cat Stevens
description: Nostalgia, invocations of peace and love, and diplomatic positioning were all part of A Cats Attic, a gentle retrospective concert by Yusuf, the former Cat Stevens. Two shows at the Beacon Theater were his first full New York concerts since 1976, the year before he converted to Islam, changed his full name to Yusuf Islam and spent nearly three decades away from secular music.

title: Anthem and Cigna Accuse Each Other of Breaching Merger Deal
description: The Justice Department, which is suing Anthem and Cigna to block their $48 billion deal, revealed on Wednesday in court documents that the two health insurers have been accusing each other of breaching their merger agreement.

title: Review: Hamilton Leithauser and Rostam Evoke Dreams and Ghosts
description: Hamilton Leithauser has one of the most tactile voices in rock: a coarse yet viscous instrument, like wet concrete. So its striking that he keeps returning to the intangible, the realm of phantasm and reverie, on I Had a Dream That You Were Mine, his persuasively moody new collaboration with the producer and multi-instrumentalist known as Rostam.

title: Avery Amereau Is a Rarity in Music: A Contralto
description: Contraltos, the female singers with the lowest vocal range, have always been scarce and seem especially rare today. The days of Kathleen Ferrier and Marian Anderson are long past. Edith Wiens, a stellar soprano and a renowned teacher, calls the contralto voice  or, informally, alto  a freak of nature, a product of that inch in the throat.

title: Suzanne Farrell Ballet Plans to Close After 2017-18 Season
description: The Suzanne Farrell Ballet, a company known for keeping the legacy and choreography of George Balanchine alive at the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts in Washington, plans to close after the 2017-18 season, officials said Wednesday.

title: A Murder Case Nags at a Reporters Mind, Before and After It Goes to Trial
description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how news, features and opinion come together at The New York Times. In this article, Jesse McKinley, The Timess Albany bureau chief, shares how difficult its been  particularly for a father, like me, of an 11-year-old boy  to leave the Garrett Phillips murder case behind, for months, while juggling other stories.

title: Shell Fired by ISIS at U.S. and Iraqi Troops May Have Contained Chemical Agent
description: WASHINGTON  Fighters with the Islamic State fired a shell onto a military base in northern Iraq, home to American and Iraqi troops, that may have contained a chemical agent, military officials said on Wednesday.

title: Chicago to Hire Many More Police, but Effect on Crime Is Debated
description: CHICAGO  An ambitious, costly plan to expand this citys police force by almost 1,000 officers to stem a surge in murders and shootings has opened a new question here: Do more police officers always mean an end to rising violence?

title: If You See Something, Say Something  and New Yorkers Have, in Droves
description: The scene that unfolded at a McDonalds in Times Square on Wednesday has played out more than 800 times across New York City in the days since a bomb rattled Chelsea. Police officers rushed into the fast-food restaurant, evacuated customers and their half-eaten breakfasts and shut down a busy thoroughfare.

title: Immigrants Arent Taking Americans Jobs, New Study Finds
description: Do immigrants take jobs from Americans and lower their wages by working for less?

title: Kashmir Crisis Poses Major Test for Indias Leader, Narendra Modi
description: NEW DELHI  Escalating tension over the contested Kashmir region is presenting a challenge to Prime Minister Narendra Modi of India, who needs regional peace to reach his principal goal of economic revival there. But Indian citizens have been clamoring for a response to what they say is a provocation by Pakistan.

title: Barcelonas Season Takes a Turn in the Span of a Minute
description: BARCELONA, Spain  Perhaps a minute elapsed between Lionel Messis trudging off the field as he dejectedly clutched his left thigh and ngel Correas joyously clenching his fist as he celebrated the goal that gave Atltico Madrid a point at Barcelona. Those 60 seconds may prove the most significant of the entire Spanish league season.

title: A Wall of Pigeons in a Bikers Path
description: Dear Diary:

title: Texas Threatens to Pull Out of Refugee Resettlement Program
description: HOUSTON  Texas escalated its fight with the Obama administration over refugee resettlements on Wednesday, threatening to pull out of the federal resettlement program if the states plan to limit the number of refugees it accepts and to receive additional security assurances is not approved.

title: In Wells Fargos Bogus Accounts, Echoes of Foreclosure Abuses
description: John Stumpf, the chairman and chief executive of Wells Fargo, won a dubious achievement award from one of his interrogators during Tuesdays scorching hearings on Capitol Hill. The banks yearslong practice of opening bogus accounts for customers and charging fees to do so, said Senator Jon Tester, Democrat of Montana, had united the Senate Banking Committee on a major topic for the first time in a decade. And not in a good way, he added.

title: World Leaders Agree at U.N. on Steps to Curb Rising Drug Resistance
description: World leaders agreed Wednesday on steps to curb the rapid rise of drug resistance, the first global effort to stop the spread of dangerous superbugs that are fast becoming immune to many of the most critical medicines.

title: Las mujeres de Atenco
description:
Hace ms de diez aos, cuando era gobernador del Estado de Mxico, Enrique Pea Nieto orden un operativo para reprimir a manifestantes en San Salvador de Atenco que deriv en brutales abusos sexuales a decenas de mujeres. Las vctimas llevaron su caso a la Comisin Interamericana de Derechos Humanos, que ahora ha solicitado una investigacin sobre toda la cadena de mando involucrada con los hechos.

Este es el testimonio de 11 de las vctimas.

title: Port Authority Chief Testifies Christie Ally Pressured Him to Reclose Lanes to Bridge
description: NEWARK  On the morning that Patrick J. Foye ordered the reversal of the mysterious lane closings near the George Washington Bridge in September 2013, Bill Baroni appeared in his office, visibly on edge.

title: I.R.S. Chief Calls Efforts to Oust Him Improper
description: WASHINGTON  The commissioner of the Internal Revenue Service, John A. Koskinen, expressed regret Wednesday for management mistakes but called an attempt by House Republicans to impeach him improper, warning that such threats would discourage people from government service.

title: U.S. Allows Boeing and Airbus to Sell Planes to Iran
description: TEHRAN  The United States on Wednesday removed a final hurdle for Western aircraft manufacturers to sell planes to Iran, a country desperately in need of hundreds of new aircraft.

title: Mayor Suggests London Could Eventually Host M.L.B. Games
description: Major League Baseball has hosted regular-season games in Mexico, Japan and, most recently, in Australia in 2014. Commissioner Rob Manfred has said he was interested in expanding baseball overseas.

title: After Much Rancor, Obama and Netanyahu Meet, Probably for Last Time
description: UNITED NATIONS  For seven years, they slogged through the sour rituals of a broken relationship: the strained meetings; the angry phone calls; the bitter recriminations; the slights, real and perceived.

title: Defendants Daughter Testifies in Potsdam Murder Trial
description: CANTON, N.Y.  The most intense clash on the final day of testimony in the trial of an upstate man accused of strangling a small boy was between a veteran Syracuse-area prosecutor  with dozens of murder convictions to his name  and a 19-year-old woman who barely spoke above a whisper.

title: Why First Aid Is Often Lacking in the Moments After a Police Shooting
description: After the police in Tulsa, Okla., released video footage of an officer fatally shooting an unarmed man, and then standing back rather than tending to the mans wounds, many people had the same reaction as a local activist, Marq Lewis, who voiced outrage that they let him lay there two-plus minutes, bleeding.

title: Cuomo Called for Reboot of School Standards. Officials Propose Tweaks Instead.
description: More interactive lessons for the youngest students. Reading more fiction. Delaying teaching the order of operations in math until the fourth grade. Those are some of the changes New York State public schools may see in their classrooms, under revised standards proposed on Wednesday by education officials.

title: Dead Shot Mary, Pistol-Packing Trailblazer, Returns in One-Policewoman Show
description: Armed with her trusty .32-caliber revolver and a bottle of Irish whiskey, Dead Shot Mary is back in town.

title: The EpiPen Outrage Continues
description: A congressional hearing on Wednesday about the outlandish price increases of the EpiPen followed a pattern that has become all too familiar in recent years. A drug price soars for no reason; lawmakers call a hearing to scold a pharmaceutical executive; the executive pleads innocence and provides as little information as possible. The drama plays out with no effect on the price.

title: Paris Climate Deal Passes Milestone as 20 More Nations Sign On
description: UNITED NATIONS  More than 20 world leaders tendered legal documents on Wednesday, formally binding their governments to the Paris climate accord at a General Assembly ceremony here and all but ensuring that the agreement will go into force by the end of the year.

title: Fight Between Saudis and 9/11 Families Escalates in Washington
description: WASHINGTON  On Monday, a constellation of lobbyists for Saudi Arabia, which has spent more than $5 million this past year to buy influence in Washington, called a crisis meeting to try to stop legislation allowing the families of victims of the Sept. 11 attacks to sue the Saudi government for any role in the plot.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: In about 18 minutes, everyone will stop what theyre doing and wash their hands.

title: Liberals See Hillary Clintons Focus on Big Donors as Bafflingly Dated
description: WASHINGTON  In 2012, B. Rowe Winecoff, a retired social worker from Newton, Iowa, contributed $120 to President Obamas re-election campaign. But he has yet to give any money to Hillary Clinton in this election. This year just seems dirtier than ever, said Mr. Winecoff, a Democrat, explaining why he has not contributed to the candidate he intends to vote for.

title: Clashes in Charlotte After Shots Fired
description: A 26-year-old man, Justin Carr, was fatally wounded on Wednesday night during protests in Charlotte, N.C., over the police killing of Keith L. Scott.

title: Cocktails in Berlin
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  Ive always said that if there are two things that go together particularly well, its puns and European travel. [You have, in fact, never said that.  Ed.] [You dont believe me? Check out this sketch from Monty Python.  D. A.]

title: Empire Season 3 Premiere: The Fall
description: Empire wasnt built in a day  it was built one jaw-dropping, Twitter-ready moment at a time. Foxs blockbuster drama about the Shakespearean dynamics between a family of performers, producers and businesspeople at the pinnacle of a hip-hop record label is, or was, simply very good at being a ritzy prime-time soap opera. It moved its many story lines along at breakneck speed, careening through multiple shocks and twists each episode with little of the plot-prolonging wheel-spinning endemic to the genre. For an instructive comparison, viewers should watch not just any entertaining daytime soap, but even a relatively sharp and setting-specific nighttime serial like Gossip Girl; the ruthless efficiency of Empire is unparalleled. And from corpses in cars to main characters behind bars, it always knew how to end an hour, a stretch of episodes or an entire season on a strong note.

title: Why Didnt the F.B.I. Stop the New York Bombing?
description: WASHINGTON  The F.B.I. is the government agency in charge of investigating terrorism. But the bureau has been criticized for failing to thwart a series of terrorist attacks in recent years in Boston; Orlando, Fla.; Garland, Tex.; and now New York. In each of those cases, the person suspected of carrying out the attack had been investigated previously by the F.B.I. The latest case involved Ahmad Khan Rahami, 28, who was charged with setting off bombs in New York and New Jersey.

title: Georgia Wont Force Fugitive, 71, Back From Connecticut to Finish His Term
description: A Connecticut man who escaped from a Georgia prison nearly 50 years ago and then settled into a quiet life in his home state will be allowed to remain there, the authorities in Georgia have decided.

title: New Tool Shows New York Neighborhoods at Risk of Rent Hikes
description: A building sells for twice as much as the average price in the neighborhood. For another building, multiple work permits are being sought from the city for renovations.

title: Fire at Power Plant Leaves Puerto Rico in the Dark
description: MIAMI  Puerto Rico tumbled into darkness on Wednesday after a fire knocked a power plant offline, disrupting service to 1.5 million utility customers, creating huge traffic jams, and prompting the early closings of businesses and a return to candles and open windows for residents.

title: Deborah S. Jin Dies at 47; Physicist Studied Matter in Extreme Cold
description: Deborah S. Jin, a much-honored physicist who created and explored matter that exists only at a sliver of a degree above absolute zero  or minus 459.67 degrees Fahrenheit  died on Sept. 15 in Boulder, Colo. She was 47.

title: Curtis Hanson: A Filmmaker of Sunshine and Noir
description: Curtis Hanson and Los Angeles were made for each other. He grew up in that city, learned from it and, in his 1997 noir L.A. Confidential, gave it one of its greatest films. Mr. Hanson, who died Tuesday at 71, hadnt directed a feature since Chasing Mavericks, a 2012 drama about California surfers. Mr. Hanson left Mavericks before finishing it (Michael Apted took over for him), apparently because of health issues. Its a sunny distraction if now also a rueful finale to a career that for about a decade starting in the mid-1990s, enlivened movie screens with grace, range and peerless turns from the likes of Russell Crowe, Kim Basinger and Michael Douglas.

title: Victor Scheinman, Assembly Line Robot Inventor, Dies at 73
description: Victor Scheinman, who overcame his boyhood nightmares about a science-fiction movie humanoid to build the first successful electrically powered, computer-controlled industrial robot, died on Tuesday in Petrolia, Calif. He was 73.

title: Unanswered Questions Fuel Doubts Among Friends of Minnesota Mall Attacker
description: ST. CLOUD, Minn.  Frustration is growing among members of the Somali community here who are eager for official information about a stabbing attack at a mall Saturday that left 10 people injured and the suspect, Dahir Adan, shot dead by an off-duty policeman. The episode is being investigated as a potential terrorist attack by the F.B.I.

title: Violent Protest in Charlotte
description: Protests of a fatal shooting by the police in Charlotte, N.C., took a violent turn Wednesday night.

title: Entire Indiana Fever Team Kneels During Anthem Before Playoff Game
description: The latest round of athlete protests during the playing of the national anthem came Wednesday against the backdrop of recent fatal shootings of black men by the police in Tulsa, Okla., and Charlotte, N.C.

title: Ive Never Seen Anything Like It: Gary Sanchez Blasts 2 More Homers
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla.  Brian McCann rapped out four hits, something he had not done in more than two years. Masahiro Tanaka gave up four home runs in an inning, something he had never done in a game since joining the Yankees.

title: Designated Survivor Series Premiere: Glasses Off
description: At the Emmy Awards ceremony this week, while accepting her Emmy for best actress, Veep star Julia Louis-Dreyfus offered an apology for the toxic political climate that pervades Washington. Our show started out as a political satire, but it now feels like a sobering documentary.

title: Mr. Robot Season 2 Finale: Fade to Black
description: Ending a season of unremitting bleakness with an unambiguous, unhappy ending would have been harsh of Mr. Robot, but understandable. Ending it on a note of near-total uncertainty, with virtually none of its major story lines resolved for either good or ill, is somehow even crueler.

title: Ender Inciarte Seals Braves Sweep of Mets With a Game-Ending Catch
description: Yoenis Cespedes swung hard, and the ball sliced through the September night, the Mets playoff hopes riding on every play at this critical time of the season. He jogged out of the batters box, and the crowd at Citi Field roared, thinking, like Cespedes and the entire Mets dugout, that he had clobbered a three-run home to erase a night of missed opportunities and mistakes.

title: Auston Matthews, N.H.L.s Top Pick, Draws Attention at World Cup of Hockey
description: TORONTO  Auston Matthews got a glimpse of the kind of reception he is likely to receive from Toronto fans when his rookie N.H.L. season begins next month.

title: MacArthur Foundations 23 Genius Grant Winners for 2016
description: The MacArthur fellowships, awarded annually by the John D. and Catherine T. MacArthur Foundation for exceptional originality, insight and potential, come with a no-strings-attached award of $625,000, distributed over five years. These are the 2016 fellows.

title: MacArthur Foundation Announces 2016 Genius Grant Winners
description: Getting a phone call from an unidentified number in Chicago in late summer is a fantasy many artists, scientists and other creative people have entertained. But that doesnt mean it seems real when it actually happens.

title: Corrections: September 22, 2016
description: BUSINESS DAY

title: Chinese Court Sentences Ai Weiweis Lawyer to 12 Years for Fraud
description: BEIJING  A Beijing lawyer whose clients included the artist Ai Weiwei joined the swelling population of Chinese rights advocates in prison on Thursday, when a court sentenced him to 12 years after convicting him on fraud charges.

title: Scenes and Voices From the Protests in Charlotte
description: Protesters and the police clashed for a second night in Charlotte, N.C., after the fatal police shooting of Keith L. Scott.

title: Milan Fashion Week, Day 2: It Will Be Frenzied
description: Good morning, Milan. Proceedings kick off early on Thursday, even if you partied until the wee hours with Fergie after her set at Philipp Plein last night (as we did). There are no excuses not to be on time, people. Its only Day 2, and as weve said, fashion month is a marathon, not a sprint.

title: Whats on TV Thursday: Pitch and Brangelina in By the Sea
description: Kylie Bunbury stars as the first woman to pitch in the big leagues in Pitch, made with the involvement of Major League Baseball. Piper Perabo and Daniel Sunjata spar in the cable-news arena in Notorious. And ponder the demise of Brangelina with By the Sea.

title: In the Studio: Fendi
description: Silvia Fendi, Creative Director of Accessories and Mens,  takes us inside the extraordinary palazzo that Fendi calls home.

title: In the Studio With Silvia Fendi
description: ROME  In Episode 2 of this seasons In the Studio series, which takes you into a designers private working space, Silvia Fendi, the creative director of accessories and mens wear for the company that bears her name, talks about her obsession with order, her first job at the company (phone operator!) and her familys special request to the president. This interview has been condensed and edited.

title: Word + Quiz: spendthrift
Photographing Lagos, As Much an Experience as a Place
description: Robin Hammond set out to document Lagos, a teeming metropolis where intimacy and exclusion, love and hate, laughter and insult regularly rub shoulders on its streets.

title: Saad Hariri: Iran Must Stop Meddling in Arab Affairs
description: On Feb. 14, 2005, a massive bomb killed the former prime minister of Lebanon, Rafik Hariri, my father, along with 22 other Lebanese. The Special Tribunal for Lebanon at The Hague identified five Hezbollah operatives as suspected collaborators in the murder. If proved, that would mean his assassination was carried out by Irans allies in Lebanon, who are financed and controlled by the regime in Tehran.

title: Foreign Wars and Terrorism
description: Dealing with extremism abroad and its spillover at home will present an enormously complex challenge for the next president. Over the last five years, conflicts in Syria and Iraq have continued to frustrate the United States diplomatically, sapped military resources and provided a breeding ground for Islamic State radicals, who have spread bloodshed and destruction in the region and the West.

title: Ready, Aim  Voting
description: The hottest political ad of the season  I am not counting anything involving Triumph the Insult Comic Dog  is probably for the Missouri Senate, in which the Democratic candidate talks about  gun background checks.

title: The Folly of the Protest Vote
description: Last week, after I delivered a speech at the impressive campus of Morgan State University, a historically black college in northeast Baltimore, a woman approached the mike during the question-and-answer period to raise an issue that she and I both found frustrating: What to say to young people, particularly young African-Americans, who have decided either not to vote in the forthcoming presidential election or to cast a protest vote for a third-party candidate who will most assuredly lose?

title: The Best News You Dont Know
description: The world is a mess, with billions of people locked in inescapable cycles of war, famine and poverty, with more children than ever perishing from hunger, disease and violence.

title: When It Comes to Baskets, Were All Deplorable
description: It was the awkward comment heard round the world. At a fund-raiser earlier this month, the Democratic presidential nominee, Hillary Clinton, divided the supporters of her Republican opponent Donald J. Trump into two even groups. One consisted of good, if alienated and dispossessed, people. But the other half goes into a basket of deplorables, she said. The racist, sexist, homophobic, xenophobic, Islamophobic  you name it.

title: The Divided States of America
description: Reading the nonstop coverage of what may well be a close presidential election, one might be forgiven for thinking that political competition is alive and well in America.

title: Artist Zeng Fanzhi on the Evolution of His Work and Chinas Art Market
description: To get a sense of the remarkable growth of the Chinese contemporary art market, look no further than the artist Zeng Fanzhi.

title: Photographing Lagos, As Much an Experience as a Place
description: I have been an outsider most of my life. As an immigrant or photographer in the countries where I have lived and worked, I have not truly belonged. Ive been a foreigner for so long that I dont really know anything else. It has become part of who I am.

title: An 18-Karat Throne
Questions for: An English Soccer Club Turns Fantasy Sports Into Reality
description: Article: An English Soccer Club Turns Fantasy Sports Into Reality

title: In a Lab in Poland, Plastic That Can Crawl
description: Its about half an inch long, a few millimeters wide and no thicker than a human hair, and it usually just sits there like a discarded strip of red cellophane  until a specific shade of green laser light strikes it.

title: Facing Britain: Simon Schama Takes a Gallery Tour
description: THE FACE OF BRITAINA History of the Nation Through Its PortraitsBy Simon SchamaIllustrated. 603 pp. Oxford University Press. $39.95.

title: Richard Ford Reviews Bruce Springsteens Memoir
description: BORN TO RUNBy Bruce SpringsteenIllustrated. 510 pp. Simon & Schuster. $32.50.

title: Close to Work in Midtown West
description: In 2010, Andrew Warren, working in London for an American bank, was given a chance to transfer to Salt Lake City. He took it. There, at work, he met his wife-to-be, Ellada Arakelova.

title: 36 Hours in Edinburgh
description: Where old and modern merge seamlessly: along with medieval alleys, design-forward buildings and a new Scottish cuisine.

title: Inside Hillary Clintons Outrage Machine, Allies Push the Buttons
description: Just before 9:30 p.m. on Sept. 13, the first Twitter post appeared, directing users to an obscure article about a remark Donald J. Trump had made last year that 50 percent of the country did not want to work.
