title: Police Sex Abuse Case Is Bad News for Mexicos Leader
description: MEXICO CITY  International human rights officials are demanding an investigation into the brutal sexual assaults of 11 Mexican women during protests a decade ago  an inquiry that would take aim at President Enrique Pea Nieto, who was the governor in charge at the time of the attacks.

title: Fantasy Football: Players to Start in Week 3
description: The Sablich brothers have provided award-winning fantasy football advice for The New York Times since 2010. See their weekly player rankings and visit 5thDownFantasy.com for more fantasy analysis. You can also ask them questions through their Twitter account, @5thdownfantasy.

title: A Laser-Powered Robot Caterpillar
description: The University of Warsaw developed a robot caterpillar that uses an external laser to move. Other soft robots can be propelled by electromagnetic fields or light.

title: Why Does Celebrity Gossip Interest Us So Much?
description: When did you hear the Brangelina news? How did you react? Why do you think the public reaction was so intense that the hashtag #Brangelina quickly became the top trending item on Twitter?

title: Review: Denzel Washington Rides High in The Magnificent Seven
description: Denzel Washington looks just right high in the saddle, which makes sense given that hes become our John Wayne  our point-and-shoot savior. Its a funny business being a hero these days, and Mr. Washington has the rsum to prove it, with characters  a corrupt cop, a drug kingpin  that would have been unthinkable for Wayne, who saved the day when the lines between right and wrong were more rigidly defined. Those lines have blurred, of course, and good guys went sort of bad and sometimes very bad, partly because we like it like that. (It feels so good.)

title: Will Women Play Major League Baseball? (And Not Just on TV)
description: The new Fox drama Pitch, about the first female pitcher in Major League Baseball, proclaims that it is a true story on the verge of happening.

title: Foreign Reporters in China Face More Restrictions Now, Report Says
description: BEIJING  China has tightened restrictions on foreign journalists since Xi Jinping became the countrys leader four years ago, complicating efforts to parse Beijings thinking at a time when its slowing economy and growing global ambitions are making it increasingly important to the world.

title: Max Mara: Spring 2017
description: Looks from the labels latest collection.

title: Morning Agenda: Outrage Over Health Care, Fund Giant Is Charged, Viacom Chief to Step Down
description: The world of health care is filled with acrimony and accusations at the moment.

title: Flyhalf Assembly Line Is Key to New Zealands Rugby Success
description: WELLINGTON, New Zealand  Grant Fox, Andrew Mehrtens, Dan Carter: for 30 years, the New Zealand All Blacks have produced an endless stream of world-class flyhalves who have steered the team to success.

title: Charlotte, EpiPen, Deflategate: Your Thursday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: 5 Ways to Make College Tours Fun Instead of Grueling
description: At Amherst College in Amherst, Mass., my family, including our son, prospective applicant Seth, enjoyed the natural history museum and spied on swim team practice. At Colby College in Waterville, Me., we appreciated the colonial architecture and the modern art collection. At the University of Chicago, we loved the Hogwarts-like reading room and the pierogi truck.

title: Five Places to Go in Prague
description: Once defined by its rundown Communist-style housing blocks, uneven sidewalks and graffiti-laced storefronts, Pragues Vrsovice district has transformed into one of the capitals it neighborhoods. Over the last decade, stylish cafes, craft beer pubs and boutique retailers have moved in, tucked among its colorful rowhouses. With its popular biannual street festivals and vibrant night life, this former blue-collar neighborhood has now become something of a cultural melting pot with a breezy bohemian vibe, attracting an international crowd.

title: Sarah Jessica Parker, Leaving Carrie Behind With HBOs Divorce
description: Sarah Jessica Parker was waiting for a menu at a restaurant in Hastings-on-Hudson, a Westchester County suburb of New York, when a 50-something man in a polo shirt and shorts showed up at her table. Im out of your face right after this little note I made for you  check it out, he said. He handed her a small folded piece of paper and waited as Ms. Parker read it. Aw, she said, and smiled. Thank you! Thank you, Michael!

title: Clinton and Trump Tied in North Carolina Poll, With Sharp Educational Divides
description: Perhaps no battleground state is as polarized along demographic lines as this one.

title: New York Today: An Extended Summer
description: Updated, 10:53 a.m.

title: Lang Lang Is Named New Yorks First Cultural Tourism Ambassador
description: BEIJING  New York City, already a top international tourist destination, has a message for visitors from China: Theres more to see than the Empire State Building and Times Square.

title: The Voyages Issue: Remarkable Journeys With Six Photographers
description: Photo essays from around the world by Andrea Frazzetta, Joachim Ladefoged, David Maurice Smith, Kirsten Luce, Sebastin Liste and Raymond Meeks.

title: What We See When We Look at Travel Photography
description: There is a vast gulf between how people tend to think of tourism, an agreeable pursuit for themselves and a great benefit to their local economy, and how people tend to think of other tourists, as interlopers, beholden to oafish appetites for packaged experience. Those of us who travel professionally, with a view to record for those at home our encounters on the road, try to bridge that perceptual divide. This can be uncomfortable. Tourists in bad faith, we are paid to elevate our nave consumption (of city, museum, vista, ruin, breakfast) to the level of a vocation. The internal anxiety that this contradiction inspires in us often gets displaced, in an amusing way, onto others on the same circuit. Professional travelers like nothing better than the opportunity to point out the crumminess of other professional travelers.

title: Identity Is a Hoax, People!
description: This week, we discuss Sundays prime-time Emmy Awards broadcast, which Jenna barely wanted to watch.

title: 1966: Peace Move Would End Assault
description: United Nations  The United States offered today [Sept. 22] to stop bombing North Vietnam and begin pulling out its troops if Hanoi would take corresponding action to de-escalate the fighting. U.S. Ambassador Arthur J. Goldberg, making a major policy declaration, told the 118-member General Assembly that the United States was willing to undertake first steps provided North Vietnam showed through public or private response it was ready to reciprocate. The United States, Mr. Goldberg said, does not seek to make South Vietnam a permanent U.S. ally.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Sept. 23, 1966

title: Nina Stemme on a Love and Loss in Tristan und Isolde
description: Nina Stemmes favorite page from the score of Wagners Tristan und Isolde is a surprising one: not Isoldes closing Liebestod or the great love scene, but a passing moment in the first act. Isolde, eyeing Tristan but addressing herself and her maid, Brangne, laments that Tristan is destined for her but has been taken from her. She reveals her love for him by tracing the yearning theme that dominates the opera but resolves that such love must end in death. Hers are a Todgeweihtes Haupt and a Todgeweihtes Herz  a head and heart fated for the grave. Here are edited excerpts from a conversation with Ms. Stemme about the sequence.

title: Spending Bill Seems Likely to Take Up Ted Cruzs Fight Over Internet Directory
description: A plan to help revive the Export-Import Bank seems to be headed for the legislative cutting-room floor. A Republican dream of weakening pesticide regulations has been scotched. But the short-term spending bill that Congress is set to pass next week, one that both parties tried to use to promote various policies, will most likely include a provision championed by Senator Ted Cruz, Republican of Texas, a frequent troublemaker on all matters fiscal.

title: Nina Stemme Takes On Her Biggest Met Opera Assignment Yet
description: For a certain kind of New Yorker, whose Manhattan-centrism comes with the expectation that the Big Apple should naturally be a magnet for the best of everything, the long absences of Nina Stemme, the great Swedish dramatic soprano, were somewhat puzzling.

title: Apple Opens the iMessage Door, and the Ephemera Rushes In
description: Apple built an empire on hermetically sealed systems with sleek, minimalist designs. Nowhere was its strategy more evident than in iMessage, the companys instant messaging system that offered a free, elegant chatting solution exclusive to Apple devices. Until last week, that is, when Apple updated its software, cracked open iMessage and allowed the ephemera of the outside internet to seep in.

title: Ex-Cuomo Aides Charged in Federal Corruption Inquiry
description: Federal corruption charges were announced on Thursday against two former close aides to Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, a senior state official and six other people, in a blow to the governors innermost circle and a repudiation of the way his prized upstate economic development programs were managed.

title: Botched Repair to Chinas Great Wall Provokes Outrage
description: BEIJING  The Great Wall of China. A stirring symbol of national pride whose overlapping sections span thousands of miles. A crumbling, melancholy monument to Chinas imperial grandeur, so imposing that it inspired the stubborn myth that it is visible from the moon.

title: The Curious Confidence of Charlatans and Cranks
description: Brad DeLong tells us about a letter being circulated by economists for Trump  although, as he notes, they dont dare say that, and describe themselves only as critics of Clinton. Several things are notable about the letter, including the absence of many usually reliable Republican hired guns economists. But they do have a Nobelist, Eugene Fama, at the top. And the substance of the letter  government bad! taxes and regulation bad! free markets rool like Reagan!  is pretty standard.

title: In Pinters No Mans Land, Actor-Knights Wield Their Words
description: LONDON  No Mans Land has attracted no shortage of legendary talent since Harold Pinters ceaselessly tantalizing and cryptic play premiered in 1975, starting with those era-defining actor-knights, John Gielgud and Ralph Richardson. As two of the signature stage voices of all time, their every utterance signaled the playsqualities as a chamber poem.

title: Afghanistan Signs Draft Peace Deal With Faction Led by Gulbuddin Hekmatyar
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  The Afghan government signed a draft peace deal on Thursday with a small insurgent faction led by a warlord who has been designated a global terrorist by the United States.

title: Body Image Issues? Lisa Lampanelli Knows the Feeling
description: Lisa Lampanelli didnt become an insult comic by herself. A heckler helped.

title: U.S. to Step Up Deportations of Haitians Amid Surge at Border
description: MEXICO CITY  The Obama administration, responding to an extraordinary wave of Haitian migrants seeking to enter the United States, said on Thursday that it would fully resume deportations of undocumented Haitian immigrants.

title: Cirque du Soleil Brings Steampunk to Randalls Island
description: Cirque du Soleil has its geographical bases pretty much covered, from Paramour, currently on Broadway, to the many productions in Las Vegas and on tour. But the best way to experience the circus is under a big top, which makes Kurios: Cabinet of Curiosities, to be presented in a pop-up space on Randalls Island, especially exciting. And it arrives in New York with exuberant reviews in its wake: It is not to be missed on any account, Chris Jones wrote in The Chicago Tribune.

title: This Conductor Is on the Rise, and Shes Coming to New York
description: Mirga Grazinyte-Tyla, 30, is already one of the worlds fastest-rising conductors. Closely affiliated with the Los Angeles Philharmonic, a canny judge of young talent, she has just become the music director of the City of Birmingham Symphony Orchestra in England, a position that jump-started the careers of Simon Rattle and Andris Nelsons.

title: California Today: The Debate Over Indian Mascots and Imagery
description: Good morning.

title: Jeremy Corbyn and the Problem With Electability
description: LONDON  Jeremy Corbyns tenure since last September as leader of the Labour Party has been bumpy, to say the least: The party now has the worst poll ratings in its history. Labours parliamentary members have complained that Mr. Corbyn cannot manage them. And his tenure has been troubled by poor decisions  he chose, for example, to go to a Cuba solidarity event on the same day that Theresa May, the new prime minister, announced the formation of her cabinet, leaving the opposition with no public response. Mr. Corbyn was widely considered a lackluster campaigner in the effort to persuade British voters that their country should remain in the European Union.

title: End U.S. Support for the Thugs of Honduras
description: Santa Cruz, Calif.  Around midnight on March 2, the indigenous peoples rights and environmental activist Berta Cceres was shot dead by gunmen who entered her residence in La Esperanza, Honduras. A longtime campaigner against illegal logging operations, Ms. Cceres had been repeatedly threatened because of her opposition to the Agua Zarca hydroelectric project, one of the largest of its kind in Central America.

title: Come Check Out Our House, Metropolitan Opera Says
description: As opera companies around the world try to remove the barriers that can inhibit newcomers, the Metropolitan Opera is experimenting with a literal approach. The Met plans to throw open its gates and welcome visitors to the front of the opera house for free on weekdays beginning next month, the company announced Thursday.

title: The Artists and Their Alley, in Postwar France
description: Theres a back street in Montparnasse, the entrance to a hospital morgue, where weeds grow in sidewalk cracks and beer cans rust on the pavement. The only discernible sign of life is a corner cafe, but even that feels more like the backdrop of a Cartier-Bresson photograph than a place to purchase actual coffee. On a clammy afternoon in August, the owner sits outside alone, smoking.

title: Charges Against Joseph Percoco and Others
description: Mr. Percoco, who had served as Gov. Andrew M. Cuomos executive deputy secretary, is accused of soliciting and taking more than $315,000 in bribes. In addition, corruption charges were announced against another former aide, a senior state official and six other people.

title: Charges Against Todd Howe
description: Mr. Howe, a former aide to Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, is accused of arranging bribes for another aide.

title: Boko Haram Rages in Nigeria, but the Worlds Eyes Are Elsewhere
description: MAIDUGURI, Nigeria  The crisis spawned by Boko Haram has drawn hundreds of thousands of people to a relatively little-known city in Nigeria that has finally become safe enough for them to wait out an end to the awful, deadly war.

title: Slovenias (Burgeoning) Fairy Tale of a City
description: Visiting Ljubljana, Slovenias 1,000-year-old capital, feels like stepping into an ancient fable. Despite decades under communist rule, theres magic to the intimate city: Its the sort of place where you can stroll past jelly-bean-colored Baroque churches, over a bridge flanked by dragons  Ljubljanas mascot  onto winding cobblestone lanes filled with local farmers selling peonies the size of lap dogs and creaky inns serving bear meat.

title: The Peculiar Pleasure of Ornately Embellished Accessories
description: Visually arresting shoes and bags are the perfect antidote to minimalist fashion.

title: Want to Change Banking Culture? Stop Talking About Cross-Selling
description: Bankers love the phrase cross-sell. I dont.

title: Restoring a Run-Down Convent in Tuscany
description: For 60 years, a 16th-century Franciscan convent designed by the Florentine architect Antonio da Sangallo the Younger, a creator of both the Palazzo Farnese and the Villa Madama in Rome, had existed in a state of abandoned decrepitude. Situated on the edge of the town of Pitigliano, in southern Tuscany, with vegetation engulfing its cloisters, the house had no electricity, almost no running water and no windows. It was exactly what the mother-and-daughter duo Holly Lueders and Venetia Sacret Young had been looking for: the perfect ruin.

title: Fendi: Spring 2017
description: After showing a 90th-anniversary couture collection at he Trevi Fountain in Rome, Karl Lagerfeld presents his spring show.

title: Polands Most Optimistic, Backward-Looking Artist
description: For the Polish artist Paulina Olowska, Warsaw in the 2000s was a city of ghosts. Walking through neighborhoods, she would notice skeletal and darkened neon signs for shops that no longer existed, the legacy of a centrally planned neonization of Warsaw. She would pass shuttered storefronts with elaborate papier-mch dioramas, a decorative tradition left over from a time when shops had little to display in their windows. She saw an expired idealism in the library for the blind across the street from her apartment; in the Modernist buildings, constructed with a utopian society in mind and yet unlivable; in the defunct socialist monuments.

title: Professed Hit Man Tempers Claims of Rodrigo Dutertes Role in Philippine Killings
description: MANILA  A professed hit man who implicated President Rodrigo Duterte of the Philippines in extrajudicial killings backed off some of his earlier assertions of the presidents involvement under tough questioning from a Senate committee on Thursday.

title: Profile in Style: Ren Tadeo Holguin
description: Inside the creative rodeo of the shop owner and purveyor of eclectic finds.

title: All About L.A.s Importer of Eclectic, Southwestern Vibes
description: Inside the creative rodeo of the RTH shop owner and purveyor of eclectic finds Ren Tadeo Holguin.

title: How Restricting Food Stamp Choices Can Fight Obesity
description: Often, when people discuss the obesity crisis in the United States, and another failed effort to help people change their eating habits, its as if theres nothing we can do.

title: 40 Intriguing Photos to Make Students Think
description: Update, Oct. 4, 2020: We have published a sequel to this post with 40 more intriguing photographs.

title: 1891: Rebellion Threatens China
description: SHANGHAI  The situation daily grows more serious. Mob rule prevails at Ichang, and is the prelude of other disorders. The Valley of the Yangtsee is in rebellion.

title: Who Is Jacoby Brissett? Maybe the Patriots Starting Quarterback
description: The Patriots are 2-0, and all the concerns about Tom Bradys four-game suspension to start the season seemed unfounded when his backup, Jimmy Garoppolo, played well.

title: Climate Change Threatens Worlds Coffee Supply, Report Says
description: A report examining the many ways climate change threatens coffee and coffee farmers has alarmed people who are now imagining what it would be like getting through the day without their caffeine fix.

title: Great British Bake Off Loses Mary Berry, a Star Host
description: LONDON  The Great British Bake Off, the hit series that pits pastry makers against one another in polite competition, is losing one of its greatest draws: Mary Berry, an 81-year-old celebrity chef whose understated expressions of delight and disdain have attracted something of a cult following.

title: U.N. Criticizes Congo for Response to Deadly Unrest
description: KINSHASA, Democratic Republic of Congo  The United Nations high commissioner for human rights blamed the government of the Democratic Republic of Congo on Thursday for using excessive force during political demonstrations and riots this week that might have killed more than 50 people.

title: Funny Pages
description: I. Prime Baby: Conclusion (pdf format) By GENE LUEN YANG  Chapter 1  Chapter 2  Chapter 3  Chapter 4  Chapter 5  Chapter 6  Chapter 7  Chapter 8  Chapter 9  Chapter 10  Chapter 11  Chapter 12  Chapter 13  Chapter 14  Chapter 15  Chapter 16  Chapter 17

title: After Brexit, E.U. Revives Idea of Its Own Joint Military Command
description: LONDON  In late April 2003, just after the rapid fall of Baghdad, four of the founding countries of what is now the European Union met to announce the formation of a European operational military command headquarters just down the road from NATO.

title: Obama Is on the Cusp of a Rebuke He Has Long Avoided: A Veto Override
description: WASHINGTON  It has taken nearly eight years, but it appears President Obama is about to finally suffer the stinging indignity of a veto override.

title: In a Switch for Paris Show, Automakers Turn From Diesel
description: At the Paris Motor Show, which will open on Saturday, diesel will be a dirty word.

title: Fashion Week Photo Diary: Gucci and No. 21
description: Scenes from the spring/summer 2017 collections that were presented in Milan on Wednesday.

title: Video Review: With Many Options, Ford Explorer Rides High
description: IT can be argued that the Ford Explorer ignited Americas love affair with sport utility vehicles when it arrived in 1990, riding on the compact Ranger pickup platform.

title: Expecto Patronum! Patronus Test Keeps Harry Potter Marketing Alive
description: Heres a question that separates a real Harry Potter fan from the rest of the muggles who think this is all just a bunch of wizarding gibberish: Is your Patronus a Siberian cat, a heron or a basset hound?

title: Inside MoMA PS1s Back to School Bash
description: Ryan McNamara likes to think his No. 1 talent is as a casting director. He may be confident in his vision for new performance pieces, but he said he often invites his weird friends to add something he cant.

title: Rebelling Against Insta-Everything at Fendi and Roberto Cavalli
description: MILAN  Theres a balmy wind of minor rebellion sweeping along the catwalks of Milan, making unlikely allies of normally opposing aesthetics, and drawing a line in the sand. The insta-fashion that so defined the start of the season in New York (the way, arguably, insta-everything so defines modern life) is finding little purchase here.

title: Secrets to Lasting Relationships From High School Sweethearts
description: Growing up, and growing older, with their partners. Couples reveal how their love matured.

title: Living With Schizophrenia: My Fathers Perfect Family
description: My father said on numerous occasions when I was growing up that he would see other families that had problems like divorce and drug use, and he would thank God that his family was so perfect.

title: Put Your iPhone Photos on the Map
description: Q. How do I make my iPhone pictures appear on the map in the Photos app?

title: Emilio Pucci: Spring 2017
description: Massimo Giorgetti shows his third collection for the house.

title: Chris Christie Protected Culprit in Bridge Lane Closings, Agency Head Testifies
description: NEWARK  The acknowledged culprit behind the closing of traffic lanes leading to the George Washington Bridge in September 2013 was protected by Chris Christie, the executive director of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey agreed during court testimony on Thursday.

title: Keith Scotts Family Sees Videos of His Killing, and Says the Public Should, Too
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  The grieving relatives of a man who was killed by the police here watched videos on Thursday of the fatal shooting, a wrenching experience that they said revealed no hint of aggression in him and left the family members convinced that the videos should be made public. But the citys police chief, who had arranged for the private viewing, held fast to his decision not to release the recordings.

title: Amid New Airstrikes in Syria, an Aid Convoy Arrives
description: The United Nations resumed aid convoys to besieged communities in Syria on Thursday for the first time since a deadly attack on trucks loaded with supplies on Monday.

title: Baseball Is Having a Power Surge, but Nobody Knows Why
description: If you looked through the annual home run leaderboards, the 2000 season would not stick out as particularly noteworthy. Sammy Sosa led Major League Baseball with a relatively modest 50 homers after consecutive seasons in which he and Mark McGwire each hit more than 60. A year later, Barry Bonds surpassed both of them by hitting 73.

title: Stress May Counteract Effects of a Healthful Diet
description: Stress may counteract the beneficial effects of a healthful diet, a study in Molecular Psychiatry suggests.

title: Daily Report: Bay Area Claims Transport Center of the World Title
description: For several years now, the San Francisco Bay Area has increasingly become the transportation hub of the world, with start-ups and big companies experimenting with driverless cars, electric vehicles, ride-sharing, drones and even flying autos.

title: Tong Sam Gyup Goo Yi
description: Korean barbecue pork reigns supreme at this tiny restaurant in Flushing, Queens.

title: The Thrill of the Tabletop Grill at Tong Sam Gyup Goo Yi
description: The crowd is of one mind at Tong Sam Gyup Goo Yi: From every table rises a gleaming black cast-iron dome with a tapered handle, like the lid of a giant pot, and on every dome lie stripes of pork belly, more white than red, flesh nearly overrun by fat.

title: Risky Business: Hollywood Bets Big on Deepwater Horizon
description: In Hollywood, films like Deepwater Horizon are not supposed to exist.

title: Before I Say I Do, Lets Just Go Over Every Possible Scenario One More Time
description: Alex, the first night we met, I knew you were the one. When you asked me to move in, I didnt hesitate. When you proposed, I said yes right away.

title: Can the F.B.I. Do More to Investigate Suspected Extremists?
Violence Ripples Through Congo
description: Uncertainty over the next presidential election has spurred deadly clashes in the Democratic Republic of Congos capital, Kinshasa, over the last week.

title: Panthers Review Game Security After Violent Protests in Charlotte
description: The Carolina Panthers are reviewing security for Sunday afternoons home game against the Minnesota Vikings in the wake of violent protests in Charlotte, N.C., over the killing of a black man by a police officer.

title: In-Betweeners Are Part of a Rich Recruiting Pool for Jihadists
description: WASHINGTON  They were young men caught between cultures, sons of immigrant families, feeling lost or rejected  and angry about American-led wars. Online they encountered the silver-tongued recruiters of Al Qaeda and the Islamic State, who said their first loyalty should be not to their nation but to Islam. Then they plotted sensational violence.

title: Keep an Eye on Him, Ahmad Khan Rahamis Father Says He Told F.B.I.
description: The father of the man accused of carrying out bombings last weekend in New York and New Jersey said that, two years ago, he warned federal agents explicitly about his sons interest in terrorist organizations like Al Qaeda and his fascination with jihadist music, poetry and videos.

title: Fees Must Fall: Anatomy of the Student Protests in South Africa
description: University students protested in South Africa for at least a second day this week over plans to increase fees at the countrys colleges in 2017. The protests, which erupted in September, have turned violent as students have clashed with the police.

title: Review: In Queen of Katwe, a Pawn Finds Her Crown Through Chess
description: Irresistible is one of those adjectives that critics should handle with utmost care. No matter how universally charming or winning a movie or a performance might seem to be, there is always a chance that somebody, somewhere, will be able to resist it. For all I know that may be the case with Queen of Katwe, but if there is anyone out there capable of remaining unmoved by this true-life triumph-of-the-underdog sports story, I dont think I want to meet that person.

title: A Deadpan Hillary Clinton Visits Between Two Ferns
description: Hillary Clinton, a candidate who has gone to great lengths to showcase the playful side of her personality, apparently wanted to prove that she can take not only a joke but a full interview of nonstop lampooning when she appeared on the mock celebrity interview show Between Two Ferns.

title: Teenage Smoking Rates
description: To the Editor:

title: With Boeing Deal, Americans Are Coming to Iran
description: TEHRAN  Long before the first newly purchased Boeing airliner lands at Imam Khomeini International Airport, Iran and the United States will have had to come to terms with a new reality: American citizens will once again be taking up residence in Tehran, the first to do so since the Islamic Revolution and subsequent hostage crisis in 1979 and 1980.

title: Apple in Ireland
description: To the Editor:

title: What Patriotism Means
description: To the Editor:

title: Donald Trumps Economic Lies
description: To the Editor:

title: Dont Sell Plum Island
description: To the Editor:

title: Fixing Infrastructure: At Last, Something to Agree On
description: To the Editor:

title: As New York Breathes Sigh of Relief, Bomb Victims Cope With the Aftermath
description: One mans front teeth were knocked out. Another blacked out when his car was hit by the force of the blast. And one woman had to have ball bearings tweezed from her flesh, metal fragments removed from her ear and wood shards extracted from her neck.

title: Apple Kicks the Tires at McLaren
description: McLarens cars travel fast, but rumors about Apple acquisitions can flash by, too.

title: Yahoo Says Hackers Stole Data on 500 Million Users in 2014
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Yahoo announced on Thursday that the account information of at least 500 million users was stolen by hackers two years ago, in the biggest known intrusion of one companys computer network.

title: Eleven Artists Share Their Most Memorable Art-School Stories
description: New Yorks beloved kunsthalle in Long Island City, MoMA PS1, was a pioneering alternative art space when its founder Alanna Heiss converted a decommissioned public school into a full-time contemporary art center in 1971. This Friday evening, for the first time since then, school bells will ring to call PS1 to session in its original, pre-museum incarnation, in a festive subversion of T.G.I.F.

title: When a Fashionable Photographer Shoots Her Own Relatives
description: Bea De Giacomo bonds with her family by photographing them in staged situations, for her ongoing series La Casa Rosa.

title: Sidelined at the U.N., a Frustrated Taiwan Presses On
description: From her 12th-floor corner office overlooking the thrum of Manhattans East 42nd Street, Joanne Ou, a Taiwanese diplomat, can catch a glimpse of the motorcades ferrying foreign leaders to the United Nations General Assembly meeting a few blocks to the east.

title: Dont Waste Money on Premium Gas if Your Car Is Made for Regular
description: With the typical new passenger vehicle costing more than $33,000, American drivers understandably want to do everything they can to preserve their investments.

title: Prada: Spring 2017
description: Miuccia Prada, in a nod to see-now/buy-now fashion, offers accessories for sale right after her spring show.

title: Student Protests in South Africa Turn Violent
description: The police fired stun grenades and rubber bullets in an effort to disperse students protesting plans to increase fees at South Africas colleges in 2017.

title: 10 Stylish Bibliophiles at MoMA PS1 for Book Fair
description: Printed Matters New York Art Book Fair draws a smart-looking crowd. Heres how they got that way.

title: Donald Trump Says Drugs Are Big Factor in Urban Violence
description: PITTSBURGH  Donald J. Trump said Thursday that drugs were to blame for the violence roiling cities across the nation.

title: Photoville: Bigger, and Covering the Waterfront
description: ALMOST everything is bigger at this years edition of Photoville, the annual Brooklyn photography festival that runs through Sunday in Dumbo. Even the beer garden.

title: China Shrugs Off the Ties That Bind
description: China has marriage on its mind  but perhaps not commitment.

title: How I Got the Shot: A Discreetly Passed Note About the Location of a Terror Suspect
description: Times Insider shares insights into how we work at The New York Times. In this installment of How I Got the Shot, Sam Hodgson, a freelance photographer, reveals that a Times push alert on his phone enabled him to be in the right spot at the right time.

title: Photos From Alberta Ferretti, Fendi and Roberto Cavalli
description: Plus: Puglisi and MaxMaras spring 2017 collections.

title: In the Wild, Goldfish Turn From Pet to Pest
description: Two decades ago, someone dropped a handful of unwanted pet goldfish into a creek in southwestern Australia. Those goldfish grew, swam downstream, mucked up waters wherever they went and spawned like mad. Before long, they took over the whole river.

title: A Real-Life Black Beauty Is Cashing In on His Looks
description: Fifteen hundred tons of synthetic dirt now sit in the middle of Wollman Rink in Central Park, hauled in a few days ago to transform the ice skating area into a parade ground for some of the worlds most prized horses. The Rolex Central Park Horse Show is meant to bring horses back to a city and a park with bridle paths that were once frequently used for riding. Champion ponies and renowned Olympic steeds will spend part of this week there in what are expected to be fierce competitions.

title: JPMorgan May Face New Scrutiny in China Hiring Case
description: For the last three years, JPMorgan Chases hiring practices in China were at the center of a federal bribery investigation.

title: Netanyahu and Abbas at U.N. General Assembly
description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel and the Palestinian Authority president, Mahmoud Abbas, continued to make their cases for peace at the United Nations on Thursday

title: Review: Dance That Playfully Brings Art History to Life
description: It begins with a body, a woman lying curled and motionless onstage, possibly asleep. Theres a suggestion of story in the sparkly dress she wears. When she stirs, she moves languorously, and when, still reclining, she strikes an over-the-shoulder pose, you think of the odalisques of art history.

title: An American Tragedy: Charlotte, Tulsa ...
description: To the Editor:

title: How Puccis New Designer Reinterprets Vintage Pieces
description: When Emilio Pucci  marquis of Barsento, Olympic skier, aviator and politician  whipped up his first stretch ski suits in 1947 and launched his own fashion label in 1951, he couldnt have dreamed that, nearly 80 years later, his brand of kaleidoscope-print luxury wear would carry on his name.

title: As Flagship Returns, South Street Museum Aims to Right Its Course
description: JONATHAN BOULWARE, executive director of the South Street Seaport Museum in Lower Manhattan, was talking about restoration, revitalization and return  the restoration, revitalization and return of a 131-year-old sailing ship. But he could just as easily have been talking about the museum itself.

title: Review: In The Undertaking, Considering the End With Some Laughter
description: Whats your greatest fear? If youre a normal, neurotic New Yorker, its probably the big inevitable: death.

title: Review: Storks, an Uneasy Return to Delivering Babies
description: Birds have been fine  memorable, even  as secondary characters in animated fare. Zazu in The Lion King. Scuttle in The Little Mermaid. But giving a bird or birds top billing is another matter, as demonstrated by Storks. This film, directed by Nicholas Stoller and Doug Sweetland, is a harmless enough way to occupy a youngster for an hour and a half. Its just not especially rich in extraordinary characters or moments.

title: How to Get the Bright, Matte Lips From the Runways
description: This season, makeup artists have painted lips with bright, matte shades ranging from powder blue to traffic-cone orange. Heres how they did it.

title: Manslaughter Charge for Tulsa Officer Who Killed Black Driver
description: TULSA, Okla.  The white police officer who fatally shot an unarmed black driver here last week as he stood outside his vehicle overreacted during a confrontation captured on video and was charged on Thursday with first-degree manslaughter, the authorities said.

title: How to Get Pradas Simple, Classic Beauty Look
description: The Prada spring/summer 2017 collection was full of delicate, feminine pieces with off-kilter mens wear touches  in other words, classic Prada. To accompany the clothing, the makeup artist Pat McGrath created a stripped down, natural look for the models faces  perfecting the skin with a little foundation, grooming the eyebrows, adding a touch of cream blush and mascara and, to finish, highlighting cheeks and eyes with nude Skin Fetish from her recently launched line, Pat McGrath Labs. Mrs. Prada spoke about going back to the codes of Prada, and a nod to the past, McGrath said backstage before the show, So I kept things very simple and easy.

title: Review: In The Dressmaker, a Femme Fatale Wants Vengeance
description: Im back, you bastards.

title: Yahoo Says It Was Hacked. Heres How to Protect Yourself.
description: Simple tips to follow if you think your personal information online has been exposed to hackers.

title: What to See in New York Art Galleries This Week
description: Marcus Garvey Park, Morningside Park, St. Nicholas Park and Jackie Robinson Park Through July 25

title: Review: In Seed: The Untold Story, Its Farmers Versus Big Business
description: Seed: The Untold Story is one of those documentaries that get you riled up about a situation but leave you feeling that nothing significant can be done about it.

title: A Peek at House Members Before Recess, in Three Snippets
description: WASHINGTON  These are the final days of this pre-election Congress, the last chance to make an impression for Americans to carry to the voting booth. Nowhere is this clearer than in the House, where members are trying to keep busy while the Senate brokers a spending deal to simultaneously keep the lights on in the federal government and shut them off in the halls of Congress as everyone heads home to campaign.

title: Review: Its Jane Jacobss World We Live In
description: Jane Jacobs (1916-2006) was a heroic figure of intellectual life in the second half of the 20th century, and she is nearly always instructive and cheering to read about.

title: Review: A Safe Start to Alan Gilberts Final Season With the Philharmonic
description: Alan Gilbert began his tenure as music director of the New York Philharmonic in September  2009 by turning the traditional season-opening gala concert into a strong statement of artistic purpose. Conductors at orchestras everywhere are under institutional pressure to make these gala programs, which also function as fund-raisers for patrons, light and festive. Mr. Gilberts inaugural challenged this notion.

title: Review: In The Ruins of Lifta, a Dispute Amid the Rubble
description: Among the hills on the western outskirts of Jerusalem stands an abandoned group of stone buildings, the remains of Lifta, an Arab village whose residents were driven out in 1948, during what Israelis know as the War of Independence and what Palestinians call the Nakba (Catastrophe). Plans to demolish the homes and build a new development have drawn opposition from an Israeli-Palestinian coalition seeking to preserve the site.

title: Good, Bad and Mad: Times Opinion Columnist Andrew Rosenthal on the News
description: Times Opinion columnist Andrew Rosenthal on the Chelsea bombing, racial profiling, Lewis Black, and Times Op-Docs. Susan Lehman is host.

title: The Paintings Are Delicate. The Shows a Shambles.
description: Some artists may be at odds with their own talents and wish they could be something more than they are. A spectacular example of such a conflicted creative sensibility is Kai Althoff: and then leave me to the common swifts (und dann berlasst mich den Mauerseglern) at the Museum of Modern Art, which has more than 200 of Mr. Althoffs poetically allusive, delicately made paintings, drawings and sculptures folded into an unfortunately messy and confusing installation of found materials.

title: Review: 1000 Rupee Note, a Poor Widows Blessing and Curse
description: Its not every day you see a film in Marathi. But Shrihari Sathes 1000 Rupee Note, true to its origins in the Maharashtra State of India, is told in a dialect of that language.

title: Siblings Who Dont Play Nice After a Mothers Death
description: It has been two years since my mother died, and the Jewish holidays are around the corner again. The problem: They are stressful and not much fun without her. My siblings and I, in our 20s and 30s, do a lot of sniping, and our dad seems mostly checked out. I know that everyone is trying; no one always plays the villain. But too often, family occasions end in hurt feelings. Do you think its possible to repair this situation? Or should I just stop going and deal with the fallout?

title: Good, Bad and Mad: Andrew Rosenthal on the News
description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how news, features and opinion come together at The New York Times. In this podcast, Andrew Rosenthal, a Times Op-Ed columnist, talks about the news  the good, the bad and that which makes him mad.

title: Call Him an Early Adopter: Thomas Child, a 19th-Century Photographer in China
description: Thomas Child, a British engineer, traveled to China in 1870 for work but was so entranced by the scenery and culture that he stayed for nearly two decades. He imported cameras to set up a sideline business as a portrait and landscape photographer, and his works were published in magazines and books. He also marketed them to tourists and dignitaries. The accompanying texts were a mix of admiration and condescension for traditions that Westerners of the time considered primitive.

title: Review: My Blind Brother, Who Is Also a Major Pain
description: In My Blind Brother, Robbie (Adam Scott) is a world-class jerk, an athlete who brags about his achievements. He also happens to be blind, and during sporting events is guided by his brother, Bill (Nick Kroll), introduced  exhausted and sweaty  running beside him in a marathon to raise money for blind children.

title: Moschino: Spring 2017
description: Jeremy Scott shows his latest Pop-infused collection.

title: Elizabeth Dee Gallery Is Ready to Take On Harlem
description: Its too soon to declare Chelsea over.

title: Review: The Jazz Loft According to W. Eugene Smith
description: In the last years of the 1950s, the esteemed American photojournalist W. Eugene Smith was at a personal and professional crossroads. Several years spent on a productive but ultimately abortive project (documenting the city of Pittsburgh) forced him to sell his large home in Croton-on-Hudson, N.Y. His marriage ended. He acquired a Manhattan loft on Avenue of the Americas in the 20s  then known as the flower district  where his immediate neighbors were up-all-night musicians. A different resident might have complained of the noise. But Smith, whose predilection for recording eventually developed into something like a mania, started shooting and taping, and kept at it for almost a decade.

title: Theater Listings for Sept. 23-29
description: A critical guide to productions in New York City, including shows in previews.

title: Donald Trumps Real Message on Race
description: The more Donald Trump presses his supposed effort to appeal to black voters, the more bizarre it gets.

title: Cosima von Bonin, Swimming Against the Tide
description: This world, Hamlet tells us, is a sea of troubles; love, every pop star will assure you, is as deep as an ocean. For the versatile, sometimes inscrutable German sculptor Cosima von Bonin, too, the sea is a metaphor for our own lives, and she brings to our dry environment visitors from the deep. Hermit crabs and octopuses flounce on furniture, burdened by all too human anxieties. Clams stare out of their shells, their goggle eyes bearing down on you as if they know your secrets.

title: Review: In I.T., Smart House, Dumb Owner
description: Wishing you had one of those smart houses, where there are cameras everyplace, and the plumbing and lighting and appliances are all computer-controlled? The thriller I.T. could save you a lot of money. It will make you grateful that you live in an old-fashioned dumb house.

title: Review: Sagas, Swashbuckling and Scheherazade in 1001 Nights
description: Poor Scheherazade. You couldnt have blamed her if shed had trouble keeping her head. The Arabian Nights gave her little recourse: Use it or lose it.

title: Wage Campaign at Port Authority Hits an Impasse
description: Angering a vocal crowd of unionized airport workers, the commissioners of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey hit an impasse on Thursday over proposals for raising the agencys minimum wage.

title: Charlotte, Yahoo, U.S. Presidential Race: Your Thursday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Wells Fargo Tests Justice Departments Get-Tough Approach
description: In response to widespread public criticism that the government has been too lenient with executives responsible for corporate crime, Deputy Attorney General Sally Quillian Yates issued tough new guidelines last year for federal prosecutors.

title: They Found Bombs on a Beer Run. What Gratitude Are They Owed?
description: On Sunday evening, the day after a bomb exploded on West 23rd Street in Manhattan, Lee Parker visited his friend Ivan White at his apartment in Elizabeth, N.J., to borrow some clothes for a job interview the next morning and to watch some football. Mr. Parker had been struggling to find work for the past few years; he was laid off after Hurricane Sandy and had been sleeping on a series of sofas belonging to friends for some time. The interview the following day was for work at a trucking company. Mr. Parker had mentioned to Mr. White that in addition to a new outfit, he wished he had a new backpack.

title: Review: In Goat, Frat Brothers Unleash Their Sadistic Terror
description: A credible and dispiriting chronicle of late-adolescent male toxicity, Goat, adapted from a 2004 memoir by Brad Land, begins with a senseless assault. The quiet, seemingly sensible Brad (Ben Schnetzer) bails on a college party his older brother, Brett (Nick Jonas), has allowed him to attend, and is waylaid by a couple of local lowlifes. Brad nevertheless resolves to go to Bretts school, and pledge his frat.

title: Shove Over. I Want Back on the Grid.
description: The three words that terrify me most are off the grid, so its a testament to our friendship that I visit my pal Joyce (yeah, same name) in her off-the-grid cabin in the Catskills every summer.

title: Donald Trump, in Pittsburgh, Pledges to Boost Both Coal and Gas
description: Donald J. Trump on Thursday traveled to Pittsburgh, a city once synonymous with the rich coal seam that runs beneath it and now the capital of natural gas fracking, to promise the impossible: a boom for both coal and gas.

title: Jerusalem as a Place of Desire and Death, at the Metropolitan Museum
description: Arrows of desire: Jerusalem has been aiming them at the hearts of pilgrims, tourists and potentates for thousands of years. And the complex sensations the stings can deliver  exhilarating, devastating  is what the Metropolitan Museum of Art captures in Jerusalem 1000-1400: Every People Under Heaven.

title: Review: The Exorcist Reboots a Battle Against a Demonic Presence
description: The Exorcist, a horror series that begins Friday on Fox, has two demons to fight. Some viewers will be measuring it against what they consider to be one of the scariest movies the genre has ever produced, the 1973 film directed by William Friedkin. Others, schooled on decades worth of parodies of that same movie (especially its projectile-vomiting and 360-degree-head-spinning scenes), will be on the lookout for anything in the TV show that might be laughably ineffective or pretentious.

title: Review: Debate Wars, Where Nothing Is Too Frivolous for Argument
description: Whatever happens in Monday nights presidential debate, its unlikely to be anywhere near as entertaining as the goings-on in Debate Wars, six episodes of which went up on Thursday on Seeso, the comedy streaming service.

title: Review: In Closet Monster, a Teenagers Self-Discovery Is Tinged With Danger
description: You may find yourself hoping that Closet Monster fades to black during one of its few cheerful scenes  that way, the conflicted young man at its center will get a happy ending. This affecting film prompts that kind of concern for its characters. You want them to be safe.

title: Review: In The Free World, Being Free Isnt All Its Cracked Up to Be
description: Boyd Holbrooks performance in The Free World is so intense in its compressed fury that you can almost see steam coming out of his ears. An approximate 80s Mel Gibson look-alike, Mr. Holbrook plays Mo Lundy, a recently released prisoner who served time in the Louisiana State Penitentiary for murders he did not commit.

title: Review: An Unflinching Portrayal of Impending Mortality in Chronic
description: In the quietly devastating Chronic, Tim Roth, never more impressive onscreen, plays David, a palliative care worker whose intimacy with death and dying both scares and shames family members who nervously peek in on loved ones they have more or less abandoned. The first English-language film by Michel Franco, the Mexican director of After Lucia, a harrowing study of high school bullying, Chronic stands back from its characters, which it views with a cold documentarylike detachment.

title: Review: In The Lovers and the Despot, a Harrowing Korean Ordeal
description: Every so often a documentary has such a head-shakingly bizarre story that alone makes it worth seeing. If you follow the news, this one may sound familiar: In 1986, a popular South Korean actress, Choi Eun-hee, and her ex-husband, a once-successful film director, Shin Sang-ok, entered the United States Embassy in Vienna and said that years earlier they had been kidnapped by North Korea  where they had been held against their will  and were now seeking asylum. It was stranger than fiction and also true (mostly, maybe).

title: Review: In The Age of Shadows, Plots Fine, but Actions Better
description: Like a reader skimming a novel to find the juicy parts, Kim Jee-woon gets through the story dutifully enough in The Age of Shadows. But this director is really looking to stage the action sequences, which he prolongs and savors once they arrive.

title: Review: Audrie & Daisy, on Sexual Assault and Technology
description: The Netflix documentary Audrie & Daisy is intended to spread awareness of teenage sexual assaults and how technology can amplify their ramifications.

title: Email Hack Details Movements of Joe Biden, Michelle Obama and Hillary Clinton
description: WASHINGTON  Hackers on Thursday posted hundreds of emails from a young Democratic operative that contained documents detailing the minute-by-minute schedules and precise movements of the vice president, the first lady and Hillary Clinton during recent campaign fund-raisers and official political events.

title: Review: Chicken People, Pampering Royalty That Clucks
description: They hold grudges. They have best friends. They arent big on foreplay, and you can revive them with mouth-to-mouth resuscitation if they choke during a shampoo.

title: Government Moves to Close a Watchdog of For-Profit Colleges
description: The Education Department on Thursday moved to shut down the nations largest accreditor of for-profit colleges, which had stood watch as failing institutions like Corinthian Colleges and ITT Technical Institute teetered on a pileup of fraud investigations.

title: Gigi Hadid Fights Off a Fashion Week Nuisance
description: Oversize black sunglasses perched on her nose, the model Gigi Hadid made her way out of the Max Mara show on Thursday in Milan, pausing to smile for selfies with a few fans. As she moved through the paparazzi gaggle, a bearded man in a wide-brimmed hat and reflective sunglasses wrapped his arms around her waist from behind and lifted her into the air.

title: Comedy Listings for Sept. 23-29
description: A selected guide to stand-up, improv and comedy shows in New York City.

title: Harvard, Searching for Endowment Manager, Reports a Loss
description: Harvard is looking for a new manager for its endowment, the largest of any university. And based on results announced on Thursday, there will be plenty of room for improvement.

title: Why the World Forgot the Israeli-Palestinian Conflict
description: JERUSALEM  They took the stage, one after the other, two aging actors in a long-running drama that has begun to lose its audience. As the Israeli and Palestinian leaders recited their lines in the grand hall of the United Nations General Assembly on Thursday, many in the orchestra seats recognized the script.

title: Keith Scotts Killing by Police Emerges as Issue in Tight North Carolina Race
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  The  protests filling television screens since a police shooting here have added a volatile new element to the presidential race in North Carolina, where the candidates are locked in fierce competition.

title: Presenting Americas Newest Comedy Team: Mel Brooks and Obama
description: WASHINGTON  Mel Brooks performed a bit of slapstick near the portrait of George Washington. President Obama tried his hand at stand-up comedy beside his lectern. Audra McDonald almost missed her moment on stage.

description: Dear Diary:

title: Classical Music Listings for Sept. 23-29

description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla.  When Yankees Manager Joe Girardi, sitting in the dugout before Wednesdays game, was asked about the surprisingly sturdy health of his starting pitchers this season, he did not wait for the question to be finished.

title: Pop & Rock Listings for Sept. 23-29
description: A selected guide to concerts in the New York City area.

description: At a Senate hearing on Tuesday, John Stumpf, the chairman and chief executive of Wells Fargo, gave the Banking Committee a non-apology for the banks pervasive abuse of customers.

description: A selected guide to jazz performances in New York City.

title: Police Videos, Kept Private, Fuel Tensions in Charlotte
description: The release of official videos has become a significant point of contention in the aftermath of the fatal police shooting of a 43-year-old black man on Tuesday in Charlotte, N.C.

title: Teodoro Gonzlez de Len, Evocative Mexican Architect, Dies at 90
description: MEXICO CITY  Teodoro Gonzlez de Len, an architect who fused the legacy of Mexicos pre-Hispanic past with European Modernism to design some of his countrys most distinctive public buildings, died on Sept. 16 in Mexico City. He was 90.

title: Dance Listings for Sept. 23-29
description: A selected guide to dance performances in New York City.

title: Shooting Victim Keith L. Scott Lived Sometimes Troubled but Quiet Life
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  Before Keith L. Scott joined a growing list of black men killed by the police and before his death became the center of violent protests here, he lived a sometimes troubled but relatively quiet life in a close-knit family.

title: Release the Charlotte Police Video
description: Elected officials who have paid any attention to the killings of civilians by the police that have roiled several cities in recent years should understand that keeping the public in the dark heightens tension and undermines trust in law enforcement.

title: In San Francisco, a Sinking Skyscraper and a Deepening Dispute
description: SAN FRANCISCO  The developers of the luxurious Millennium Tower laid out the risks and potential defects of the 58-story building in minute detail when its apartments went on sale seven years ago.

title: Mets Scratch Steven Matz as Shoulder Concerns Return
description: As soon as a Mets athletic trainer appeared in Manager Terry Collinss office on Thursday afternoon, Collins shook his head. In a season defined by nicks and bruises up and down the roster, Collins had a hunch the injury news was about Steven Matz.

title: Nike Tosses Its Golf Clubs. (Shirts to Stay On.)
description: ATLANTA  So, who comes to mind when you think of golf and Nike?

title: Fatal Shooting by Police Shakes Charlottes Self-Image
description: CHARLOTTE  This has always been a place that has prided itself on order, consensus and a can-do corporate mentality that turned a locale with no real geographic reason to exist into one of the hemispheres financial dynamos.

title: Anthony Weiner Faces New Scrutiny After Report About Girl, 15
description: Federal authorities in New York have issued a subpoena for records pertaining to allegations that Anthony D. Weiner exchanged sexually explicit messages with a 15-year-old girl, a person with knowledge of the matter said.

title: Obama Puts Syria at Arms Length as Carnage Drags On
description: WASHINGTON  When Secretary of State John Kerry took the floor at the United Nations on Wednesday to deliver a searing denunciation of the airstrike on an aid convoy headed for the Syrian city of Aleppo President Obama was crosstown, at his Manhattan hotel, preparing for a day of diplomacy that included Africa, Israel and Colombia  but, conspicuously, not Syria.

title: Donald Trumps Crime Policies Might Hit Minorities Harder, Experts Say
description: Branding himself the law-and-order candidate, Donald J. Trump has vowed to carry out a crackdown on crime and terrorism that would benefit white Americans and racial minorities alike.

title: A New York School Where Students Learn to Read by Sculpting Words
description: Cut into syllables, one of Wednesdays vocabulary words was displayed on the board in Rachel Schiffs fourth-grade classroom in Manhattan.

title: Spare Times for Children Listings for Sept. 23-29
description: A select guide to cultural events for children, teenagers and families.

title: Physicist in Albany Corruption Case Was a Geek With Big Goals
description: ALBANY  For eight of the nine defendants charged on Thursday in the wide-ranging bribery and bid-rigging scheme surrounding Gov. Andrew M. Cuomos economic development programs in upstate and Western New York, the motive for the alleged crime seemed to be simple, old-fashioned greed.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: I have not overcome it, not even a little. It is something that haunts me, and you dont survive.

title: Muslim Brotherhoods Political Arm Wins Seats in Jordans Parliament
description: AMMAN, Jordan  Members of the political arm of the opposition Muslim Brotherhood won seats in Jordans Parliament in a symbolic comeback, and women increased their numbers in the legislature, according to results of parliamentary elections released on Thursday.

title: John D. Loudermilk, Who Wrote Tobacco Road and Indian Reservation, Dies at 82
description: John D. Loudermilk, a country singer and prolific songwriter whose dozens of hits in the 1960s and 70s included Tobacco Road by the Nashville Teens, Then You Can Tell Me Goodbye by the Casinos and Indian Reservation by Paul Revere and the Raiders, died on Wednesday at his home in Christiana, Tenn. He was 82.

title: One Making Waves
description: FRIDAY PUZZLE  If youre going to push yourself to do the late-week puzzles, you might want to practice on a puzzle like Andrew Zhous, which allows you to succeed while feeling slightly naughty: You may feel challenged by the more obscure entries and tougher clues, but you can find just enough gettable entries to keep you going. Todays puzzle will require you to tough it out for quite a while, but youre definitely solving with the pros now.

title: Canada and China Will Enter Trade Talks, Justin Trudeau Says
description: OTTAWA  Canada and China will begin talks that may lead to a free-trade agreement, Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said Thursday.

title: Closing Arguments Are Made in Trial Over Potsdam Boys Killing
description: CANTON, N.Y.  After nearly five years of living under suspicion, Oral Nicholas Hillary  accused of murder, and steadfastly proclaiming his innocence  is about to have his fate decided by a single man.

title: Rahm Emanuel Proposes More Police and Mentors to Stop Chicagos Cascading Violence
description: CHICAGO  Faced with intensifying pressure to solve this citys cascading violence, Mayor Rahm Emanuel on Thursday evening laid out what he described as a comprehensive plan for public safety: more police, more mentors, more jobs.

title: New Charges for Long Island Foster Father Accused of Abusing Boys
description: A longtime foster father, already accused of sexually abusing five of his adopted sons and endangering the welfare of two foster children, was charged on Thursday with abusing another boy in his home on Long Island.

title: Indictment of Long Island Foster Father
description: Cesar Gonzales-Mugaburu, a longtime foster father already accused of sexually abusing five of his adopted sons and endangering the welfare of two foster children, was charged on Thursday with abusing another young boy in his home on Long Island.

title: Ike Davis, Back in New York, Leads Israel Past Britain in World Baseball Classic Qualifier
description: Ike Davis spoke Thursday about his affection for New York  the state and the city. He began his professional career with the Brooklyn Cyclones in this Coney Island stadium. Eventually, he would spend minor league seasons in Buffalo and Binghamton, and play in five seasons with the Mets and eight games with the Yankees.

title: Antiques Dealers Charged in Illegal Sale of Ivory Priced at $4.5 Million
description: One chilly day last November, two well-dressed men walked into the Metropolitan Fine Arts and Antiques store on West 57th Street in Manhattan, looking for Chinese figurines carved from ivory.

title: This Weeks Movies: Sept. 23, 2016
description: The New York Times film critics review The Magnificent Seven, Queen of Katwe and The Dressmaker.

title: Jacoby Brissett Proves More Than Capable in Patriots Rout of Texans
description: It did not look much like Tom Bradys version of the New England Patriots, but when Jacoby Brissett rolled over the right tackle on a bootleg and sprinted for the end zone in the first quarter of Thursday nights game against the Houston Texans, he made quite a statement about his readiness for the N.F.L.

title: Asdrubal Cabreras 3-Run Homer Pushes Mets Past Phillies in 11 Innings
description: The baseball season is arduously long and rewards the emotionally even-keeled, so forgive Asdrubal Cabrera if, in one dramatic moment, it all came pouring out. When he made contact, he instantly knew what had happened. Unlike one the night before, this home run ball was not getting robbed at the fence. It was not going to hook foul as one had earlier on Thursday night.

title: Corrections: September 23, 2016
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Gold Medalists May Win a Tax Exemption, Too
description: A bill in Congress would block the I.R.S. from taxing most medals or other prizes awarded to United States Olympians.

Congressman Tells BBC: Charlotte Protesters Hate White People
description: A United States representative from North Carolina said in a television interview on Thursday that protesters in Charlotte hate white people because white people are successful and theyre not, and then hours later recanted and apologized.

title: Whats on TV Friday: The Exorcist Series and Transparent
description: Geena Davis stars in The Exorcist, a scary new series inspired by the 1973 horror classic. MacGyver and Van Helsing are also updated, though perhaps not quite as successfully. And Transparent returns for a third season, with three more Emmy wins to its credit.

description: And so to Friday, the end of the working week for some but not for the nomads of the fashion tribe, who have just reached the halfway point of a frenzied Milan schedule. Heres whats on for today:

title: 9 New Books We Recommend This Week
description: I know, the number of big books out each fall is intimidating  even this month, when publishers put off a lot of big fiction until after the election. This week weve got the best books related to the election itself (there arent many, to be honest). And then weve got some smart and entertaining counterprogramming.

title: Paperback Row
description: Seven new paperbacks to check out this week.

title: The Savory Collection, a Mythical Trove of Jazz Recordings, Will Get a Digital Release
description: A major jazz discovery will finally be commercially accessible to the public, courtesy of the National Jazz Museum in Harlem and Apple Music, which have partnered to release The Savory Collection in digital form. A series of archival recordings from the 1930s and early 40s, from radio broadcasts taped by the pioneering sound engineer Bill Savory, its a revelatory body of music that had been cloaked in myth and obscurity for many years.

title: The Week in Pictures: Sept. 23, 2016
description: Photos from The New York Times and photographers from around the world.

description: Donald J. Trump visited the Detroit Economic Club last month to tell a story about a once-great city destroyed by free trade.

description: Hillary Clinton made a very pertinent comment this week: Why arent I 50 points ahead? you might ask.

title: A Right to a Lawyer to Save Your Home
description: There are few legal fights more lopsided than landlords suing to evict their lower-income tenants.

title: The Lying Game
description: Heres what we can be fairly sure will happen in Mondays presidential debate: Donald Trump will lie repeatedly and grotesquely, on a variety of subjects. Meanwhile, Hillary Clinton might say a couple of untrue things. Or she might not.

title: Will the Left Survive the Millennials?
description: Midway through my opening address for the Brisbane Writers Festival earlier this month, Yassmin Abdel-Magied, a Sudanese-born Australian engineer and 25-year-old memoirist, walked out. Her indignant comments about the event might have sunk into obscurity, along with my speech, had they not been republished by The Guardian. Twenty minutes in, this audience member apparently turned to her mother:  Mama, I cant sit here, I said, the corners of my mouth dragging downwards. I cannot legitimize this.  She continued: The faces around me blurred. As my heels thudded against the grey plastic of the flooring, harmonizing with the beat of the adrenaline pumping through my veins, my mind was blank save for one question. How is this happening?

title: Audiobooks Turn More Readers Into Listeners as E-Books Slip
description: Sales of paperback books are up. Independent bookstores are thriving again. The threat of a digital apocalypse has subsided, as e-book sales have tumbled.

title: Brendan Cox: Carrying On Jos Work Against Hate
description: All our lives, Jo and I had been optimists. Almost by instinct, we both believed that the world was getting better and that it would continue to do so.

description: Whats the story behind this photo?

title: Danish Payments Processor Nets Valued at $4.5 Billion in I.P.O.
description: LONDON  Nets, a Danish payments processor, said on Friday that it was valued at 30 billion Danish kroner, or about $4.5 billion, in its initial public stock offering in Copenhagen.

title: How to Find the Right Cruise for You
description: Whether your idea of a vacation is to sleep until noon and while away afternoons sipping margaritas by a pool or wake up early for a nonstop day of sightseeing, there is a cruise for you  one that fits your budget, too. Cruises today cater to every kind of traveler, said Judy Perl, a cruise specialist and the founder of the New York City travel consultancy Judy Perl Worldwide Travel. Gone are the days, she said, when a cruise vacation was only about midnight buffets and spending a half-day at a port before moving on to the next one. Here, she shares her top tips for finding a trip to suit your travel style.

title: When a Couch Is More Than a Couch
description: Were I healthy enough these days, I would be sipping a glass of free wine and running my hands over an exquisite accent pillow in an impossibly hip showroom called something like Space or Lust, while a sales assistant speaks to me of the virtues of aniline versus semi-aniline leather.

title: Moments of Giants Glory: What Alzheimers Couldnt Steal
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Every now and again, when Im feeling a little down, I go to Baseball-Reference.com and look up the San Francisco Giants box score from July 29, 2012. Its an odd choice for a Giants fan. The Los Angeles Dodgers won, 4-0, completing a weekend sweep in which they outscored the Giants by 19-3 and tied them for the lead in the National League West.

title: Why Bomb Suspects Travels Didnt Set Off More Scrutiny
description: WASHINGTON  To an amateur eye, Ahmad Khan Rahamis travel history might appear to be a red flag: He had traveled to Pakistan, the home of Al Qaeda, four times between 2005 and 2014. The last time he stayed for a year.

description: SYDNEY, Australia  That map of Australia you have? Its wrong. And the whole country is going to officially relocate to correct the error.

description: WASHINGTON  The House speaker, Paul D. Ryan, has expressed no particular opinion on the stop-and-frisk police tactics advocated this week by Donald J. Trump. He does not have any certain thoughts about Mr. Trumps repeated praise of Vladimir V. Putin. He sort of suggested that Mr. Trump should release his tax returns, but what he really meant, it seems, is that candidates in general should do so. Then again, he said that he would defer to Mr. Trump on the decision.

Encourage students to connect this film to the current presidential campaign and to consider what stories the competing candidates are pitching to voters.

title: Buffalo Museum, Ready to Expand, Raises Money at Breakneck Pace
description: Most museums take years to complete multimillion dollar fund-raising campaigns, working laboriously to secure lead gifts and come up with the last dollar.

title: On St. Croix, a Restaurant Twists Caribbean Classics
description: Kallaloo, a mass of greens and okra, pork and crab, slow-simmered into a deep, darkly flavorful stew, is a dish usually best found at grannys house  if youre lucky enough to have a West Indian granny. Or you could head to Balter, in St. Croixs historic Christiansted, where the homespun dish takes on a gloss with foraged leaves of sea purslane and house-pickled peppers adding pops of color and crunch against a luxuriously soft background. The result is the sort of artful twisting of Caribbean comfort food that characterizes this elegant restaurant, which opened in April.

title: How to Plan an Active Vacation
description: Forget the standard hangout by the beach or sightseeing through a city vacation. Hiking, walking and biking are less common ways to explore a destination, according to Susan Sparks, a travel adviser at Points of Interest Travel in Aspen, Colo., who specializes in customized active trips. When you take an active trip, youre out in nature and get a perspective on a place that most travelers dont. Plus, youre moving a lot and burn plenty of calories to balance out all the eating and drinking that are typical on vacations, she said.

title: Morning Agenda: Yahoos Hacking, Princeling Problem, Test for the Justice Dept.
description: Yahoo had no shortage of issues when it was trying to sell itself. But now that it has finally sealed a deal, the theft of data on 500 million users has thrown another wrench in the works.

title: How I Found Ways to Work Out as a New Mom of Twins
description: Up until a week before I gave birth to my twin boys, I swam every day. My belly ballooned between the halves of my sports bikini, and the swimmers in the other lanes must have feared that they were going to witness a water birth. I felt weightless and free. The scent of chlorine was bracing yet purifying, and the air bubbles trailed behind me like comets.

title: Chinese City Urges Comrades to Do Their Part and Reproduce
description: BEIJING  For 36 years the Chinese state nearly turned out the lights on childbearing, ordering most families to have just one child and to focus instead on economic growth. An authoritative public letter to Communist Party members from the central government in September 1980 detailed the one-child policy.

title: 1941: Signs of Vichy Collaboration
description: VICHY  Signs of a renewal of political activity, probably along the lines of Franco-German collaboration, were evident in Vichy today, after the summer lull. Marshal Henri Ptain is back in the provisional capital after a visit to the Alpine province of Savoy, and Jacques Benoist-Mechin, Under Secretary of State, is on his way here from Paris. Benoist-Mechin, one of the most ardent collaborationists, has his office in Paris, where he is in fact, if not titularly, the most important representative of the Ptain government. His return to Vichy follows discussions with Otto Abetz, the German Ambassador at Paris. Informed quarters here say they expect no important developments in Franco-German relations soon, but it is cautiously admitted that Benoist-Mechins visit here signifies a resumption of contacts with the Nazis.  New York Herald Tribune, Sept. 24, 1941

title: The Bangladeshi Traffic Jam That Never Ends
description: Of all the dysfunctions that plague the worlds megacities, none may be more pernicious than bad (really, really bad) traffic. Sitting still in Dhaka, where bad design takes on epic proportions.

title: Forget Trumps Wall: For Mexico, the Election Is About Nafta
description: TOLUCA, Mexico  In this industrial city near the Mexican capital, workers gather outside the gates of a sprawling Chrysler plant for a late shift assembling Dodge Journey S.U.V.s. Its a sought-after job, with autoworkers in Mexico earning an average of about $5 an hour, compared with the nations minimum wage of less than $4 for the whole day. Yet it is a fifth of what autoworkers make in Detroit, and that has helped Mexico become a global powerhouse in car production. The finished products can be seen in the parking lot: thousands of shiny new S.U.V.s, black, white, silver, red, waiting to be shipped around the planet, particularly to the United States, where Americans bought 100,000 Journeys last year.

title: Love in the Afternoon, a Tale of Male Restlessness, Back Onscreen
description: I feel marriage closes me in, cloisters me, and I want to escape, muses Frdric, the protagonist of Eric Rohmers 1972 film Love in the Afternoon, which runs until Thursday, Sept. 29, at the Walter Reade Theater.

title: A Very Moon Juice Cookbook
description: Amanda Chantal Bacon, the founder of the L.A.-based wellness brand Moon Juice, owns countless cookbooks but cant remember ever having followed a recipe, preferring to page through them for inspiration, often in bed. To that end, she sees her own first book, out next month, as more guide than manual, for anyone who wants to rethink their entire food philosophy  though it does contain recipes, 75 of them, for things like green-juice-and-kelp gazpacho, almond milk kefir and chia sesame dough.

title: Frozen Musical Zeros In on Michael Grandage as Director
description: Disney is expected to name Michael Grandage to direct its coming Frozen musical as the company seeks to keep the high-stakes project on track after firing the previous director.

title: Trumps Ghostwriter Explains How to Beat Him in a Debate

title: The Story Behind This Weeks Best Sellers
description: Timber: I speak for the trees, the Lorax proclaimed. But maybe trees can speak for themselves, if wed just shut up and listen. Thats the premise of a book by the German forest ranger Peter Wohlleben, The Hidden Life of Trees, that debuts at No. 5 on the hardcover nonfiction list and explains  in strikingly anthropomorphic terms  how trees protect their young, communicate through underground networks and develop sophisticated social communities, among other things. When trees are really thirsty, they begin to scream, Wohlleben writes. If youre out in the forest, you wont be able to hear them, because this all takes place at ultrasonic levels. Published last year in Germany, the book has already been a big best seller there, prompting a New York Times profile of the author last winter. (My favorite quote came not from Wohlleben  who once clarified to a German newspaper that I dont hug trees and I dont talk to them  but from a German literary critic eager to dismiss the idea that forestry was a particularly German obsession: Yes, theres Hansel and Gretel, and, sure, if your marriage fails, you go for a long hike in the woods. But I dont think Germans love their forest more than Swedes or Norwegians or Finns.) Now that Wohllebens book has been translated into English, by Jane Billinghurst, other media outlets are also taking notice. The thing that surprised me most is how social trees are, Wohlleben told The Guardian recently. I stumbled over an old stump one day and saw that it was still living although it was 400 or 500 years old, without any green leaf. Every living being needs nutrition. The only explanation was that it was supported by the neighbor trees via the roots with a sugar solution. ... Trees are very interested in keeping every member of this community alive.

title: The Truth Is Out There
description: In October of 1995, two Swiss astronomers announced a major discovery: They had detected, about 50 light-years from Earth, a planet orbiting a sun-like star. Scientists had long imagined there were such planets outside our solar system, but never before had one been confirmed. This extrasolar planet, or exoplanet, appeared to be a Jupiter-like ball of gas and liquid with a blistering atmospheric temperature of 1,700 degrees Fahrenheit. In the two decades since, astronomers have detected more than 3,000 exoplanets. No one has yet found a replica of Earth, although Proxima b, an Earth-size planet in a temperate orbit a mere 4.2 light-years away, whose discovery was announced last month, sounds as if it could be a decent place to live.

Gromyko pulled a surprise in his speech today [Sept. 23] to the General Assembly by placing more emphasis on the potential for war in Europe than on the actual conflict in Vietnam. She later produced and starred in the comedic online series Life With Jeannie. On Oct. 2, she will host the Golden Probes, a satirical ceremony that will pay tribute to outstanding achievements in the fields of sexism and anti-abortion extremism. The show will also feature the comedians Sarah Silverman and Abbi Jacobson and Ilana Glazer from the TV series Broad City. Ms. Grae, 39, lives in Bushwick, Brooklyn, with Quelle Chris, a musician and producer. The two recently broke up, and Mr. Chris is looking for a new apartment.
