description: BERKELEY, Calif.  A vain politician runs for the presidency, short on specifics but long on bluster, inveighing against a religious minority and promising to make America prosperous again.

title: Review: Breaking the Waves Lends Musical Heft to a von Trier Tale
description: PHILADELPHIA  If opera is the art of emotional extremity, few subjects are as operatic as Breaking the Waves, the 1996 Lars von Trier film that has been adapted by the composer Missy Mazzoli and the librettist Royce Vavrek. Its doomed protagonist endures trials at least the equal of Toscas or Madama Butterflys.

title: Pronoun Privilege
description: My fall classes started recently, and I had to face the pronoun question. Its simple for me: My appearance matches my preferred pronoun, so I dont worry about anyone misstating it. But some of my students are transgender or gender nonconforming, and they want to announce how others should refer to them. Or do they?

title: Desperate Redskins Take Risks and Beat Giants
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  Odell Beckham Jr.s bushy platinum curls posed a stark contrast to the deep red scratch still glimmering above the corner of his right eye socket Sunday evening, as he stood in the Giants locker room minutes after a hard-fought defeat.

title: Mets Crush the Phillies. Now the Hard Part.
description: The Mets clobbered the also-ran Philadelphia Phillies, 17-0, in their most lopsided shutout victory in franchise history on Sunday. In their final home game of the season, the Mets took advantage of relentless hitting, the stellar pitching of the rookie Robert Gsellman and head-scratching mistakes by the Phillies.

title: Shut Up Already!
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  If you cant afford psychotherapy, I highly recommend giving crossword-puzzle constructing a try. Its fun, its a creative outlet and, best of all, you dont have to worry about whether your therapist is in-network.

description: Les Miles, Louisiana States always eccentric, sometimes frustrating and never boring football coach, was fired four games into his 12th season, the university announced Sunday.

title: Plan to Let Migrant Children Attend School Enrages Many Greeks
description: ORAIOKASTRO, Greece  Mariya bint Loqman Abdlkarim is 9. She arrived in Greece in February after fleeing Syria with her family and crossing from Turkey in a rickety boat. Since then, she has been living in a shabby state-run camp, her future uncertain, her present reduced to the bare necessities.

title: The Great Debate: Style or Substance?

title: Difficult Questions: How Much the Clinton-Trump Debates Matter
description: Forty years later, a moment in the annals of presidential debates remains a classic, worth recalling as Hillary Clinton and Donald J. Trump prepare to go head to head on Monday.

title: Why Obama Is Right on Clean Energy

description: Despite not endorsing Bernie Sanders for president, Mayor Bill de Blasio certainly has many things in common with the senator from Vermont  a kinship that has led to several private meetings between the two, including a dinner in Vermont during a family vacation last month.

description: WASHINGTON  The pitched battle over President Obamas signature climate change policy, which is moving to the courts this week, carries considerable political, economic and historical stakes. Yet its legal fate, widely expected to be ultimately decided by the Supreme Court, could rest on a clerical error in an obscure provision of a 26-year-old law.

description: WASHINGTON  When the Federal Communications Commission announced a plan this year that would free people from having to rent cable set-top boxes, the cable and television industries balked and lobbied hard to forestall the proposal.

description: LONDON  A majority of British chief executives are considering moving their headquarters or some of their operations outside Britain as a result of the countrys decision to leave the European Union, according to a new survey by the accounting firm KPMG.

title: Making Video Ads That Work on Facebooks Silent Screen
description: THE GEICO commercial that made its premiere this summer seemed like a standard 30-second television ad. It features two men building sand castles on a pristine beach with their children. Guess what I just did? one of the men asks. Built a sand castle? the other responds. Ha  no. I switched to Geico and got more, the first man says.

title: For New Yorks New Police Commissioner, Less Crime Is Just a Start
description: Last Monday, James P. ONeill stood in a crowded auditorium to be publicly sworn in by Mayor Bill de Blasio as the commissioner of the New York Police Department. By that point, though, he had already been tested.

title: Russia, Jailer of Local Separatists, Welcomes Foreign Secessionists
description: MOSCOW  Russia may jail its own separatists, but that did not hinder a nominally independent Russian organization from laying out the welcome mat on Sunday for an oddball, global troupe of liberation movements, including, improbably, four from the United States.

title: Court Leader or Leading Dissenter? Chief Justices Fate Tied to Election

Roberts Jr.s 11 years on the Supreme Court, his unfolding legacy has been marked by a debate over whether his very occasional liberal votes in major cases were the acts of a statesman devoted to his institution, a traitor to his principles or the legal umpire he said he aspired to be at his confirmation hearings.

title: Sharing a Breeze With a Baby
description: The air conditioning on the arriving downtown No. 6 train was working just enough that a smattering of straphangers was visible through the window. Stepping in after ten minutes waiting on the steamy Astor Place platform, and with my 3-month-old strapped to my chest, I didnt dare make a dash for the next car. Instead, we grudgingly eased ourselves into a seat by the door.

title: Denver Broncos Trevor Siemian Handles Cincinnati Bengals Pressure
description: At the start of the fourth quarter of his N.F.L. Week 3 matchup with the Cincinnati Bengals, Trevor Siemian, the young quarterback of the Denver Broncos, found himself facing something resembling adversity. His team was down, 17-16, on the road, and his perfect 2-0 record as a starter was in jeopardy.

title: Aviations Paris Moment as Nations Near Emissions Deal
description: Looking to build on momentum from the Paris climate agreements milestone last week, government officials will gather in Montreal beginning Tuesday for final negotiations on a deal to cap greenhouse gas emissions from international jet flights.

title: Mike Davis, Worlds Grumpiest Boss, Dies at 85
description: There will be no more birthday celebrations, birthday cakes, levity or celebrations of any kind within the office, the boss wrote on Feb. 8, 1978. This is a business office. If you have to celebrate, do it after office hours on your own time.

title: From the Memos of the Worlds Grumpiest Boss
description: Here are excerpts from Edward Mike Daviss memos:

title: Richard P. Cooley, Former Wells Fargo C.E.O., Dies at 92
description: Richard P. Cooley, a former chief executive of Wells Fargo and a ubiquitous name in banking for decades in the Pacific Northwest, died on Wednesday at his home in Seattle. He was 92.

title: Grit vs. Goliath: A Reporters Dogged Pursuit of Roger Ailes
description: Anyone visiting the Rockefeller Center studios of MSNBC on Sept. 2 would have witnessed a peculiar spectacle: the reporter Gabriel Sherman arriving for an on-air interview accompanied by a bodyguard.

description: SANTIAGO DE COMPOSTELA, Spain  Spains main opposition Socialist Party suffered significant defeats in two regional elections on Sunday, increasing pressure on the party leader, Pedro Snchez, to negotiate an end to the nine-month deadlock in Spains national politics.

description: Rolling Stone, a magazine that for decades helped shaped music and popular culture but now finds itself facing significant legal and economic challenges, has brought in an outside investor for the first time in its nearly 50-year history.

description: Not that long ago, Alex Caicedo was stuck working a series of odd jobs and watching his 1984 Chevy Nova cough its last breaths. He could make $21 an hour at the Johnny Rockets food stand at FedEx Field when the Washington Redskins were playing, but the work was spotty.

title: What We Know About the Details of the Police Shooting in Charlotte
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  The fatal police shooting of Keith Lamont Scott here on Tuesday afternoon has sparked outrage and concern, and set off, once again, a national conversation about the treatment of minorities by the police. The details of the case have also been a source of intense debate. Here are some questions that readers have asked reporters at The New York Times since Mr. Scotts death.

title: For Cuomo and Christie, Parallel Paths to the Top, and Trouble When They Got There
description: It might be hard to remember now, with one governor embroiled in a corruption scandal for the last three years and his counterpart across the Hudson River plunging headlong into another, but Chris Christie of New Jersey and Andrew M. Cuomo of New York were once lionized for relentlessly prosecuting bad behavior in government.

description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  Cherrell Brown turned to Facebook in the hours after the fatal police shooting of Keith Lamont Scott, a black resident here, hoping to reach a network of activists with which she has connected.

description: ATLANTA  The first time Rory McIlroy went to the 16th hole on Sunday, he holed out from the fairway and danced with glee. The second time he went to the 16th  a little less than two hours later  McIlroy picked up about $11.5 million.

description: He was the charismatic face of professional golf and one of its dominant players.

description: Arnold Palmer, the champion golfer whose full-bore style of play, thrilling tournament victories and magnetic personality inspired an American golf boom, attracted a following known as Arnies Army and made him one of the most popular athletes in the world, died on Sunday evening in Pittsburgh. description: MEXICO CITY  Firefighting crews extinguished a fire aboard a fuel tanker belonging to the Mexican state oil company, Pemex, late Sunday afternoon, about 30 hours after an explosion sent flames billowing into the air off the Gulf Coast port of Veracruz.

title: First Clinton-Trump Debate Is Framed by Rifts Over Race and Gender

title: Did You Watch the Power Season 3 Finale? Lets Talk About It
description: The Starz show Power ended its third season Sunday night not far from where it began. The question that looms over the series  can James St. Patrick, known as Ghost, (Omari Hardwick) ever move on from his drug past  is one that increasingly seems like it may never be answered. It seems that every move he makes toward freedom is met with a devastating blow, often from places he least expects. Lets take a quick look at the finale and what it might mean for Season 4.

title: Can You Tell What Questions Trump and Clinton Were Answering?
description: See if you can decode these answers from Donald J. Trump and Hillary Clinton.

description: A sequence of events in the fatal shooting in Charlotte, N.C., based on what can be seen in four videos.

description: The 37-year-old woman began to weep as she told her story to Dr. Michael L. Parks. Her job required her to be on her feet all day, Dr. Parks recalled, and she was in constant pain from knee arthritis. She had seen an orthopedic surgeon, hoping to discuss knee replacement, but he dismissed her complaints, telling her she was too fat and should just go on a diet.

Then, if and when a candidate actually does propose innovative policies, the news media pays little attention, chasing scandals or, all too often, fake scandals instead. Remember the extensive coverage last month, when Hillary Clinton laid out an ambitious mental health agenda? Neither do I.

title: The Falsity of False Equivalence

I know some (many) journalists are busy denying responsibility, but this is absurd, and I think they know it. As Nick Kristof says, polls showing that the public considers Hillary Clinton, a minor fibber at most, less trustworthy than a pathological liar is prima facie evidence of massive media failure.

title: Stories From the Black Panthers Unfinished Revolution
description: In The Black Panthers: Portraits From an Unfinished Revolution, the photographer Bryan Shih and the historian Yohuru R. Williams tell the rarely heard stories of the rank-and-file members of the organization through portraits, interviews and scholarly essays. Fifty years after the Black Panthers founding, in October 1966, the volume, published by Nation Books, goes beyond charismatic leaders like Huey P. Newton, Bobby Seale and Eldridge Cleaver and allows the groups members to reflect on their personal experiences. Below are portraits by Mr. Shih, along with short biographies as they appear in the book and audio excerpts of the testimonies.

She spoke very quietly. I thought I heard the phrases anonymity without being hidden and productive unproductivity.

title: To Save Mosul, Arm the Sunnis

As of this month, Mr. Abadi, a Shiite, has had two years to rebuild the Iraqi Army with the support of an international coalition. Unfortunately, the institution remains incapable of liberating Mosul on its own, forcing Mr. Abadi to rely on Shiite militias  many of which serve as Irans proxies in Iraq  to conduct the war.

title: 1941: Poles Ready to Fight Nazis
description: LONDON  Three Polish divisions, comprising about 45,000 men, are ready to go into battle against Germany on the Russian front within a fortnight after supplies of arms and equipment for them now en route to Great Britain and America arrive in Russia, it was said today [Sept. 26]. About 80 percent of the men have had army training and 50 percent have seen combat service, according to Josef H. Retinger, Polish Charge dAffaires at Moscow, who has just reached London.  New York Herald Tribune, Sept. 27, 1941

title: 1966: Humphrey Doubts Kennedy
description: LOS ANGELES  Vice-President Hubert H. Humphrey twisted a raw nerve within the Democratic hierarchy today [Sept. 26] asserting that Sen. Robert F. Kennedy displays less political maturity than President Johnson. I dont think Sen. Kennedy is out to get President Johnson  as such, Mr. Humphrey said. Then he added: I think he has a different point of view on some matters. I think President Johnsons point of view is a little more mature, a little more responsible and a little bit more in the public interest. Before arriving to speak on behalf of Democratic candidates in the November election, Mr. Humphrey always had attempted to submerge any friction with the Kennedy camp.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Sept. 27, 1966

title: An Artists New Look  at the Hairdresser, and on Show
description: Coming here reminds me of home, says the Venezuelan artist Sol Calero as she relaxes into her chair. Its days before the opening of her sophomore show at Laura Bartlett Gallery in London, and Calero is at Glorias Unisex Salon, a locals haunt thats situated under the railway arches in Elephant and Castle. I realized I needed a change, she says, showing off her Rapunzel length jet-black hair. It has got so long that cycling around Berlin, where I live, has become kind of dangerous. Its not the first time the artist has visited Gloria Dominguezs salon. After spotting an advertisement for the hairdresser in a copy of the local Latin News (Dominguez hails from Ecuador), Calero enlisted her help for her debut display at Laura Bartlett  a reconstructed Latin beauty salon, where visitors could get their hair and nails done.

title: Brand to Know: A Line of Deconstructed Unisex Pieces, Inspired by Fantasy

He liked science best at school  and though he would play after class in his mothers clothing factory, where she manufactured mass-market apparel, he read Japanese manga, never fashion magazines. The feminine figures he sketched resembled Hayao Miyazakis Princess Nausica, heroine of the post-apocalyptic tale Nausica of the Valley of the Wind  not the typical elongated croquis of fashion illustrations.
