The dream was spoiled, though, when I looked down at my jersey and saw Cubs printed in bright red letters.

title: Obama and Bill Clinton to Travel to Israel to Honor Shimon Peres
description: JERUSALEM  World leaders made plans to converge on Israel to pay tribute to Shimon Peres, the Nobel Prize-winning former prime minister who died on Wednesday, focusing renewed attention on his quest for peace in a fractured land that fell well short of his dreams.

title: A Dream Come True: Metro Editor Meets Lifelong Hero, Elvis Costello
description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how news, features and opinion come together at The New York Times. In this piece, Wendell Jamieson, the editor of the Metro section, shares his experience at the Algonquin Hotel with his idol, the musician Elvis Costello.

title: More Wealth, More Jobs, but Not for Everyone: What Fuels the Backlash on Trade
description: ROTTERDAM, the Netherlands  For as long as ships have ventured across water, laborers like Patrick Duijzers have tied their fortunes to trade.

title: The Best Fall Cookbooks
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Donald Trump Keeps Insulting Rosie ODonnell. Heres How Their Feud Started.
description: Hillary Clintons accusation during Monday nights debate that Donald J. Trump had once mocked a teenage Latina beauty queen as Miss Piggy and Miss Housekeeping unexpectedly led to familiar territory: He rehashed his decade-old feud with the comedian Rosie ODonnell.

title: Lanvin, Spring 2017
description: Looks from Lanvins spring 2017 collection show.

title: Maison Margiela, Spring 2017
description: Looks from the Maison Margiela spring 2017 collection show.

title: At Lanvin, Bouchra Jarrar is Playing Many Womens Tune
description: PARIS  And so to the second major debut of the season: Bouchra Jarrar at Lanvin.

title: American Honey: Open Highways, Free Spirits
description: Several years ago, on one of the many road trips around the United States that served as research for her new film, American Honey, the English director Andrea Arnold was driving through the South learning how to dance. She ended up inadvertently following a tornado.

title: Iranian Womens Rights Activist Is Given 16-Year Sentence
description: TEHRAN  An Iranian appeals court has confirmed a 16-year sentence for one of Irans most prominent womens rights activists, her lawyer said Wednesday.

title: More Fun on Your Wrist With New Apps for the Apple Watch
description: APPLE this month released a faster, smarter Apple Watch and also sped up its first-generation smartwatch with a faster chip. The speed increase will help watch apps run more smoothly, and plenty of great software is available to take the improved watches for a test drive.

title: A High-Stakes Bet: Turning Google Assistant Into a Star Trek Computer
description: Google is one of the most valuable companies in the world, but its future, like that of all tech giants, is clouded by a looming threat. The search company makes virtually all of its money from ads placed on the World Wide Web. But what happens to the cash machine if web search eventually becomes outmoded?

title: Regulators to Review London Stock Exchange-Deutsche Brse Merger
description: LONDON  European regulators said on Wednesday that they had opened an in-depth investigation into the planned merger of the London Stock Exchange Group and Deutsche Brse over its potential impact on competition in financial markets.

title: The Jacquemus Girl; Courrges, Slim and Short
description: PARIS  Its a French one, eh? said Simon Porte Jacquemus, accepting French cheek kisses and French congratulations backstage after his Jacquemus show. The tent had been pitched in the heart of the Tuileries garden, but the scene was set in the south of France, his home turf. His models wore giant straw hats and, leg-of-mutton sleeves, and came down the runway to the schmaltzy orchestral theme from Jean de Florette, the Grard Depardieu period piece from the 1980s  French cheese at its ripest.

title: The Plot to Put Conceptual Art on Melrose Place. Yes, Really.
description: Twenty years ago, the conceptual artist Mel Chin cold-called the offices of Melrose Place, Aaron Spellings wildly popular prime-time soap opera, with a proposition. What if a task force of artists supplied free artworks and props for the shows apartment-complex set, with coded cultural messages on pressing topics like reproductive rights, American foreign policy, alcoholism and sexual politics?

title: Flying While Muslim: A Civil Rights Advocate on Travel Right Now
description: Roula Allouch, 36, is a Cincinnati lawyer and the chairwoman of the national board of directors of the Council on American-Islamic Relations, one of the nations largest civil rights and advocacy groups for the American Muslim community. Raised in Kentucky, she is a member of the American Bar Associations Rule of Law Initiative for the Middle East and North Africa. Ms. Allouchs parents emigrated to the United States from Syria in the 1970s. Following are edited excerpts from a conversation with Ms. Allouch.

title: In Laos, a Haven for Tubing Offers More Peace, Less Partying
description: I never imagined Id experience the sensation of floating in the sky while on a river, but in Vang Vieng in central Laos, I did. Arching my back on an inner tube while lifting my feet out of the silky Nam Song, the air still and the day quiet, I looked up into a cloudless sky and felt as if I were hovering in midair, completely weightless.

title: Fashion Week Photo Diary: Jacquemus, Saint Laurent and Koch
description: Scenes from the spring/summer 2017 collections that were presented in Paris on Tuesday.

title: Virtual Realitys Possibilities Lure Video Game Developers
description: Phil Fish, an independent video game developer who made the hit game Fez, quit the business in 2014 after burning out and becoming fed up with the gaming industrys sometimes corrosive culture.

title: Syria Talks Will End if Aleppo Bombing Continues, U.S. Tells Russia
description: WASHINGTON  The United States threatened on Wednesday to halt talks with Russia on the war in Syria and scrap plans for joint military targeting of jihadists unless the Russian and Syrian militaries stopped bombing Aleppo.

title: Reaction to El Cajon Police Shooting
description: A black man was killed by the police in El Cajon, Calif., on Tuesday. The city's police chief said the man pulled an object from his pocket and took what appeared to be a shooting stance.

title: Their Time, Their Place
description: Mark Seliger photographed members of the transgender community on Manhattans Christopher Street.

title: A Trans Life, Captured by Mark Seliger
description: Tony Zosherafatain shows off his hairy chest and armpits, naked in a New York apartment except for a pair of tighty whities. Jamilla Braxton stands on a street corner wearing a ribbed tank top and flashing her long nails painted white.

title: President and Michelle Obama Lash Out at Donald Trump
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama and the first lady, Michelle Obama, issued scathing denunciations of Donald J. Trump on Wednesday, conveying the same message that a vote for a third-party candidate rather than Hillary Clinton would help elect a president who is unfit for office.

title: Congress Votes to Override Obama Veto on 9/11 Victims Bill
description: WASHINGTON  Congress on Wednesday voted overwhelmingly to override a veto by President Obama for the first time, passing into law a bill that would allow the families of those killed in the Sept. 11, 2001, terrorist attacks to sue Saudi Arabia for any role in the plot.

title: The Anatomy of an Airstrike
description: An airstrike in east Aleppo, Syria, destroyed a building where four families lived. Heres how rescuers responded minute by minute in an area where basic services have been devastated by years of war.

title: James Blake and Majid Jordan: Soul Through a Digital Lens
description: Theres real breathing room in the music of James Blake and Majid Jordan, two acts that refract soul music through a digital lens, approaching their songs with reserve and crispness and using moist emotion as a point of contrast. Majid Jordan, a Toronto duo signed to Drakes OVO Sound label, builds a thick sheen atop disco and funk skeletons on its self-titled debut album. And Mr. Blakes latest, The Colour in Anything (Republic), is familiarly meditative and aching; hes an austere singer who finds swing in minimal electronic compositions.

title: Dries Van Noten: Spring 2017
description: Spring 2017 looks from the Belgian designer.

title: A Venezuelan Orchestra of Fortitude Opens Carnegie Hall Season
description: Venezuela is a country in crisis, with drastic food shortages, public protests and government crackdowns. Given this backdrop, that the Simn Bolvar Symphony Orchestra of Venezuela is making it to New York to open the Carnegie Hall season shows fortitude.

title: A Shen Wei Premiere at the Brooklyn Academy of Music
description: Watching the work of the choreographer and visual artist Shen Wei is like peeking into an ant farm, in which dancers elegantly and efficiently construct a private world, seemingly unaware of being observed. These worlds are always distinctive, defined by Mr. Shens signature swooshing style of movement, best explained as physical calligraphy.

title: O Death: Posthumous Portraits at the Folk Art Museum
description: It seemed like a resurrection, said Sidney George Fisher, a well-to-do Philadelphian in 1858, upon seeing a miniature portrait of his recently deceased sister-in-law painted from a daguerreotype, a posthumous icon made as such imagery began to flourish in a society preoccupied with mourning.

title: At 77, He Gets to Woo Mary-Louise Parker
description: On a recent late-summer morning, the actor Denis Arndt sat down to a pint of Guinness and a plate of bivalves in the oyster bar at Grand Central Terminal. The beer was cool, the oysters plump, and Mr. Arndt had even put on a tie, a swirling print designed by Jerry Garcia. Normally he dresses up only for openings and bat mitzvahs, he said. But he was determined to make an occasion of this snack. And why not?

title: Holiday Inn Arrives, and so Does an Early White Christmas
description: The Roundabout Theater Company enters the seasonal-treats sweepstakes with Holiday Inn, a stage adaptation of the 1942 movie starring Bing Crosby as an entertainer who decides to call it quits, buy a farm and turn the place into a novelty act: a venue open only on holidays.

title: Heavens Gate Comes to BAMcinmatek
description: Michael Ciminos costly, 216-minute western Heavens Gate (1980)  coming to BAMcinmatek on Sunday, Oct. 2, as part of Desperate Hours: The Films of Michael Cimino  helped sink United Artists, the studio behind it. But Mr. Cimino (who died in July) had made his masterpiece, with granular attention to period detail that at times evokes the Italian director Luchino Visconti at his most lavish. The brilliant cinematographer Vilmos Zsigmond is at his atmospheric apex, with a cast including Isabelle Huppert, Christopher Walken (from Mr. Ciminos The Deer Hunter), Jeff Bridges (from his Thunderbolt and Lightfoot) and Kris Kristofferson as the archetypal taciturn lawman.

title: The Siege of Jadotville on Netflix Rediscovers a Faded Footnote
description: The Congo crisis, as it was generally known, is a historical footnote to many people now, but The Siege of Jadotville, a Netflix film that becomes available Friday, Oct. 7, makes a gripping drama out of one particular moment in the yearslong struggle for control in Central Africa. Jamie Dornan (Fifty Shades of Grey) plays the commandant leading a small Irish force of United Nations peacekeepers that was besieged in 1961 in the Democratic Republic of Congo by several thousand local troops from Katanga Province, which was seeking to secede. By the fourth day, the Irish were down to their last biscuit, The New York Times reported at the time. They had gone for four days without sleep and two days without water. Early in the film, before the Irish force deploys, someone asks the commandant if he thinks his men will see any action. Who knows? he responds. I dont think anyones clear whats going on out there. Those words prove to be quite accurate.

title: Wells Fargo C.E.O.s Prepared House Testimony
description: John Stumpf is scheduled to testify on September 29 to a House panel on the scandal over the bank illegally creating sham accounts.

title: Maines Clean Medical Marijuana: Organic in Disguise
description: FARMINGTON, Me.  In a suite one flight above the bustling main street of Farmington, a university town in the foothills of western Maine, LoveGrown Caregiver Services is a marijuana lovers delight.

title: The Best Sellers: Filed Under Sports
description: The best-selling sports books in August 2016, according to the New York Times best-seller list.

title: I Wont Be Silent: Serena Williams on the Fear of Driving While Black
description: It may seem mundane: having a relative drive you around to do errands.

title: How to Get Dries Van Notens Shadowed Eye Look
description: At Dries Van Notens spring/summer 2017 show, several models wore veils. The shadows they created over the models faces, specifically across the eyes and the bridge of the nose, became an inspirational reference point for an entire uniform makeup look. Its got a little bit of a Blade Runner effect, but its an actual shadow, explained the makeup artist Peter Philips.

title: Daily Report: Latest Hack Shows Yahoos Weak Security History
description: For Yahoo, loving customers used to be so much easier.

title: How Those Wireless Emergency Alerts Find You
description: Q. When I get an emergency alert on my phone for a certain area, how does the system know Im in that location? Do these messages count against my monthly limit?

title: Bulgarian Shakes Up Race for U.N. Leader
description: UNITED NATIONS  The contest to be the next leader of the United Nations turned more complicated on Wednesday when a Bulgarian diplomat long rumored to aspire to the position formally entered the race.

title: Keep Tradition in Olde England
description: To the Editor:

title: Loma Fire Spreads in California
description: The blaze has spread to more than 2,000 acres, threatening hundreds of homes and forcing residents to evacuate. Officials are investigating the cause.

title: Chinese vs. Western Medicine
description: To the Editor:

title: Och-Ziff African Unit Expected to Plead Guilty to Bribery
description: OZ Africa Management, a unit of the hedge fund giant Och-Ziff Capital Management, is expected to enter a guilty plea to bribery charges on Thursday, according to two people briefed on the matter.

title: Tim Tebow Homers in First At-Bat (and Finishes 1 for 6)
description: Tim Tebow stepped to the plate Wednesday for his first at-bat as a professional baseball player and took a swing at the first pitch he saw. Naturally, he hit a home run.

title: Elizabeth LeCompte of the Wooster Group Wins the Gish Prize
description: Elizabeth LeCompte, the director of the experimental theater company the Wooster Group, has been awarded the Dorothy and Lillian Gish Prize, which is given annually to an artist who pushes the boundaries of an art form and contributes to social change.

title: Azuma Makotos Iced Flowers at Dries Van Noten
description: The Japanese artist brought his sculptures to Paris Fashion Week.

title: The Story Behind the Magical, Ice-Encased Flowers at Dries Van Noten
description: The backdrops for Dries Van Notens womens wear shows are, oftentimes, art unto themselves; for example, his models for spring/summer 2015 swanned atop a custom-made, patchy green carpet by the Argentine talent Alexandra Kehayoglou. To present his latest collection today in Paris, the designer partnered with the Japanese flower artist Azuma Makoto, sending a series of floral-print garments down a runway flanked by Azumas sculptures.

title: Rochas: Spring 2017
description: The labels spring 2017 collection.

title: A Dozen Looks That Make Us Want to Wear More Color
description: A city known for dressing in black has really brightened up.

title: Text to Text | The Glass Castle and Life on the Streets
description: Browse all our Text to Text lesson plans.

title: In Caesars Bankruptcy Fight, Private Equity Owners Fold
description: Caesars may be defeated, but borrowers reign supreme.

title: Is a Third-Party Vote a Wasted Vote?
description: To the Editor:

title: Peres: 93 Years Young
description: When I heard the news that Shimon Peres, the last of Israels greatest generation of founding leaders, had died I found myself ruminating about what was so special about this man whom I had had the pleasure of knowing for almost 35 years. It took me a second to articulate it. Peres was almost unique among the Arab and Israeli leaders Ive covered as a reporter in the Middle East in two crucial respects: He could stand in the other guys shoes, and he was determined to let the future bury the past and not let the past bury the future.

title: The Proposal Was Awkward (but the Answer Was Yes)
description: Andrew Fox of New Castle, Pa., had it all planned. He would propose to his girlfriend, Heather Terwilliger of Fredonia, N.Y., Tuesday night during their first visit to Yankee Stadium as the Yankees played the Boston Red Sox.

title: In Decades-Old Slides, Drops of Blood and Hints of Malarias Path
description: In 1925, the Spanish government hired a doctor named Ildefonso Canicio to head up a malaria research center in the Ebro Delta, where the disease was endemic. Dr. Canicio worked with patients from the surrounding rice fields for several decades, until he contracted malaria himself. He died of unrelated causes in 1961, the year malaria was eradicated from Spain.

title: Donald Verrilli, Former Solicitor General, to Join Law Firm
description: Former Solicitor General Donald B. Verrilli Jr., who defended the Obama administrations positions in major legal issues including the Affordable Care Act and marriage equality before the Supreme Court, is joining the law firm Munger, Tolles & Olson. He will open a Washington office for the firm, which is based in Los Angeles.

title: Whats in Your Herbal Pills? Firm Promises DNA Testing for Proof
description: NBTY, one of the nations largest makers of popular supplements like ginkgo biloba and ginseng, has agreed to conduct advanced genetic testing to help ensure that its herbal products actually contain the ingredients promised on the label.

title: What Do Anna Wintour and Bob Dylan Have in Common? This Secret Garden
description: In 2008, the photographer and film director Francesco Carrozzini bought a townhouse in Greenwich Village for $6.8 million. Ostensibly, he got a four-story brick home built in 1844 with low ceilings and small, dark rooms. But luxury real estate is never about the basics.

title: 2 Men Who Found Unexploded Bomb in Chelsea Are Identified
description: Investigators have identified the two men who found a travel bag containing an unexploded bomb on a Manhattan street this month, a few blocks from where a bomb exploded, two law enforcement officials said.

title: A Set Designer Captures His Journey Around the World
description: Over more than two decades, Happy Massee traveled to many cities for his work  and documented his adventures in Polaroids.

title: Twenty-Five Years as a Set Designer, Captured in Polaroids
description: I was just very lucky I snuck in there, says Happy Massee of the Polaroid on the cover of his new book, Diary of a Set Designer. The image features Madonna sitting in a cloak of light  a stroke of magic for the infamously finicky film  wearing a satiny bra, her legs wrapped in a black skirt and tights. Its from the set of her 1994 music video Take a Bow, on which Massee worked. (The video is now in the Museum of Modern Arts permanent video collection.)

title: California Suspends Ties With Wells Fargo
description: Citing Wells Fargos venal abuse of its customers, the California treasurer took the unusual step on Wednesday of suspending many of its ties with the San Francisco bank as it continues to reel from the scandal over the creation of as many as two million unauthorized bank and credit card accounts.

title: Carolina Boy, 14, Held After Father Is Killed and 3 Are Shot at School
description: Update: Jesse Dewitt Osborne was sentenced on Nov. 14, 2019, to life without parole.

title: Soho Rep Abruptly Closes Its Theater, Seeking New Space
description: Soho Rep, a small Off Broadway theater that has nurtured plays with impact well beyond its size, is closing the TriBeCa space in which it has been performing for 25 years.

title: U.S. to Send 600 More Troops to Iraq to Help Retake Mosul From ISIS
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama has authorized sending an additional 600 American troops to Iraq to assist Iraqi forces in the looming battle to take back the city of Mosul from the Islamic State, United States officials said on Wednesday.

title: A Look at Alessandro Micheles Sets for Gucci
description: Since becoming creative director of the iconic house, he has crafted a careful world within the show environment each season.

title: Inside the Elaborate World of Guccis Shows
description: I have the soul of a director, says the designer Alessandro Michele, a couple of days after his spring/summer 2017 Gucci show. Hes speaking over the phone from Rome, which is fitting, given that Rome is the home of la Cinecitt, the hub of Italian cinema. Michele isnt hankering after a feature film production like his predecessor Tom Ford. (The former Gucci creative directors second movie, Nocturnal Animals, is out this November.) Rather, hes talking about the scenography of his tenure at Gucci, which has scrolled through multiple iterations over the past 18 months, like sequels in an ever-unfolding cinematic franchise.

title: Donald Trump, Sean Hannity and a Still-Elusive Tape
description: Near the end of Mondays presidential debate between Donald Trump and Hillary Clinton, Trump stood by his oft-contested claim that he opposed invading Iraq in 2003, despite a tape-recorded interview with Howard Stern in 2002 to the contrary. This time, however, he suggested a new source to back up his assertion. I had numerous conversations with Sean Hannity at Fox, he told the audience. He and I used to have arguments about the war. I said its a terrible, stupid thing; its going to destabilize the Middle East. And thats exactly what its done. He added: Nobody wants to call him. Nobody calls Sean Hannity.

title: Tennessee Williams and Eugene ONeill Side by Side, Under the Sun
description: PROVINCETOWN, Mass.  Loneliness, the condition into which we are born, and from which we spend much of our lives trying to escape  whether through love and sex, or alcohol or drugs or even, yes, art  is a theme that resounds throughout the works of Eugene ONeill and Tennessee Williams, two of Americas greatest playwrights, if not the two greatest.

title: 4.1 Miles
description: A coast guard captain on a small Greek island is suddenly charged with saving thousands of refugees from drowning at sea.

title: 4.1 Miles
description: Note: This documentary short film won a 2016 Peabody Award and was nominated for a 2017 Academy Award.

title: Vineyard Vines, Now at Grand Central. Consider a Pit Stop.
description: Make your Metro-North commute more enjoyable with a pit stop on Thursday, from 5 to 7 p.m., at the recently opened Vineyard Vines store. Youll find drinks and custom Grand Central coozies, and the founders, Shep and Ian Murray, will be signing the labels signature whimsical whale-print bow ties ($55 to $65). At Grand Central Terminal, 89 East 42nd Street.

title: Yankees Praise Their Hitting Coach, but Not Their Hitting
description: When Mark Teixeira paused to admire his ninth-inning, game-tying home run Monday night, which he then punctuated with an ostentatious flip of the bat, it was a cause for celebration of an infrequent type  for him and the Yankees  when leaving the batters box this season.

title: After the Clinton-Trump Debate: Other Voices
description: To the Editor:

title: What Stumpf Is Telling Congress About the Wells Fargo Scandal
description: The responses that John G. Stumpf, Wells Fargos chief executive, gave last week before a Senate committee notably veered off script from his prepared remarks. See how.

title: In Battle for Soul of Britains Labour Party, a Leftist Group Is Winning
description: LIVERPOOL, England  Jackie Walker, a prominent left-wing activist, was in full flow. Were part of the biggest political moment in the last 50 years! she cried. The seeds we are sowing, who knows what fruit they will bring?

title: 7 Party Hot Spots Opening in New York This Fall
description: Leaf through vintage records from Sly and the Family Stone while sipping coffee. Pair duck confit with a mezcal cocktail. Sprawl on a kidney-shaped banquette with a personal mixologist. Maybe catch a rugby match.

title: CBS and Viacom, Long Split, Will Be Told to Consider Reuniting
description: A month after a bitter fight over Viacoms leadership was settled, the company may find itself pressed to reunite with its corporate sibling, CBS.

title: In Martino, Atlanta United Hires a Pedigree With an Eye on the Future
description: ATLANTA  Gerardo Martino looked relaxed Wednesday morning, an hour before his unveiling as the first coach of Atlanta United, the Major League Soccer expansion team scheduled to begin play in March. Dressed in a tailored black suit, a European collar on his white shirt, he smiled readily as he discussed tactics, players and plans. The only sign that he was about to stand in front of a room of reporters was a cheat sheet on a table nearby bearing a few words of greeting in English  a language that Martino, an Argentine, has yet to learn.

title: Russias Brutal Bombing of Aleppo May Be Calculated, and It May Be Working
description: The effects of Russias bombing campaign in the Syrian city of Aleppo  destroying hospitals and schools, choking off basic supplies, and killing aid workers and hundreds of civilians over just days  raise a question: What could possibly motivate such brutality?

title: The Modern Love Podcast: Kathryn Hahn Reads The Wedding Toast Ill Never Give
description: In this episode of Modern Love: The Podcast, the actress Kathryn Hahn (Bad Moms, Transparent) reads the essay The Wedding Toast Ill Never Give, about lessons learned  but seldom shared  from 11 years of marriage.

title: Review: NY Quadrille Opens With a Barefoot Delight
description: For the two weeks of NY Quadrille, the Joyce Theater has been reconfigured. The stage is a raised rectangle (almost a square) in the center of the space. Half the audience is on the far side. Dancers are seen to wait and even dance in the wide margins of space on either side of the stage.

title: Review: A Singers Strong Return in a Drab Don Giovanni
description: First the good news. The acclaimed English baritone Simon Keenlyside made a much-anticipated return to the Metropolitan Opera on Tuesday evening, after health-related cancellations in recent years.

title: Income, Not Driving Record, May Determine Auto Insurance Cost
description: Some motorists with high incomes but bad driving records may pay less for car insurance than lower-income consumers with pristine records, a new analysis has found.

title: Why Do We Lock Up Survivors of Sex Trafficking?
description: Eighteen-year-old Macy[1] has an infectious smile despite everything. Like many of her college freshman classmates, she works part-time and has several roommates. Unlike those classmates, the shared house she lives in is a safe home for survivors of human trafficking.

title: Hillary Clinton Struggles to Win Back Young Voters From Third Parties
description: With just six weeks to go until Election Day, younger voters are shunning the two major political parties on a scale not seen since Ross Perots third-party bid for the presidency in 1992, a striking swing in public opinion that is slicing into Hillary Clintons thin margin for error.

title: Protecting Humans and Jobs From Robots Is 5 Tech Giants Goal
description: Five major technology companies said Wednesday that they had created an organization to set the ground rules for protecting humans  and their jobs  in the face of rapid advances in artificial intelligence.

title: Review: Laura Benanti Shows Range With Songs and Stories
description: Supreme command, a thrilling voice and a wild sense of humor combined to make Laura Benantis opening-night show, Tales From Soprano Isle at Caf Carlyle, on Tuesday evening a sensation. If some of the stories she told of her adventures in show business described disabling stage fright and technical mishaps during performances, Ms. Benanti exhibited a fearless self-assurance as she blithely sailed through a program that ran from Rodgers and Hammerstein to Tori Amos. On top of that, Ms. Benanti is pregnant with her first child, a girl, by Patrick Brown, whom she married last November.

title: Court Overturns New Hampshire Ban on Selfies (and Snapchat) in Voting Booths
description: New Hampshire voters seeking to express themselves in the voting booth with a so-called ballot selfie will be able to snap freely after a federal appeals court ruled that a ban against the practice infringed on free speech.

title: For Some Newspapers, Endorsing Clinton Means Losing Subscribers
description: The subscription cancellations were coming every 10 minutes. Angry readers have been calling in droves. One caller issued a death threat.

title: Review: With 22, a Million, Bon Iver Beats a Retreat to Even Quieter Reinvention
description: The eccentric in retreat isnt a new character in pop  the motivations can be technological, aesthetic, psychological or simply circumstantial  but it has specific meaning in 2016. The relentlessness of modern internet conversation has led to an implicit threat: Be everywhere, or dont be at all.

title: YouTube Hires Music Executive as a Liaison to the Industry
description: For the last year, the music industry has been waging a bitter war against YouTube, accusing the popular video site of paying too little in royalties. The conflict has often seemed tribal, with record companies and stars on one side, and Silicon Valley on the other.

title: Alec Baldwin Joins S.N.L. as Donald Trump
description: Saturday Night Live has found its Donald Trump, and its a performer who is plenty familiar with the show.

title: Review: The Moth Snowstorm, and Other Natural Bliss-Outs
description: For the word porn alone, nature writing can be its own giddy reward. Consider the names of shorebirds, which Michael McCarthy deploys to voluptuous effect in The Moth Snowstorm: Nature and Joy. Dunlins. Great knots. Curlews. Nordmanns greenshanks. Bar-tailed godwits.

title: U.S. Just Made It a Lot Less Difficult to Sue Nursing Homes
description: The federal agency that controls more than $1 trillion in Medicare and Medicaid funding has moved to prevent nursing homes from forcing claims of elder abuse, sexual harassment and even wrongful death into the private system of justice known as arbitration.

title: U.S. Congress, El Cajon, Hillary Clinton: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: New York Tonight: Chelsea Bombing News and the Potsdam Trial
description: Good evening on this drizzle-destined Wednesday.

title: Israel Without Shimon Peres? In Many Ways, His Dream Faded Long Ago
description: JERUSALEM  The world awoke on Wednesday to an actuality it had never known before: a modern state of Israel without Shimon Peres. But in many respects Mr. Peress Israel began to disappear long ago.

title: Romeo Castellucci, the Provocative Italian Stage Director
description: New Yorkers get to see a lot of Shakespeare, but its usually not as out there as Julius Caesar. Spared Parts. Directed by Romeo Castellucci, this 45-minute performance boils down the play to three main scenes, and even they are almost unrecognizable. Mark Antonys funeral speech, for instance, is delivered in a barely decipherable rasp by an actor, Dalmazio Masini, who has had a tracheotomy.

title: A Look at Rihannas Fenty for Puma Collection
description: The pop star showed her second collection for the sportswear company.

title: A Look at Rihannas Fenty for Puma Collection
description: Rihanna presented her second Fenty collection, in collaboration with Puma, at the iconic Htel Salomon de Rothschild in Paris. Lets do this thing, she said before the show. Lets make some money.

title: Coachella Classic: A Festival for Rock Giants and Their Aging Fans
description: One day in February, Paul Tollett, the promoter of the Coachella music festival, was summoned to Mick Jaggers dressing room in Buenos Aires.

title: Mr. Wolf Sought to Fix Bridge Scandal, Ex-Christie Ally Testifies
description: NEWARK  As Bill Baroni headed to the New Jersey State House in November 2013 to face questions from a legislative committee about the mysterious lane closings on the George Washington Bridge earlier that year, he texted David Wildstein an image titled Mr. Wolf.

title: I.M.F. Chief Lagarde Calls Trade Restrictions Economic Malpractice
description: The leader of the International Monetary Fund, Christine Lagarde, warned in a speech on Wednesday that an increase in protectionist trade measures could derail a fragile economic recovery in the United States and the rest of the world.

title: Agnes Nixon, Who Infused Her Soap Operas With Social Relevance, Dies at 93
description: Agnes Nixon, a celebrated creator and writer of television soap operas, who introduced uterine cancer, venereal diseases, child abuse, AIDS and other societal terrors into the weekday fantasy worlds of millions of daytime viewers, died on Wednesday in Rosemont, Pa. She was 93.

title: Israels Philosopher-Politician
description: Shimon Peres, who died in Tel Aviv on Wednesday at age 93, was a man of contradictions. Admired in much of the world for his eloquence, wisdom and dedication to peacemaking, within Israel he lacked the popularity and charisma of other leaders of his generation, military heroes like Yitzhak Rabin or Ariel Sharon in whose shadow he spent much of his long public service.

title: Deutsche Bank Is the Darling of the Short-Sellers
description: In a market full of crowded trades, few have become as fashionable as the bet that Deutsche Banks stock price will keep on falling.

title: Obama and Shimon Peres: Fast Friends Who Found Peace Out of Reach
description: JERUSALEM  They were an international odd couple with seemingly little in common, a 40-something African-American born in Hawaii and an octogenarian Zionist born in a shtetl in Poland. But somehow Barack Obama and Shimon Peres hit it off.

title: Brian Anderson, Skateboarding Star, Comes Out as Gay
description: Last week, Brian Anderson, a professional skateboarder known for his powerful and aggressive style, told his 40,000-plus Instagram followers to prepare themselves for a forthcoming video. When it was released, on Tuesday, it shared something that most people had never heard.

title: OPEC Agrees to Cut Production, Sending Oil Prices Soaring
description: OPECs 14 oil producing nations agreed on Wednesday to modestly cut their collective oil output later this year in an effort to bolster sagging prices, according to a cartel official. The decision sent global oil prices soaring by more than 5 percent.

title: How to Juggle Coffee and Umbrellas in Manhattan
description: Dear Diary:

title: Former A.I.G Chief Spars With Prosecutor at His Fraud Trial
description: Maurice R. Greenberg, the former chief executive of American International Group, clashed with a New York State prosecutor on Wednesday over the extent of his role in a transaction at the center of his civil accounting fraud trial.

title: Old Foes Bernie Sanders and Hillary Clinton Team Up to Woo the Kids
description: DURHAM, N.H.  Election Day has drawn too near now for Hillary Clinton to bother with understatement.

title: Judge Dismisses Appeal Against Benjamin C. Bradlees Mausoleum
description: WASHINGTON  Nearly two years after his death, Benjamin C. Bradlee, the celebrated editor of The Washington Post, may be secure in his resting place after all.

title: House Panel Questions Fed Chief on Wells Fargo Scandal
description: House lawmakers questioned Janet L. Yellen, the Federal Reserve chairwoman, on Wednesday about the handling of the Wells Fargo accounts scandal, with some calling for tougher punishment of the biggest banks and their senior managers when they violate the law.

title: Alabama Chief Justice Roy S. Moore Battles Latest Ethics Charges
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala.  The sequel was not quite the blockbuster media sensation of the original, when TV satellite trucks parked at the state judicial building for days on end. This may be due in part to the competing theatrics here and elsewhere these days  the criminal conviction of the House speaker, the possible impeachment of an allegedly philandering governor, not to mention the national political spectacle.

title: Leader of Spains Socialist Party Survives Ouster Attempt
description: MADRID  The leader of Spains main opposition Socialist Party on Wednesday narrowly escaped an attempt by senior members of his own party to oust him, after a string of electoral defeats and amid a lengthy stalemate in Spanish politics.

title: Review: Giselle, a Winning Gamble for English National Ballet
description: MANCHESTER, England  Akram Khans eagerly awaited new Giselle for English National Ballet was a courageous, expensive gamble for the companys director, Tamara Rojo. It was also a creative leap and a risk for Mr. Khan, who had never created a full-length work for a ballet company, and whose distinctive fusion of contemporary dance and Indian kathak did not seem especially suited to a classical ensemble. To add to the high stakes, Mr. Khan decided to commission a score rather than use the ballets traditional music by Adolphe Adam, then parted ways with his composer, Ben Frost, a month before the premiere, replacing him with Vincenzo Lamagna.

title: She Has a Name, Alicia Machado, and It Is Everywhere
description: In the final minutes of Monday nights debate, Hillary Clinton told the story of a 1996 Miss Universe winner and how Donald J. Trump had called her names because she had gained weight. Donald, she has a name, Mrs. Clinton said.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Ralph who?

title: Parsing What Makes a Trump Supporter Tick
description: PHOENIX  Donald! cried a woman in the front row at the Arizona Republican Party headquarters on Monday night. On the large TV screen before her, Donald J. Trump strode out to do battle with Hillary Clinton. Among the 84 million people tuned in to the first presidential debate of the general election, the crowd in Phoenix was primed for a gladiatorial contest.

title: Ronald P. Stanton, Trammo Founder Who Shared His Fortune, Dies at 88
description: Ronald P. Stanton, a refugee from Nazi Germany who made a fortune in petrochemicals and then gave or pledged more than $300 million to various charities, most of them in New York, died on Monday at his home in Manhattan. He was 88.

title: I Guess Im Having an Aleppo Moment: Gary Johnson Cant Name a Single Foreign Leader
description: It was, in Gary Johnsons own words, another Aleppo moment.

title: Fire Dept. Chief Killed in Bronx Blast Is Recalled as Family Man and Rising Star
description: Michael J. Fahy became a New York City firefighter in 1999, and he climbed the ranks of the department in the years after Sept. 11, when the terrorist attacks and a wave of retirements that followed stirred concern about a drain of experience and institutional memory.

title: Lawful Ends
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  Some people, I believe, are put on this earth for a specific reason. Some are here to innovate and bring new ideas to the world. Some are here to teach us about love and compassion. And still others are here to test us via the crossword puzzle, most likely to make sure we have not fallen asleep facedown into our bowl of Cocoa Puffs.

title: Review: Hes Geekily Charming in This Magic Show, Until He Fools You
description: I dont know if this is going to work or not.

title: Empire Season 3, Episode 2: Stay WOKE
description: The pop, the pulp and the politics of Empire are often so explosive they might be expected to send the show flying in a million different directions. Episodes like this weeks, however, go a long way toward explaining why thats never happened: Quiet scenes involving the three Lyon sons, like the scotch-fueled exchange that appears near the end of the hour, frequently serve as the invisible thread that holds the whole thing together.

title: Review: All the Ways to Say I Love You, a Lesson in Guilt
description: When a subway rumbles under the Lucille Lortel Theater these days, audiences assembled there for Neil LaButes All the Ways to Say I Love You may assume that its just Judith Lights thundering pulse. Portraying a schoolteacher with a secret (or rather, A Secret) in a self-flagellating monologue that could have been written only by Mr. LaBute, she gives palpable force to a buried guilt that keeps clawing its way to the light, like some prematurely entombed figure out of Edgar Allan Poe.

title: Colin Kaepernick Says Presidential Candidates Were Trying to Debate Whos Less Racist
description: Colin Kaepernick, the San Francisco 49ers quarterback who has refused to stand during the national anthem as a way of protesting discrimination, called both major presidential candidates liars and said they seemed to be trying to debate whos less racist.

title: The Girl on the Train Takes the Fast Track From Book to Screen
description: Back in March 2014, when Jared LeBoff, a producer at Marc Platt Productions, first read the thriller The Girl on the Train, it wasnt yet a sensation, one that to date has sold more than six million copies in the United States alone. Sent to him in digital form by an agent of an unknown author, Paula  Hawkins, it was a yet-to-be-published novel with three untrustworthy female narrators  one of them an unhappy, alcoholic divorce named Rachel Watson who believes she has witnessed something key to a womans disappearance.

title: Death of 6-Year-Old Boy in Harlem Raises Questions for Child Welfare Agency
description: Sixteen candles crowded a nook off a stoop in Harlem on Wednesday in memory of a 6-year-old boy named Zymere Perkins.

title: Arnold Palmer and His Savvy Agent Set the Bar for Pitchmen
description: Arnold Palmer was heading to a corporate golf outing in 1971 when Mark McCormack, head of the International Management Group and shepherd of Palmers business career, sent him a short note. He reminded his star client to use his charm on the advertising manager for Lincoln-Mercury because they were pursuing a renewal of Palmers endorsement deal with that division of Ford Motor.

title: Designated Survivor Season 1, Episode 2: Day One
description: Last week, the crisis was a bomb that blew up the United States Capitol. This week, its  viral videos.

title: Jay Bruce Homer Helps Mets Beat Marlins and Protect Wild-Card Lead
description: MIAMI  Although he said the right things and carried himself well, the struggles and the time on the bench annoyed Jay Bruce. He was streaky at the plate, but he was a proven power hitter with three All-Star Game selections who had hit at least 20 home runs in eight major league seasons, including this year.

title: Mark Teixeiras Ninth-Inning Grand Slam Lifts Yankees From Brink of Elimination
description: A quick survey of the Yankees clubhouse  a small sample, admittedly  revealed that no one was familiar with the perhaps apocryphal tale from Russian history of Rasputin, the spiritual adviser to Czar Nicholas II, whose rivals fed him poisoned wine, shot him several times and then tossed him into an icy river, which he tried to claw his way out of before finally dying.

title: Donald Trump Pushes Debunked Theory That Google Suppressed Rivals Bad News
description: WAUKESHA, Wisc.  While seeking to publicize his success in unscientific online polls after the presidential debate on Monday, Donald J. Trump on Wednesday promoted an unsubstantiated and debunked conspiracy theory about Google suppressing negative news in search results about his opponent.

title: Tana French: By the Book
description: The author of The Trespasser likes crime writers who see genre conventions as starting points rather than limitations, who refuse to recognize that supposed boundary between genre and literary.

title: Report Accuses Sudan of Scorched Earth Tactics in Darfur
description: UNITED NATIONS  Amnesty International said on Thursday that Sudanese government forces had laid waste to dozens of villages in the restive region of Darfur, bombing them from the air, burning homes, looting livestock and raping women  while preventing United Nations peacekeepers from going there to protect civilians.

title: How High Blood Pressure May Hurt Childrens Brains
description: Increasing numbers of children have high blood pressure, largely as a consequence of their obesity. A growing body of evidence suggests that high blood pressure may impair childrens cognitive skills, reducing their ability to remember, pay attention and organize facts.

title: Here Are 10 Practical Solutions to the Worlds Big Problems
description: THE FIXHow Nations Survive and Thrive in a World in DeclineBy Jonathan Tepperman307 pp. Tim Duggan Books. $28.

title: Games People Play: Three Books on Whats Behind the Fun
description: PLAY ANYTHINGThe Pleasure of Limits, the Uses of Boredom, and the Secret of GamesBy Ian Bogost266 pp. Basic Books. $26.99.

title: North Korean Soldier Crosses DMZ to Defect, South Says
description: SEOUL, South Korea  A North Korean soldier defected to South Korea on Thursday morning, sneaking across the countries land border, which is heavily guarded with armed sentries, minefields and barbed wire fences.

title: Word + Quiz: trident
description: : a spear with three prongs

title: Paris Fashion Week, Day 3: Characters on Parade
description: The action continues. The schedule is full. The nights are getting longer, the mornings blearier. Shake off Rihannas after-party from last night and get ready: Theres a lot to see today. Here are the highlights.

title: Whats on TV Thursday: Independence Day: Resurgence and Better Things
description: It fizzled at the box office, but Independence Day: Resurgence is now the top-watched film on iTunes. The Good Place continues to unearth the kinds of mistakes that can make the afterlife a living hell. And Better Things places its hilarious star, Pamela Adlon, under a microscope.

title: Corrections: September 29, 2016
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Lingering on the Edge of His Fathers Long Shadow
description: BARCELONA, Spain  Just occasionally, as he begins another story about what his father did, or said, or thought, Jordi Cruyff lapses into the present tense.

title: The Brotherhood of Big City BMX
description: Steps away from Yankee Stadium, BMX enthusiasts have made a welcoming and self-sustaining community.

title: A General Theory Of Austerity?
description: Simon Wren-Lewis has an excellent new paper trying to explain the widespread resort to austerity in the face of a liquidity trap, which is exactly the moment when such policies do the most harm. His bottom line is that

title: A Virtual Visit to a Relative in Jail
description: Chicago  Are you tired of taking the time to drive to the jail and wait in long lines for your visit? asks the website of Securus, a private company that manages phones in jails and prisons throughout the United States. Visit your loved one from the comfort of your home using a computer.

title: Pondering the Supreme Courts Future
description: Anyone interested in the future of the Supreme Court might ponder a three-sentence order the court issued on the last day of August. It announced the courts denial of North Carolinas emergency request to reinstate the voter ID and two other provisions of its election law that a federal appeals court struck down this summer as intentionally discriminatory.

title: Trumps Debate Flameout
description: No one with an open mind and sound reason who witnessed the sniffing, sipping, scowling, raging, interrupting display of petulance and agitation that was Donald Trumps debate performance on Monday could possibly argue that he won that debate or that he is the kind of person to whom we should entrust the presidency.

title: The Dangers of Misreading the F.B.I. Crime Report
description: Over the last several decades, whenever there has been a reported increase in violent crime numbers, there have been people eager to seize on the statistics and argue, as the Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump has, that crime is out of control.

title: Vladimir Putins Outlaw State
description: President Vladimir Putin is fast turning Russia into an outlaw nation. As one of five permanent members of the United Nations Security Council, his country shares a special responsibility to uphold international law. Yet, his behavior in Ukraine and Syria violates not only the rules intended to promote peace instead of conflict, but also common human decency.

title: That Seventh-Grade Bully Is Running for President
description: Donald Trump displayed an excellent version of the stern squint in the presidential debate. Many of us men are familiar with this expression, because we practice it at age 13 in the hope that it will impress girls. It doesnt, and we grow out of it  most of us, anyway.

title: What Does Immigration Actually Cost Us?
description: Last week, as soon as the National Academy of Sciences issued The Economic and Fiscal Consequences of Immigration, its 509-page report, interest groups on the left and right immediately claimed vindication.

title: Whos Really Older, Trump or Clinton?
description: Strange we havent been talking more about age.

title: Poverty, Prosperity and the Minimum Wage
Calls to 911 From Black Neighborhoods Fell After a Case of Police Violence
description: MILWAUKEE  Milwaukee residents were outraged when they learned, about three months after the fact, that a biracial man at a party had been severely beaten by several white off-duty police officers also in attendance. The man, Frank Jude, was left with a broken nose, bruises and severe bleeding in his ears, a result of having pens pushed into them.

title: The Brotherhood of Big City BMX
description: As any city kid knows, there is a pure joy to getting your first bike. Suddenly, you can venture beyond your block and explore foreign places  like neighborhoods, parks and bridges on the other side of the borough. Growing up in St. Albans, Queens, Elias Williams savored that freedom.

title: Above and Below
Questions for: In the Wild, Goldfish Turn From Pet to Pest
description: Article: In the Wild, Goldfish Turn From Pet to Pest

title: Chicken Tetrazzini, the Casserole Even Snobs Love
description: In the early years of the 20th century, when the Italian opera star Luisa Tetrazzini was singing to adoring crowds in San Francisco and New York, some enterprising chef got the idea of making an insanely rich pasta dish and naming it for her. Chicken tetrazzini was spaghetti, heavy cream, chicken, mushrooms and Parmesan, served with two classic French sauces, chicken velout and hollandaise, on top. This was fancy food, if hardly Italian, and within just a few years you could find tetrazzini in the dining rooms of the nations swankier hotels. In the 1930s, the actor Vincent Price used to eat it at Sardis in Manhattan, where he was a thrice-weekly regular during a run of Victoria Regina at the Broadhurst Theater across the street. He liked tetrazzini so much that he included a recipe for it in A Treasury of Great Recipes, the cookbook he wrote with his wife, Mary, in 1965.

title: Medicinal Herb or Myth? Indian Official Proposes Hunt for Sanjivani of Lore
description: Sanjivani is the stuff of myth: an herb that glows in the dark and has the power to revive the dying, wrenching them back from the fog of unconsciousness. In the Ramayana, a sacred Hindu epic, the herb is used to resuscitate both the god-hero Rama and his younger brother Lakshmana.

title: The 4 Traits That Put Kids at Risk for Addiction
description: Drug education is the only part of the middle school curriculum I remember  perhaps because it backfired so spectacularly. Before reaching todays legal drinking age, I was shooting cocaine and heroin.

title: The Health Care Public Option Is Back. Can It Help Obamacare?
description: On the campaign trail and in the halls of policy wonks, the health care term of the moment is the public option. The idea is to create a government-run health care plan that would be an alternative to the private insurance plans offered under the Affordable Care Act, or provide a fallback in markets where insurers have been pulling out. In an article in The New England Journal of Medicine published on Wednesday, Hillary Clinton reiterated her support for such a measure. Margot Sanger-Katz and Reed Abelson, two New York Times reporters who have been covering Obamacare, discuss the public option and the questions it raises.

title: Letter of Recommendation: The Nakagin Capsule Tower
description: Earlier this year, heartbroken and restless, I ran away from my problems to visit a friend in Tokyo. The city is famously full of diversions for rootless Westerners; any neurosis or perversion might be catered to in the warrens between its skyscrapers. But there was only one thing I really wanted to see: the Nakagin Capsule Tower, a grand architectural oddity designed by Kisho Kurokawa, a founding genius behind Japanese Metabolism, an innovative movement united around the desire to create buildings whose forms mirrored and were responsive to those of living organisms. The Metabolists were part of the postwar boom in bizarre, expressive architectural concepts, but unlike so many of their contemporaries, the Metabolists actually managed to get some of their projects built.

title: How Donald Trump Set Off a Civil War Within the Right-Wing Media
description: In recent years, one of the most important events on a prospective Republican presidential candidates calendar was the RedState Gathering, a summer convention for conservative activists from across the nation. Its host was Erick Erickson, a round-faced, redheaded former election lawyer and city councilman in Macon, Ga., who began blogging in 2004 on a site called RedState.com.

title: A Dog-Friendly Co-op in Sunset Park, Brooklyn
description: Michael Beattie and Marissa Tarallo, traffic engineers who met at work, rented a one-bedroom on the garden level of a brownstone in Park Slope, Brooklyn. The rent was $2,100 a month. The place was dark and noisy. It served its purpose, but we were ready to move on, Mr. Beattie said.

title: Cubs Theo Epstein Is Making Lightning Strike Twice
description: CHICAGO  Five years ago, Theo Epstein took a job that even his friends called career suicide.

title: 36 Hours in Richmond, Virginia
description: A new African-American museum, appealing parks and distinctive dining spots are among the lures of this riverside city.

title: When Yelling Commands Is the Wrong Police Response
description: The story out of El Cajon, Calif., a San Diego suburb, had an eerie familiarity: The police respond to a person exhibiting some kind of disturbing behavior, but the subject  perhaps lost in his own, altered world  does not comply with the usual commands, does not heed the standard warnings, acts in a way that seems to invite danger, and ends up dead.

title: Rihannas Fenty Line Debuts in Paris and Receives a Pop Star Welcome
description: PARIS  On an upper floor of the Htel Salomon de Rothschild, the 19th-century manse formerly occupied by the banking Rothschilds, a line of sweating models fiddled with the rings in their lips and the septums of their perfect noses, and waited to have their lip gloss reapplied. They chatted among themselves, fanning one another with torn bits of cardboard in the close, sticky corridor and examining their nails, which had been sharpened to talons and encrusted with miniature gems. They received compliments with the languorous equanimity of court ladies, which for a night they were.

title: Is Your Online World Just a Filter Bubble of People With the Same Opinions?
description: Where and how do you get your news? How much comes via a social media feed? How diverse is that feed in terms of demographic details like the ages, races, religions, geographical locations, interests and political affiliations of the people you follow?

title: India Claims Surgical Strikes Across Line of Control in Kashmir
description: NEW DELHI  India announced on Thursday that it had carried out early morning surgical strikes on terrorist camps in Pakistani-controlled Kashmir, a step that risks escalating the conflict between the two nuclear powers.

title: Torn Over Donald Trump and Cut Off by Culture Wars, Evangelicals Despair
description: GRIMES, Iowa  Betty and Dick Odgaard used to own the tiny church next door to their home. They had built it over 13 years into an art gallery, bistro, flower shop and framing service. They even rented out the chapel, with its bright stained glass windows, for social events.

title: Hillary Clintons College Plan Appeals to the Left, but Educators Have Doubts
description: Hillary Clinton announced her new higher education plan this summer with a burst of fanfare, promising to invest $500 billion to eliminate tuition for millions of students at public colleges and universities across the country. The move was an expansion of an earlier, less ambitious proposal, and was seen as a conciliatory gesture to her left-leaning primary opponent, Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont, and his supporters ahead of the Democratic Partys convention.

title: U.S. Election, El Cajon, Yahoo: Your Thursday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Peres and the Passing of Hope
description: With the death of Shimon Peres and the passing of the last of the giants of Israels foundation a void fills the soul  in part because the peace of which he dreamed has proved elusive, in part because the search for Israeli-Palestinian compromise has reached a low point of repetitive sterility, but above all because statesmanship has now given way among the leaders of Israel to barren tactical maneuver.

title: New York Today: Artists-in-Residence
description: Updated, 10:20 a.m.

title: A 7-Night, $250 Cruise? Yes, and You Might Also Do Some Good
description: I had been on only one cruise in my life: a hulking 4,252-person Royal Caribbean vessel that featured an ice-skating rink, a mini-golf course, a casino and a Johnny Rockets. It felt as if a small city had been ripped from its foundation, airlifted and placed on the water. David Foster Wallaces famous essay on the perils of being pampered at sea rang true: Between the all-you-can-eat food, bad drinks and being compelled to participate in Y.M.C.A. more times than I care to admit, I was ready to never set foot on a cruise ship again.

title: Five Places to Shop in Singapore
description: A homegrown design scene is emerging in Singapore, which last year celebrated 50 years as an independent state. A smattering of 19th-century buildings from its days as a British colony conjure up images of steamy afternoons of Singapore Sling cocktails and card games at the Raffles Hotel, which its owners named after Stamford Raffles, founder of modern Singapore. But get a taste of Singapores cultural mlange by delving into vibrant enclaves like Little India, Chinatown and Arab Town. Look even further and youll find local designers setting up shops across the island city-state, increasingly giving this global financial center a reputation as a design hub.

title: Is Westworld HBOs Next Big Hit?
description: On the morning they finished shooting the pilot for Westworld, the married showrunners Jonathan Nolan and Lisa Joy commandeered a golf cart and went for a drive around Sweetwater, the Old West town they built for the show on Gene Autrys former ranch studio in Santa Clarita, Calif.

title: Morning Agenda: CBS and Viacom, Rules on Arbitration, Deutsche Bank Gloom
description: Could it be time for CBS and Viacom to get back together again?

title: Deborah de Robertis: Shocking for a Purpose
description: In 2014, the renegade performance artist Deborah de Robertis shocked audiences at the Muse dOrsay by exposing her genitals in front of Gustave Courbets The Origin of the World. In January, she was arrested after staging a similar re-enactment of Manets Olympia, also at the Orsay. This month, she invited herself into two major Paris exhibitions. At the Muse Guimet, she recast herself as the model in an iconic photograph by Nobuyoshi Araki, dressing as a geisha and gorging on a watermelon placed between her legs. Then, at the Muse des Arts Dcoratifs, she was arrested after crashing an exhibition devoted to Barbie, appearing in a plastic costume that reimagined the classic doll as a symbol of 21st-century feminism, with articulated nipples, pubic hair, a nose ring and Go-Pro camera strapped to her head. While some dismiss these unsanctioned appearances as shameless provocations, the Luxembourg-born Ms. De Robertis, 32, sees her work in the tradition of guerrilla performance artists like Valie Export and Andrea Fraser. In the following edited interview, she discusses the heady ideas behind her bold acts, and the very diverse reactions they elicit  from ferocious criticism to rapturous applause.

title: Donald Trump Leans Into Rough News Cycle
description: When presented with the opportunity to move past a difficult news cycle, Donald J. Trump has struggled to do so throughout the campaign.

title: Review: In Deepwater Horizon, Oil, Fire and Greed
description: Deepwater Horizon is a swift and suspenseful action movie, full of noise, peril, muck and fire. Its also a true-crime story, the highly detailed procedural chronicle of how, on April 20, 2010, 11 people were killed and a vast marine ecosystem was despoiled because of negligence and greed. Like The Big Short, this film, directed by Peter Berg, dramatizes a broadly familiar story and stands as a work of popular narrative for an age of corporate impunity. The anger and grief you feel leaving the theater constitute a kind of catharsis, a modest symbolic compensation for the failure of justice in the real world.

title: Review: Youthful Recklessness Finds Adventure on the Road in American Honey
description: On the shelf of essential cultural products whose names begin with the word American, Andrea Arnolds new film (her fourth feature and the first set in the United States) might find a spot between Grant Woods Gothic and Green Days Idiot. This is not solely a matter of alphabetical order. American Honey, which takes its title from a song by Lady Antebellum, is a roaming, rambling road picture propelled by sex, hip-hop and close-ups of insects. It probes the murk and terror beneath the surface of contemporary life, and illuminates the vital role of ignorance, poor judgment and wishful thinking in our national character.

title: Chlo: Spring 2017
description: The labels spring 2017 collection

title: Chengguan, Widely Despised Officers in China, Find Refuge and a Kind Ear
description: BEIJING  They may be the most reviled public servants in China. A Chinese Academy of Social Sciences report on the popularity of government officials two years ago ranked the chengguan, or urban management officers, dead last. Unarmed but charged with enforcing order on city streets, they have been scorned as bullies who brutalize beggars, smash unlicensed fruit vendors carts, kill unregistered pets and assist in the forced demolition of peoples homes. Scuffles are common, sometimes ending in injury or even death.

title: Russia Rejects John Kerrys Demands on Syria, Accusing U.S. of Promoting Terror
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Russia escalated its anti-American invective Thursday in the deadlocked diplomacy over the Syrian war, dismissing a threat by Secretary of State John Kerry to halt talks and accusing his spokesman of abetting global terrorism  including against Russian military personnel in Syria.

title: Former BlackRock Fund Manager Charged With Insider Trading
description: LONDON  A former BlackRock fund manager has been charged with insider trading, British authorities said on Thursday.

title: Fall Weather Means Good Deals at Upscale European Hotels
description: The South of France, the Amalfi Coast of Italy and Spains Costa del Sol are just a few of the seaside European destinations known as the summertime haunts of well-heeled travelers. From June through September, prices for a nights stay in a hotel are sky high, and jockeying for reservations at popular restaurants is something of a full-time sport.

title: The Dog Ate My Planet
description: This article is part of the Opinion Today newsletter. You can sign up here to receive more briefings and a guide to the section daily in your inbox.

title: California Today: A Snooze of a Senate Race
description: Good morning.

title: Our Top Five Denzels
description: Denzel is back in theaters. If you want a hit of Mr. Washington, you could go see The Magnificent Seven, Antoine Fuquas Western remake of Akira Kurosawas classic film about gunmen banding together to protect a village against thieves. But Wesley doesnt recommend that.

title: U.S. Will Require Its Contractors to Provide Paid Sick Leave
description: The Obama administration, in its latest effort to update workplace policies it says have lagged far behind the realities of Americans lives, will require federal government contractors to provide paid sick leave to their workers.

title: Wild-Card Update: Tie in American League and Three-Way Race in National League
description: The Boston Red Sox lost dramatically Wednesday night, on a two-out ninth-inning grand slam by the Yankees Mark Teixeira. But they captured the American League East title, anyway, because the Toronto Blue Jays also lost on a ninth-inning home run, by Baltimores Hyun Soo Kim.

title: Why Are the Different Presidential Forecasts So Far Apart?
description: Hillary Clinton currently has a 71 percent chance of winning the presidency, according to The Upshots forecasting model. This is down from 90 percent last month, but higher than some other models were tracking, which put the odds between 58 percent and 85 percent.

title: Reykjavik Briefly Swaps Its City Lights for Northern Ones
description: Lights off. Lights on.

title: Hoboken Train Crash Kills 1 and Injures Over 100
description: HOBOKEN, N.J.  A careening commuter train plowed through the barrier at the end of the tracks and crashed into a wall at a terminal here during the morning rush on Thursday, killing one person, injuring more than 100 others and unleashing chaos as part of the stations roof came tumbling down in a jumble of metal.

title: Antigraft Law Stirs Up Wariness Over South Koreans Bearing Gifts
description: SEOUL, South Korea  During the lunch hour on Thursday in downtown Seoul, amid government agencies and newspaper offices, diners lined up at cash registers to do something long considered a breach of etiquette here: splitting the bill.

title: Anatomy of a Scene | Magnificent Seven
description: Antoine Fuqua narrates a sequence from the film.

title: A Free-Speech Fatality
description: AMMAN, Jordan  In January 2015, King Abdullah and Queen Rania of Jordan marched in Paris with other world leaders to pay tribute to the murdered cartoonists of Charlie Hebdo and to stand up for freedom of expression. Less than two years later, when Nahed Hattar, a 56-year-old Jordanian writer from a Christian family, shared a cartoon on his Facebook page that some perceived to be mocking God, the Jordanian government swiftly ordered his arrest and charged him with insulting religious belief and sentiment.

title: Antoine Fuqua Narrates a Scene From The Magnificent Seven
description: One particular gunfight in the new Magnificent Seven is a doozy. The crew from the title has gotten together to save a town from bandits and, in this scene, unite to fight for the first time. Guns blaze, arrows pierce, knives fly  and the bodies pile up.

title: Better Traffic Manners Where an Iron Fist Rules
description: MOSCOW  The usually busy Moscow street was empty of cars and also of police officers as a light drizzle turned into a downpour.

title: In Letter, Redstones Urge Viacom and CBS to Explore Merger
description: The Redstones are playing hardball.

title: Train Crashes Into New Jersey Station
description: A New Jersey Transit commuter train crashed into the station at Hoboken, N.J., on Thursday. Video shot by witnesses shows the damage moments after the crash.

title: Video Shows Shooting of Louisiana Child
description: Body camera video released on Wednesday by a Louisiana judge shows two deputy city marshals shooting into a car, killing a 6-year-old boy and critically wounding his father. (Audio begins at 15 seconds.)

title: Ann Demeulemeester: Spring 2017
description: The labels spring 2017 collection.

title: Train Crashes Into Hoboken Station
description: A New Jersey Transit train crashed at a station during the Thursday morning rush, killing at least one person and injuring about 100 people,

title: 1916: Sultan of Egypt Keeps Faith in Britain
description: LONDON  In an interview with a correspondent of the Associated Press, the Sultan of Egypt dealt at considerable length with the British protectorate over his country. He said, according to a Reuter despatch from New York: I believe that under the protection of Great Britain, the greatest of liberal Powers, the future of Egypt is assured.  Had it not been for my faith in the British Government, and my belief that there would be a gradual increase in the rights granted us in the matter of self-rule, I should never have undertaken the task. From a personal standpoint I had nothing to gain. I was happy as a prince, following my agricultural and philanthropic pursuits, with no weight of government upon my shoulders.

title: F.C.C. Delays Vote on Cable Set-Top Boxes
description: WASHINGTON  Federal regulators on Thursday delayed a vote on a proposal to reshape the television market by freeing consumers from cable box rentals, putting into doubt a plan that has pitted technology companies against cable television providers.

title: Paco Rabanne: Spring 2017
description: The labels spring 2017 collection.

title: Irish Rep to Serve Dinner and The Dead
description: This should be a dinner party to remember.

title: Alex Rodriguez Is Headed to the Playoffs, as a TV Analyst
description: Alex Rodriguez has been quiet since he was released by the Yankees last month, finishing the last of his 12 tempestuous seasons in the Bronx with a .200 batting average and nine home runs. In the weeks since, he has been watching baseball on television at home in Miami and shepherding his daughters, ages 8 and 11, to school and other places.

title: The Texas-Shaped World
description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights from The New York Times. In this postcard, our Houston bureau chief considers the singular, curiously drawn image that somehow encapsulates, with a few right angles and big bends, a state of 27 million people.

title: Duterte, Philippine President, Raises Doubts About Military Alliance With U.S.
description: MANILA  Military and diplomatic officials in the Philippines were facing a quandary on Thursday after President Rodrigo Duterte distanced the country further from the United States, its biggest defense ally, by saying he would end joint military exercises like one scheduled for next week and would pursue closer ties to China and Russia.

title: Video Review: With Genesis, Hyundai Brings a New Luxury Brand to Town
description: A NEW luxury brand is arriving in the United States with two sedans, one of them a repurposed model already available here.

title: Haitian Men Cut Off From Families as U.S. Tightens Entry Rules
description: MEXICO CITY  A sudden shift in American immigration policy has divided scores of Haitian families trying to enter the United States from Mexico, immigrants and advocates say.

title: To Age Naturally or Not? Readers Respond to Debora L. Spars Aging and My Beauty Dilemma
description: The Barnard College presidents confessions about cosmetic surgery struck a nerve.

title: The Subtle Phrases Hillary Clinton Uses to Sway Black Voters
description: When political candidates speak, they are often addressing several audiences at once, and their words can have different meanings for each. When Hillary Clinton talked about race during her debate Monday night against Donald J. Trump, she delivered a subtle and powerful message to black voters, speaking to them not only in the substance of what she said, but in her carefully chosen language.

title: Paris Fashion Week Photos: Fenty designed by Rihanna for Puma, Dries Van Noten and More
description: Plus: Paco Rabanne, Chlo, Rochas and Ann Demeulemeester.

title: Teaching Teenagers to Cope With Social Stress
description: Almost four million American teenagers have just started their freshman year of high school. Can they learn better ways to deal with all that stress and insecurity?

title: In Venice, Duty-Free Shopping Takes on a Whole New Look
description: VENICE  On Saturday, the Fondaco dei Tedeschi, one of Venices most majestic Renaissance palazzos, overlooking the Grand Canal and steps from the Rialto Bridge, will open to the public again.

title: Why the Terrorist Who Destroyed Palmyra Wont Face Justice
description: For the first time, the worlds highest criminal court ruled this week that destroying cultural antiquities is a war crime.

title: IBM to Acquire Promontory, a Financial Consulting Firm
description: In recent years, IBM has been known for its forays into artificial intelligence and cloud computing. Now, the technology provider is moving deeper into financial consulting with the acquisition of a prominent  and at times controversial  Washington firm.

title: What Happened in the New Jersey Transit Train Crash
description: A commuter train crashed into Hoboken Terminal at about 8:45 Thursday morning.

title: Law on Disparaging Trademarks Gets Supreme Court Review
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court agreed on Thursday to decide whether a federal law that denies protection to disparaging trademarks can survive First Amendment scrutiny.

title: Fashion Week Photo Diary: Maison Margiela, Dries Van Noten, Lemaire and Lanvin
description: Scenes from the spring/summer 2017 collections that were presented in Paris on Wednesday.

title: A.C.C. Moves Football Championship Game to Orlando
description: The Atlantic Coast Conferences football championship game, typically played in Charlotte, N.C., but pulled from the state earlier this month in response to a controversial North Carolina law, will be staged at Camping World Stadium in Orlando, Fla., in December, the conference announced Thursday.

title: Train Crashes Into Hoboken Station
description: A New Jersey Transit train crashed at a station during the Thursday morning rush, killing at least one person and injuring dozens.

title: So Was Rihannas Show Any Good? And More Pressing Questions from Paris Fashion Week
description: PARIS  Twenty-three blocks of ice, each almost five feet tall, enclosed perfectly preserved gardens of flowers at the peak of their color and bloom on the second floor of a long, cavernous warehouse space at a grungy edge of the Eighth Arrondissement of Paris, just beyond the railway tracks of the Gare St.-Lazare, like a three-dimensional gallery of Dutch flower paintings. Then the melting  and the Dries Van Noten show  began. Everyone watching knew that all that frozen beauty would inevitably end in puddles in the floor. Disney came to mind. Also Robert Frost.

title: Swizz Beatzs Music Studio Is Basically an Art Gallery
description: On a recent late-summer evening, a gleaming black Mercedes Maybach pulled up on West 15th Street outside of Kola House, a newly opened restaurant, and lingered quietly by the curb.

title: Sophie and Frederik Bille Brahes Jewelry-Inspired Feast
description: For her Paris Fashion Week dinner tonight, the jewelry designer recruited her younger brother to create a menu based on her designs.

title: In Paris, a Dinner Where Food and Jewelry Commingle
description: Scandinavian bling is how the Danish jewelry designer Sophie Bille Brahe jokingly describes her new spring/summer 2017 collection, which will be presented in Paris tonight.

title: Creepy Clown Hoaxes Lead to 12 Arrests in Multiple States
description: The reports to the police had one thing in common with the circus act involving an improbable number of clowns emerging from a small car.

title: 1941: Van Gogh Painting Acquired
description: The Museum of Modern Art, 11 West Fifty-third Street, announced yesterday the acquisition of a painting by Vincent Van Gogh, called Starry Night. The work, an oil painting measuring about 29 by 35 inches, was acquired by the museum through the Lillie P. Bliss bequest. Starry Night, the announcement said, is the first Van Gogh to be acquired by a New York museum, and one of the most important paintings obtained by the Museum of Modern Art. It was painted in 1889 in St. Rmy in the artists late style, and consists of a composition of cypress trees in the foreground with a village and hills in a distance beneath a sky with explosive stars and swirling milky way. The picture is comparatively little known in New York.  New York Herald Tribune, Sept. 30, 1941

title: How a Merger of Viacom and CBS Might Make Sense
description: Sumner M. Redstone and his family are contemplating a reunification.

title: Spectacular Northern Lights Over Iceland
description: The northern lights are particularly vivid this week and the Reykjavik City Council ordered street lamps to be turned off in most neighborhoods to improve visibility for watching the dancing lights.

title: Joy Luck Palace
description: The dim sum, little piggy buns included, draws crowds in Manhattans Chinatown.

title: At Joy Luck Palace, Dim Sum Amid the Chaos
description: Everyone wants the little piggies, plump white buns with black sesame-seed eyes, orange snouts and slashes of ears that look more like worried brows. At Joy Luck Palace in Manhattans Chinatown, they come three to a steamer basket and harbor gooey souls of custard.

title: Win or Lose, the U.S. Ryder Cup Team Belongs to Phil Mickelson
description: CHASKA, Minn.  The wind was gusting at more than 30 miles per hour when the United States team showed up at Hazeltine National Golf Club on Monday for its first practices of the Ryder Cup week. Some people might have seen the blustery conditions as symbolic of the difficulties the Americans face in trying to regain their footing in a competition whose outcome in recent years has tilted toward the Europeans.

title: Take a Picture Quickly in iOS 10
